original: 2. Bhaguttheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Ahaṃ middhenātiādikā āyasmato bhaguttherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayaṃ kira padumuttarassa🔽bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto satthari parinibbute tassa dhātuyo🔽pupphehi pūjesi. So tena puññakammena nimmānaratīsu nibbattitvā aparāparaṃ devamanussesu🔽saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sakyarājakule nibbattitvā bhagūti laddhanāmo vayappatto
analyzed: bhaga utthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  aham middhena ati ādikā āyasmataḥ bhaga uttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam kira padumuttarassa  bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam patto satthari parinibbute tassa dhātuyaḥ  pupphehi pūjesi saḥ tena puñña kammena nimmānaratīsu nibbattitvā apara aparam deva manussesu  saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sakya rāja kule nibbattitvā bhagūti laddha nāmaḥ vaya ppattaḥ
translated: The Elder Bhagā’s Verses

original: anuruddhakimilehi saddhiṃ nikkhamitvā pabbajitvā bālakaloṇakagāme vasanto ekadivasaṃ
analyzed: anuruddha kimilehi saddhim nikkhamitvā pabbajitvā bālakaloṇakagāme vasantaḥ eka divasam
translated: The Elder Bhagā’s verses beginning with “I, overcome by sloth and torpor” . Where did this Elder Bhagā originate? In the time of the Blessed One Padumuttara he was reborn in a good family. When he reached years of discretion he worshipped the Master’s bodily relics with flowers after the Blessed One had attained final Nibbāna. By that root of merit he was reborn in the Nimmānarati gods’ realm, and passing from one happy state of existence to another among gods and men, he was reborn in a Sakyan family at the time of the present Buddha. He was given the name Bhagā, and when he reached years of discretion he went forth into homelessness together with Anuruddha and Kimbila. While he was living in the village of Bālakaloṇaka, one day he went out from the monastery to dispel the oppression of sloth and torpor. He climbed the walk and fell asleep.

original: thinamiddhābhibhavaṃ vinodetuṃ vihārato nikkhamma caṅkamaṃ abhiruhanto papatitvā🔽tadeva aṅkusaṃ katvā thinamiddhaṃ vinodetvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi.

translated: He removed his drowsiness and torpor by making a goad of that very post, and he increased his insight and attained Arahantship.

original: Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –

translated: Therefore it is said in the Apadāna:

translated: I made a funeral pile of flowers and cremated his body.

original: “Ayaṃ pacchimako mayhaṃ, carimo vattate bhavo;

translated: “This is my last birth, my last existence, my last body;

translated: They do not know that the dispute will not be settled until they have given up their own views and have taken up the right view.🔽When, however, they give up their own views and, by means of the right view,

analyzed: adhamma dhamma āditaḥ yathābhūtam vijānanti tatas tesam santikā te paṇḍita purise nissāya

original: vivādasaṅkhātā medhagā sammantīti evampettha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: vivāda saṅkhātā medha gā sammantī iti evampi ittha atthaḥ veditabbo

original: Yadāti yasmiṃ kāle. Avijānantāti vivādassa vūpasamūpāyaṃ, dhammādhamme vā yāthāvato🔽ajānantā. Iriyantyamarā viyāti amarā viya jarāmaraṇaṃ atikkantā viya uddhatā unnaḷā
analyzed: yadā ati yasmin kāle a vijānantā ati vivādassa dhamma adhamme vā yāthāvato  a jānantāḥ amarāḥ viya ati amarāḥ viya jarā maraṇam atikkantāḥ viya uddhatāḥ unnaḷā
translated: When: at the time when. Not knowing: not knowing the means of settling the dispute or the right and wrong, etc., of the dispute.

original: capalā mukharā vippakiṇṇavācā hutvā vattanti caranti vicaranti tadā vivādo na vūpasammateva.
analyzed: capalāḥ mukharāḥ vippakiṇṇa vācāḥ hutvā vattanti caranti vicaranti tadā vivādaḥ na
translated: They go about like immortals: they behave, move about, and wander about like immortals who have transcended old age and death, being conceited, arrogant, fickle, garrulous, and talkative. At that time the dispute is not settled.

original: Vijānanti ca ye dhammaṃ, āturesu anāturāti ye pana satthu sāsanadhammaṃ yathābhūtaṃ
analyzed: vijānanti ca ye dhammam āturesu ye pana satthu sāsana dhammam yathābhūtam
translated: But when they know the Dhamma, the wise among the sick: but when they know the Dhamma of the Master’s Dispensation as it really is,

original: jānanti, te kilesarogena āturesu sattesu anāturā nikkilesā anīghā viharanti, tesaṃ
analyzed: jānanti te kilesa rogena āturesu sattesu anāturāḥ nikkilesāḥ anīghāḥ viharanti tesam

original: vasena vivādo accantameva vūpasammatīti adhippāyo.🔽Yaṃ kiñci sithilaṃ kammanti oliyitvā karaṇena sithilagāhaṃ katvā sāthalibhāvena kataṃ
analyzed: vasena vivādaḥ accantam eva vūpasammati iti adhippāyo  yam kiñci sithilam karaṇena sithila gāham katvā sāthali bhāvena katam
translated: The intention is that because of them, the dispute is completely pacified.🔽Whatever is loose in action: any profitable action done with a loose hold, by doing it slackly.

original: yaṃ kiñci kusalakammaṃ. Saṃkiliṭṭhanti vesīādike agocare caraṇena, kuhanādimicchājīvena🔽vā saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ vatasamādānaṃ. Saṅkassaranti saṅkāhi saritabbaṃ, vihāre kiñci asāruppaṃ🔽sutvā – “nūna asukena kata”nti parehi asaṅkitabbaṃ, uposathakiccādīsu aññatarakiccavasena
analyzed: yam kiñci kusala kammam vesī ādike agocare caraṇena kuhanā ādim icchājīvena  vā saṃkiliṭṭham vata samādānam saṅkassaranti saṅkāhi saritabbam vihāre kiñci a sāruppam  sutvā nūna asukena katanti parehi uposatha kicca ādīsu aññatara kicca vasena
translated: Whatever is defiled: the undertaking of vows defiled by visiting prostitutes, etc., or by wrong livelihood such as scheming, etc.

original: sannipatitampi saṅghaṃ disvā, “addhā ime mama cariyaṃ ñatvā maṃ ukkhipitukāmā sannipatitā”ti

original: evaṃ attano vā āsaṅkāhi saritaṃ usaṅkitaṃ parisaṅkitaṃ. Na taṃ hotīti taṃ evarūpaṃ
analyzed: evam saritam usaṅkitam parisaṅkitam na tam hoti iti tam evarūpam

original: brahmacariyaṃ samaṇadhammakaraṇaṃ tassa puggalassa mahapphalaṃ na hoti. Tassa amahapphalabhāveneva
analyzed: brahmacariyam samaṇa dhamma karaṇam tassa puggalassa mahat phalam na hoti tassa a mahat phala bhāvena iva
translated: The life of purity, the state of being a recluse, is not fruitful for that person. And because it is not fruitful for him,

original: paccayadāyakānampissa na mahapphalaṃ hoti. Tasmā sallekhavuttinā bhavitabbaṃ. Sallekhavuttino
analyzed: paccaya dāyakānam pissa na mahapphalam hoti tasmā sallekhavuttinā bhavitabbam sallekhavuttino
translated: it is not fruitful for those who give him requisites. Therefore one should be a forest-dweller. And the intention is that for one who is a forest-dweller

translated: there is no opportunity for dispute.🔽Respect is not obtained: in the case of those fellow celibates who are worthy of respect, respect and honour are not found in that person who does not accept the advice.

analyzed: puggalo paṭipatti saddhammataḥ api paṭivedha saddhammataḥ api dūre hoti na hi tam garū sikkhāpenti
translated: That kind of person is far from the true Dhamma,

translated: “For a hundred thousand cycles of time, I enjoyed

analyzed: āmantana vacanāni sampuṇṇe  duggandha iti kuṇapa pūrita ttā eva sabhāva duggandhe māra pakkha iti yasmā visa bhāga vatthu

translated: It increases the Mara-Devaputta’s

translated: and he gives them a chance to enter. That is why he is on Mara’s side. Hence it is said: “On Mara’s side” .

original: Avassuteti sabbakālaṃ kilesāvassavanena tahiṃ tahiṃ asucinissandanena ca avassute.

original: Idānissā navasotāni te kāye, yāni sandanti sabbadāti “akkhimhā akkhigūthako”tiādinā
analyzed: nava sotāni te kāye yāni sandanti sabba dāti akkhimhā akkhi gūthaka uti ādinā

original: vuttaṃ asucino avassavanaṭṭhānaṃ dasseti.

original: Evaṃ pana navachiddaṃ dhuvassavaṃ asucibharitaṃ kāyaṃ yathābhūtaṃ jānantī mā purāṇaṃ
analyzed: evam pana nava chiddam dhuvassavam asuci bharitam kāyam yathābhūtam jānantī mā purāṇam

original: amaññitthoti purāṇaṃ ajānanakāle pavattaṃ hasitalapitaṃ kīḷitaṃ mā maññi, “idānipi
analyzed: amaññittha uti purāṇam a jānana kāle pavattam hasita lapitam kīḷitam mā maññi idāni pi

In the dispensation of the Buddha Tissa he was reborn in a certain wealthy family.

analyzed: nibbattitvā viññu tam patto satthu sammāsambodhim saddahantaḥ bodhi rukkham vanditvā
translated: When he had attained maturity of judgment, he had faith in the Buddha’s enlightenment. He went to worship the Bodhi Tree and made an offering of seeds.

original: bījanena pūjesi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto kassapassa bhagavato🔽kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto sāsane pabbajitvā aññatarena upāsakena kārite
analyzed: bījanena pūjesi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ kassapassa bhagavato  kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññu tam patto sāsane pabbajitvā aññatarena upāsakena kārite
translated: As a result of that meritorious deed, he was reborn in the heavenly world and in the world of men. In the dispensation of the Buddha Kassapa he was reborn in a certain wealthy family.🔽When he had attained maturity of judgment, he retired from the world and became a monk in the Dispensation of the Buddha Kassapa. He became a resident of a monastery built by a certain lay disciple and lived in dependence on that lay disciple.

original: ārāme āvāsiko hutvā viharati tena upaṭṭhīyamāno. Athekadivasaṃ eko khīṇāsavatthero
analyzed: ārāme āvāsikaḥ hutvā viharati tena upaṭṭhīyamānaḥ atha eka divasam ekaḥ khīṇāsava ttheraḥ

analyzed: lūkha cīvara dharo kesaḥ haraṇa attham araññataḥ gāma abhimukhaḥ āgacchati tam disvā saḥ upāsako
translated: came from the forest to the village to have his head shaved. He was wearing a coarse robe. When the lay disciple saw him,🔽he said to the Elder, “Venerable, you are a resident of the monastery. I am your supporter. I will give you a robe.”

original: iriyāpathe pasīditvā kappakena kesamassūni ohārāpetvā paṇītabhojanaṃ bhojetvā sundarāni
analyzed: iriyāpathe pasīditvā kappakena kesa massūni ohārāpetvā paṇīta bhojanam bhojetvā sundarāni

analyzed: cīvarāni da tvā idhā iva bhante vasatha ati tam disvā āvāsikaḥ

original: khīṇāsavattheraṃ āha – “varaṃ te, bhikkhu, iminā pāpupāsakena upaṭṭhīyamānassa evaṃ🔽idha vasanato aṅgulīhi kese luñcitvā acelassa sato gūthamuttāhārajīvana”nti. Evañca🔽pana vatvā tāvadeva vaccakuṭiṃ pavisitvā pāyāsaṃ vaḍḍhento viya hatthena gūthaṃ vaḍḍhetvā
analyzed: khīṇāsava theram āha varam te bhikkhu iminā pāpa upāsakena upaṭṭhīyamānassa evam  vasanataḥ aṅgulīhi kese luñcitvā acelassa sataḥ evañca  pana vatvā tāvat eva vacca kuṭim pavisitvā pāyāsam vaḍḍhentaḥ viya hatthena gūtham vaḍḍhetvā
translated: and be served by this wicked layman than to live🔽pulling out your hair with your fingers and eating a diet of filth as a naked ascetic.”🔽Having said this, he entered the privy, and pretending to be eating rice gruel, he took up some feces with his hand, ate it, and drank urine to his heart’s content.

original: vaḍḍhetvā yāvadatthaṃ khādi, muttañca pivi. Iminā niyāmena yāvatāyukaṃ ṭhatvā kālaṅkatvā🔽niraye paccitvā puna gūthamuttāhāro vasitvā tasseva kammassa vipākāvasesena manussesu
analyzed: vaḍḍhetvā yāvadattham khādi muttam ca iminā niyāmena yāvatāyukam ṭhatvā  niraye paccitvā puna gūtha mutta āhāraḥ vasitvā tassa iva kammassa vipāka avasesena manussesu
translated: In this manner he lived out his life. When he died, he was reborn in hell and lived there for a long time eating feces and drinking urine.

original: uppannopi pañca jātisatāni nigaṇṭho hutvā gūthabhakkho ahosi.
analyzed: uppannaḥ api pañca jāti satāni nigaṇṭhaḥ hutvā gūtha bhakkhaḥ ahosi
translated: When he was finally reborn among humans, he was born in a low family. He was a naked ascetic for five hundred births and ate feces.

original: Puna imasmiṃ buddhuppāde manussayoniyaṃ nibbattamānopi ariyūpavādabalena duggatakūle🔽nibbattitvā thaññaṃ vā khīraṃ vā sappiṃ vā pāyamāno, taṃ chaḍḍetvā muttameva pivati,
analyzed: punar imasmin buddhuppāde manussa yoniyam nibbattamānaḥ api ariyūpa vāda balena duggata kūle  nibbattitvā thaññam vā khīram vā sappim vā pāyamānaḥ tam chaḍḍetvā muttam eva pivati
translated: And on his rebirth in the human womb in this dispensation of the Buddha, he was born in a low family,🔽and he was suckled at the breast and fed on milk and ghee, but he rejected these and drank only urine,

original: odanaṃ bhojiyamāno, taṃ chaḍḍetvā gūthameva khādati, evaṃ gūthamuttaparibhogena vaḍḍhanto
analyzed: odanam bhojiyamānaḥ tam chaḍḍetvā gūtham eva khādati evam gūtha mutta paribhogena vaḍḍhantaḥ
translated: and when he was fed on rice he rejected that and ate only excrement. Thus he grew up subsisting on excrement and urine,

original: vayappattopi tadeva paribhuñjati. Manussā tato vāretuṃ asakkontā pariccajiṃsu. So
analyzed: vaya pattaḥ api tat eva paribhuñjati manussā tatas vāretum a sakkontā pariccajiṃsu so
translated: and when he reached maturity he continued to do so. People were unable to prevent him, so they abandoned him.

original: ñātakehi pariccatto naggapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā na nhāyati, rajojalladharo kesamassūni
analyzed: ñātakehi pariccattaḥ naggapabbajjam pabbajitvā na nhāyati rajaḥ jalladharaḥ kesa massūni
translated: Abandoned by his relatives, he went forth into homelessness in the naked ascetics’ mode of life. He did not bathe, he wore dust and dirt, he let his hair and beard grow long,

original: luñcitvā aññe iriyāpathe paṭikkhipitvā ekapādena tiṭṭhati, nimantanaṃ na sādiyati,
analyzed: luñcitvā aññe iriyāpathe paṭikkhipitvā eka pādena tiṭṭhati nimantanam na sādiyati
translated: he rejected other postures, and he stood on one leg. He did not accept invitations,

original: māsopavāsaṃ adhiṭṭhāya puññatthikehi dinnaṃ bhojanaṃ māse māse ekavāraṃ kusaggena🔽gahetvā divā jivhaggena lehati, rattiyaṃ pana “allagūthaṃ sappāṇaka”nti akhāditvā
analyzed: māsopavāsam adhiṭṭhāya puññatthikehi dinnam bhojanam māse māse eka vāram kusaggena 🔽gahetvā divā jivhaggena lehati rattiyam pana alla gūtham sappāṇakanti a khāditvā
translated: but he took a blade of grass in his mouth once a month and licked with his tongue the food given by those who sought merit. At night he did not eat the “green-and-raw” food,

original: sukkhagūthameva khādati, evaṃ karontassa pañcapaññāsavassāni vītivattāni mahājano
analyzed: sukkha gūtham eva khādati evam karontassa pañca paññāsa vassāni vītivattāni mahājanaḥ
translated: He ate only dry dung. In this way he spent fifty-five years.

original: “mahātapo paramappiccho”ti maññamāno tanninno tappoṇo ahosi.
analyzed: mahā tapo paramappiccho ti maññamāno tad ninnaḥ tad poṇaḥ ahosi
translated: The people, thinking that he was a great ascetic who had attained the highest goal, were devoted to him and paid homage to him.

original: Atha bhagavā tassa hadayabbhantare ghaṭe padīpaṃ viya arahattūpanissayaṃ pajjalantaṃ
analyzed: atha bhagavā tassa hadaya bbhantare ghaṭe padīpam viya arahattu upanissayam pajjalantam
translated: Then the Blessed One saw that the monk’s potential for arahatship was burning within him like a lamp inside a pot.

original: disvā sayameva tattha gantvā dhammaṃ desetvā sotāpattiphale patiṭṭhāpetvā, ehibhikkhūpasampadāya
analyzed: disvā sayam eva tattha gantvā dhammaṃ desetvā sotāpatti phale patiṭṭhāpetvā ehi bhikkhu upasampadāya
translated: He went there himself, taught him the Dhamma, established him in the fruit of stream-entry, and then gave him the going forth and higher ordination.

original: laddhūpasampadaṃ vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā arahatte patiṭṭhāpesi. Ayamettha saṅkhepo.
analyzed: laddha upasampadam vipassanam ussukkāpetvā arahatte patiṭṭhāpesi ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ
translated: After he had received the higher ordination, the Blessed One urged him to develop insight, and he was established in arahatship. This is the brief account.

original: Vitthāro pana dhammapade “māse māse kusaggenā”ti gāthāvaṇṇanāya vuttanayena veditabbo.

analyzed: nissāya sāvakena adhigantabbam mayā adhigatanti dassento 🔽pañca paññāsa vassāni rajojallam adhārayim
translated: I attained what can be attained by a disciple by following the Perfectly Enlightened One. ”🔽He said this in order to show that he had attained what can be attained by a disciple by following the Perfectly Enlightened One.

analyzed: eka pādena aṭṭhāsim āsanam parivajjayim
translated: I stood on one leg, I shunned a seat,

original: “Etādisaṃ karitvāna, bahuṃ duggatigāminaṃ;
analyzed: etādisam bahum duggati gāminam

original: sayaṃ nāyakarahitattā ca vināyakaṃ. Kenaci anabhibhūto hutvā sakalaṃ lokaṃ abhibhavitvā
analyzed: sayam ca vināyakam kenacid an abhibhūtaḥ hutvā sakalam lokam abhibhavitvā
translated: He is the Victorious because he has overcome the whole world and stands firm, being unconquered by anyone,🔽and because he has conquered the five aggregates as enemies.

original: ṭhitattā, pañcannampi mārānaṃ jitattā ca sadevakassa lokassa jinaṃ sadevake loke🔽aggajinaṃ, bāttiṃsavaramahāpurisalakkhaṇaasītianubyañjanādipaṭimaṇḍitarūpakāyatāya
analyzed: ṭhita ttā pañcannam pi mārānam jita ttā ca sa devakassa lokassa jinam sa devake loke  agga jinam bāttiṃsa vara mahāpurisa lakkhaṇa asīti anubyañjana ādi paṭimaṇḍita rūpa kāya tāya
translated: He is the Incomparable because he is incomparable in the world with its gods,🔽because he is adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man, the eighty minor characteristics, etc., and because he is adorned with the qualities of the ten powers, the four kinds of fearlessness, etc.,

original: dasabalacatuvesārajjādiguṇapaṭimaṇḍitadhammakāyatāya ca sadevakena lokena aparimeyyadassanatāya🔽asadisadassanatāya ca atuladassanaṃ.
analyzed: dasa bala catu vesārajja ādi guṇa paṭimaṇḍita dhamma kāya tāya ca sa devakena lokena aparimeyya dassana tāya  asadisa dassana tāya ca atula dassanam
translated: and because he is seen as immeasurable and incomparable by the world with its gods.🔽He is the Great Naga because he is like a great naga in his perfection of going, strength, courage, etc.,

original: Gatibalaparakkamādisampattiyā mahānāgasadisattā, nāgesupi khīṇāsavesu mahānubhāvatāya
analyzed: gati bala parakkama ādi sampattiyāḥ mahā nāga sadisa ttā nāgesu pi khīṇa āsavesu mahā anubhāva tāya
translated: and because he is the most powerful of all the nagas, that is, of all the arahats.

original: ca mahānāgaṃ. Mārasenāvimathanato mahāvikkantatāya ca mahāvīraṃ. Mahājutinti mahāpatāpaṃ
analyzed: ca mahā nāgam māra senā vimathanataḥ mahā vikkanta tāya ca mahāvīram mahājutinti mahāpatāpam
translated: and a great elephant. And a great hero because he crushed Mara’s army and because of his great fearlessness. Greatly resplendent: greatly burning.

original: mahātejanti attho. Natthi etassa cattāropi āsavāti anāsavaṃ. Sabbe āsavā savāsanā
analyzed: mahā tejanti atthaḥ na atthi etassa cattāro api āsavā ti anāsavam sabbe āsavā sa vāsanā
translated: The meaning is: of great splendour. He has no four taints: taintless.

original: parikkhīṇā etassāti sabbāsavaparikkhīṇaṃ. Kāmaṃ sāvakabuddhā paccekabuddhā ca khīṇāsavāva,🔽sabbaññubuddhā eva pana savāsane āsave khepentīti dassanatthaṃ “anāsava”nti vatvā
analyzed: parikkhīṇāḥ etassa ati sabba āsava parikkhīṇam kāmam sāvakabuddhā paccekabuddhā ca  sabbaññu buddhāḥ eva pana sa vāsane āsave khepenti iti dassana attham anāsavanti vatvā
translated: All his taints have been completely destroyed: all-taint-destroyer. Although disciples and paccekabuddhas are taint-destroyers,🔽they are called “taintless” and “all-taint-destroyer” in order to show that only the Enlightened One destroys the taints together with their residues.

original: puna “sabbāsavaparikkhīṇa”nti vuttaṃ. Tena vuttaṃ – “sabbe āsavā savāsanā parikkhīṇā
analyzed: puna sabba āsava parikkhīṇanti vuttam tena vuttam sabbe āsavā sava āsanā parikkhīṇā
translated: Therefore it is said: “All his taints have been completely destroyed,

original: etassāti sabbāsavaparikkhīṇa”nti. Diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthehi yathārahaṃ
analyzed: etassa ati sabba āsava parikkhīṇam ti diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika paramatthehi yathāraham
translated: therefore he is all-taint-destroyer.” He is a teacher because he teaches disciples according to their worth with reference to the highest good in this life, in the life to come, and in the ultimate sense.

original: veneyyānaṃ anusāsanato satthāraṃ, catuvesārajjavisāradatāya kutocipi bhayābhāvato
analyzed: veneyyānam anusāsanataḥ satthāram catu vesārajja visārada tāya kutocipi bhaya abhāvato
translated: He is fearless because he is confident in the fourfold fearlessness and because he is free from fear from any quarter.

original: akutobhayaṃ, evarūpaṃ sammāsambuddhaṃ yaṃ yasmā addasāsiṃ, tasmā svāgataṃ vata me āsīti yojanā.
analyzed: akutobhayam evarūpam sammāsambuddham yam yasmai tasmai svāgatam vata me āsi iti yojanā
translated: I have seen such a Perfect Buddha, therefore it is as if I have come to my own home.

original: Idāni satthu dassanena attanā laddhaguṇaṃ dassento catutthaṃ gāthamāha. Tassattho🔽– kañjiyapuṇṇalābu viya takkabharitacāṭi viya vasāpītapilotikā viya ca saṃkilesavatthūhi
analyzed: idāni satthu dassanena attanā laddha guṇam dassento catuttham gātham āha tassa atthaḥ  kañjiya puṇṇa lābu viya vasā pīta pilotikā viya ca saṃkilesa vatthūhi
translated: Now, showing the virtue he had gained by seeing the Teacher, he spoke the fourth stanza:🔽The meaning is this: For a long time in the beginningless round of rebirths, I was defiled by the grounds of defilement,

original: anamatagge saṃsāre cirakālaṃ saṃkiliṭṭhaṃ. Gaddulabandhitaṃ viya thambhe sārameyaṃ
analyzed: anamatagge saṃsāre cira kālam saṃkiliṭṭham gaddula bandhitam viya thambhe sārameyam
translated: like a gourd full of beans, like a pot full of rice, like a cloth soaked in oil.

original: sakkāyathambhe diṭṭhisandānena, diṭṭhibandhanena bandhitaṃ baddhaṃ, tato vimocento
analyzed: sakkāya thambhe diṭṭhi sandānena diṭṭhi bandhanena bandhitam baddham tatas
translated: I was bound to the post of personality view by the fetter of the view of individuality,🔽like a snake to a post by a rope. Delivering me from that,

original: ca abhijjhādīhi sabbaganthe hi maṃ senakaṃ ariyamaggahatthena, vimocayi vata so bhagavā
analyzed: ca abhijjha ādīhi sabba ganthe hi mam senakam ariya magga hatthena vimocayi vata saḥ bhagavā
translated: he, the Blessed One, freed me from all the bonds, such as covetousness, with the hand of the Noble Path.

original: mayhaṃ satthāti bhagavati abhippasādaṃ pavedeti.
analyzed: mayham satthā ati bhagavati abhippasādam paveda iti
translated: He is my Teacher. Thus he proclaims his confidence in the Blessed One.

original: Senakattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: senakatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Senaka is finished.

original: 7. Sambhūtattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sambhūta tthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: Sambhūta

original: Yo dandhakāletiādikā āyasmato sambhūtattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: yaḥ dandhakāla iti ādikā āyasmataḥ sambhūta ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The Elder Sambhūta’s verses beginning with “In the dark” . Where was this Elder Sambhūta reborn?

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni karonto buddhasuññe loke candabhāgāya nadiyā
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni karontaḥ buddha suññe loke candabhāgāya nadiyā
translated: having done what had to be done, making merit here and there, in a world devoid of Buddhas, on the bank of the Candabhāgā River,

original: tīre kinnarayoniyaṃ nibbatto. Ekadivasaṃ aññataraṃ paccekabuddhaṃ disvā pasannamānaso
analyzed: tīre kinnara yoniyam nibbattaḥ eka divasam aññataram paccekabuddham disvā pasanna mānasaḥ
translated: Having thus made provision for himself in various existences, he made merit, and when the world was devoid of Buddhas he was reborn in the Kinnara world on the banks of the river Candabhāgā. One day he saw a certain Paccekabuddha, and with a mind full of faith

original: vanditvā katañjalī ajjunapupphehi pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu
analyzed: vanditvā katañjalī ajjuna pupphehi pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu
translated: he worshipped him with a handful of Ajjuna flowers. By that root of merit he passed

original: saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kulagehe nibbattitvā sambhūtoti laddhanāmo vayappatto
analyzed: saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde kula gehe nibbattitvā sambhūtaḥ iti laddha nāmaḥ vaya ppatto
translated: from one happy state of existence to another, and in this dispensation he was reborn in a certain great family. When he was grown up he received the name Sambhūta.

original: bhagavato parinibbānassa pacchā dhammabhaṇḍāgārikassa santike dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: bhagavato parinibbānassa pacchā dhammabhaṇḍāgārikassa santike dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ
translated: After the Blessed One’s Parinibbāna he heard the Dhamma from the Dhamma Treasurer, and faith arose in him.

original: pabbajitvā samaṇadhammaṃ karonto vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: pabbajitvā samaṇa dhammaṃ karontaḥ vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: He went forth into homelessness, and while he was practicing the duties of a monk he developed insight and attained Arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadāna:🔽“At that time I was a Kinnara

original: “Candabhāgānadītīre, ahosiṃ kinnaro tadā;
analyzed: candabhāgā nadī tīre tadā
translated: On the banks of the river Candabhāgā.🔽I saw the stainless Buddha,

original: Addasaṃ virajaṃ buddhaṃ, sayambhuṃ aparājitaṃ.
analyzed: addasam virajam buddham sayambhum aparājitam
translated: The Self-becoming One, the Invincible.

original: “Pasannacitto sumano, vedajāto katañjalī;
analyzed: pasanna cittaḥ veda jātaḥ katañjalī
translated: “With a mind full of faith,

original: Gahetvā ajjunaṃ pupphaṃ, sayambhuṃ abhipūjayiṃ.
analyzed: gahetvā ajjunam puppham sayambhum
translated: And taking a jasmine flower, I worshipped the Self-Brough

original: “Tena kammena sukatena, cetanāpaṇidhīhi ca;
analyzed: tena kammena su katena cetanā paṇidhīhi ca
translated: “By that good deed well done, and by my intention and aspiration,

original: Jahitvā kinnaraṃ dehaṃ, tāvatiṃsamagacchahaṃ.
analyzed: jahitvā kinnaram deham tāvatiṃsam agaccha aham
translated: Abandoning the body of a kinnara, I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.

original: “Chattisakkhattuṃ devindo, devarajjamakārayiṃ;
analyzed: chattisakkhattum devindaḥ deva rajjam akārayim
translated: “Thirty-six times I was Sakka, king of the gods,

original: Dasakkhattuṃ cakkavattī, mahārajjamakārayiṃ.
analyzed: dasa kkhattum cakkavattī mahā rajjam akārayim
translated: Ten times a wheel-turning monarch, a great king.

original: “Padesarajjaṃ vipulaṃ, gaṇanāto asaṅkhiyaṃ;
analyzed: padesa rajjam vipulam gaṇanātaḥ asaṅkhiyam
translated: “And countless times I was a king of a region,

original: Sukhette vappitaṃ bījaṃ, sayambhumhi aho mama.
analyzed: su khette vappitam bījam sayambhumhi aho mama
translated: A seed sown in a good field, in the Self-Brough

original: “Kusalaṃ vijjate mayhaṃ, pabbajiṃ anagāriyaṃ;
analyzed: kusalam vijjate mayham pabbajim anagāriyam
translated: “I have done what is skillful, I have gone forth into homelessness;

original: Pūjāraho ahaṃ ajja, sakyaputtassa sāsane.
analyzed: pūjā rahaḥ aham ajja sakya puttassa sāsane
translated: I am worthy of worship today, in the Dispensation of the Son of the Sakyans.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.🔽Arahattaṃ pana patvā vimuttisukhena viharanto vassasataparinibbute bhagavati vesālikesu
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti  arahattam pana patvā vimutti sukhena viharantaḥ vassa sata parinibbute bhagavati vesālikesu
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: vajjiputtakesu dasa vatthūni paggayha ṭhitesu kākaṇḍakaputtena yasattherena ussāhitehi
analyzed: vajji puttakesu dasa vatthūni paggayha ṭhitesu kākaṇḍaka puttena yasattherena ussāhitehi
translated: But after attaining arahatship, while living in the bliss of deliverance, a hundred years after the Blessed One had attained final Nibbana, when the Vajjian monks of Vesali had set up ten practices as allowable,🔽and the Elder Yasa, the son of Kakandiya, had been sent by the Elder Revata, the chief resident of the Dakkhiṇagiri, to put a stop to those practices,

original: sattasatehi khīṇāsavehi taṃ diṭṭhiṃ bhinditvā saddhammaṃ paggaṇhantehi dhammavinayasaṅgahe
analyzed: satta satehi khīṇa āsavehi tam diṭṭhim bhinditvā saddhammam paggaṇhantehi dhamma vinaya saṅgahe
translated: and when the seven hundred Arahants, who were Free from the Fading of the Corruptions, had refuted that view and had recited the True Dhamma and Discipline,🔽and had completed the compilation of the True Dhamma and Discipline, the Vajjians, who were ignorant of the True Dhamma and Discipline, were distressed.

original: kate tesaṃ vajjiputtakānaṃ uddhammaubbinayadīpane dhammasaṃvegena thero –
analyzed: kate tesam vajji puttakānam uddhamma ubbinaya dīpane dhamma saṃvegena theraḥ
translated: The Elder, in order to teach the True Dhamma and Discipline to the Vajjians, recited these verses:

original: “Yo dandhakāle tarati, taraṇīye ca dandhaye;
analyzed: yaḥ dandha kāle tarati taraṇīye ca dandhaye
translated: “He who crosses when it is time to cross, and crosses what should be crossed,

original: Ayonisaṃvidhānena, bālo dukkhaṃ nigacchati.
analyzed: ayoni saṃvidhānena bālaḥ dukkham nigacchati
translated: The fool, by not applying himself properly, comes to suffering.

original: “Tassatthā parihāyanti, kāḷapakkheva candimā;
analyzed: tassatthā parihāyanti kāḷapakkhā iva candimā
translated: “His affairs decline, like the moon in the dark fortnight;

original: Āyasakyañca pappoti, mittehi ca virujjhati.
analyzed: āyasakyam ca pappoti mittehi ca virujjhati
translated: he comes to debt and is estranged from his friends.

original: “Yo dandhakāle dandheti, taraṇīye ca tāraye;
analyzed: yaḥ dandha kāle dandha iti taraṇīye ca tāraye
translated: “He who crosses when it is time to cross, and crosses what should be crossed,

original: Yoniso saṃvidhānena, sukhaṃ pappoti paṇḍito.
analyzed: yonisaḥ saṃvidhānena sukham pappoti paṇḍitaḥ
translated: the wise man, by applying himself properly, comes to happiness.

original: “Tassatthā paripūrenti, sukkapakkheva candimā;
analyzed: tassatthā paripūrenti sukka pakkhā iva candimā
translated: “His affairs increase, like the moon in the bright fortnight;

original: Yaso kittiñca pappoti, mittehi na virujjhatī”ti. –
analyzed: yasaḥ kittiñca pappoti mittehi na virujjhati iti
translated: he comes to fame and glory and is not estranged from his friends.”

original: Imā gāthā bhaṇanto aññaṃ byākāsi.🔽Tattha yo dandhakāle taratīti kismiñci kattabbavatthusmiṃ – “kappati nu kho, na nu
analyzed: imāḥ gāthāḥ bhaṇantaḥ aññam byākāsi 🔽tattha yaḥ dandha kāle tarati iti kismiñci kattabba vatthusmim kappati nu kho na nu
translated: Reciting these verses, he declared final knowledge.

original: kho kappatī”ti vinayakukkucce uppanne yāva viyattaṃ vinayadharaṃ pucchitvā taṃ kukkuccaṃ
analyzed: kho kappati iti vinaya kukkucce uppanne yāva viyat tam vinaya dharam pucchitvā tam kukkuccaṃ
translated: If there is doubt about the Monastic Law, he should ask someone who is knowledgeable about the Monastic Law, and he should then do what that knowledgeable person advises.

original: na vinodeti, tāva dandhakāle tassa kiccassa dandhāyitabbasamaye tarati madditvā vītikkamaṃ🔽karoti. Taraṇīye ca dandhayeti gahaṭṭhassa tāva saraṇagamanasīlasamādānādike, pabbajitassa
analyzed: na vinodeti tāva dandha kāle tassa kiccassa dandhāyitabba samaye tarati madditvā vītikkamam  karoti taraṇīye ca dandhayā iti gaha ṭṭhassa tāva saraṇa gamana sīla samādāna ādike pabbajitassa
translated: If, when the doubt has arisen, he does not clear it up by asking a legal expert, then he transgresses by delay.🔽For the time of doing that action is the time for which it should be done.🔽And when it is necessary to hurry, he delays: when it is necessary to hurry, he does not apply himself quickly to the task of going for refuge and undertaking the precepts, etc., in the case of a householder,

original: vattapaṭivattakaraṇādike samathavipassanānuyoge ca taritabbe sampatte sīghaṃ taṃ🔽kiccaṃ ananuyuñjitvā – “āgamanamāse pakkhe vā karissāmī”ti dandhāyeyya, taṃ kiccaṃ
analyzed: vatta paṭivatta karaṇa ādike samatha vipassanā anuyoge ca taritabbe sampatte sīgham tam  kiccam an anuyuñjitvā āgamana māse pakkhe vā karissāmi iti dandhāyeyya tam kiccam
translated: or to the task of carrying out the duties of the Pātimokkha, etc., in the case of one gone forth,🔽or to the task of developing serenity and insight when it is necessary to hurry, he delays, thinking, “I shall do it next month or next fortnight,” and he lets the time pass without doing the task.

original: akarontova kālaṃ vītināmeyya. Ayonisaṃvidhānenāti evaṃ dandhāyitabbe taranto taritabbe
analyzed: a karontaḥ uva kālam a yoni saṃvidhānena ati evam dandhāyitabbe tarantaḥ taritabbe
translated: By unwise reflection: one who, acting in this way, hurrying when he should delay and delaying when he should hurry,

original: ca dandhāyanto anupāyasaṃvidhānena upāyasaṃvidhānābhāvena bālo, mandabuddhiko puggalo,
analyzed: ca dandhāyantaḥ an upāya saṃvidhānena upāya saṃvidhāna abhāvena bālaḥ manda buddhikaḥ puggalo
translated: is a fool, a person of little intelligence, who has unwise reflection, who lacks wise reflection,

original: sampati āyatiñca dukkhaṃ anatthaṃ pāpuṇāti.
analyzed: sampati āyatiñca dukkham anattham pāpuṇāti
translated: attains suffering and what is unprofitable both in this world and in the next.

original: Tassatthā parihāyantīti tassa tathārūpassa puggalassa diṭṭhadhammikādibhedā atthā
analyzed: parihāyanti iti tassa tathārūpassa puggalassa diṭṭhadhammika ādi bhedāḥ atthāḥ
translated: which are of the kind beginning with those of the present life,

original: kāḷapakkhe candimā viya, parihāyanti divase divase parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gacchanti.
analyzed: kāḷapakkhe candimāḥ viya parihāyanti divase divase parikkhayam pariyādānam gacchanti
translated: decline like the waning moon; day by day they go to ruin and decrease.

original: “Asuko puggalo assaddho appasanno kusīto hīnavīriyo”tiādinā. Āyasakyaṃ viññūhi garahitabbataṃ🔽pappoti pāpuṇāti. Mittehi ca virujjhatīti “evaṃ paṭipajja, mā evaṃ paṭipajjā”ti ovādadāyakehi
analyzed: asukaḥ puggalaḥ assaddhaḥ appasannaḥ kusītaḥ hīna vīriya uti ādinā āyasakyam viññūhi garahitabbatam  pappoti pāpuṇāti mittehi ca virujjhati iti evam paṭipajja mā evam paṭipajjāti ovāda dāyakehi
translated: He is reproved by the wise: he is reproved, blamed, and so on, by the wise, who say, “So-and-so is faithless, confident in what is not true, lazy, and low in energy.”

original: kalyāṇamittehi “avacanīyā maya”nti ovādassa anādāneneva viruddho nāma hoti.
analyzed: kalyāṇa mittehi avacanīyāḥ mayanti ovādassa an ādānena iva viruddhaḥ nāma hoti
translated: He is shunned by his good fellows: he is shunned by good fellows who advise him, saying, “Do not behave like this, behave like this,” because he does not accept their advice, thinking, “We are not to be told by them.”🔽The meaning of the remaining two verses should be understood in the opposite sense.

original: Sesagāthādvayassa vuttavipariyāyena attho veditabbo. Keci panettha – “tarati dandhaye”tipadānaṃ
analyzed: sesa gāthā dvayassa vutta vipariyāyena atthaḥ veditabbaḥ keci pana ittha tarati dandhayā iti padānam
translated: But some, taking the words “he crosses over doubt” ,

original: atthabhāvena bhāvanācittassa paggahaniggahe uddharanti. Taṃ pacchimagāthāsu yujjati.
analyzed: attha bhāvena bhāvanā cittassa paggaha niggahe uddharanti tam pacchima gāthāsu yujjati
translated: extract the meaning of the words and take it as a heading for arousing and directing the mind to development. That is appropriate in the case of the last two verses.

original: Purimā hi dve gāthā pabbajitakālato paṭṭhāya caritabbaṃ samaṇadhammaṃ akatvā kukkuccapakatatāya
analyzed: purimā hi dve gāthā pabbajita kālataḥ paṭṭhāya caritabbam samaṇa dhammam a katvā kukkucca pakata tāya
translated: For the first two stanzas were spoken by the Elder because, after going forth, he did not practice the recluse’s duties and became remorseful.

original: dasa vatthūni dīpetvā saṅghena nikkaḍḍhite vajjiputtake sandhāya therena vuttā. Pacchimā
analyzed: dasa vatthūni dīpetvā saṅghena nikkaḍḍhite vajji puttake sandhāya therena vuttā pacchimā
translated: For the first two stanzas were spoken by the Elder about the Vajjiputtakas who were expelled by the Order after they had set forth ten points.

original: pana attasadise sammā paṭipanne sakatthaṃ nipphādetvā ṭhiteti.
analyzed: pana atta sadise sammā paṭipanne sakattham nipphādetvā ṭhitā iti

original: sītibhūto saupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā nibbuto, ahaṃ asmi homīti attho.
analyzed: sīti bhūtaḥ sa aupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā nibbutaḥ aham asmi homi iti attho
translated: I am one who is cool, extinguished in the element of extinction with a residue of attachment. The meaning is: I am one who is so.

original: Rāhulattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: rāhula thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Rāhula is finished.

original: 9. Candanattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: candanatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Verses of the Elder Candana🔽The elder named Candana, who possessed the supernormal power of reading the minds of others, recited this verse:🔽“The one who was praised by the Buddha, the supreme person,🔽The one who was called ‘foremost among my disciples who are meditators’—🔽I revere that Elder Mahāmoggallāna.”

original: Jātarūpenātiādikā āyasmato candanattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: jātarūpena ati ādikā āyasmataḥ candana ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The elder named Candana, who possessed the supernormal power of reading the minds of others, recited this verse:🔽“The one who was praised by the Buddha, the supreme person,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto ito ekatiṃse kappe buddhasuññe
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ itas ekatiṃse kappe buddha suññe
translated: The one who was called ‘foremost among my disciples who are meditators’—🔽I revere that Elder Mahāmoggallāna.”

original: loke rukkhadevatā hutvā nibbatto sudassanaṃ nāma paccekabuddhaṃ pabbatantare vasantaṃ
analyzed: loke rukkha devatā hutvā nibbattaḥ sudassanam nāma paccekabuddham pabbata antare vasantam
translated: Seeing the Paccekabuddha named Sudassana living in a mountain cave,

original: disvā pasannamānaso kuṭajapupphehi pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu
analyzed: disvā pasanna mānasaḥ kuṭaja pupphehi pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu
translated: he worshipped him with a flower of the kuṭaja tree, with a mind full of faith. By that meritorious deed he was reborn in the world of the gods and in the world of men,

original: saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ vibhavasampanne kule nibbattitvā candanoti
analyzed: saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam vibhava sampanne kule nibbattitvā candanoti
translated: and in this generation of the Buddha he was reborn in Sāvatthi in a family possessing great wealth. He was given the name Candana,

original: laddhanāmo vayappatto gharāvāsaṃ vasanto satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā sotāpanno ahosi.
analyzed: laddha nāmaḥ vaya ppattaḥ gharāvāsam vasantaḥ satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā sotāpannaḥ ahosi
translated: and when he reached maturity he lived in a house. Hearing the Dhamma in the presence of the Teacher, he became a Stream-Winner.

original: So ekaṃ puttaṃ labhitvā gharāvāsaṃ pahāya pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā
analyzed: so ekam puttam labhitvā ghara āvāsam pahāya pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā
translated: He had a son, and after leaving the household life he went forth. He took up the meditation subject of insight

original: araññe viharanto satthāraṃ vandituṃ sāvatthiṃ āgato susāne vasati. Tassa āgatabhāvaṃ
analyzed: araññe viharantaḥ satthāram vanditum sāvatthim āgataḥ susāne vasati tassa āgata bhāvam
translated: and lived in the forest. He came to Sāvatthi to pay homage to the Teacher. He stayed in a charnel ground.🔽Hearing that he had come, his former wife,

original: sutvā purāṇadutiyikā alaṅkatapaṭiyattā dārakaṃ ādāya mahatā parivārena therassa santikaṃ
analyzed: sutvā purāṇa dutiyikā alaṅkata paṭiyattā dārakam ādāya mahatā parivārena therassa santikam
translated: adorned and dressed in her best, took her son and went with a great retinue to the Elder,

original: gacchati – “itthikuttādīhi naṃ palobhetvā uppabbājessāmī”ti. Thero taṃ āgacchantiṃ
analyzed: gacchati itthi kutta ādīhi nam palobhetvā uppabbājessāmi iti theraḥ tam āgacchantim
translated: thinking, “I will seduce him with the beauty of a woman and so forth, and cause him to fall away from the ascetic life.” The Elder saw her coming🔽and said to his son, “Son, go and fetch a pot of water.”

original: dūratova disvā “idānissā avisayo bhavissāmī”ti yathāraddhaṃ vipassanaṃ ussukkāpetvā
analyzed: dūratas iva disvā avisayaḥ bhavissāmi iti yathā āraddham vipassanam ussukkāpetvā
translated: and seeing her from afar, he thought, “Now I will have no opportunity to develop insight.”🔽and he became one who had attained the six kinds of direct knowledge.

original: chaḷabhiñño ahosi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽“Not far from the Himalayas

original: “Himavantassāvidūre, vasalo nāma pabbato;
analyzed: himavantassa avidūre vasalaḥ nāma pabbato
translated: is a mountain named Vasala;🔽A Buddha named Sudassana

original: Buddho sudassano nāma, vasate pabbatantare.
analyzed: buddhaḥ sudassanaḥ nāma vasate pabbata antare
translated: dwelt in the midst of that mountain.🔽“I took a flower from the Himalayas

original: “Pupphaṃ hemavantaṃ mayha, vehāsaṃ agamāsahaṃ;
analyzed: puppham hemavantam mayha vehāsam agamāsaham
translated: and went through the air;🔽There I saw the Sambuddha,

original: Tatthaddasāsiṃ sambuddhaṃ, oghatiṇṇamanāsavaṃ.
analyzed: sambuddham ogha tiṇṇa manāsavam
translated: who had crossed over doubt and passion.🔽“Taking a flower of the kuṭaja tree,

original: “Pupphaṃ kuṭajamādāya, sire katvāna añjaliṃ;
analyzed: puppham kuṭajam ādāya sire katvāna añjalim
translated: I raised my joined palms in salutation🔽and offered it to the Buddha,

original: Buddhassa abhiropesiṃ, sayambhussa mahesino.
analyzed: buddhassa abhiropesim sayambhussa mahesinaḥ
translated: the Great Sage who is self-become.🔽“In the thirty-first eon from now,

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ pupphamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam puppham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: I worshipped with that flower;🔽I do not recall any bad destination—

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.🔽“My defilements are destroyed …

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: I have fulfilled the Buddha’s instructions.”

original: Chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā ākāse ṭhatvā tassā dhammaṃ desetvā saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāpetvā
analyzed: chaḷabhiñño pana hutvā ākāse ṭhatvā tassāḥ dhammam desetvā saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāpetvā
translated: After becoming one who had attained the six kinds of direct knowledge, he stood in the air and taught the Dhamma to her, established her in the refuges and precepts,

original: sayaṃ attanā pubbe vasitaṭṭhānameva gato. Sahāyabhikkhūhi – “vippasannāni kho te,
analyzed: sayam attanā pubbe vasita ṭṭhānam eva gato sahāya bhikkhūhi vippasannāni kho te
translated: The bhikkhus who were his friends asked him: “Friend, your faculties are clear and bright.

original: āvuso, indriyāni, kacci tayā saccāni paṭividdhānī”ti puṭṭho –
analyzed: āvuso indriyāni kacci tayā saccāni paṭividdhāni iti puṭṭhaḥ
translated: Have you penetrated the truths?”🔽“Adorned with gold,

original: “Jātarūpena sañchannā, dāsīgaṇapurakkhatā;
analyzed: jātarūpena sañchannā
translated: with a retinue of female slaves,🔽my wife came to me,

original: Aṅkena puttamādāya, bhariyā maṃ upāgami.
analyzed: aṅkena puttam ādāya bhariyā mam upāgami
translated: carrying my son on her hip.

original: “Tañca disvāna āyantiṃ, sakaputtassa mātaraṃ;
analyzed: tat ca disvānaḥ āyantim saka puttassa mātaram
translated: “Seeing her coming,🔽adorned, well clothed,

original: Alaṅkataṃ suvasanaṃ, maccupāsaṃva oḍḍitaṃ.
analyzed: alaṅkatam su vasanam oḍḍitam
translated: like a bride all made up,🔽“Then attention arose in me,

original: “Tato me manasīkāro, yoniso udapajjatha;
analyzed: tatas me manasīkāraḥ yonisaḥ udapajjatha
translated: and insight came to me.

original: Ādīnavo pāturahu, nibbidā samatiṭṭhatha.
analyzed: ādīnavaḥ pāturahu nibbidā samatiṭṭhatha
translated: I saw the danger and became dispassionate.🔽“Then my mind was liberated.

original: “Tato cittaṃ vimucci me, passa dhammasudhammataṃ;
analyzed: tatas cittam vimucci me passa dhamma su dhamma tam
translated: See the excellence of the Dhamma!🔽I have attained the three true knowledges.

original: Tisso vijjā anuppattā, kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti. –
analyzed: tissaḥ vijjāḥ anuppattā katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: I have fulfilled the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Imāhi gāthāhi attano paṭipattiṃ kathento aññaṃ byākāsi.
analyzed: imāhi gāthāhi attanaḥ paṭipattim kathentaḥ aññam byākāsi
translated: By reciting these verses he made known his own penetration of the truths.

original: Tattha jātarūpena sañchannāti jātarūpamayena sīsūpagādialaṅkārena alaṅkaraṇavasena
analyzed: tattha jātarūpena jātarūpa mayena sīsūpaga ādi alaṅkārena alaṅkaraṇa vasena
translated: Herein, adorned with gold means adorned with head ornaments, etc., made of gold.

original: paṭicchāditasarīrā, sabbābharaṇabhūsitāti attho. Dāsīgaṇapurakkhatāti yathārahaṃ
analyzed: paṭicchādita sarīrā sabba ābharaṇa bhūsitā ati atthaḥ dāsī gaṇa purakkhatā ati yathāraham
translated: with her body covered, adorned with all ornaments, is the meaning.🔽🔽Surrounded by a troupe of maids: having surrounded her in a fitting way,

original: alaṅkatapaṭiyattena attano dāsigaṇena purato katā parivāritāti attho. Aṅkena puttamādāyāti
analyzed: alaṅkata paṭiyattena attanaḥ dāsi gaṇena puratas katā parivāritā ati attho aṅkena puttam ādāya ati
translated: Her body was covered up, the meaning is, she was adorned with all her ornaments. Surrounded by her retinue of maids: the meaning is, she was surrounded by her retinue of maids who were dressed and adorned in a manner suitable to their rank. Holding her son on her lap:

original: “api nāma puttampi disvā gehassitasāto bhaveyyā”ti puttaṃ attano aṅkena gahetvā.
analyzed: api nāma puttam pi disvā gehassita sātaḥ bhaveyya ati puttam attanaḥ aṅkena gahetvā
translated: thinking, “Perhaps she will be gladdened by seeing her son,” she took her son on her lap.

original: Āyantinti āgacchantiṃ. Sakaputtassa mātaranti mama orasaputtassa jananiṃ, mayhaṃ
analyzed: āyantim ti āgacchantim saka puttassa mātaranti mama orasa puttassa jananim mayham
translated: As she came: as she approached. The mother of my son: the mother of my son who was a young man;

original: purāṇadutiyikanti attho. Sabbamidaṃ thero attano kāmarāgasamucchedaṃ bahumaññanto
analyzed: purāṇadutiyikanti attho sabbam idam theraḥ attanaḥ kāma rāga samucchedam bahu maññanto
translated: my former wife, is the meaning. The Elder spoke thus because he valued the destruction of his lust.

original: vadati. Yoniso udapajjathāti “evarūpāpi nāma sampatti jarābyādhimaraṇehi abhibhuyyati,
analyzed: vadati evarūpā api nāma sampatti jarā byādhi maraṇehi
translated: Proper attention arose: thinking, “Such a beauty as this is overcome by old age, sickness, and death,

original: aho saṅkhārā aniccā adhuvā anassāsikā”ti evaṃ yonisomanasikāro uppajji. Sesaṃ heṭṭhā vuttanayameva.
analyzed: aho saṅkhārāḥ aniccāḥ a dhuvāḥ an assāsikā ti evam yoniso manasikāraḥ uppajji sesam heṭṭhā vutta nayam eva
translated: alas, impermanent are formations, unstable, a burden to be borne,” proper attention arose. The rest is as already stated.

original: Candanattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: candana thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Candana is finished.

original: 10. Dhammikattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dhammikatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Verses of the Elder Dhammika

original: Dhammo havetiādikā āyasmato dhammikattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: dhammaḥ havā iti ādikā āyasmataḥ dhammika ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The story of the Elder Dhamika is given in the Commentary to this stanza.

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto sikhissa bhagavato kāle migaluddako
analyzed: kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ sikhissa bhagavataḥ kāle migaluddako
translated: In the dispensation of the former Buddha Sikhī he was a hunter.

original: hutvā ekadivasaṃ araññāyatane devaparisāya satthu dhammaṃ desentassa “dhammo eso🔽vuccatī”ti desanāya nimittaṃ gaṇhi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto🔽imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kosalaraṭṭhe brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā dhammikoti laddhanāmo vayappatto
analyzed: hutvā eka divasam arañña āyatane deva parisāya satthu dhammam desentassa dhammo eso  vuccati iti desanāya nimittam gaṇhi so tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ  imasmin buddhuppāde kosala raṭṭhe brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā dhammikaḥ iti laddha nāmaḥ vaya ppatto
translated: One day, as the Teacher was preaching the Law to the assembly of devas in the deva-world, he heard the words, “This is the Law.”🔽Thereupon he conceived the idea of becoming a preacher of the Law.🔽As the result of this meritorious deed, he passed successively through happy states of existence among men and devas and was finally born in the dispensation of the present Buddha in the brahmin caste in the Kosala country.

original: jetavanapaṭiggahaṇe laddhappasādo pabbajitvā aññatarasmiṃ gāmakāvāse āvāsiko hutvā🔽viharanto āgantukānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ vattāvattesu ujjhānabahulo akkhamo ahosi. Tena bhikkhū
analyzed: jetavana paṭiggahaṇe laddha ppasādaḥ pabbajitvā aññatarasmin gāmaka āvāse āvāsikaḥ hutvā  viharantaḥ āgantukānam bhikkhūnam vatta avattesu ujjhāna bahulaḥ akkhamaḥ ahosi tena bhikkhū
translated: He received the name Dhamika. When he reached years of maturity, he obtained faith in the Dispensation of the Buddha through the instrumentality of the acceptance of Jetavana, retired from the world, and became a monk.🔽He became a resident of a certain village monastery.🔽He was very censorious of the conduct of visiting monks, and was impatient of their presence. Consequently the monks left his monastery and went elsewhere.

original: taṃ vihāraṃ chaḍḍetvā pakkamiṃsu. So ekakova ahosi. Vihārasāmiko upāsako taṃ kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: tam vihāram chaḍḍetvā pakkamiṃsu saḥ ekakaḥ iva ahosi vihārasāmikaḥ upāsako tam kāraṇam
translated: He was left alone. The lay disciple who was the owner of the monastery heard the reason why the monks had left,

original: sutvā bhagavato taṃ pavattiṃ ārocesi. Satthā taṃ bhikkhuṃ pakkosetvā tamatthaṃ pucchitvā
analyzed: sutvā bhagavataḥ tam pavattim ārocesi satthā tam bhikkhum pakkosetvā tam attham pucchitvā
translated: and told the Teacher the whole story. The Teacher rebuked the monk, asked him whence he had come,

original: tena “evaṃ, bhante”ti vutte – “nāyaṃ idāneva akkhamo, pubbepi akkhamo ahosī”ti vatvā
analyzed: tena evam bhante iti vutte na ayam idānā iva akkhamaḥ pubbe api akkhamaḥ ahosi iti vatvā
translated: and when he replied, “From such and such a place,” said to him, “This is not the first time you have been impatient. You were impatient on a former occasion also.”

original: bhikkhūhi yācito rukkhadhammaṃ kathetvā upari tassa ovādaṃ dento –
analyzed: bhikkhūhi yācitaḥ rukkha dhammam kathetvā upari tassa ovādam dentaḥ
translated: And when the monks asked him to tell them about it, he related this story of the past.

original: “Dhammo have rakkhati dhammacāriṃ, dhammo suciṇṇo sukhamāvahāti;
analyzed: dhammaḥ have rakkhati dhamma cārim dhammaḥ su ciṇṇaḥ sukham āvahāti
translated: “The Law protects the man who lives by the Law; the Law, when rightly followed, brings happiness.

original: Esānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe, na duggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārī.
analyzed: esa anisaṃsaḥ dhamme su ciṇṇe na duggatim gacchati dhamma cārī
translated: This is the advantage in the Law, that the man who lives by the Law goes not to a place of woe.

original: “Na hi dhammo adhammo ca, ubho samavipākino;
analyzed: na hi dhammo adhammo ca ubho sama vipākino
translated: “The Law and the Unlaw do not bring forth their fruit at one and the same time.

original: Adhammo nirayaṃ neti, dhammo pāpeti suggatiṃ.
analyzed: adhammaḥ nirayam neti dhammaḥ pāpeti suggatim
translated: The Unlaw leads to hell; the Law leads to a happy state.

original: “Tasmā hi dhammesu kareyya chandaṃ, iti modamāno sugatena tādinā;
analyzed: tasmai hi dhammesu kareyya chandam iti modamānaḥ sugatena tādinā
translated: “Therefore one should set his heart on the Law; thus rejoicing, he should follow the Law of the Supremely Happy One.

original: Dhamme ṭhitā sugatavarassa sāvakā, nīyanti dhīrā saraṇavaraggagāmino.
analyzed: dhamme ṭhitā sugata varassa sāvakā nīyanti dhīrā saraṇa vara gga gāminaḥ
translated: The disciples of the Supremely Happy One, who abide in the Law, are wise, and go to the foremost refuge.

original: “Vipphoṭito gaṇḍamūlo, taṇhājālo samūhato;
analyzed: vipphoṭitaḥ gaṇḍa mūlo taṇhā jālo samūhataḥ
translated: “The root of the boil has been torn out; the net of craving has been destroyed.

original: So khīṇasaṃsāro na catthi kiñcanaṃ,
analyzed: so khīṇa saṃsāraḥ na catthi kiñcanaṃ
translated: He has put an end to the round of births; he has nothing whatever.

original: Cando yathā dosinā puṇṇamāsiya”nti. – catasso gāthā abhāsi;
analyzed: candaḥ yathā dosinā puṇṇamāsiyanti catassaḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: and the moon on the fourteenth day of the waning fortnight.

original: Tattha dhammoti lokiyalokuttaro sucaritadhammo. Rakkhatīti apāyadukkhato rakkhati,🔽saṃsāradukkhato ca vivaṭṭūpanissayabhūto rakkhatiyeva. Dhammacārinti taṃ dhammaṃ🔽carantaṃ paṭipajjantaṃ. Suciṇṇoti suṭṭhu ciṇṇo kammaphalāni saddahitvā sakkaccaṃ
analyzed: tattha dhammo ti lokiya lokuttaraḥ su carita dhammo rakkhati iti apāya dukkhataḥ rakkhati  saṃsāra dukkhataḥ ca vivaṭṭu upanissaya bhūto rakkhatiyā iva dhamma cārin ti tam dhammaṃ  carantam paṭipajjantam su ciṇṇo ti suṭṭhu ciṇṇo kamma phalāni saddahitvā sakkaccam
translated: Herein, the Dhamma is the good conduct of the world and the higher than the world. It protects : it protects from the suffering of the states of loss.

original: cittīkatvā upacito. Sukhanti lokiyalokuttarasukhaṃ. Tattha lokiyaṃ tāva kāmāvacarādibhedo
analyzed: cittīkatvā upacitaḥ lokiya lokuttara sukham tattha lokiyam kāmāvacara ādi bhedo
translated: And it protects by being the support for turning away from the suffering of the round of rebirths. The virtuous : the one who practices that Dhamma, who undertakes it. Well-practised : well undertaken, well accumulated, having believed in the results of action and having made them paramount. Happiness : mundane and supramundane happiness. Herein, the mundane kind is the happiness of the kinds classed as sensual, etc.,

original: dhammo yathāsakaṃ sukhaṃ diṭṭhe vā dhamme upapajje vā apare vā pariyāye āvahati nipphādeti,
analyzed: dhammaḥ yathāsakam sukham diṭṭhe vā dhamme upapajje vā apare vā pariyāye āvahati nipphādeti
translated: which the Dhamma of the kind already stated brings in this very life, or in the life immediately following, or in some subsequent existence, and which it conveys, that is to say, produces.

original: itaraṃ pana vivaṭṭūpanissaye ṭhatvā ciṇṇo paramparāya āvahatīti vattuṃ vaṭṭati anupanissayassa
analyzed: itaram pana vivaṭṭu upanissaye ṭhatvā ciṇṇaḥ paramparāyaḥ āvahati iti vattum vaṭṭati an upanissayassa
translated: But the other kind, when practised, can be said to bring happiness by a kind of conveyance, since it is the support for turning away from the round of rebirths.

original: tadabhāvato. Esānisaṃso dhamme suciṇṇe, na duggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārīti dhammacārī
analyzed: tad abhāvataḥ esa anisaṃsaḥ dhamme su ciṇṇe na duggatim gacchati dhamma cārī iti dhamma cārī
translated: The virtuous man does not go to a state of loss.

original: puggalo dhamme suciṇṇe taṃnimittaṃ duggatiṃ na gacchatīti eso dhamme suciṇṇe ānisaṃso udrayoti attho.
analyzed: puggalaḥ dhamme su ciṇṇe taṃnimittam duggatim na gacchati iti esaḥ dhamme su ciṇṇe ānisaṃsaḥ attho
translated: When a person has practiced the Dhamma well, he does not go to a bad destination because of that cause. This is the benefit of having practiced the Dhamma well. The meaning is: it is a great benefit.

original: Yasmā dhammeneva sugatigamanaṃ, adhammeneva ca duggatigamanaṃ, tasmā “dhammo adhammo”ti
analyzed: yasmai dhammena iva sugati gamanam adhammena iva ca duggati gamanam tasmai dhammaḥ adhammaḥ ti
translated: Because it is by the Dhamma that one goes to a good destination and by the non-Dhamma that one goes to a bad destination, therefore,

original: ime aññamaññaṃ asaṃkiṇṇaphalāti dassetuṃ “na hi dhammo”tiādinā dutiyaṃ gāthamāha.
analyzed: ime aññam aññam asaṃkiṇṇa phalā ti dassetum na hi dhamma iti ādinā dutiyam gātham āha
translated: in order to show that the Dhamma and the non-Dhamma have their fruits unmingled with each other, he uttered the second stanza, “The Dhamma and the non-Dhamma, etc.”

original: Tattha adhammoti dhammapaṭipakkho duccaritaṃ. Samavipākinoti sadisavipākā samānaphalā.
analyzed: tattha adhammaḥ ti dhamma paṭipakkhaḥ duccaritam sama vipākino ti sadisa vipākā samāna phalā
translated: Herein, the non-Dhamma is misconduct, the opposite of the Dhamma. Of equal ripening: having an equal fruit, having the same fruit.🔽Therefore: because the Dhamma and the non-Dhamma have the different ripening as stated above.

original: Tasmāti yasmā dhammādhammānaṃ ayaṃ yathāvutto vipākabhedo, tasmā. Chandanti kattukamyatāchandaṃ.
analyzed: tasmā iti yasmā dhamma adhammānam ayam yathā vuttaḥ vipāka bhedaḥ tasmā chandanti kattu kamya tā chandam
translated: Desire: desire to do.

original: Iti modamāno sugatena tādināti iti evaṃ vuttappakārena ovādadānena sugatena sammaggatena
analyzed: iti modamānaḥ sugatena tādinā ati iti evam vutta ppakārena ovāda dānena sugatena sammaggatena
translated: Thus rejoicing in the One who goes well, the One who tames: thus rejoicing in the One who goes well, the One who goes by the right path,

original: sammāpaṭipannena iṭṭhādīsu tādibhāvappattiyā tādināmavatā hetubhūtena modamāno tuṭṭhiṃ
analyzed: sammā paṭipannena iṭṭha ādīsu ta ādi bhāva ppattiyā ta ādi nāmavatā hetu bhūtena modamāno tuṭṭhim
translated: the One who has practiced the right way, the One who is called the tamer because he is the cause for the attainment of the state of being tamed in regard to desirable, etc., objects, rejoicing, being satisfied,

original: āpajjamāno dhammesu chandaṃ kareyyāti yojanā. Ettāvatā vaṭṭaṃ dassetvā idāni vivaṭṭaṃ🔽dassento “dhamme ṭhitā”tiādimāha. Tassattho – yasmā sugatassa varassa sugatesu ca
analyzed: āpajjamānaḥ dhammesu chandam kareyya ati yojanā ettāvatā vaṭṭam dassetvā idāni vivaṭṭam  dassentaḥ dhamme ṭhitā ti ādim āha tassa atthaḥ yasmā sugatassa varassa sugatesu ca
translated: Having thus shown the round, he now shows the breaking of the round,🔽saying, “The wise who stand upon the Dhamma.” The meaning is this: Because the disciples of the Well-Farer, the Excellent One, the Supremely Enlightened One,

original: varassa sammāsambuddhassa sāvakā tassa dhamme ṭhitā dhīrā ativiya aggabhūtasaraṇagāmino
analyzed: varassa sammāsambuddhassa sāvakā tassa dhamme ṭhitā dhīrā agga bhūta saraṇa gāminaḥ
translated: the wise who stand upon the Dhamma, the supreme refuge,

original: teneva saraṇagamanasaṅkhāte dhamme ṭhitabhāvena sakalavaṭṭadukkhatopi nīyanti nissaranti,
analyzed: tena iva saraṇa gamana saṅkhāte dhamme ṭhita bhāvena sakala vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ pi nīyanti nissaranti
translated: are led out of the entire round of suffering by virtue of their standing upon the Dhamma called the going for refuge,

original: tasmā hi dhammesu kareyya chandanti.
analyzed: tasmā hi dhammesu kareyya chandanti
translated: therefore one should make his will regarding the Dhamma.🔽When the Teacher had thus expounded the Dhamma in three stanzas, the lay devotee increased his insight by developing it right where he was sitting and attained arahatship.

original: Evaṃ satthārā tīhi gāthāhi dhamme desite desanānusārena yathānisinnova vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: evam satthārā tīhi gāthāhi dhamme desite desanā anusārena yathā nisinnaḥ eva vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Therefore it was said above:

original: “Migaluddo pure āsiṃ, araññe vipine ahaṃ;
analyzed: migaluddo pure āsim araññe vipine aham
translated: “In the forest I was a hunter,🔽I saw the dust-free Buddha,

original: Addasaṃ virajaṃ buddhaṃ, devasaṅghapurakkhataṃ.
analyzed: addasam virajam buddham deva saṅgha purakkhatam
translated: Surrounded by the assembly of gods.

original: “Catusaccaṃ pakāsentaṃ, desentaṃ amataṃ padaṃ;
analyzed: catusaccam pakāsentam desentam amatam padam
translated: “He was teaching the four truths,🔽The deathless state, the sweet Dhamma,

original: Assosiṃ madhuraṃ dhammaṃ, sikhino lokabandhuno.
analyzed: assosim madhuram dhammam sikhinaḥ loka bandhunaḥ
translated: Of the world’s friend, the Enlightened One.

original: “Ghose cittaṃ pasādesiṃ, asamappaṭipuggale;
analyzed: ghose cittam pasādesim asamappaṭipuggale
translated: “I was gladdened by the sound, by the one who was not practicing rightly;

original: Tattha cittaṃ pasādetvā, uttariṃ duttaraṃ bhavaṃ.
analyzed: cittam pasādetvā uttarim duttaram bhavam
translated: Having gladdened my mind there, I crossed the crossing beyond birth.

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ saññamalabhiṃ tadā;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam tadā
translated: “Thirty-one eons ago, I obtained the sign then;

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, ghosasaññāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi ghosa saññāya idam phalam
translated: I do not know of a bad destination, this is the fruit of the sign of Ghosaka.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are burned up… the Buddha’s instruction is fulfilled.”

original: Tathā arahatte patiṭṭhito. Arahattaṃ pana patvā attanā adhigataṃ visesaṃ satthu nivedento carimagāthāya aññaṃ byākāsi.
analyzed: tathā arahatte patiṭṭhitaḥ arahattam pana patvā attanā adhigatam visesam satthu nivedento carima gāthāya aññam byākāsi
translated: And he was established in Liberation. But having attained Liberation, he declared his understanding to the Teacher, and in the last verse he made a declaration of his attainment.

original: Tattha vipphoṭitoti vidhuto, maggañāṇena paṭinissaṭṭhoti attho. Gaṇḍamūloti avijjā.
analyzed: tattha vipphoṭitaḥ ti vidhutaḥ magga ñāṇena paṭinissaṭṭhaḥ ti attho gaṇḍamūlaḥ ti avijjā
translated: Herein, he was shaken off means he was shaken out, the meaning is, he was removed by the knowledge of the path. The root of the dart means ignorance.

original: Sā hi gaṇḍati savati. “Gaṇḍoti kho, bhikkhu, pañcannetaṃ upādānakkhandhānaṃ adhivacana”nti
analyzed: sā hi gaṇḍati savati gaṇḍo ti kho bhikkhu pañcanna etam upādānakkhandhānam adhivacananti
translated: For this is said by the Teacher: “Bhikkhu, the word dart stands for the five aggregates as objects of clinging” .🔽And it is the root of the dart because it is the root of suffering,

original: evaṃ satthārā vuttassa dukkhamūlayogato, kilesāsucipaggharaṇato, uppādajarābhaṅgehi
analyzed: evam satthārā vuttassa dukkha mūla yogataḥ kilesa asuci paggharaṇataḥ uppāda jarā bhaṅgehi
translated: and it is the dart because it is the source of the foulness of defilement, and because it is the source of the foulness of the body, and because it is the source of the foulness of death.

original: uddhumātapakkapabhijjanato ca, gaṇḍābhidhānassa upādānakkhandhapañcakassa mūlaṃ kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: ca gaṇḍa abhidhānassa upādāna khandha pañcakassa mūlam kāraṇam
translated: The root of the name “boil” is the five aggregates as objects of clinging.

original: taṇhājālo samūhatoti taṇhāsaṅkhāto jālo maggena samugghāṭito. So khīṇasaṃsāro na
analyzed: taṇhā jālo samūhato ti taṇhā saṅkhātaḥ jālaḥ maggena samugghāṭitaḥ saḥ khīṇa saṃsāraḥ na
translated: The net of craving is destroyed: the net called craving is torn by the path. He is one whose round of births is ended,

original: catthi kiñcananti so ahaṃ evaṃ pahīnataṇhāvijjatāya parikkhīṇasaṃsāro pahīnabhavamūlattā🔽eva na catthi, na ca upalabbhati rāgādikiñcanaṃ. Cando yathā dosinā puṇṇamāsiyanti🔽yathā nāma cando abbhamahikādidosarahito puṇṇamāsiyaṃ paripuṇṇakāle evaṃ ahampi arahattādhigamena🔽apetarāgādikiñcano paripuṇṇadhammakoṭṭhāso ahosinti.🔽Dhammikattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: catthi kiñcana nti so aham evam pahīna taṇhā vijja tāya parikkhīṇa saṃsāraḥ pahīna bhava mūla ttā  eva na catthi na ca upalabbhati rāga ādi kiñcanam candaḥ yathā dosinā  yathā nāma candaḥ abbha mahika ādi dosa rahitaḥ puṇṇamāsiyam paripuṇṇa kāle evam aham pi arahatta adhigamena  apeta rāga ādi kiñcano paripuṇṇa dhamma koṭṭhāsaḥ ahosinti  dhammika thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto ito ekatiṃse kappe mahānubhāvo🔽nāgarājā hutvā nibbatto sambhavassa nāma paccekabuddhassa abbhokāse samāpattiyā nisinnassa
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ itas ekatiṃse kappe mahā anubhāvaḥ  nāga rājā hutvā nibbattaḥ sambhavassa nāma paccekabuddhassa abbhokāse samāpattiyā nisinnassa
translated: and having thus made provision for himself, he accumulated much merit. At the end of thirty-one cycles of time he was reborn as a king of the Nāgas.🔽Now a certain Private Buddha, named Sambhava, was sitting in a state of trance in the open air.

original: mahantaṃ padumaṃ gahetvā uparimuddhani dhārento pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena
analyzed: mahantam padumam gahetvā uparimuddhani dhārento pūjam akāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena
translated: and he was reborn in various states of existence, accumulating merit. At the end of thirty-one cycles of time he was reborn as a king of the nāgas. He took a great lotus flower and held it over the head of the Private Buddha Sambhava, who was sitting in the open air in the attainment of meditation. Thus he made an offering to him. By that meritorious deed

original: devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ brāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā
analyzed: deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam brāhmaṇa kule nibbattitvā
translated: he was reborn in the heavenly world and in the world of men. At the time of the present Buddha he was reborn in Sāvatthi in a brāhmaṇa family.

original: sappakoti laddhanāmo viññutaṃ patto bhagavato santike dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: sappakaḥ iti laddha nāmaḥ viññu tam pattaḥ bhagavato santike dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddho
translated: He received the name Sappaka. When he reached maturity he heard the Dhamma in the presence of the Exalted One, and having gained faith,

original: pabbajitvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā ajakaraṇiyā nāma nadiyā tīre leṇagirivihāre vasanto
analyzed: pabbajitvā kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā ajakaraṇiyāḥ nāma nadiyāḥ tīre leṇa giri vihāre vasantaḥ
translated: he went forth into homelessness. He received a meditation subject and dwelt in the Cave Mountain Monastery on the bank of the river Ajakaraṇī.

original: nacirasseva arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: nacirassa iva arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Soon he attained arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadāna:

original: “Himavantassāvidūre, romaso nāma pabbato;
analyzed: himavantassa avidūre romasaḥ nāma pabbato
translated: “Not far from the Himalayas, there is a mountain named Romasa.

original: Buddhopi sambhavo nāma, abbhokāse vasī tadā.
analyzed: buddhaḥ api sambhavaḥ nāma abbhokāse vasī tadā
translated: The Buddha named Sambhava, at that time dwelt in the open air.

original: “Bhavanā nikkhamitvāna, padumaṃ dhārayiṃ ahaṃ;
analyzed: bhavanā nikkhamitvāna padumam dhārayim aham
translated: “Having gone forth from my dwelling, I held a lotus flower.

original: Ekāhaṃ dhārayitvāna, bhavanaṃ punarāgamiṃ.
analyzed: ekāham bhavanam punar āgamin
translated: After keeping it one day, I returned to my home.

original: “Ekatiṃse ito kappe, yaṃ buddhamabhipūjayiṃ;
analyzed: ekatiṃse itas kappe yam buddham abhipūjayiṃ
translated: “Thirty-one cycles of time have passed since then, since I worshipped the Buddha.

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I do not recall any state of woe; this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements have been burned out. … The Buddha’s teaching has been done.”

original: So arahattaṃ patvā satthāraṃ vandituṃ sāvatthiṃ āgato ñātīhi upaṭṭhīyamāno tattha
analyzed: saḥ arahattam patvā satthāram vanditum sāvatthim āgataḥ ñātīhi upaṭṭhīyamānaḥ tattha
translated: After attaining arahatship, he went to Savatthi to pay homage to the Teacher. There he was waited upon by his relatives.

original: katipāhaṃ vasitvā dhammaṃ desetvā ñātake saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāpetvā yathāvuttaṭṭhānameva
analyzed: katipāham vasitvā dhammaṃ desetvā ñātake saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāpetvā yathāvutta ṭṭhānam eva
translated: After staying there for several days, he preached the Law and established his relatives in the Refuges and the Precepts. Then he desired to return to the place he had mentioned.

original: gantukāmo ahosi. Taṃ ñātakā “idheva, bhante, vasatha, mayaṃ paṭijaggissāmā”ti yāciṃsu.
analyzed: gantu kāmaḥ ahosi tam ñātakāḥ idhā iva bhante vasatha mayam paṭijaggissāma ati yāciṃsu
translated: His relatives asked him to remain, saying, “Reverend Sir, remain here. We will wait upon you.”

original: So gamanākāraṃ dassetvā ṭhito attanā vasitaṭṭhānakittanāpadesena vivekābhiratiṃ pakāsento –
analyzed: so gamana ākāram dassetvā ṭhitaḥ attanā vasita ṭṭhāna kittana apadesena viveka abhiratim pakāsentaḥ
translated: But he made signs that he would go. Standing there, he extolled the place where he dwelt, and in order to show his delight in solitude, he recited the following Stanza,

original: “Yadā balākā sucipaṇḍaracchadā, kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā;
analyzed: yadā balākā su cipaṇḍara chadā kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā
translated: When the balaka cranes, white and fair of wing, are frightened by the black rain-cloud,

original: Palehiti ālayamālayesinī, tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.
analyzed: tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rama iti
translated: Then the river Ajakaraṇī, seeking a resting place, delights me.

original: “Yadā balākā suvisuddhapaṇḍarā, kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā;
analyzed: yadā balākā su visuddha paṇḍarā kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitā
translated: “When the cranes, their wings pure and white, Are frightened by the black cloud’s fear,

original: Pariyesati leṇamaleṇadassinī, tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti maṃ.
analyzed: pariyesati tadā nadī aja karaṇī rameti mama
translated: And seek a shelter, seeing shelter, Then the Ajakaraṇī River delights me.

original: “Kaṃ nu tattha na ramenti, jambuyo ubhato tahiṃ;
analyzed: kam nu tattha na ramenti ubhatas tahim
translated: “But what is it that delights there, The rose-apple trees on both sides?

original: Sobhentī āpagākūlaṃ, mama leṇassa pacchato.
analyzed: sobhentī āpagā kūlam mama leṇassa pacchatas
translated: They shine on the bank of the river, Behind my shelter.

original: “Tāmatamadasaṅghasuppahīnā, bhekā mandavatī panādayanti;
analyzed: tāmata mada saṅgha su pahīnāḥ bhekāḥ mandavatī panādayanti
translated: “The frogs, their groups of darkness gone, Are croaking softly.

original: Nājja girinadīhi vippavāsasamayo,
analyzed: na ajja giri nadīhi vippavāsa samayaḥ
translated: Today is not the time to leave the mountain river,

original: Khemā ajakaraṇī sivā surammā”ti. – catasso gāthā abhāsi;
analyzed: khemā ajakaraṇī sivā surammā ati catassaḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: The Ajakaraṇī is safe, peaceful, and delightful.” – he spoke four verses:

original: Tattha yadāti yasmiṃ kāle. Balākāti balākāsakuṇikā. Sucipaṇḍaracchadāti sucisuddhadhavalapakkhā.🔽Kāḷassa meghassa bhayena tajjitāti jalabhārabharitatāya kāḷassa añjanagirisannikāsassa
analyzed: tattha yadā ati yasmin kāle balākā ati balākā sakuṇikā suci paṇḍaracchadā ati suci suddha dhavala pakkhā  kāḷassa meghassa bhayena jala bhāra bharita tāya kāḷassa añjana giri sannikāsassa
translated: Therein, “when” means at what time. “Cranes” means cranes and small birds. “Pure and white wings” means pure and clean white wings.

original: pāvussakameghassa gajjato vuṭṭhibhayena nibbijjitā bhiṃsāpitā. Palehitīti gocarabhūmito
analyzed: pāvussaka meghassa gajjataḥ vuṭṭhi bhayena nibbijjitā bhiṃsāpitā palehitī iti gocara bhūmitaḥ
translated: “Frightened by the black cloud’s fear” means frightened by the fear of lightning, frightened and terrified by the fear of the rain falling from the black cloud that is close to the Añjana mountain. “Seeing shelter” means from the place of wandering.

original: uppatitvā gamissati. Ālayanti nilayaṃ attano kulāvakaṃ. Ālayesinīti tattha ālayanaṃ
analyzed: uppatitvā gamissati ālayanti nilayam attano kulāvakam ālayesinī iti tattha ālayanam
translated: and will fly away. “A home-seeker”: a home is a place of one’s own family. “Seeking a home”:

original: nilīyanameva icchantī. Tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti manti tasmiṃ pāvussakakāle ajakaraṇīnāmikā
analyzed: nilīyanam eva icchantī tadā nadī ajakaraṇī rameti tasmin pāvussaka kāle ajakaraṇī nāmikā
translated: desiring to settle down there. “Then the river Ajakaraṇī”: at that time of the Pavāraṇā ceremony, the river named Ajakaraṇī

original: nadī navodakassa pūrā hārahārinī kulaṅkasā maṃ rameti mama cittaṃ ārādhetīti utupadesavisesakittanāpadesena
analyzed: nadī nava udakassa pūrā hāra hārinī kulaṅkasā mam rameti mama cittam ārādheti iti utu padesa visesa kittana apadesena
translated: was filled with fresh water, carrying away the grass, and it delighted me. It pleased my mind. By this description of the special qualities of the season,

original: vivekābhiratiṃ pakāsesi.
analyzed: viveka abhiratim pakāsesi
translated: she shows her delight in seclusion.

original: Suvisuddhapaṇḍarāti suṭṭhu visuddhapaṇḍaravaṇṇā, asammissavaṇṇā sabbasetāti attho.
analyzed: su visuddha paṇḍarā ti suṭṭhu visuddha paṇḍara vaṇṇā asammissa vaṇṇā sabba setā ti attho

analyzed: ekaṃsataḥ vā bhijjatu ayam kāyo ti ayam mama pūti kāyo iminā vīriya patāpena bhijjati  ce bhijjatu chinna bhinnam hotu maṃsa pesī iminā daḷha parakkamena imasmai
translated: Or let it break up all at once. This body: this my foul body; if it breaks up through the effort of energy, let it break up, let it be shattered.

translated: So too is a well-spoken utterance, though fruitful,

original: Imā pañca gāthā abhāsi.🔽Tattha ayogeti ayuñjitabbe asevitabbe antadvaye. Idha pana attakilamathānuyogavasena🔽attho veditabbo. Yuñjanti tasmiṃ attānaṃ yuñjanto yojento tathā paṭipajjanto. Kiccamicchakoti
analyzed: imā pañca gāthāḥ abhāsi  tattha ayoga iti ayuñjitabbe asevitabbe anta dvaye idha pana atta kilamatha anuyoga vasena  atthaḥ veditabbaḥ yuñjanti tasmin attānam yuñjantaḥ yojentaḥ tathā paṭipajjantaḥ kiccam icchakoti

original: ubhayahitāvahaṃ kiccaṃ icchanto, tappaṭipakkhato ayoge caraṃ caranto ce bhaveyya.

translated: Herein, ayoge means in what should not be undertaken, should not be pursued, in the two extremes. But here the meaning should be understood as “in the pursuit of self-mortification.” Yuñjanti tasmin means they undertake, they pursue, they practice in that way. Kiccamicchako means one who desires what is beneficial to both. If he were to practice in the opposite of that, in the pursuit of what is not to be undertaken,

analyzed: na adhigaccheyya iti yathā adhippetam hita sukham na pāpuṇeyya ati ñāyo tasmai yam aham titthiya mata vañcito
translated: Nādhigaccheyya means he would not attain what is intended, he would not reach welfare and happiness. Therefore, the misfortune that I, deceived by the views of sectarians,
