analyzed: ṭhitaḥ pabbata pādamhi mahā muni
translated: the Great Sage spoke to me:

original: Vakkalīti jino vācaṃ, taṃ sutvā mudito ahaṃ.
analyzed: vakkalī iti jinaḥ vācam tam sutvā muditaḥ aham
translated: ‘Vakkali,’ said the Victorious One. Hearing that, I was overjoyed.

original: “Pakkhandiṃ selapabbhāre, anekasataporise;
analyzed: pakkhandim sela pabbhāre aneka sata porise
translated: “I descended the rocky slope,

original: Tadā buddhānubhāvena, sukheneva mahiṃ gato.
analyzed: tadā buddha anubhāvena sukhena iva mahim gataḥ
translated: and easily reached the ground.

original: “Punopi dhammaṃ deseti, khandhānaṃ udayabbayaṃ;
analyzed: punar api dhammam deseti khandhānam udaya bbayam
translated: “Again he taught the Dhamma,🔽the arising and passing away of the five aggregates.🔽Understanding that Dhamma,

original: Tamahaṃ dhammamaññāya, arahattamapāpuṇiṃ.🔽“Sumahāparisamajjhe, tadā maṃ caraṇantago;
analyzed: tam aham dhammam aññāya arahattam apāpuṇim  su mahā parisamajjhe tadā mam caraṇantagaḥ
translated: I attained perfection.🔽“In the middle of a great assembly,🔽the Great Sage, with his foot on my head,

original: Aggaṃ saddhādhimuttānaṃ, paññapesi mahāmati.
analyzed: aggam saddhā adhimuttānam paññapesi mahāmati
translated: declared me foremost🔽of those resolute in faith.🔽“For a hundred thousand eons,

original: “Satasahassito kappe, yaṃ kammamakariṃ tadā;🔽Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhapūjāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: kappe yam kammam akarim tadā  duggatim nā abhijānāmi buddha pūjāya idam phalam
translated: I did that deed.🔽I do not recall any bad destination. This is the fruit of my worship of the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: My defilements are ended… I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā aññaṃ byākarontopi thero imā eva gāthā abhāsi. Atha naṃ satthā bhikkhusaṅghamajjhe nisinno saddhādhimuttānaṃ aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesīti.
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā aññam byākarontaḥ api theraḥ imāḥ eva gāthāḥ abhāsi atha nam satthā bhikkhu saṅgha majjhe nisinnaḥ saddhādhimuttānam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi iti
translated: But when he attained Arahantship, he recited these same verses in his declaration of his enlightenment. Then the Teacher, seated in the midst of the Congregation of Bhikkhus, established him in the foremost place among those who are devoted to faith.

original: Vakkalittheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vakkali tthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Vakkali is finished.

original: 9. Vijitasenattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vijitasena thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Elder Vijitasena

original: Olaggessāmītiādikā āyasmato vijitasenattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: āyasmataḥ vijitasena therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The Elder Vijitasena’s verses beginning with the words, “I will build a hut” were spoken by the Elder Vijitasena. What was the origin of these verses? This Elder also formed his resolution in the presence of former Buddhas.

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ kusalaṃ upacinanto atthadassissa🔽bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto gharāvāsaṃ pahāya isipabbajjaṃ🔽pabbajitvā araññe viharanto ākāsena gacchantaṃ bhagavantaṃ disvā pasannamānaso pasannākāraṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusalam upacinantaḥ atthadassissa  bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ ghara āvāsam pahāya isi pabbajjam  pabbajitvā araññe viharantaḥ ākāsena gacchantam bhagavantam disvā pasanna mānasaḥ pasanna ākāram
translated: In various states of existence, accumulating merit, the root of which was the desire for the welfare of all beings, he was reborn in the time of the Supremely Enlightened One Kassapa.🔽Having gone forth in the Dispensation of that Buddha, he lived in the forest. One day, as he was going through the air, he saw the Supremely Enlightened One Kassapa. His mind became serene with faith, and he stood with uplifted hands,

original: dassento añjaliṃ paggayha aṭṭhāsi. Satthā tassa ajjhāsayaṃ ñatvā ākāsato otari. So
analyzed: dassentaḥ añjalim paggayha aṭṭhāsi satthā tassa ajjhāsayam ñatvā ākāsataḥ otari so
translated: showing forth his serene faith. The Teacher, perceiving his intention, descended from the air.

original: bhagavato manoharāni madhurāni phalāni upanesi, paṭiggahesi bhagavā anukampaṃ upādāya.
analyzed: bhagavataḥ manoharāni madhurāni phalāni upanesi paṭiggahesi bhagavā anukampam upādāya
translated: and offered them to the Lord, who accepted them out of compassion.

original: So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde kosalaraṭṭhe hatthācariyakule
analyzed: so tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde kosala raṭṭhe hatthācariya kule
translated: As a result of that root of merit, he was reborn in the heavenly worlds and among humans, and in this dispensation he was reborn in the Kosala country in a family of elephant trainers.

original: nibbattitvā vijitasenoti laddhanāmo viññutaṃ pāpuṇi. Tassa mātulā seno ca upaseno
analyzed: nibbattitvā vijitasenaḥ ti laddha nāmaḥ viññu tam pāpuṇi tassa mātulā seno ca upaseno
translated: He was given the name Vijayasena. When he had reached maturity, his two maternal uncles, Seno and Upaseno,

original: cāti dve hatthācariyā satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddhā pabbajitvā vāsadhuraṃ
analyzed: ca ati dve hatthācariyā satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdha saddhā pabbajitvā vāsa dhuram
translated: who were elephant trainers, heard the Dhamma from the Teacher, gained faith, went forth, and fulfilled the duties of the monk’s role.

original: pūrentā arahattaṃ pāpuṇiṃsu. Vijitasenopi hatthisippe nipphattiṃ gato nissaraṇajjhāsayatāya
analyzed: pūrentāḥ arahattam pāpuṇiṃsu vijita senaḥ api hatthi sippe nipphattim gataḥ nissaraṇa jhāsayatāya
translated: Vijayasena, too, became proficient in the art of training elephants. But because he was inclined to renunciation,

original: gharāvāse alaggamānaso satthu yamakapāṭihāriyaṃ disvā paṭiladdhasaddho mātulattherānaṃ🔽santike pabbajitvā tesaṃ ovādānusāsaniyā vipassanāya kammaṃ karonto vipassanāvīthiṃ
analyzed: ghara āvāse a lagga mānasaḥ satthu yamaka pāṭihāriyam disvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ  santike pabbajitvā tesam ovāda anusāsaniyā vipassanāya kammam karontaḥ vipassanā vīthim
translated: he was not attached to the life of a householder. When he saw the Twin Miracle, he gained faith, went forth in the presence of his two maternal uncles,🔽and while he was doing the meditation subject under their instruction, his mind, which was leaping about and straying outside on various objects,

original: laṅghitvā bahiddhā nānārammaṇe vidhāvantaṃ attano cittaṃ ovadanto –
analyzed: laṅghitvā bahiddhā nānā ārammaṇe vidhāvantam attano cittam ovadantaḥ
translated: he admonished himself with this stanza:

original: “Olaggessāmi te citta, āṇidvāreva hatthinaṃ;
analyzed: olaggessāmi te citte āṇi dvārā iva hatthinam
translated: I’ll bind you, mind, as one binds an elephant at the temple’s gate,

original: Na taṃ pāpe niyojessaṃ, kāmajālaṃ sarīrajaṃ.
analyzed: na tam pāpe niyojessam kāma jālam sarīra jam
translated: And never will I let you go to sin, to lust’s ensnaring snare.

original: “Tvaṃ olaggo na gacchasi, dvāravivaraṃ gajova alabhanto;
analyzed: tvam olaggaḥ na gacchasi dvāra vivaram
translated: You’re bound, you cannot go, like an elephant at the temple’s gate,

original: Na ca cittakali punappunaṃ, pasakka pāparato carissasi.
analyzed: na ca citta kali punappunam pasakka pāpa rataḥ carissasi
translated: And never will you go again, mind, to sin, to evil deeds.

original: “Yathā kuñjaraṃ adantaṃ, navaggahamaṅkusaggaho;
analyzed: yathā kuñjaram adantam navaggaham aṅkusaggahaḥ
translated: As one who has a goad controls an elephant, a wild young bull,

original: Balavā āvatteti akāmaṃ, evaṃ āvattayissaṃ taṃ.
analyzed: balavān āvattā iti akāmam evam āvattayissam tam
translated: And makes it do his will, though it be hard, so will I control you.

original: “Yathā varahayadamakusalo, sārathipavaro dameti ājaññaṃ;
analyzed: yathā vara haya dama kusalaḥ sārathi pavaraḥ dameti ājaññam
translated: As a skilled driver controls a fine steed, a thoroughbred,

original: Evaṃ damayissaṃ taṃ, patiṭṭhito pañcasu balesu.
analyzed: evam damayissam tam patiṭṭhitaḥ pañcasu balesu
translated: So will I control you, standing firm in the five powers.

original: “Satiyā taṃ nibandhissaṃ, payutto te damessāmi;
analyzed: satiyā tam nibandhissam payuttaḥ te damessāmi
translated: I’ll bind you with mindfulness, and with energy I’ll control you;

original: Vīriyadhuraniggahito, na yito dūraṃ gamissase cittā”ti. –
analyzed: vīriya dhura niggahitaḥ na yitaḥ dūram gamissase citta ati
translated: Held back by the curb of energy, you will not go far, mind.

original: Gāthā abhāsi.
analyzed: gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: He spoke this verse:

original: Tattha olaggessāmīti saṃvarissāmi nivāressāmi. Teti taṃ. Upayogatthe hi idaṃ sāmivacanaṃ.
analyzed: tattha olaggessāmi iti saṃvarissāmi nivāressāmi te iti tam upayoga atthe hi idam sāmi vacanam
translated: Herein, I’ll bind you means I’ll restrain you, I’ll check you. You means you, mind. For this is a possessive expression in the sense of use.

original: Te gamananti vā vacanaseso. Hatthinanti ca hatthinti attho. Cittāti attano cittaṃ
analyzed: te gamananti vā vacana sesaḥ hatthinanti ca hatthinti attho cittāti cittam
translated: Or else the remainder of the words is implied by the words I’ll bind you. An elephant at the temple’s gate means an elephant in the royal elephant-house. Mind means his own mind.

original: ālapati. Yathā taṃ vāretukāmo, taṃ dassento “āṇidvāreva hatthina”nti āha. Āṇidvāraṃ
analyzed: ālapati yathā tam vāretu kāmo tam dassento āṇi dvārā iva hatthinanti āha āṇi dvāram
translated: He speaks to it as one who wants to restrain it, showing it by the words “at the city gate with the bolt” .

original: nāma pākārabaddhassa nagarassa khuddakadvāraṃ, yaṃ ghaṭikāchidde āṇimhi pakkhitte🔽yantena vinā abbhantare ṭhitehipi vivarituṃ na sakkā. Yena manussagavassamahiṃsādayo
analyzed: nāma pākāra baddhassa nagarassa khuddaka dvāram yam ghaṭikā chidde āṇimhi pakkhitte  yantena vinā vivaritum na sakkā yena
translated: The city gate with the bolt is a small gate in a walled city, in which a bolt is fixed in a hole in the doorpost,🔽and which cannot be opened by those inside even when they are in a hurry, much less by outsiders. It is a gate in which men, cattle, buffaloes, etc.,

original: na niggantuṃ sakkā. Nagarato bahi niggantukāmampi hatthiṃ yato palobhetvā hatthācariyo
analyzed: na niggantum sakkā nagarataḥ bahi niggantu kāmam pi hatthim yatas palobhetvā hatthācariyaḥ
translated: cannot get out. When an elephant wants to get out of the city, the mahout stops it by tempting it with food, etc.

original: gamanaṃ nivāresi. Atha vā āṇidvāraṃ nāma palighadvāraṃ. Tattha hi tiriyaṃ palighaṃ🔽ṭhapetvā rukkhasūcisaṅkhātaṃ āṇiṃ palighasīse āvuṇanti. Pāpeti rūpādīsu uppajjanakaabhijjhādipāpadhamme
analyzed: gamanam nivāresi atha vā āṇidvāram nāma paligha dvāram tattha hi tiriyam paligham  ṭhapetvā rukkha sūci saṅkhātam āṇim paligha sīse āvuṇanti pāpa iti rūpa ādīsu uppajjanaka abhijjhā ādi pāpa dhamme
translated: Or the city gate with the bolt is a gate with a crossbar. For a crossbar is fixed there across the door, and a bolt is inserted in the top of the crossbar.🔽I shall not set it in motion, I shall not set it in motion” .

original: taṃ na niyojessaṃ na niyojissāmi. Kāmajālāti kāmassa jālabhūtaṃ. Yathā hi macchabandhamigaluddānaṃ
analyzed: tam na niyojessam na niyojissāmi kāma jālā ati kāmassa jāla bhūtam yathā hi macchabandha migaluddānam
translated: The snare of sense desires: the sense desires are a snare for him, thus he is the one “with the snare of sense desires.” For just as a hunter spreads a snare in a frequented place in the forest in order to catch deer, birds, etc.,

original: jālaṃ nāma macchādīnaṃ tesaṃ yathākāmakārasādhanaṃ, evaṃ ayonisomanasikārānupātitaṃ
analyzed: jālam nāma yathā kāmakāra sādhanam evam a yoniso manasikāra anupātitam
translated: A net is a means of catching fish, etc., and so is applied to the case of wrong reflection.

original: cittaṃ mārassa kāmakārasādhanaṃ. Tena hi so satte anatthesu pāteti. Sarīrajāti sarīresu
analyzed: cittam mārassa kāmakāra sādhanam tena hi saḥ satte anatthesu pātā iti sarīra jāti sarīresu
translated: “A net” is a means of catching fish, etc., and so is a means of doing as one wishes with them. So too, the mind, when it has been brought to by unwise attention, is a means of doing as Mara wishes with it. Therefore he makes beings fall into misfortune. “Born in the body” : it is born in the bodies.

original: uppajjanaka. Pañcavokārabhave hi cittaṃ rūpapaṭibaddhavuttitāya “sarīraja”nti vuccati.🔽Tvaṃ olaggo na gacchasīti tvaṃ, cittakali, mayā satipaññāpatodaaṅkusehi vārito na
analyzed: uppajjanaka pañcavokāra bhave hi cittam rūpa paṭibaddha vutti tāya sarīra janti vuccati  tvam olaggaḥ na gacchasi iti tvam citta kali mayā sati paññā patoda aṅkusehi vāritaḥ na
translated: For in the five-constituent kind of becoming the mind is called “born in the body” because its occurrence is bound up with material form.

original: dāni yathāruciṃ gamissasi, ayonisomanasikāravasena yathākāmaṃ vattituṃ na labhissasi.
analyzed: dāni yathārucim gamissasi a yoniso manasikāra vasena yathākāmam vattitum na labhissasi
translated: “You, O creeper, do not go” : you, O mind, do not go as you please, restrained by the goad of mindfulness and understanding. You will not get to act as you wish by way of unwise attention.

original: Yathā kiṃ? Dvāravivaraṃ gajova alabhanto nagarato gajanirodhato vā niggamanāya dvāravivarakaṃ🔽alabhamāno hatthī viya. Cittakalīti cittakāḷakaṇṇi. Punappunanti aparāparaṃ. Pasakkāti
analyzed: yathā kim dvāra vivaram nagarataḥ gaja nirodhataḥ vā niggamanāya dvāra vivarakam  a labhamānaḥ hatthī viya cittakalī iti citta kāḷa kaṇṇi punappunanti apara aparam pasakkāti
translated: How? Like an elephant that cannot get to the opening of a door, or like an elephant that cannot get out of a stable.

original: saraṇasampassāsavasena. Pāparatoti pāpakammanirato pubbe viya idāni na carissasi
analyzed: saraṇa sampassāsa vasena pāpa rataḥ ti pāpa kamma nirataḥ pubbe viya idāni na carissasi
translated: “You, O creeper” : you, O mind, O black-ear. “Again and again” : repeatedly. “In the open” : by way of the open door of the sense doors. “You will not go” : you will not go as you did before, being intent on evil action.

original: tathā carituṃ na dassāmīti attho.
analyzed: tathā caritum na dassāmi iti attho
translated: I will not allow it to go on like that.

original: Adantanti adamitaṃ hatthisikkhaṃ asikkhitaṃ. Navaggahanti aciragahitaṃ. Aṅkusaggahoti
analyzed: a dantanti a damitam hatthi sikkham a sikkhitam nava ggahanti acira gahitam aṅkusa ggahaḥ ti
translated: Untamed: not tamed, not trained in elephant taming. Newly caught: recently caught. The goad-handler:

original: hatthācariyo. Balavāti kāyabalena ñāṇabalena ca balavā. Āvatteti akāmanti anicchantameva
analyzed: hatthācariyaḥ balavā ati kāya balena ñāṇa balena ca balavā āvattā iti a kāmanti an icchantam eva
translated: the elephant trainer. Powerful: powerful in physical strength and in the strength of knowledge. I will turn back: I will turn back, i.e. stop, him who does not wish,

original: nisedhanato nivatteti. Evaṃ āvattayissanti yathā yathāvuttaṃ hatthiṃ hatthācariyo,
analyzed: nisedhanataḥ nivatteti evam āvattayissanti yathā yathāvuttam hatthim hatthācariyaḥ
translated: who does not want to. Just as the elephant trainer will turn back the elephant as described,

original: evaṃ taṃ cittaṃ cittakaliṃ duccaritanisedhanato nivattayissāmi.🔽Varahayadamakusaloti uttamānaṃ assadammānaṃ damane kusalo. Tato eva sārathipavaro
analyzed: evam tam cittam citta kalim duccarita nisedhanataḥ nivattayissāmi  vara haya dama kusalaḥ ti uttamānam assa dammānam damane kusalaḥ tatas eva sārathi pavaraḥ
translated: in the same way I will turn back, i.e. stop, the mind, the rogue elephant, by stopping bad conduct.🔽Skilled in taming the best horses: skilled in taming the best horses, the best of horses. Therefore, the best charioteer:

original: assadammasārathīsu visiṭṭho dameti ājaññaṃ ājānīyaṃ assadammaṃ desakālānurūpaṃ saṇhapharusehi
analyzed: assa damma sārathīsu visiṭṭhaḥ dameti ājaññam ājānīyam assa dammam desa kāla anurūpam saṇha pharusehi
translated: the best among charioteers who tame horses. He tames: he tames, i.e. trains, the horse, the best of horses, in accordance with the time and place, by means of gentle and harsh methods.

original: dameti vineti nibbisevanaṃ karoti. Patiṭṭhito pañcasu balesūti saddhādīsu pañcasu
analyzed: dameti vinā iti nibbisevanam karoti patiṭṭhitaḥ pañcasu balesu iti saddhā ādīsu pañcasu
translated: He makes it free from vice. Firmly established in the five powers: having become firmly established in the five powers beginning with faith,

original: balesu patiṭṭhito hutvā assaddhiyādinisedhanato taṃ damayissaṃ damessāmīti attho.
analyzed: balesu patiṭṭhitaḥ hutvā tam damayissam damessāmi iti atthaḥ
translated: I will tame, i.e. I will stop, him by stopping lack of faith and so on.

original: Satiyā taṃ nibandhissanti gocarajjhattato bahi gantuṃ adento satiyottena kammaṭṭhānathambhe,🔽cittakali, taṃ nibandhissāmi niyamessāmi. Payutto te damessāmīti tattha nibandhanto
analyzed: satiyā tam nibandhissanti gocara jjhattataḥ bahi gantum a dento kamma ṭṭhāna thambhe  cittakali tam nibandhissāmi niyamessāmi payuttaḥ te damessāmi iti tattha nibandhantaḥ
translated: He will bind it with mindfulness, preventing it from going outside the range of the meditation subject by means of the mindfulness factor of complete awakening,🔽and he will bind it, he will control it, he will tame it, he will restrain it, he will subdue it, he will crush it, he will bring it to subjection, he will bring it to complete obedience. He will bind it there,

original: eva yuttappayutto hutvā te damessāmi, saṃkilesamalato taṃ visodhessāmi. Vīriyadhuraniggahitoti
analyzed: eva yutta ppayuttaḥ hutvā te damessāmi saṃkilesa malataḥ tam visodhessāmi vīriya dhura niggahitaḥ ti
translated: and he will bring it to complete obedience by being properly yoked to it. He will purify it of the stain of defilement. He will restrain it with the yoke-yoke of energy.

original: yathāvutto chekena susārathinā yuge yojito yuganiggahito yugantaragato taṃ nātikkamati,🔽evaṃ tvampi citta, mama vīriyadhure niggahito sakkaccakāritāya sātaccakāritāya aññathā
analyzed: yathā vuttaḥ chekena su sārathinā yuge yojitaḥ yuga niggahitaḥ yugantara gataḥ tam na atikkamati  evam tvam pi citta mama vīriya dhure niggahitaḥ sakkacca kāritāya sātacca kāritāya aññathā
translated: Just as a well-trained driver restrains a horse yoked to a carriage with the yoke-yoke, so that it does not go beyond the range of the carriage pole,

original: vattituṃ alabhanto ito gocarajjhattato dūraṃ bahi na gamissasi. Bhāvanānuyuttassa
analyzed: vattitum a labhantaḥ itas gocara jjhattataḥ dūram bahi na gamissasi bhāvanā anuyuttassa
translated: so too, mind, you will not go beyond the range of the meditation subject, outside the range of the meditation subject, because you are restrained by me with the yoke-yoke of energy, because you are made to work hard by me, because you are made to work continuously by me, because you are unable to behave as you choose.

original: hi kammaṭṭhānato aññaṃ āsannampi lakkhaṇato dūramevāti evaṃ thero imāhi gāthāhi attano
analyzed: hi kammaṭṭhānataḥ aññam āsannam pi lakkhaṇataḥ dūram eva ati evam theraḥ imāhi gāthāhi attanaḥ
translated: For to one devoted to development, even what is near is far by reason of its characteristics.

original: cittaṃ niggaṇhantova vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: cittam niggaṇhantaḥ iva vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: Thus the elder developed insight by restraining his mind in this way with these verses, and he reached Arahantship. Hence it is said in the Apadana:

original: “Suvaṇṇavaṇṇaṃ sambuddhaṃ, dvattiṃsavaralakkhaṇaṃ;

original: Koṭiagghanakassa kaṇṇapiḷandhanassa dhāraṇena “koṭikaṇṇo”ti vattabbe kuṭikaṇṇoti paññāyittha.

translated: Because he wore an earring worth a hundred thousand pieces of money, he should have been called Koṭikaṇṇa; but he was known as Kuṭikaṇṇa.

original: So anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā kuṭumbaṃ saṇṭhapento āyasmante mahākaccāne kulagharaṃ nissāya
analyzed: saḥ anukkamena vaḍḍhitvā kuṭumbam saṇṭhapentaḥ āyasmante mahākaccāne kula gharam nissāya
translated: When he had grown up, he married and settled down in the world. One day, as the venerable Mahā Kaccāna was wandering through the country on his alms round, he came to the house of Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa.

original: pavattapabbate viharante tassa santike dhammaṃ sutvā saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāya
analyzed: pavatta pabbate viharante tassa santike dhammam sutvā saraṇesu ca sīlesu ca patiṭṭhāya
translated: Soṇa heard the Dhamma from the elder, and he and his wife took their stand in the Refuges and the Precepts.

original: taṃ catūhi paccayehi upaṭṭhahi. So aparabhāge saṃsāre sañjātasaṃvego therassa santike
analyzed: tam catūhi paccayehi upaṭṭhahi saḥ aparabhāge saṃsāre sañjāta saṃvegaḥ therassa santike
translated: and he looked after him with the four requisites. Later, when he had become disgusted with saṃsāra, he went forth

original: pabbajitvā kicchena kasirena dasavaggaṃ saṅghaṃ sannipātetvā upasampajjitvā katipayakālaṃ
analyzed: pabbajitvā kicchena kasirena dasa vaggam saṅgham sannipātetvā upasampajjitvā katipaya kālam
translated: in the presence of the Elder, and after gathering a group of ten monks with difficulty and hardship, he was fully admitted to the Order. After living with the Elder for a few days,

original: therassa santike vasitvā, theraṃ āpucchitvā satthāraṃ vandituṃ sāvatthiṃ upagato,
analyzed: therassa santike vasitvā theram āpucchitvā satthāram vanditum sāvatthim upagataḥ
translated: he took leave of the Elder and went to Sāvatthi to pay homage to the Teacher.

original: satthārā ekagandhakuṭiyaṃ vāsaṃ labhitvā paccūsasamaye ajjhiṭṭho soḷasaaṭṭhakavaggiyānaṃ
analyzed: satthārā eka gandhakuṭiyam vāsam labhitvā paccūsa samaye ajjhiṭṭhaḥ soḷasa aṭṭhaka vaggiyānam
translated: The Teacher gave him lodging in the Fragrant Cottage. When he was sitting in meditation at the time of the first watch of the night, he heard the recitation of the sixteen sections of the Aṭṭhakavagga,

original: ussāraṇena sādhukāraṃ datvā bhāsitāya “disvā ādīnavaṃ loke”ti udānagāthāya pariyosāne
analyzed: ussāraṇena sādhukāram da tvā bhāsitāya disvā ādīnavam loka iti udāna gāthāya pariyosāne
translated: and when he heard the recitation of the Udāna, “Having seen the world in bondage to craving,”

original: vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: he increased his insight and attained Arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadāna:

original: “Padumuttaro nāma jino, āhutīnaṃ paṭiggaho;
analyzed: padumuttaraḥ nāma jinaḥ āhutīnam paṭiggahaḥ
translated: “The Conqueror named Padumuttara, who received offerings,

original: Vasīsatasahassehi, nagaraṃ pāvisī tadā.
analyzed: vasī sata sahassehi nagaram pāvisī tadā
translated: Entered the city at that time with a hundred thousand Vasī monks.

original: “Nagaraṃ pavisantassa, upasantassa tādino;
analyzed: nagaram pavisantassa upasantassa tādinaḥ
translated: “When he entered the city, tranquil and self-controlled,

original: Ratanāni pajjotiṃsu, nigghoso āsi tāvade.
analyzed: ratanāni pajjotiṃsu nigghosaḥ āsi tāvade
translated: The gems shone forth and a great shout went up.

original: “Buddhassa ānubhāvena, bherī vajjumaghaṭṭitā;
analyzed: buddhassa ānubhāvena bherī vajjum aghaṭṭitā
translated: “By the Buddha’s power, the drum of the gods was beaten;

original: Sayaṃ vīṇā pavajjanti, buddhassa pavisato puraṃ.
analyzed: sayam vīṇā pavajjanti buddhassa pavisataḥ puram
translated: The lute played by itself as the Buddha entered the city.

original: “Buddhaseṭṭhaṃ namassāmi, padumuttaramahāmuniṃ;
analyzed: buddha seṭṭham namassāmi padumuttara mahā munim
translated: “I paid homage to the Buddha, the best of beings, the great sage Padumuttara,

original: Pāṭihīrañca passitvā, tattha cittaṃ pasādayiṃ.
analyzed: pāṭihīram ca passitvā tattha cittam
translated: And having seen the miracle, I gained confidence in him.

original: “Aho buddho aho dhammo, aho no satthu sampadā;
analyzed: aho buddhaḥ aho dhammaḥ aho no satthu sampadā
translated: “Wonderful is the Buddha, wonderful is the Dhamma, wonderful is the Master’s achievement!

original: Acetanāpi tūriyā, sayameva pavajjare.
analyzed: acetanā api tūriyā sayamā iva pavajjare
translated: Even the insentient instruments played by themselves.

original: “Satasahassito kappe, yaṃ saññamalabhiṃ tadā;
analyzed: kappe yam tadā
translated: “For a hundred thousand eons, I did not obtain the opportunity

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, buddhasaññāyidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi buddha saññāya idam phalam
translated: To remember the Buddha. I do not recall any bad destination. This is the fruit of remembering the Buddha.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham pe katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: “My defilements are destroyed … The Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Arahatte pana patiṭṭhito attano upajjhāyena ācikkhitaniyāmena paccantimesu janapadesu
analyzed: arahatte pana patiṭṭhitaḥ attanaḥ upajjhāyena ācikkhita niyāmena paccantimesu janapadesu
translated: But when he was established in Arahantship, he asked for five favors from the Teacher, according to the method told by his preceptor in the border countries:

original: vinayadharapañcamena gaṇena upasampadā, dhuvanhānaṃ, cammattharaṇaṃ, guṇaṅguṇūpāhanaṃ,
analyzed: vinayadhara pañcamena gaṇena upasampadā camma attharaṇam guṇaṅguṇūpāhanam
translated: ordination by a group of five including a Vinaya expert, permanent residence, a skin-covering, sandals with many linings,

original: cīvaravippavāsoti pañca vare yācitvā te satthu santikā labhitvā punadeva attano vasitaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: cīvara vippavāso ti pañca vare yācitvā te satthu santikā labhitvā puna deva attanaḥ vasita ṭṭhānam
translated: and living apart from one’s robe. Having obtained these from the Teacher, he returned to his own dwelling place.

original: gantvā upajjhāyassa tamatthaṃ ārocesi. Ayamettha saṅkhepo. Vitthāro pana udānaṭṭhakathāyaṃ🔽āgatanayena veditabbo. Aṅguttaraṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “upasampanno hutvā attano upajjhāyassa
analyzed: gantvā upajjhāyassa tam attham ārocesi ayam ettha saṅkhepaḥ vitthāraḥ pana udāna ṭhakathāyam  āgata nayena veditabbaḥ aṅguttara ṭṭhakathā ayam pana upasampannaḥ hutvā attanaḥ upajjhāyassa
translated: and told his preceptor what had happened. This is the brief account. The detailed account should be understood according to the Udāna Commentary.

original: santike kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: santike kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi iti vuttam
translated: But in the Commentary to the Aṅguttara Nikāya it is said that he received the full admission, took up a meditation subject in the presence of his preceptor, developed insight, and reached Arahantship.

original: So aparabhāge vimuttisukhena viharanto attano paṭipattiṃ paccavekkhitvā somanassajāto udānavasena –
analyzed: so aparabhāge vimutti sukhena viharantaḥ attanaḥ paṭipattim paccavekkhitvā somanassa jātaḥ udāna vasena
translated: Later, as he was living contentedly in the happiness of deliverance, he looked back over his own career and, filled with joy, he uttered this Solemn Utterance:🔽“I have received the full admission,

original: “Upasampadā ca me laddhā, vimutto camhi anāsavo;
analyzed: upasampadā ca me laddhā vimuttaḥ ca amhi anāsavaḥ
translated: I am liberated, without cankers;🔽I have seen the Blessed One,

original: So ca me bhagavā diṭṭho, vihāre ca sahāvasiṃ.
analyzed: saḥ ca me bhagavā diṭṭhaḥ vihāre ca saha avasim
translated: And lived with him in the life of purity.🔽“For many a night the Blessed One

original: “Bahudeva rattiṃ bhagavā, abbhokāsetināmayi;
analyzed: bahu deva rattim bhagavān
translated: Has lain out in the open air;🔽The Teacher, skilled in dwellings,

original: Vihārakusalo satthā, vihāraṃ pāvisī tadā.
analyzed: vihāra kusalaḥ satthā vihāram pāvisī tadā
translated: Has entered his abode.🔽“Spreading out his outer robe,

original: “Santharitvāna saṅghāṭiṃ, seyyaṃ kappesi gotamo;
analyzed: santharitvāna saṅghāṭim seyyam kappesi gotamaḥ
translated: The Gotama has made his bed;🔽Like a lion in his rocky cave,

original: Sīho selaguhāyaṃva, pahīnabhayabheravo.
analyzed: sīhaḥ
translated: He lies, fear and trembling past.🔽“Then a disciple of the Fully Enlightened One,

original: “Tato kalyāṇavākkaraṇo, sammāsambuddhasāvako;
analyzed: tatas kalyāṇa vāc karaṇaḥ sammāsambuddha sāvako
translated: A speaker of what is well and rightly said,

original: Soṇo abhāsi saddhammaṃ, buddhaseṭṭhassa sammukhā.
analyzed: soṇaḥ abhāsi saddhammam buddha seṭṭhassa sammukhā
translated: Soṇā spoke the True Idea in the presence of the Best of Buddhas.

original: “Pañcakkhandhe pariññāya, bhāvayitvāna añjasaṃ;
analyzed: pañcakkhandhe pariññāya bhāvayitvāna añjasam
translated: Having fully understood the five categories, and having developed the straight way,

original: Pappuyya paramaṃ santiṃ, parinibbissatyanāsavo”ti. –
analyzed: pappuyya paramam santim parinibbissati anāsavaḥ ti
translated: Having attained the supreme peace, he will attain extinction without influxes.

original: Imā pañca gāthā abhāsi.
analyzed: imā pañca gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: These five stanzas he spoke.

original: Tattha upasampadā ca me laddhāti yā sā kicchena dasavaggaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ sannipātetvā🔽attanā laddhā upasampadā. Yā ca pana varadānavasena sabbapaccantimesu janapadesu
analyzed: tattha upasampadā ca me laddhā ati yā sā kicchena dasa vaggam bhikkhu saṅgham sannipātetvā  attanā laddhā upasampadā yā ca pana vara dāna vasena sabba paccantimesu janapadesu
translated: Herein, I have received Acceptance means the Acceptance that he himself received after he had brought together with difficulty a Community of monks in a group of ten,

original: vinayadharapañcamena gaṇena satthārā anuññātā upasampadā, tadubhayaṃ sandhāyāha.
analyzed: vinaya dhara pañcamena gaṇena satthārā anuññātāḥ upasampadā tat ubhayam sandhāya āha
translated: and also the Acceptance that was allowed by the Blessed One with a group of five who were versed in the Monastic Law for the most outlying countries by way of the gift of a boon. He said ‘and’ because he was including the other boons he had received in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: Ca-saddo samuccayattho, tena itarepi satthu santikā laddhavare saṅgaṇhāti. Vimutto
analyzed: ca saddaḥ samuccaya tthaḥ tena itare pi satthu santikā laddha vare saṅgaṇhāti vimuttaḥ
translated: The word ‘and’ has the meaning of a conjunction, and so he includes the other boons he had received in the presence of the Blessed One. I am liberated,

original: camhi anāsavoti aggamaggena sakalakilesavatthuvimuttiyā vimutto ca amhi. Tato eva
analyzed: anāsavaḥ ti aggamaggena sakala kilesa vatthu vimuttiyā vimuttaḥ ca amhi tatas eva
translated: without influxes means that I am liberated by the liberation of the entire basis of defilement by means of the Noble Path. And because of that

original: kāmāsavādīhi anāsavo amhīti yojanā. So ca me bhagavā diṭṭhoti yadatthaṃ ahaṃ avantiraṭṭhato
analyzed: kāma āsava ādīhi anāsavaḥ amhi iti yojanā so ca me bhagavā diṭṭhaḥ iti yad attham aham
translated: I am without influxes of sensual desire, etc., is the construction. And I have seen that Blessed One means that for the sake of which I came from the country of Avanti

original: sāvatthiṃ gato, so ca bhagavā mayā adiṭṭhapubbo diṭṭho. Vihāre ca sahāvasinti na🔽kevalaṃ tassa bhagavato dassanameva mayā laddhaṃ, atha kho vihāre satthu gandhakuṭiyaṃ
analyzed: sāvatthim gataḥ saḥ ca bhagavā mayā a diṭṭha pubbaḥ diṭṭhaḥ vihāre ca saha avasinti na  kevalam tassa bhagavataḥ dassanam eva mayā laddham atha kho vihāre satthu gandhakuṭiyam
translated: and I went to Savatthi, and I saw the Lord, whom I had not seen before. And I dwelt together with him in the monastery.🔽Not only did I get to see the Lord, but I also dwelt together with the Lord in the monastery, in the Perfumed Chamber,

original: satthārā kāraṇaṃ sallakkhetvā vāsentena saha avasiṃ. “Vihāreti vihārasamīpe”ti keci.🔽Bahudeva rattinti paṭhamaṃ yāmaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dhammadesanāvasena kammaṭṭhānasodhanavasena🔽ca, majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ devānaṃ brahmūnañca kaṅkhacchedanavasena bhagavā bahudeva rattiṃ
analyzed: satthārā kāraṇam sallakkhetvā vāsentena saha avasim vihāreti vihāra samīpa iti keci  bahu deva paṭhamam yāmam bhikkhūnam dhamma desanā vasena kammaṭṭhāna sodhana vasena  ca majjhimam yāmam devānam brahmūnam ca kaṅkha chedana vasena bhagavā bahudeva rattim
translated: after the Lord had considered the matter and had sent for me. Some say: “In the monastery” means “near the monastery.”🔽For most of the night: in the first watch of the night the Lord spent most of the night teaching the Dhamma to the bhikkhus and clearing up their doubts, in accordance with their several dispositions, in order to develop their meditation subjects,🔽and in the middle watch of the night he cleared up the doubts of the devas and brahmas who came to see him.

original: abbhokāse atināmayi vītināmesi. Vihārakusaloti dibbabrahmaāneñjaariyavihāresu kusalo.
analyzed: abbhokāse atināmayi vītināmesi vihāra kusalo ti dibba brahma āneñja ariya vihāresu kusalaḥ
translated: Skilled in the monastery: skilled in the divine, the brahma, and the imperturbable abidings.

original: Vihāraṃ pāvisīti ativelaṃ nisajjacaṅkamehi uppannaparissamavinodanatthaṃ gandhakuṭiṃ pāvisi.
analyzed: vihāram pāvisi iti ativelam nisajja caṅkamehi uppanna parissama vinodana attham gandhakuṭim pāvisi
translated: He entered the monastery: he entered the Perfumed Chamber in order to dispel the fatigue arisen from sitting and walking for too long.

original: Santharitvāna saṅghāṭiṃ, seyyaṃ kappesīti catugguṇaṃ saṅghāṭiṃ paññāpetvā sīhaseyyaṃ
analyzed: santharitvāna saṅghāṭim seyyam kappesi iti catugguṇam saṅghāṭim paññāpetvā sīha seyyam
translated: Having folded his outer robe in four, he lay down: having arranged his outer robe folded in four, he lay down on his right side,

original: kappesi. Tenāha “gotamo sīho selaguhāyaṃva pahīnabhayabheravo”ti. Tattha gotamoti
analyzed: tena āha gotamo sīhaḥ tattha gotamo ti
translated: He lay down. Therefore it is said: “Gotama, a lion, like a lion in a rocky cave, free from fear and dread.”🔽Herein, Gotama:

original: bhagavantaṃ gottena kitteti. Sīho selaguhāyaṃvāti selassa pabbatassa guhāyaṃ. Yathā
analyzed: bhagavantam gottena kittā iti sīhaḥ sela guhāyam vā ati selassa pabbatassa guhāyam yathā
translated: he extols the Blessed One by means of his clan. A lion, like a lion in a rocky cave: in a cave in a rock. Just as

original: sīho migarājā tejussadatāya pahīnabhayabheravo dakkhiṇena passena pāde pādaṃ accādhāya🔽seyyaṃ kappesi, evaṃ cittutrāsalomahaṃsanachambhitattahetūnaṃ kilesānaṃ samucchinnattā
analyzed: sīhaḥ miga rājā tejussadatāya pahīna bhaya bheravaḥ dakkhiṇena passena pāde pādam accādhāya  sā iyyam kappesi evam cittu trāsa lomahaṃsana chambhi tatta hetūnam kilesānam samucchinna ttā
translated: a lion, king of beasts, free from fear and dread because of his great strength, lies down having placed his head on his paw,🔽so too the Blessed One, free from fear and dread because of the complete destruction of the defilements that are the cause of terror, trembling, and horripilation,

original: pahīnabhayabheravo gotamo bhagavā seyyaṃ kappesīti attho.
analyzed: pahīna bhaya bheravaḥ gotamaḥ bhagavā seyyam kappesi iti attho
translated: lay down. This is the meaning.

original: Tatoti pacchā, sīhaseyyaṃ kappetvā tato vuṭṭhahitvā “paṭibhātu taṃ bhikkhu dhammo🔽bhāsitu”nti satthārā ajjhesitoti attho. Kalyāṇavākkaraṇoti sundaravacīkaraṇo, lakkhaṇasampannavacanakkamoti
analyzed: tato ti pacchā sīha seyyam kappetvā tatas vuṭṭhahitvā paṭibhātu tam bhikkhu dhammo  bhāsitunti satthārā ajjhesito ti attho kalyāṇa vāc karaṇaḥ iti sundara vacī karaṇaḥ lakkhaṇa sampanna vacana kkamo ti
translated: After that: afterwards, after he had lain down in the lion’s posture and had got up, “May the Dhamma appear to you, bhikkhu,🔽and may you speak the Dhamma.” The meaning is: he was invited by the Teacher. A good speaker: one who speaks well, one who has a sequence of speech endowed with the characteristics of beauty;

original: attho. Soṇo abhāsi saddhammanti soḷasa aṭṭhakavaggiyasuttāni soṇo kuṭikaṇṇo, buddhaseṭṭhassa
analyzed: soṇaḥ abhāsi saddhammanti soḷasa aṭṭhaka vaggiya suttāni soṇo kuṭikaṇṇaḥ buddha seṭṭhassa
translated: this is the meaning. Soṇa spoke the true Dhamma: Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa spoke the sixteen suttas of the Aṭṭhakavagga. To the best of Buddhas,

original: sammāsambuddhassa sammukhā, paccakkhato abhāsīti thero attānameva paraṃ viya avoca.
analyzed: sammāsambuddhassa sammukhā paccakkhataḥ abhāsi iti theraḥ attānam eva param viya avoca
translated: The Elder said, “Face to face with the Fully Enlightened One,” etc., as if he were speaking of another.

original: Pañcakkhandhe pariññāyāti pañcupādānakkhandhe tīhipi pariññāhi parijānitvā te parijānantoyeva,
analyzed: pañca kkhandhe pariññāya ati pañca upādāna kkhandhe tīhi pi pariññāhi parijānitvā te parijānantaḥ yeva
translated: Having fully understood the five aggregates: having fully understood the five aggregates as objects of clinging by means of the three kinds of full understanding.

original: añjasaṃ ariyaṃ aṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ bhāvayitvā, paramaṃ santiṃ nibbānaṃ pappuyya pāpuṇitvā
analyzed: añjasam ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam bhāvayitvā paramam santim nibbānam pappuyya pāpuṇitvā
translated: Having developed the straight path of the Noble Eightfold Path, he attained the supreme peace, Nibbāna.

original: ṭhito anāsavo. Tato eva idāni parinibbissati anupādisesanibbānavasena nibbāyissatīti.
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ anāsavaḥ tatas eva idāni parinibbissati anupādisesa nibbāna vasena nibbāyissati iti
translated: He stands, free from cankers, and now will attain final Nibbāna by way of the Nibbāna element without residue remaining.

original: Soṇakuṭikaṇṇattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: soṇakuṭikaṇṇa thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Sonakuṭikaṇṇa is finished.

original: 12. Kosiyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: kosiya thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Kosiya

original: Yo eva garūnantiādikā āyasmato kosiyattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu🔽katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ kusalaṃ upacinanto vipassissa bhagavato
analyzed: yaḥ eva garu nanti ādikā āyasmataḥ kosiya ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu  kata adhikāro tattha tattha bhave vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusalam upacinantaḥ vipassissa bhagavato
translated: The elder Kosiya’s verses beginning with the words, “Having cast off the heavy burden” . Where did they originate? This elder too, having formed his aspiration in the presence of former Buddhas,🔽accumulated merit and knowledge in various births, and obtained the conditions for enlightenment,

original: kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ disvā pasannacitto
analyzed: kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññutam pattaḥ eka divasam satthāram disvā pasanna citto
translated: was reborn in a good family in the dispensation of the Buddha Vipassi. When he reached maturity, he saw the Teacher one day and became filled with joy.

original: ucchukhaṇḍikaṃ adāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde
analyzed: ucchukhaṇḍikam adāsi saḥ tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde
translated: and gave him a lump of salt. By that root of merit, passing away from there, he was reborn in the world of the gods and among people.🔽In this generation of the Buddha,

translated: and is still and unruffled, so he is unshaken by the defilement-winds and the winds of the doctrines of the sectarians, and therefore he stands firm and is still and unruffled.

original: paṭivijjhanena gambhīrapañño nipuṇatthadassī. Asaṃhāriyo nāma ca hoti paṇḍito so

translated: He is “one of deep understanding, a seer of the meaning of what is profound,” because he penetrates the profound meaning of dependent origination, etc., which is hard to fathom for those who have not acquired the equipment for knowledge. He is called “invincible” and “wise”

original: tādiso puggalo kilesehi devaputtamārādīsu vā kenaci asaṃhāriyatāya asaṃhāriyo nāma
analyzed: tādisaḥ puggalaḥ kilesehi deva putta māra ādīsu vā kenaci asaṃhāriya tāya asaṃhāriyaḥ nāma
translated: Such a person is called “invincible” because he is not overcome by defilements or by anyone such as the deva-sons.

original: hoti, yathāvuttena atthena paṇḍito ca nāma hoti. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: hoti yathā vuttena atthena paṇḍito ca nāma hoti sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: And he is called “wise” in the sense stated. The rest is as already stated.

analyzed: bahussuto ti pariyatti bāhu sacca vasena bahussutaḥ sutta geyya ādi bahum sutam etassa iti  bahussutaḥ tam eva dhammam suvaṇṇa bhājane pakkhitta sīha vasam viya a vinassantam eva  dhāreti iti dhamma dharo ca hoti dhammassa hoti anudhamma cārī iti yathā sutassa yathā pariyattassa
translated: He is learned: he is learned in the sense of having much learning in the scriptures. He has heard much, he has learned much, the Dhamma and Discipline has been taught to him in detail and well taught,🔽and he bears it in mind thus: “This is the Dhamma and this is the Discipline.” He is a bearer of the Dhamma in the sense that he bears in mind the Dhamma and Discipline as he has heard it and learned it, without letting it slip from his memory.

original: dhammassa atthamaññāya dhammamaññāya navalokuttaradhammassa anurūpaṃ dhammaṃ pubbabhāgapaṭipadāsaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: dhammassa attha maññāya dhamma maññāya nava lokuttara dhammassa anurūpam dhammam pubbabhāga paṭipadā saṅkhātam
translated: He is a follower of the Dhamma in that he conducts himself by the Dhamma of the nine supramundane states as he has heard and learned it,

original: catupārisuddhisīladhutaṅgaasubhakammaṭṭhānādibhedaṃ carati paṭipajjatīti anudhammacārī
analyzed: catu pāri suddhi sīla dhutaṅga asubha kammaṭṭhāna ādi bhedam carati paṭipajjati iti anudhammacārī
translated: and he practices the Dhamma in the sense of the practice of virtue consisting in the four abstinences and the ascetic practices, the meditation subject of foulness, and so on, which are called the “preliminary work.”

original: hoti, “ajja ajjevā”ti paṭivedhaṃ ākaṅkhanto vicarati. So tādiso nāma ca hoti paṇḍitoti
analyzed: hoti ajja ajja iva ati paṭivedham ākaṅkhantaḥ vicarati saḥ tādisaḥ nāma ca hoti paṇḍita uti
translated: He is called “wise” in that he is such a one who conducts himself and practices the Dhamma, and he is called “invincible” in that he is such a one who is learned and a bearer of the Dhamma.

original: yo puggalo yaṃ garuṃ nissāya bahussuto dhammadharo dhammassa ca anudhammacārī hoti.
analyzed: yaḥ puggalaḥ yam garum nissāya bahu ssutaḥ dhamma dharaḥ dhammassa ca anudhamma cārī hoti
translated: The person who, in dependence on the elder, becomes learned, a dhamma-bearer, and a practitioner of the dhamma in accordance with the dhamma.

original: So ca tādiso tena garunā sadiso paṇḍito nāma hoti paṭipattiyā sadisabhāvato. Tathābhūto
analyzed: saḥ ca tādisaḥ tena garunā sadisaḥ paṇḍitaḥ nāma hoti paṭipattiyā sadisa bhāvato tathābhūto
translated: And that kind of person is called wise because of being similar to the elder by way of similarity in practice.

original: pana so ñatvā ca dhammesu visesi assa, taṃ vuttatthaṃva.
analyzed: pana saḥ ñatvā ca dhammesu assa tam vutta ttham va
translated: But he, being such, would be distinguished in knowing the dhammas, and that is the meaning of the verse.

original: Atthañca yo jānāti bhāsitassāti yo puggalo sammāsambuddhena bhāsitassa pariyattidhammassa
analyzed: attham ca yaḥ jānāti bhāsitassa ati yaḥ puggalaḥ sammāsambuddhena bhāsitassa pariyatti dhammassa
translated: And he who knows the meaning of what is said: the person who knows the meaning of the Dhamma in the scriptures said by the Fully Enlightened One.

original: atthaṃ jānāti. Jānanto pana “idha sīlaṃ vuttaṃ, idha samādhi, idha paññā”ti tattha
analyzed: attham jānāti jānantaḥ pana idha sīlam vuttam idha samādhi idha paññā ti tattha
translated: Knowing, he knows the meaning of what is said here in the Dhamma, and there in the Vinaya, and there in the Abhidhamma, and he knows the meaning of what is said here in the Suttas, and there in the Verses, and there in the Analyses, and there in the Expositions, and there in the Discourses, and there in the Birth Stories, and there in the Marvels, and there in the Discourses on Body and Deportment, and there in the Miscellany.

original: tattha yathāvuttaṃ atthañca ñatvāna tathā karoti yathā satthārā anusiṭṭhaṃ, tathā🔽paṭipajjati. Atthantaro nāma sa hoti paṇḍitoti so evarūpo puggalo atthantaro atthakāraṇā
analyzed: tattha yathāvuttam atthañca ñatvāna tathā karoti yathā satthārā anusiṭṭham tathā  paṭipajjati atthantaraḥ nāma sa hoti paṇḍitaḥ iti saḥ evarūpaḥ puggalo atthantaraḥ attha kāraṇā
translated: Having known the meaning of what is said here in the Dhamma, and there in the Vinaya, and there in the Abhidhamma, and having known the meaning of what is said here in the Suttas, and there in the Verses, and there in the Analyses, and there in the Expositions, and there in the Discourses, and there in the Birth Stories, and there in the Marvels, and there in the Discourses on Body and Deportment, and there in the Miscellany, he does as he is advised by the Teacher, he practices as he is advised.

original: sīlādiatthajānanamattameva upanissayaṃ katvā paṇḍito hoti. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.
analyzed: sīla ādi attha jānana mattam eva upanissayam katvā paṇḍitaḥ hoti sesam vutta nayam eva
translated: He is called wise because of the meaning, because of the reason, because of the cause, because of the condition, because of the source, because of the origin, because of the guide, because of the forerunner, because of the forerunner of the path, because of the path, because of the track, because of the track of the path, because of the way, because of the way of practice, because of the practice, because of the practice of the path, because of the practice of the way, because of the practice of the way of practice, because of the practice of the track of the path, because of the practice of the path, because of the practice of the way, because of the practice of the way of practice, because of the practice of the track of the path, because of the practice of the path

original: Ettha ca paṭhamagāthāya “yo ve garūna”ntiādinā saddhūpanissayo visesabhāvo vutto,🔽dutiyagāthāya “yaṃ āpadā”ti ādinā vīriyūpanissayo, tatiyagāthāya “yo ve samuddova
analyzed: ettha ca paṭhama gāthāya saddhu upanissayaḥ visesa bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ  dutiya gāthāya yam āpadā ti ādinā vīriya upanissayaḥ tatiya gāthāya yaḥ samuddaḥ uva
translated: And here, in the first stanza, the special quality of the support of faith is stated with the words “Who reveres his elders”;

original: ṭhito”tiādinā samādhūpanissayo, catutthagāthāya “bahussuto”tiādinā satūpanissayo,
analyzed: ṭhitaḥ iti ādinā catuttha gāthāya bahussuto ti ādinā satu upanissayo

original: pañcamagāthāya “atthañca yo jānātī”tiādinā paññūpanissayo visesabhāvo vuttoti veditabbo.

original: Kosiyattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.

translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Kosiya is finished.

original: Pañcakanipātavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: pañcaka nipāta vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Pañcakanipāta is finished.

original: 6. Chakkanipāto

translated: The Elder Uruvelakassapa’s Verses

analyzed: kusalam upacinantaḥ padumuttarassa bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā vaya ppatto

analyzed: padumuttaraḥ nāma jinaḥ
translated: “The Victor named Padumuttara, the sage who knew all in the world,

translated: “Thus it was free of trouble, empty of ascetics,

translated: But filled with arahants, with those who had attained mastery, with those who were calm.

original: “Ratanānaṭṭhapaññāsaṃ, uggato so mahāmuni;
analyzed: uggataḥ saḥ mahā muni
translated: “The great sage arose with 55 treasures,

original: Kañcanagghiyasaṅkāso, bāttiṃsavaralakkhaṇo.
analyzed: kañcana ghiya saṅkāsaḥ
translated: Shining like a golden lamp, with 32 excellent marks.

original: “Vassasatasahassāni, āyu vijjati tāvade;
analyzed: vassa sata sahassāni āyu vijjati tāvade
translated: “His lifespan was 100,000 years,

original: Tāvatā tiṭṭhamāno so, tāresi janataṃ bahuṃ.
analyzed: tāvatā tiṭṭhamānaḥ saḥ tāresi janatam bahum
translated: and for that long he remained, saving many people.

analyzed: tadā aham haṃsavatiyā brāhmaṇaḥ sādhu sammataḥ
translated: “At that time, in the city of Haṃsavatī, I was a brahmin well-regarded.

original: Upecca lokapajjotaṃ, assosiṃ dhammadesanaṃ.
analyzed: upecca loka pajjotam assosim dhamma desanaṃ
translated: Approaching the light of the world, I listened to the teaching of the Dhamma.

original: “Tadā mahāparisatiṃ, mahāparisasāvakaṃ;
analyzed: tadā mahā parisatim mahā parisasāvakam
translated: “At that time, in the great assembly, in the great assembly of disciples,

original: Ṭhapentaṃ etadaggamhi, sutvāna mudito ahaṃ.
analyzed: ṭhapentam sutvāna muditaḥ aham
translated: I heard him place this foremost, and was delighted.

original: “Mahatā parivārena, nimantetvā mahājinaṃ;
analyzed: mahatā parivārena nimantetvā mahā ajinam
translated: “With a great retinue, I invited the Great Victor,

original: Brāhmaṇānaṃ sahassena, sahadānamadāsahaṃ.
analyzed: brāhmaṇānam sahassena saha dānam adāsaham
translated: And together with a thousand Brahmins, I gave a great gift.

original: “Mahādānaṃ daditvāna, abhivādiya nāyakaṃ;
analyzed: mahā dānam daditvāna nāyakam
translated: “Having given the great gift, and having paid homage to the Leader,

analyzed: eka mantam ṭhitaḥ haṭṭhaḥ idam vacanam abravim
translated: Standing to one side, delighted, I spoke this statement:

analyzed: tayi saddhāya me vīra adhikāra guṇena ca
translated: “In you, Hero, I have faith, and because of the quality of service,

analyzed: parisā mahatī hotu nibbattassa tahim tahim

translated: “Then the Teacher, with the sweet sound of a trumpeting elephant, spoke to the assembly:

analyzed: satthā etam passatha brāhmaṇam
translated: ‘Look at this Brahmin, who has the voice of a cuckoo bird.

analyzed: hema vaṇṇam mahā bāhum kamala ānana locanam
translated: “‘He is golden-colored, with long arms, a lotus-like face and eyes,

analyzed: udagga tanujam haṭṭham saddhavantam guṇe mama
translated: Delighted, full of faith in my qualities, and of noble birth.’

analyzed: esa patthayate ṭhānam sīhaghosassa bhikkhuno
translated: “‘He aspires to the position of the monk Sihaghosa,

original: Anāgatamhi addhāne, lacchase taṃ manorathaṃ.
analyzed: anāgatamhi lacchase tam manoratham
translated: In the future, may his wish be fulfilled.’

original: “Satasahassito kappe, okkākakulasambhavo;
analyzed: sata sahassitaḥ kappe okkāka kula sambhavaḥ
translated: “‘After a hundred thousand eons, one born in the Okkāka family,

analyzed: gotamaḥ nāma gottena satthā loke bhavissati
translated: Will be a teacher in the world, named Gotama by clan.

original: “Tassa dhammesu dāyādo, oraso dhammanimmito;
analyzed: tassa dhammesu dāyādaḥ orasaḥ dhamma nimmito
translated: “‘He will be an heir to his teachings, born from his very own Dhamma,

analyzed: kassapaḥ nāma gottena hessati satthu sāvakaḥ
translated: He will be a disciple of the Teacher, and his name will be Kassapa.

analyzed: itas dvenavute kappe ahu satthā anuttaraḥ
translated: “Two times nine hundred and twenty eons ago there was a peerless Teacher,

translated: A matchless, incomparable Buddha, Phussa, the Leader of the world.

translated: “Having destroyed all darkness, having disentangled the great tangle,

translated: He rained down the rain of the Deathless, satisfying the world and the devas.

translated: “We were heroes, handsome and strong, invincible in battle.

translated: Thus did he speak to us.

original: “Tato mayaṃ avocumha, yadi deyyāsi nāyakaṃ;

translated: “Then we said, ‘If you will give us a leader,

analyzed: upaṭṭhānāya amhākam sādhayissāma vaḥ tatas
translated: we will serve him and accomplish your purpose.’

analyzed: tatas mayam laddha varā bhūmipālena pesitā
translated: “Then we, having received the boon, were sent by the lord of the earth

translated: to the border region, where the weapons had been laid down, and we returned again.

analyzed: yācitvā satthu paṭṭhānam rājānam loka nāyakam
translated: “Having asked the Teacher, the King, the Leader of the World,

analyzed: muni vīram yāvajīvam yajimha tam

original: Yasmā panāyaṃ thero ariyamaggena rāgādayo samūhanantoyeva chaḷabhiñño ahosi, tasmā🔽taṃ attano chaḷabhiññabhāvaṃ dassento “pubbenivāsaṃ jānāmī”tiādimāha. Tattha pubbenivāsaṃ🔽jānāmīti attano paresañca pubbenivāsaṃ atītāsu jātīsu nibbattakkhandhe khandhapaṭibaddhe
analyzed: yasmai pana ayam theraḥ ariya maggena rāga ādayo chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi tasmai  tam attanaḥ chaḷabhiñña bhāvam dassento pubbenivāsam jānāmi iti ādim āha tattha pubbenivāsam  jānāmi iti attanaḥ paresam ca pubbenivāsam atītāsu jātīsu nibbatta khandhe khandha paṭibaddhe
translated: But since this elder became one possessing the six kinds of direct knowledge by eradicating greed, etc., with the noble path,🔽he said, “I know the past,” etc., in order to show that he possessed the six kinds of direct knowledge. Herein, I know the past: I know by direct knowledge, I awaken to, the past, the aggregates that arose in past births, and the past that is bound up with the aggregates,

original: ca pubbenivāsañāṇena hatthatale āmalakaṃ viya paccakkhato jānāmi bujjhāmi. Dibbacakkhu
analyzed: ca pubbenivāsa ñāṇena hattha tale āmalakam viya paccakkhataḥ jānāmi bujjhāmi dibba cakkhu
translated: like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand, by means of the knowledge of the past.🔽Divine eye

original: visodhitanti dibbacakkhuñāṇaṃ visodhitaṃ, pakaticakkhunā āpāthagataṃ pakatirūpaṃ
analyzed: visodhitanti dibba cakkhu ñāṇam visodhitam pakati cakkhunā āpātha gatam pakati rūpam
translated: “Purified” means that the knowledge of the divine eye is purified, and the visible form that comes within the range of the natural eye is natural form.

original: viya dibbaṃ mānusampi dūraṃ tiroṭṭhitaṃ atisukhumañca rūpaṃ vibhāvetuṃ samatthañāṇaṃ
analyzed: viya dibbam mānusam pi dūram tiroṭṭhitam ati sukhumam ca rūpam vibhāvetum samattha ñāṇam
translated: Purified: the knowledge of the divine eye is purified, and it is able to reveal divine and human forms, even though they be far away, even though they be hidden, even though they be subtle, in the same way that ordinary forms come within the range of the physical eye.🔽I have attained it by developing it, by purifying it.

original: bhāvanāya mayā visuddhaṃ katvā paṭiladdhanti attho. Iddhimāti adhiṭṭhāniddhivikubbaniddhiādīhi🔽iddhīhi iddhimā, iddhividhañāṇalābhīti attho. Sarāgādibhedassa paresaṃ cittassa jānanato
analyzed: bhāvanāya mayā visuddham katvā paṭiladdhanti atthaḥ iddhimā ati adhiṭṭhāniddhi vikubbaniddhi ādīhi  iddhīhi iddhimā iddhividha ñāṇa lābhī iti attho sa rāga ādi bhedassa paresam cittassa jānanato
translated: Possessed of supernormal power: one who has attained the various kinds of supernormal power, such as the supernormal power of resolve, the supernormal power of transformation, etc., is “possessed of supernormal power.”🔽The meaning is that he has attained the knowledge of supernormal power.🔽Knowing the minds of others: one who knows the minds of others, which are of various kinds as being associated with lust, etc., is “one who knows the minds of others.” The meaning is that he has attained the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: paracittaññū, cetopariyañāṇalābhīti vuttaṃ hoti. Dibbasotañca pāpuṇinti dibbasotañāṇañca paṭilabhiṃ.
analyzed: para citta ññū cetaḥ pariya ñāṇa lābhī iti vuttam hoti dibba sotam ca pāpuṇinti dibba sota ñāṇam ca paṭilabhin
translated: And the divine ear: and I have attained the knowledge of the divine ear.

original: So me attho anuppatto, sabbasaṃyojanakkhayoti yo sabbesaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ khayabhūto
analyzed: saḥ me atthaḥ anuppattaḥ sabba saṃyojana khayaḥ ti yaḥ sabbesam saṃyojanānam khaya bhūtaḥ
translated: That goal has now been reached by me, the destruction of all fetters: the goal that is the state of destruction of all the fetters,

original: khayena vā laddhabbo, so sadattho paramattho ca mayā ariyamaggādhigamena adhigatoti.
analyzed: khayena vā laddhabbo so sadattho paramattho ca mayā ariya magga adhigamena adhigataḥ ti
translated: or that is to be attained by the state of destruction, that highest goal, that good goal, has been reached by me through the attainment of the noble path.

original: Evametāya gāthāya therassa aññābyākaraṇaṃ ahosīti veditabbo.
analyzed: evam etāya gāthāya therassa aññā byākaraṇam ahosi iti veditabbo
translated: This is how it should be understood that the Elder’s declaration of his enlightenment referred to this stanza.

original: Uruvelakassapattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: uruvelakassapa thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Uruvelakassapa is finished.

original: 2. Tekicchakārittheragāthāvaṇṇanā🔽Atihitā vīhītiādikā āyasmato tekicchakārittherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu🔽katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto ito ekanavute kappe vipassissa🔽bhagavato kāle kulagehe nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patvā vejjasatthe nipphattiṃ gato. Vipassissa
analyzed: tekicchakāritthera gāthā vaṇṇanā  atihitā vīhi iti ādikā āyasmataḥ tekicchakāri ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu  kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ itas ekanavute kappe vipassissa  bhagavato kāle kula gehe nibbattitvā viññu tam patvā vejjasatthe nipphattim gataḥ vipassissa
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Tekicchakāri🔽The Elder Tekicchakāri’s verses beginning with “The rice was stored in the granary” . Where was the origin of these verses? He too had performed meritorious deeds under former Buddhas and had accumulated merit in various existences. Ninety-one aeons ago, in the dispensation of the Blessed One Vipassī,

original: bhagavato upaṭṭhākaṃ asokaṃ nāma theraṃ byādhitaṃ arogamakāsi, aññesañca sattānaṃ
analyzed: bhagavato upaṭṭhākam asokam nāma theram byādhitam arogam akāsi aññesam ca sattānam
translated: he was reborn in a good family. Having reached maturity, he became a physician. He cured the Elder Asokadhamma, the attendant of the Blessed One Vipassī,

original: rogābhibhūtānaṃ anukampāya bhesajjaṃ saṃvidahi.🔽So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde subuddhassa nāma
analyzed: roga abhibhūtānam anukampāya bhesajjam  so tena puñña kammena deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde subuddhassa nāma
translated: and out of compassion for other beings afflicted with disease he prepared medicine for them.

original: brāhmaṇassa putto hutvā nibbatti. Tassa tikicchakehi gabbhakāle parissayaṃ apaharitvā
analyzed: brāhmaṇassa puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti tassa tikicchakehi gabbha kāle parissayam apaharitvā
translated: As a result of that meritorious deed, he wandered on from existence to existence in the heavenly world and the human world. In this Buddha-dispensation he was reborn as the son of a brahmin named Subuddha. Because of the treatment given to him by physicians during his pregnancy,

original: paripālitatāya tekicchakārīti nāmaṃ akaṃsu. So attano kulānurūpāni vijjāṭṭhānāni
analyzed: paripālita tāya tekicchakārī iti nāmam akaṃsu saḥ attanaḥ kula anurūpāni vijjāṭṭhānāni
translated: and because he was well protected, they gave him the name Tekicchakārī. He was growing up, learning the arts and sciences suitable for his family.

original: sippāni ca sikkhanto vaḍḍhati. Tadā cāṇakko subuddhassa paññāveyyattiyaṃ kiriyāsu
analyzed: sippāni ca sikkhantaḥ vaḍḍhati tadā cāṇakkaḥ subuddhassa paññāveyyattiyam kiriyāsu
translated: At that time Cāṇakya, seeing the extent of Subuddha’s wisdom and his skill in action,

original: upāyakosallañca disvā, “ayaṃ imasmiṃ rājakule patiṭṭhaṃ labhanto maṃ abhibhaveyyā”ti
analyzed: upāya kosallam ca disvā ayam imasmin rājakule patiṭṭham labhantaḥ mama abhibhaveyya iti
translated: thought: “If he gains a position in this royal family, he will surpass me.”

original: issāpakato raññā candaguttena taṃ bandhanāgāre khipāpesi. Tekicchakārī pitu bandhanāgārappavesanaṃ
analyzed: issāpakato raññā candaguttena tam bandhanāgāre khipāpesi tekiccha kārī pitu bandhanāgāra ppavesanam
translated: Out of jealousy, he had him thrown into prison by King Candagutta. Tekicchakārī, hearing of his father’s imprisonment,

original: sutvā bhīto palāyitvā sāṇavāsittherassa santikaṃ gantvā attano saṃvegakāraṇaṃ therassa
analyzed: sutvā bhītaḥ palāyitvā sāṇavāsi therassa santikam gantvā attano saṃvega kāraṇam therassa
translated: was frightened and fled to the Elder Sāṇavāsī, told him the reason for his distress,

original: kathetvā pabbajitvā kammaṭṭhānaṃ gahetvā abbhokāsiko nesajjiko ca hutvā viharati,
analyzed: kathetvā pabbajitvā kammaṭṭhānam gahetvā abbhokāsikaḥ nesajjikaḥ ca hutvā viharati
translated: and went forth. He took a meditation subject and lived in the open air, never lying down.

original: sītuṇhaṃ agaṇento samaṇadhammameva karoti, visesato brahmavihārabhāvanamanuyuñjati.
analyzed: a gaṇentaḥ samaṇa dhammam eva karoti visesataḥ brahmavihāra bhāvanam anuyuñjati
translated: He did not consider cold or heat, but only practiced the ascetic practices, and in particular he devoted himself to the development of the divine abodes.

original: Taṃ disvā māro pāpimā “na imassa mama visayaṃ atikkamituṃ dassāmī”ti vikkhepaṃ kātukāmo
analyzed: tam disvā māraḥ pāpimā na imassa mama visayam atikkamitum dassāmi iti vikkhepam kātu kāmo
translated: Seeing this, Māra thought: “I will not allow him to escape from my domain.” Wishing to cause him distraction,🔽he went to the king and said:

original: sassānaṃ nipphattikāle khettagopakavaṇṇena therassa santikaṃ gantvā taṃ nippaṇḍento –
analyzed: sassānam nipphatti kāle khetta gopaka vaṇṇena therassa santikam gantvā tam nippaṇḍentaḥ
translated: At the time of the harvest, Māra went to the Elder in the guise of a farmer, and, in order to confuse him, said:

original: “Atihitā vīhi, khalagatā sālī;
analyzed: atihitā vīhi khala gatā sālī
translated: “The rice is ripe, the fields are full,🔽But I cannot get a morsel. What shall I do?”

original: Na ca labhe piṇḍaṃ, kathamahaṃ kassa”nti. – āha; Taṃ sutvā thero –
analyzed: na ca labhe piṇḍam katham aham āha tam sutvā theraḥ
translated: When the Elder heard this, he said:

original: “Buddhamappameyyaṃ anussara pasanno, pītiyā phuṭasarīro hohisi satatamudaggo.
analyzed: buddham appameyyam anussara pasannaḥ pītiyā phuṭa sarīraḥ hohisi satatam udaggaḥ
translated: “Remember the Buddha’s immeasurable qualities, and be filled with joy. Let your body be suffused with happiness. Always be on the alert.

original: “Dhammamappameyyaṃ …pe… satatamudaggo.
analyzed: dhammam appameyyam pe satatam udaggaḥ
translated: “Remember the Dhamma’s immeasurable qualities …🔽“Remember the Sangha’s immeasurable qualities … Always be on the alert.”

original: “Saṅghamappameyyaṃ…pe… satatamudaggo”ti. – āha; Taṃ sutvā māro –
analyzed: saṅgham appameyyam pe satatam udaggaḥ iti āha tam sutvā māraḥ
translated: When Māra heard this, he said:

original: “Abbhokāse viharasi, sītā hemantikā imā ratyo;
analyzed: abbhokāse viharasi sītā hemantikāḥ imāḥ ratyo
translated: “You live in the open air. These are cold winter nights.

original: Mā sītena pareto vihaññittho, pavisa tvaṃ vihāraṃ phusitaggaḷa”nti. –
analyzed: mā sītena paretaḥ vihaññitthaḥ pavisa tvam vihāram
translated: Do not let the cold torment you. Go inside and shut the door.”

original: Āha. Atha thero –
analyzed: āha atha theraḥ
translated: The Elder replied:

original: “Phusissaṃ catasso appamaññāyo, tāhi ca sukhito viharissaṃ;
analyzed: phusissam catassaḥ appamaññāyo tāhi ca sukhitaḥ viharissam
translated: “I will keep the four immeasurable states. I will live happily in them.

original: Nāhaṃ sītena vihaññissaṃ, aniñjito viharanto”ti. – āha;
analyzed: na aham sītena vihaññissam an iñjitaḥ viharantaḥ iti āha
translated: I will not be tormented by the cold. I will live unperturbed.”

original: Tattha atihitā vīhīti vīhayo koṭṭhāgāraṃ atinetvā ṭhapitā, tattha paṭisāmitā khalato
analyzed: tattha atihitā vīhi iti vīhayaḥ koṭṭhāgāram atinetvā ṭhapitā tattha paṭisāmitā khalato
translated: Herein, the rice is stored in the granary after being threshed, and the seed-corn is stored in the house after being winnowed.

original: vā gharaṃ upanītāti attho. Vīhiggahaṇena cettha itarampi dhaññaṃ saṅgaṇhāti. Sālī
analyzed: vā gharam upanītā ati atthaḥ vīhi ggahaṇena ca ittha itaram pi dhaññam saṅgaṇhāti sālī
translated: The word “winnowed” means “brought to the house.” And by the word “rice” here all kinds of grain are included.

original: pana yebhuyyena vīhito pacchā paccantīti āha. Khalagatā sālīti khalaṃ dhaññakaraṇaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: pana yebhuyyena vīhito pacchā paccanti iti āha khala gatā sālī iti khalam dhañña karaṇa ṭṭhānam
translated: But the rice is mostly cooked after the other kinds of grain.

original: gatā, tattha rāsivasena maddanacāvanādivasena ṭhitāti attho. Padhānadhaññabhāvadassanatthañcettha
analyzed: gatā tattha rāsi vasena maddana cāvana ādi vasena ṭhitā ati attho padhāna dhañña bhāva dassana ttham ca ittha
translated: The word “winnowed” means “gone to the winnowing basket,” that is, it is stored there after being winnowed and cleaned.🔽The word “rice” is used separately in order to show that it is the principal kind of grain.

original: sālīnaṃ visuṃ gahaṇaṃ, ubhayenapi gāme, gāmato bahi ca dhaññaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ ṭhitanti
analyzed: sālīnam visum gahaṇam ubhayena api gāme gāmataḥ bahi ca dhaññam paripuṇṇam ṭhitanti
translated: Both kinds are stored in the village and outside the village.

original: dasseti. Na ca labhe piṇḍanti evaṃ sulabhadhaññe subhikkhakāle ahaṃ piṇḍamattampi
analyzed: dasseti na ca labhe piṇḍanti evam sulabha dhaññe subhikkha kāle aham piṇḍa mattam pi
translated: I do not get even alms-food: in this time of plenty when grain is so abundant, I do not get even alms-food.

original: na labhāmi. Idāni kathamahaṃ kassanti ahaṃ kathaṃ karissāmi, kathaṃ jīvissāmīti parihāsakeḷiṃ akāsi.
analyzed: na labhāmi idāni katham aham kassanti aham katham karissāmi katham jīvissāmi iti parihāsa keḷim akāsi
translated: Now what shall I do? What shall I do? is a contemptuous taunt: “Now what shall I do? How shall I manage? How shall I live?”

original: Taṃ sutvā thero “ayaṃ varāko attanā attano pavattiṃ mayhaṃ pakāsesi, mayā pana attanāva🔽attā ovaditabbo, na mayā kiñci kathetabba”nti vatthuttayānussatiyaṃ attānaṃ niyojento
analyzed: tam sutvā theraḥ ayam varākaḥ attanā attano pavattim mayham pakāsesi mayā pana  attā ovaditabbaḥ na mayā kiñci kathetabban ti vatthuttayā anussatiyam attānam niyojento
translated: After hearing this, the Elder thought: “This wretched man has told me his own story. But I must admonish myself. I must not say anything.” And he admonished himself by reciting the three stanzas beginning with the words, “The Buddha is immeasurable.”

original: “buddhamappameyya”ntiādinā tisso gāthā abhāsi. Tattha buddhamappameyyaṃ anussara
analyzed: buddham appameyya nti ādinā tissaḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi tattha buddham appameyyam anussara
translated: Herein, recollecting the Buddha’s immeasurableness,

original: pasannoti savāsanāya avijjāniddāya accantavigamena, buddhiyā ca vikasitabhāvena buddhaṃ
analyzed: pasannaḥ ti sa vāsanāya avijjā niddāya accanta vigamena buddhiyā ca vikasita bhāvena buddham
translated: “Believing,” with the complete disappearance of the sleep of ignorance together with its latent tendencies, and with the blossoming of understanding,

original: bhagavantaṃ pamāṇakarānaṃ rāgādikilesānaṃ abhāvā aparimāṇaguṇasamaṅgitāya appameyyapuññakkhettatāya🔽ca appameyyaṃ. Okappanalakkhaṇena abhippasādena pasanno, pasannamānaso “itipi so
analyzed: bhagavantam pamāṇa karānam rāga ādi kilesānam abhāvāḥ aparimāṇa guṇa samaṅgi tāya appameyya puñña khetta tāya  ca appameyyam okappana lakkhaṇena abhippasādena pasannaḥ pasanna mānasaḥ iti pi so
translated: “the Buddha,” the Blessed One, is immeasurable because of the absence of the defilements such as lust, etc., which are the measurers, and because of his being endowed with immeasurable special qualities and being a field of merit immeasurable in the results of merit.

original: bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho”tiādinā anussara anu anu buddhārammaṇaṃ satiṃ pavattehi,
analyzed: bhagavā araham sammāsambuddhaḥ iti ādinā anussara anu anu buddha ārammaṇam satim pavattehi
translated: He is “believing” with the faith characterized by the act of believing, with a believing mind. “Recollecting” means causing to come again and again to the mind, bringing to mind again and again, by recollecting thus: “He is such and such, the Blessed One, the Arahant, the Perfectly Enlightened One.”

original: pītiyā phuṭasarīro hohisi. Satatamudaggoti anussarantova pharaṇalakkhaṇāya pītiyā
analyzed: pītiyā phuṭa sarīraḥ hohisi satatam udaggaḥ ti anussarantaḥ uva pharaṇa lakkhaṇāya pītiyā
translated: “Your body will be suffused with joy,” you will be suffused with the happiness characterized by the act of diffusing.🔽“Always mindful,” recollecting thus,

original: satataṃ sabbadā phuṭasarīro pītisamuṭṭhānapaṇītarūpehi ajjhotthaṭasarīro ubbegapītiyā🔽udaggo kāyaṃ udaggaṃ katvā ākāsaṃ laṅghituṃ samattho ca bhaveyyāsi, buddhānussatiyā🔽buddhārammaṇaṃ uḷāraṃ pītisomanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeyyāsi. Yato sītuṇhehi viya jighacchāpipāsāhipi
analyzed: satatam sabbadā phuṭa sarīraḥ pīti samuṭṭhāna paṇīta rūpehi ajjhotthaṭa sarīraḥ ubbega pītiyā  udaggaḥ kāyam udaggam katvā ākāsam laṅghitum samatthaḥ ca bhaveyyāsi buddha anussatiyā  buddha ārammaṇam uḷāram pīti somanassam paṭisaṃvedeyyāsi yatas sītuṇhehi viya jighacchā pipāsāhi pi
translated: His body would be constantly and always pervaded by pleasant, exalted, and sublime happiness born of rapture, and he would be able to leap up into the air.🔽If you recollect the Buddha, you will experience exalted joy and happiness with the Buddha as your object.

original: anabhibhūto hohisīti attho.
analyzed: an abhibhūtaḥ hohisi iti
translated: The meaning is that you will not be overcome by cold, heat, hunger, thirst, etc., as if by enemies.

original: Dhammanti ariyaṃ lokuttaradhammaṃ. Saṅghanti ariyaṃ paramatthasaṅghaṃ. Sesaṃ vuttanayameva.🔽Anussarāti panettha “svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo”tiādinā dhammaṃ, “suppaṭipanno bhagavato
analyzed: dhammanti ariyam lokuttara dhammam saṅghanti ariyam paramattha saṅgham sesam vutta nayam eva  anussarāti pana ittha su ākkhātaḥ bhagavatā dhammaḥ ti ādinā dhammam su paṭipannaḥ bhagavataḥ
translated: “Dhamma” means the noble supramundane Dhamma. “Saṅgha” means the noble supreme Sangha. The rest is as before.

original: sāvakasaṅgho”tiādinā saṅghaṃ anussarāti yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: sāvaka saṅghaḥ ti ādinā saṅgham anussarāti yojetabbam
translated: “Recollects” : here the recollection of the Dhamma should be construed as follows: “The Dhamma is well proclaimed by the Exalted One, visible here and now, not delayed , inviting inspection, onward-leading, and to be experienced by the wise for themselves.” The recollection of the Saṅgha should be construed as follows: “The Saṅgha of the Exalted One’s disciples who have practiced well … is worthy of gifts, etc.”

original: Evaṃ therena ratanattayaguṇānussaraṇe niyojanavasena attani ovadite puna māro vivekavāsato
analyzed: evam therena niyojana vasena ovadite puna māraḥ
translated: When the elder had thus exhorted the bhikkhu to recollect the special qualities of the Three Jewels, Māra, thinking, “He will not be able to leave this place,”

original: naṃ vivecetukāmo hitesībhāvaṃ viya dassento “abbhokāse viharasī”ti pañcamaṃ gāthamāha.
analyzed: nam vivecetu kāmaḥ hitesī bhāvam viya dassentaḥ abbhokāse viharasi iti pañcamam gātham āha
translated: wishing to make him understand, he spoke the fifth stanza, “You live in the open air.”

original: Tassattho – tvaṃ, bhikkhu, abbhokāse kenaci apaṭicchanne vivaṭaṅgaṇe viharasi iriyāpathe
analyzed: tassa atthaḥ tvam bhikkhu abbhokāse kenaci apaṭicchanne vivaṭaṅgaṇe viharasi iriyāpathe
translated: The meaning is: You, monk, live in the open air, in a place that is not covered by anything, in a place that is open, in a posture that is suitable.

original: kappesi. Hemantikā himapātasamaye pariyāpannā imā sītā rattiyo vattanti. Tasmā sītena
analyzed: kappesi hemantikāḥ himapāta samaye pariyāpannāḥ imāḥ sītāḥ rattiyaḥ vattanti tasmā sītena
translated: These cold nights are coming, the cold season is approaching, the cold rains are falling. Therefore,

original: pareto abhibhūto hutvā mā vihaññittho vighātaṃ mā āpajji mā kilami. Phusitaggaḷaṃ
