analyzed: rāgaḥ uppajjati atha nam satthā tassa pekkhantassa iva navahi vaṇa mukhehi paggharamāna asucim
translated: Lust arose in him. Then the Teacher, while he was looking on, made his body appear to him as a loathsome thing, oozing and trickling from nine orifices,

original: kimikulākulaṃ ativiya bībhacchaṃ duggandhaṃ jegucchaṃ paṭikkūlaṃ katvā dassesi. So
analyzed: kimi kula ākulam ativiya bībhaccham duggandham jeguccham paṭikkūlam katvā dassesi so
translated: a mass of worms and insects, exceedingly frightful, foul-smelling, disgusting, and repulsive. He stood there,

original: taṃ pekkhanto virattacitto hutvā aṭṭhāsi. Athassa bhagavā obhāsaṃ pharitvā satiṃ janento –
analyzed: tam pekkhantaḥ viratta cittaḥ hutvā aṭṭhāsi athassa bhagavā obhāsam pharitvā satim janentaḥ
translated: his mind freed from all attachment, as he looked upon that body. Then the Exalted One, diffusing his radiance and arousing the monk’s mindfulness,

original: “Āturaṃ asuciṃ pūtiṃ, passa kulla samussayaṃ;
analyzed: āturam asucim pūtim passa kulla samussayam
translated: “Behold, Kulla, this body, diseased, impure, and foul-smelling,

original: Uggharantaṃ paggharantaṃ, bālānaṃ abhinandita”nti. –
analyzed: uggharantam paggharantam bālānam
translated: Trickling and oozing, a thing that fools delight in.”

original: Āha. Taṃ sutvā thero sammadeva sarīrasabhāvaṃ upadhārento asubhasaññaṃ paṭilabhitvā
analyzed: āha tam sutvā thero sammad eva sarīra sabhāvam upadhārentaḥ asubha saññam paṭilabhitvā
translated: When the Elder heard this, he considered the nature of the body and attained the perception of foulness.

original: tattha paṭhamaṃ jhānaṃ nibbattetvā taṃ pādakaṃ katvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ
analyzed: tattha paṭhamam jhānam nibbattetvā tam pādakam katvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam
translated: Then he made that perception the basis of his meditation, developed insight, and attained Arahatship.

original: pāpuṇitvā attano paṭipattiṃ paccavekkhitvā –
analyzed: pāpuṇitvā attanaḥ paṭipattim paccavekkhitvā
translated: Then he surveyed his own career and recited this verse:

original: “Kullo sivathikaṃ gantvā, addasa itthimujjhitaṃ;
analyzed: kullaḥ sivathikam gantvā addase itthim ujjhitam
translated: “Kulla went to the charnel-ground and saw a woman’s corpse,

original: Apaviddhaṃ susānasmiṃ, khajjantiṃ kimihī phuṭaṃ.
analyzed: apaviddham su sānasmin khajjantim kimihī phuṭam
translated: Cast away in the charnel-ground, being devoured by worms and insects.

original: “Āturaṃ…pe… bālānaṃ abhinanditaṃ.
analyzed: abhinanditam
translated: “The sick, the afflicted, the miserable, the wretched, the foolish delight in it.

original: “Dhammādāsaṃ gahetvāna, ñāṇadassanapattiyā;
analyzed: dhamma ādāsam gahetvāna ñāṇa dassana pattiyā
translated: “Having taken up the mirror of the Dhamma, for the attainment of knowledge and vision,

original: Paccavekkhiṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ, tucchaṃ santarabāhiraṃ.
analyzed: paccavekkhim imam kāyam tuccham santara bāhiram
translated: I surveyed this body, empty within and without.

original: “Yathā idaṃ tathā etaṃ, yathā etaṃ tathā idaṃ;
analyzed: yathā idam tathā etam yathā etam tathā idam
translated: “As this is, so is that; as that is, so is this.

original: Yathā adho tathā uddhaṃ, yathā uddhaṃ tathā adho.
analyzed: yathā adhas tathā uddham yathā uddham tathā adhas
translated: As below, so above; as above, so below.

original: “Yathā divā tathā rattiṃ, yathā rattiṃ tathā divā;
analyzed: yathā divā tathā rattim yathā rattim tathā divā
translated: “As by day, so at night; as at night, so by day.

original: Yathā pure tathā pacchā, yathā pacchā tathā pure.
analyzed: yathā pure tathā pacchā yathā pacchā tathā pure
translated: As before, so after; as after, so before.

original: “Pañcaṅgikena turiyena, na ratī hoti tādisī;
analyzed: pañcaṅgikena turiyena na ratī hoti tādisī
translated: “With a fivefold musical instrument, there is no such delight

original: Yathā ekaggacittassa, sammā dhammaṃ vipassato”ti. –
analyzed: yathā ekagga cittassa sammā dhammam vipassato ti
translated: As when the mind is unified, and one sees the Dhamma rightly.”

original: Udānavasena imā gāthā abhāsi.
analyzed: udāna vasena imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: He spoke these verses in the form of an Uddana.

original: Tattha kulloti attānameva thero paraṃ viya katvā vadati.🔽Āturanti nānappakārehi dukkhehi abhiṇhaṃ paṭipīḷitaṃ. Asucinti sucirahitaṃ jegucchaṃ
analyzed: tattha kullo ti attānam eva thero param katvā vadati  āturam ti nānappakārehi dukkhehi abhiṇham paṭipīḷitam asucim ti su cira hitam jeguccham
translated: Herein, “The sick” : the Elder refers to himself as if he were another.

original: paṭikkūlaṃ. Pūtinti duggandhaṃ. Passāti sabhāvato olokehi. Kullāti ovādakāle bhagavā
analyzed: paṭikkūlam pūtinti duggandham passāti sabhāvataḥ olokehi kullāti ovāda kāle bhagavā
translated: “The afflicted” : constantly oppressed by various kinds of suffering. “The miserable” : devoid of purity, contemptible, repulsive. “The wretched” : stinking. “I surveyed” : I looked at it in its true nature. “The foolish” : at the time of instruction the Blessed One

original: theraṃ ālapati. Udānakāle pana thero sayameva attānaṃ vadati. Samussayanti sarīraṃ.🔽Uggharantanti uddhaṃ vaṇamukhehi asuciṃ savantaṃ. Paggharantanti adho vaṇamukhehi
analyzed: theram ālapati udāna kāle pana theraḥ sayam eva attānam vadati samussayanti sarīram  uggharantanti uddham vaṇa mukhehi asucim savantam paggharantanti adhas vaṇa mukhehi
translated: The Elder spoke of himself in the first person at the time of the Uddāna. “The body” means the physical body.🔽“Flowing out” means flowing out from the orifices above. “Oozing” means flowing out from the orifices below.

original: samantato ca asuciṃ savantaṃ. Bālānaṃ abhinanditanti bālehi andhaputhujjanehi diṭṭhitaṇhābhinandanāhi
analyzed: samantataḥ ca asucim savantam bālānam bālehi andha puthujjanehi diṭṭhi taṇhā abhinandanāhi
translated: “All over” means flowing out from all over the body. “Delight of fools” means that fools, i.e., the blind worldlings, delight in it through the delight of craving for views,

original: “ahaṃ mama”nti abhinivissa nanditaṃ.
analyzed: aham mamanti abhinivissa nanditam
translated: and rejoice in it through the clinging of “I” and “mine.”

original: Dhammādāsanti dhammamayaṃ ādāsaṃ. Yathā hi sattā adāsena attano mukhe kāye vā guṇadose
analyzed: dhammādāsanti dhamma mayam ādāsam yathā hi sattā adāsena attanaḥ mukhe kāye vā guṇa dose
translated: “The mirror of Dhamma”: the mirror of Dhamma is made of Dhamma. Just as beings see the good and bad qualities of their own faces in a mirror,

original: passanti, evaṃ yogāvacaro yena attabhāve saṃkilesavodānadhamme yāthāvato passati,🔽taṃ vipassanāñāṇaṃ idha “dhammādāsa”nti vuttaṃ. Taṃ ñāṇadassanassa maggañāṇasaṅkhātassa
analyzed: passanti evam yogāvacaraḥ yena atta bhāve saṃkilesa vodāna dhamme yāthāvato passati  tam vipassanā ñāṇam idha vuttam tam ñāṇa dassanassa magga ñāṇa saṅkhātassa
translated: so the meditator sees in his own mental continuum the defilements and the purification of his own body,🔽and he generates the insight-knowledge called “the mirror of Dhamma” in order to attain the knowledge and vision of Dhamma,

original: dhammacakkhussa adhigamāya attano santāne uppādetvā. Paccavekkhiṃ imaṃ kāyanti imaṃ
analyzed: dhamma cakkhussa adhigamāya attano santāne uppādetvā paccavekkhiṃ imam kāyanti imam
translated: which is the path-knowledge. “Having reflected on this body”:

original: karajakāyaṃ niccasārādivirahato tucchaṃ attaparasantānānaṃ vibhāgato santarabāhiraṃ
analyzed: tuccham vibhāgato santara bāhiram
translated: But the body is empty, being devoid of a permanent core, etc., and it is both internal and external, being divided into one’s own continuity and that of others.

original: ñāṇacakkhunā patiavekkhiṃ passiṃ.🔽Yathā pana paccavekkhiṃ, taṃ dassetuṃ “yathā ida”ntiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha yathā idaṃ🔽tathā etanti yathā idaṃ mayhaṃ sarīrasaṅkhātaṃ asubhaṃ āyuusmāviññāṇānaṃ anapagamā
analyzed: ñāṇa cakkhunā pati avekkhim passim  yathā pana tam dassetum yathā idam tiādi vuttam tattha yathā idam  tathā etat ti yathā idam mayham sarīra saṅkhātam asubham an apagamā
translated: I saw it thus with the eye of knowledge.🔽In order to show how he saw it, it is said: “As this is, so is that” , etc. Herein, as this is, so is that: as this my body, called foul, shows various kinds of illusory action through the non-departure of life, heat, and consciousness,

original: nānāvidhaṃ māyopamaṃ kiriyaṃ dasseti, tathāva etaṃ matasarīraṃ pubbe tesaṃ dhammānaṃ
analyzed: nānāvidham māyā upamam kiriyam dasseti tathāva etam mata sarīram pubbe tesam dhammānam
translated: so also did this my body formerly exist through the non-departure of those states.

original: anapagamā ahosi. Yathā etaṃ etarahi matasarīraṃ tesaṃ dhammānaṃ apagamā na kiñci
analyzed: anapagamā ahosi yathā etam etarahi mata sarīram tesam dhammānam apagamā na kiñci
translated: As this my body now, through the departure of those states, shows no action whatever,

original: kiriyaṃ dasseti, tathā idaṃ mama sarīrampi tesaṃ dhammānaṃ apagamā nassatevāti. Yathā
analyzed: kiriyam dasseti tathā idam mama sarīram pi tesam dhammānam apagamā nassa tā iva ati yathā
translated: so also will this my body disappear through the departure of those states.

original: ca idaṃ mama sarīraṃ etarahi susāne na mataṃ na sayitaṃ, na uddhumātakādibhāvaṃ upagataṃ,
analyzed: ca idam mama sarīram etarahi su sāne na matam na sayitam na uddhumātaka ādi bhāvam upagatam
translated: And as this my body now, in the charnel ground, is not dead, is not lying down, has not undergone the state of bloatedness, etc.,

original: tathā etaṃ etarahi matasarīrampi pubbe ahosi. Yathā panetaṃ etarahi matasarīraṃ susāne
analyzed: tathā etam etarahi mata sarīram pi pubbe ahosi yathā pana itam etarahi mata sarīram susāne
translated: and so too was my body in the past. But just as this body of mine now,

original: sayitaṃ uddhumātakādibhāvaṃ upagataṃ, tathā idaṃ mama sarīrampi bhavissati. Atha
analyzed: sayitam uddhumātaka ādi bhāvam upagatam tathā idam mama sarīram pi bhavissati atha
translated: lying in the charnel ground, has reached the state of a bloated corpse, so too will this body of mine become like that.

original: vā yathā idaṃ mama sarīraṃ asuci duggandhaṃ jegucchaṃ paṭikkūlaṃ aniccaṃ dukkhaṃ
analyzed: vā yathā idam mama sarīram asuci duggandham jeguccham paṭikkūlam aniccam dukkham
translated: Or just as this body of mine now is impure, foul-smelling, disgusting, repulsive, impermanent, painful,

original: anattā, tathā etaṃ matasarīrampi. Yathā vā etaṃ matasarīraṃ asuciādisabhāvañceva🔽aniccādisabhāvañca, tathā idaṃ mama sarīrampi. Yathā adho tathā uddhanti yathā nābhito
analyzed: anattā tathā etam yathā vai etam mata sarīram  anicca ādi sabhāvam ca tathā idam mama sarīram pi yathā adhas tathā yathā nābhitas
translated: not-self, so too was that body of mine. Or just as that body of mine was of the nature to be impure, etc.,

original: adho heṭṭhā ayaṃ kāyo asuci duggandho jeguccho paṭikkūlo anicco dukkho anattā ca,🔽tathā uddhaṃ nābhito upari asuciādisabhāvo ca. Yathā uddhaṃ tathā adhoti yathā ca
analyzed: adhas heṭṭhā ayam kāyaḥ asuci duggandhaḥ jegucchaḥ paṭikkūlaḥ aniccaḥ dukkhaḥ anattā ca  tathā uddham ca yathā uddham tathā adhas iti yathā ca
translated: so too is this body of mine. Just as below, so above; just as above, so below: just as this body below the navel is impure, foul-smelling, disgusting, repulsive, impermanent, painful,🔽not-self, so too is the body above the navel. Or just as the body above the navel is of the nature to be impure, etc.,

original: nābhito, uddhaṃ asuciādisabhāvo, tathā adho nābhito heṭṭhāpi.
analyzed: nābhitas uddham tathā adhas nābhitas heṭṭhā api
translated: so too is the body below the navel.

original: Yathā divā tathā rattinti yathā ayaṃ kāyo divā “akkhimhā akkhigūthako”tiādinā asuci🔽paggharati, tathā rattimpi. Yathā rattiṃ tathā divāti yathā ca rattiṃ ayaṃ kāyo asuci
analyzed: yathā divā tathā yathā ayam kāyaḥ divā akkhimhā akkhi gūthaka uti ādinā asuci  paggharati tathā yathā rattim tathā divā ati yathā ca rattim ayam kāyaḥ asuci
translated: As by day, so by night: as this body exudes impurity by day thus “Eye-dirt, ear-dirt,

original: paggharati, tathā divāpi, nayimassa kālavibhāgena aññathābhāvoti attho. Yathā pure
analyzed: paggharati tathā divā api kāla vibhāgena aññathābhāvaḥ ti atthaḥ yathā pure
translated: nose-dirt, spit, urine, excrement” , so it does by night too. As by night, so by day: and as it does by night, so it does by day too. The meaning is that there is no difference in it by day and by night. As before,

original: tathā pacchāti yathā ayaṃ kāyo pure pubbe taruṇakāle asuci duggandho jeguccho paṭikkūlo,🔽tathā ca pacchā jiṇṇakāle. Yathā ca pacchā jiṇṇakāle asuciādisabhāvo, tathā pure🔽taruṇakālepi. Yathā vā pure atītakāle saviññāṇakāle asuciādisabhāvo ca aniccādisabhāvo
analyzed: tathā pacchā ati yathā ayam kāyaḥ pure pubbe taruṇa kāle asuci duggandhaḥ jegucchaḥ paṭikkūlo  tathā ca pacchā jiṇṇa kāle yathā ca pacchā jiṇṇa kāle tathā pure  taruṇa kāle api yathā vā pure atīta kāle sa viññāṇa kāle asuci ādi sabhāvo ca anicca ādi sabhāvo
translated: so after: as this body is impure, stinking, disgusting, repulsive,

original: ca, tathā pacchā anāgatakāle aviññāṇakāleti evampettha attho veditabbo.
analyzed: ca tathā pacchā anāgata kāle aviññāṇa kāle iti evam pi ittha atthaḥ veditabbo
translated: so it is after, in the old age that follows. And as it is after, in the old age that follows, so it was before, in the youth that preceded. Or else the meaning can be regarded as follows: as it was in the past, in the past time when it was possessed of consciousness, so it will be in the future, in the future time when it will be devoid of consciousness.

original: Pañcaṅgikena turiyenāti “ātataṃ vitataṃ ātatavitataṃ ghanaṃ susīra”nti evaṃ pañcaṅgikena
analyzed: pañcaṅgikena turiyena ati ātatam vitatam ātata vitatam ghanam evam pañcaṅgikena
translated: With a fivefold musical instrument: with a fivefold musical instrument consisting of the drum, the tabour, the conch, the cymbal and the horn.

original: pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatena turiyena paricariyamānassa kāmasukhasamaṅgino issarajanassa
analyzed: pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatena turiyena paricariyamānassa kāma sukha samaṅginaḥ issara janassa
translated: With five factors, a king who is a man of pleasure,

original: tādisī tathārūpā rati sukhassādo na hoti. Yathā ekaggacittassa, sammā dhammaṃ vipassatoti
analyzed: tādisī tathārūpā rati sukha ssādaḥ na hoti yathā ekagga cittassa sammā dhammam vipassato ti
translated: who is attended by a fourth of this kind, does not have such and such a kind of delight, joy, and happiness as there is for one whose mind is unified, who sees the Dhamma rightly.

original: samathavipassanaṃ yuganaddhaṃ katvā indriyānaṃ ekarasabhāvena vīthipaṭipannāya vipassanāya
analyzed: samatha vipassanam yuga naddham katvā indriyānam eka rasa bhāvena vīthi paṭipannāya vipassanāya
translated: With serenity and insight yoked evenly, with the faculties having a single function, with insight following the path of the faculties,

original: khandhānaṃ udayabbayaṃ passantassa yogāvacarassa yādisā dhammarati, tassā kalampi
analyzed: khandhānaṃ udaya bbayam passantassa yogāvacarassa yādisā tassā kalampi
translated: the meditator who sees the rise and fall of the aggregates has a delight in the Dhamma that is not even a fraction

original: kāmarati na upetīti. Vuttañhetaṃ bhagavatā –🔽“Yato yato sammasati, khandhānaṃ udayabbayaṃ;
analyzed: kāma rati naḥ upeti iti vuttam ha etam bhagavatā  yatas yatas sammasati khandhānam udaya bbayam
translated: of the delight in sensual pleasures. For this is said by the Blessed One:

original: Labhatī pītipāmojjaṃ, amataṃ taṃ vijānata”nti. ;
analyzed: labhatī pīti pāmojjam amatam tam
translated: “Whenever he comprehends the rise and fall Of the aggregates, he finds delight and joy, And he knows that to be deathless.”

original: Imā eva ca therassa aññābyākaraṇagāthāpi ahesuṃ.
analyzed: imāḥ eva ca therassa aññā byākaraṇa gāthā api ahesuṃ
translated: And these were the verses of the Elder’s declaration of his knowledge.

original: Kullattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽5. Mālukyaputtattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: kullatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Kullatissa is ended.🔽Verses of the Elder Māluṅkyaputta

original: Manujassātiādikā āyasmato mālukyaputtattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: manujassa ati ādikā āyasmataḥ mālukyaputta ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The verses beginning with the words “Manujassa” are those of the Elder Māluṅkyaputta. What was their origin? This elder, too,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinitvā imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinitvā imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam
translated: Having thus made merit in the various states of existence in which he was reborn, he was reborn in Sāvatthi in the dispensation of the present Buddha,

original: kosalarañño aggāsanikassa putto hutvā nibbatti. Tassa mātā mālukyā nāma, tassā vasena
analyzed: kosala raññaḥ aggāsanikassa puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti tassa mātā mālukyā nāma tassāḥ vasena
translated: as the son of the chief minister of the king of Kosala. His mother was called Māluṅkya,

original: mālukyaputtotveva paññāyittha. So vayappatto nissaraṇajjhāsayatāya gharāvāsaṃ pahāya
analyzed: mālukyaputto tu eva paññāyittha saḥ vaya pattaḥ nissaraṇa jhāsa yatāya ghara āvāsam pahāya
translated: and therefore he was known as the son of Māluṅkya. When he reached years of discretion, he left home,🔽because he was disgusted with the world, and went forth into the homeless state.

original: paribbājakapabbajjaṃ pabbajitvā vicaranto satthu santike dhammaṃ sutvā sāsane paṭiladdhasaddho
analyzed: paribbājaka pabbajjam pabbajitvā vicarantaḥ satthu santike dhammam sutvā sāsane paṭiladdha saddho
translated: Wandering about, he heard the Dhamma in the presence of the Teacher, and having gained faith in the Dispensation,

original: pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammaṃ karonto nacirasseva chaḷabhiñño ahosi. So ñātīsu anukampāya
analyzed: pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammam karontaḥ nacirassa iva chaḍabhiññaḥ ahosi saḥ ñātīsu anukampāya
translated: he went forth. Not long after he had begun to perform the duties of insight, he became one who possessed the six psychic powers. Out of compassion for his relatives,

original: ñātikulaṃ agamāsi. Taṃ ñātakā paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena parivisitvā dhanena
analyzed: ñāti kulam tam ñātakā paṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena parivisitvā dhanena
translated: he went to the house of his relatives. His relatives served him with choice food and drink, and in order to tempt him with wealth,

original: palobhetukāmā mahantaṃ dhanarāsiṃ purato upaṭṭhapetvā “idaṃ dhanaṃ tava santakaṃ,
analyzed: palobhetu kāmāḥ mahantam dhana rāsim puratas upaṭṭhapetvā idam dhanam tava santakam
translated: they set up a great pile of wealth in front of him, and said, “This wealth is yours.

original: vibbhamitvā iminā dhanena puttadāraṃ paṭijagganto puññāni karohī”ti yāciṃsu. Thero
analyzed: vibbhamitvā iminā dhanena putta dāram paṭijagganto puññāni karohi iti yāciṃsu thero
translated: Take it, and supporting wife and children with this wealth, perform works of merit.” The Elder

original: tesaṃ ajjhāsayaṃ viparivattento ākāse ṭhatvā –
analyzed: tesam ajjhāsayam viparivattento ākāse ṭhatvā
translated: and he stood in the air and said:

original: “Manujassa pamattacārino, taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya;
analyzed: manujassa pamatta cārinaḥ taṇhā vaḍḍhati māluvā viya
translated: “For a man who is heedless in his conduct, craving grows like a vine.

original: So plavatī hurā huraṃ, phalamicchaṃva vanasmi vānaro.
analyzed: saḥ plavatī hurā huram phalam vanasmi vānaraḥ
translated: He wanders about, here and there, like a monkey in the forest seeking fruit.

translated: He uttered these stanzas.

original: kālaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caranto accharāsaṅghātamattampi aṅguliphoṭanamattampi khaṇaṃ🔽cetosantiṃ cetaso samādhānaṃ na labhiṃ.
analyzed: kālam brahmacariyam carantaḥ accharā saṅghāta mattam pi aṅguli phoṭana mattam pi khaṇam  cetaḥ santim cetasaḥ samādhānam na labhim
translated: Herein, for twenty-nine years, since I went forth, means since I went forth, these are the twenty-nine years. I did not get even a moment’s mental tranquillity, means I did not get even a moment’s mental unification, even a moment’s mental concentration.

original: Evaṃ pana aladdhā cittassekaggataṃ, tattha kāraṇamāha “kāmarāgena aṭṭito”ti. Tattha
analyzed: evam pana aladdhā cittassa ekagga tam tattha kāraṇam āha kāma rāgena aṭṭitaḥ ti tattha
translated: Having not got such mental unification, he gives the reason for it thus: I was oppressed by lust and greed. Herein,

original: aṭṭitoti pīḷito, abhibhūtoti attho. Bāhā paggayha kandantoti “idamidha ativiya ayuttaṃ
analyzed: aṭṭitaḥ iti pīḷitaḥ abhibhūtaḥ ti attho bāhā paggayha kandanto ti idam idha ativiya ayuttam
translated: Oppressed: afflicted; overwhelmed is the meaning. With arms upraised and weeping: with his face upturned, with his arms upraised, he wept, thinking, “What is happening here is indeed most improper,

original: vattati, yadāhaṃ niyyānike sāsane pabbajitvā attānaṃ kilesapaṅkato uddharituṃ na
analyzed: vattati yadā aham niyyānike sāsane pabbajitvā attānam kilesa paṅkataḥ uddharitum na
translated: that I, having gone forth in the Dispensation of the One of Ten Powers, am unable to extricate myself from the mire of defilements.”

original: sakkomī”ti uddhaṃmukho bāhā paggayha kandamāno. Vihārā upanikkhaminti vasanakavihārato bahi nikkhanto.
analyzed: sakkomi iti uddhaṃmukhaḥ bāhā paggayha kandamānaḥ vihārā upanikkhaminti vasanaka vihārataḥ bahi nikkhantaḥ
translated: He went out from the dwelling: he went out from the dwelling where he was staying.

original: Yenādhippāyena nikkhanto, taṃ dassetuṃ “satthaṃ vā āharissāmī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha🔽satthaṃ vā āharissāmīti vā-saddo vikappanattho. Tena “rukkhā vā papatissāmi, ubbandhitvā🔽vā marissāmī”tiādike maraṇappakāre saṅgaṇhāti. Sikkhanti adhisīlasikkhaṃ. Paccakkhanti
analyzed: yena adhippāyena nikkhantaḥ tam dassetum sattham vā āharissāmi itiādi vuttam tattha  sattham vā āharissāmi iti vā saddaḥ vikappana atthaḥ tena rukkhā vā papatissāmi ubbandhitvā  vā marissāmi iti ādike maraṇa ppakāre saṅgaṇhāti sikkhanti adhi sīla sikkham paccakkhanti
translated: In order to show the purpose for which he went out, it is said: “I will take a knife” and so on. Herein,🔽the word “or” has the sense of “alternatively.” Therefore, “I will fall from a cliff” and “I will hang myself” and so on are included.

original: paccācikkhanto pariccajanto. “Paccakkhā”tipi pāḷi, paccakkhāyāti attho. Kālanti maraṇaṃ.
analyzed: paccācikkhantaḥ pariccajantaḥ paccakkhā atipi paccakkhāya ati attho kālanti maraṇaṃ
translated: The training: the training in the higher virtue. He will reject: he will renounce, he will abandon. The reading is also “paccakkhā,” the meaning being “having rejected.” The time: the time of death.

original: Kathañhi nāma mādiso sikkhāpaccakkhānena kālaṃ kareyyāti attho. Sikkhāpaccakkhānañhi🔽ariyassa vinaye maraṇaṃ nāma. Yathāha bhagavā – “maraṇañhetaṃ, bhikkhave, yo sikkhaṃ🔽paccakkhāya hīnāyāvattatī”ti. “Sikkhaṃ paccakkhā”ti pana pāṭhe kathañhi nāma mādiso🔽sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya kālaṃ kareyya, sikkhāsamaṅgī eva pana hutvā kālaṃ kareyya? Tasmā
analyzed: katham hi nāma mādisaḥ sikkhāpaccakkhānena kālam kareyya ati atthaḥ sikkhāpaccakkhānam hi  ariyassa vinaye maraṇam nāma yathā āha bhagavā maraṇam ha etam bhikkhave yaḥ sikkham  paccakkhāya hīnāya avattati iti sikkham paccakkhāti pana pāṭhe katham hi nāma mādisaḥ  sikkham paccakkhāya kālam kareyya sikkhā samaṅgī eva pana hutvā kālam kareyya tasmā
translated: What is meant is: how could one like me die by renouncing the training? For in the Noble Ones’ Discipline, renouncing the training🔽is called death. As the Blessed One said: “Monks, it is death for one who has entered on the way to die🔽by renouncing the training and reverting to the secular life” . But in the reading “sikkhaṃ paccakkhāya” , what is meant is: how could one like me die by renouncing the training? One should die only as one who has not renounced the training. Therefore,🔽🔽

original: satthaṃ vā āharissāmi, ko attho jīvitena meti yojanā.
analyzed: sattham vā āharissāmi kaḥ atthaḥ jīvitena mā iti yojanā
translated: What is the meaning? It is this: How can one like me die by renouncing the training? For in the Dispensation of the Noble Ones, renouncing the training is called death. As the Blessed One said: “Monks, this is death for one who has gone forth, namely, that he should renounce the training and return to the lower life.” In the reading “sikkhaṃ paccakkhā,” how can one like me die by renouncing the training? One should rather die while still possessing the training. Therefore the construction is: “I will take a knife and kill myself. What is the use of my life?”

original: Tadāhanti yadā kilesābhibhavena samaṇadhammaṃ kātuṃ asamatthatāya jīvite nibbindanto🔽tadā. Khuranti nisitakhuraṃ, khurasadisaṃ vā satthakaṃ. Mañcakamhi upāvisinti paresaṃ
analyzed: tadā ahanti yadā kilesa abhibhavena samaṇa dhammam kātum asamattha tāya jīvite nibbindantaḥ  tadā khuranti nisita khuram khura sadisam vā satthakam mañcakamhi upāvisinti paresam
translated: Tadāhaṃ: Then, when he was disgusted with life because he was unable to practice the ascetic life due to being overcome by defilements,

original: nivāraṇabhayena ovarakaṃ pavisitvā mañcake nisīdiṃ. Parinītoti upanīto, gale ṭhapitoti
analyzed: nivāraṇa bhayena ovarakam pavisitvā mañcake nisīdim parinītaḥ uti upanītaḥ gale ṭhapitaḥ uti
translated: Khurā: a sharp knife, or a knife resembling a razor. Mañcakamhi upāvisiṃ: having entered the inner room out of fear of being restrained by others, I sat down on the bed. Parinītaṃ: brought near, placed on the neck.

original: adhippāyo. Dhamaninti “kaṇṭhe dhamaniṃ, kaṇṭhadhamaniṃ galavalaya”ntipi vadanti.
analyzed: adhippāyaḥ dhamaninti kaṇṭhe dhamanim kaṇṭha dhamanim vadanti
translated: “The intention” is the intention to die. “Vein” : “The vein in the throat, the throat-vein, the ring in the throat” .

original: Chettunti chindituṃ.
analyzed: chettum ti chinditum
translated: “To cut” : to cut off.

original: Tato me manasīkāro, yoniso udapajjathāti “yadāhaṃ marissāmī”ti kaṇṭhe dhamaniṃ chindituṃ
analyzed: tatas me manasīkāraḥ yonisaḥ udapajjatha ati yadā aham marissāmi iti kaṇṭhe dhamanim chinditum
translated: “Then the thought occurred to me” : when I brought the razor to the vein in the throat to cut it,

original: khuraṃ upanesiṃ, tato paraṃ “arogaṃ nu kho me sīla”nti paccavekkhantassa akkhaṇḍaṃ🔽acchiddaṃ suparisuddhaṃ sīlaṃ disvā pīti uppajji, pītimanassa kāyo passambhi, passaddhakāyassa
analyzed: khuram upanesim tatas param arogam nu kho me sīlanti paccavekkhantassa akkhaṇḍam  acchiddam su parisuddham sīlam disvā pīti uppajji pīti manassa kāyo passambhi passaddha kāyassa
translated: then, reflecting on my virtue, I saw that it was unbroken,🔽unimpaired, and well purified. Joy arose in me, and my body was calmed by the joy that arose,

original: nirāmisaṃ sukhaṃ anubhavantassa cittassa samāhitatāya vipassanāvasena yoniso manasikāro
analyzed: nirāmisam sukham anubhavantassa cittassa samāhita tāya vipassanā vasena yonisaḥ manasikāro
translated: and I experienced a spiritual happiness free from material basis. As my mind became concentrated through the happiness, the thought occurred to me

original: uppajji. Atha vā tatoti kaṇṭhe khurassa upanayato vaṇe jāte uppannaṃ vedanaṃ vikkhambhento
analyzed: uppajji atha vā tatas ti kaṇṭhe khurassa upanayataḥ vaṇe jāte uppannam vedanam vikkhambhento
translated: in the sense of insight. Or alternatively, “then” means when I brought the razor to the throat, the wound that arose suppressed the pain,

original: vipassanāya vasena yonisomanasikāro uppajji. Idāni tato paraṃ maggaphalapaccavekkhaṇañāṇaṃ
analyzed: vipassanāya vasena yoniso manasikāro uppajji idāni tato param magga phala paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam
translated: and the thought occurred to me in the sense of insight. Now, after that, the knowledge of reviewing the path and the fruit

original: uppannabhāvaṃ dassetuṃ “ādīnavo pāturahū”tiādi vuttaṃ. Taṃ heṭṭhā vuttatthameva.
analyzed: uppanna bhāvam dassetum ādīnavaḥ pāturahū tiādi vuttam tat heṭṭhā vutta ttham eva
translated: The words “The danger became manifest” are said to show the state that had arisen. Their meaning has already been given above.

original: Sappadāsattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sappadāsa thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Sappadāsa is finished.

original: 7. Kātiyānattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: kātiyānatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Kātiyāna

original: Uṭṭhehītiādikā āyasmato kātiyānattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: uṭṭhehi iti ādikā āyasmataḥ kātiyāna therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The Elder Kātiyāna’s verses beginning with the words “Arise, O mind, be steady and composed” were spoken by the Elder Kātiyāna. What was their origin? This elder, too, in the dispensation of the Buddha Kassapa,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinitvā imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinitvā imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam
translated: having fulfilled the ten perfections, was reborn in a suitable place of birth, and in this dispensation, in Sāvatthi,

original: aññatarassa kosiyagottassa brāhmaṇassa putto hutvā nibbatto, mātugottavasena pana🔽kātiyānoti laddhanāmo vayappatto sāmaññakānittherassa gihisahāyo theraṃ disvā pabbajito
analyzed: aññatarassa kosiya gottassa brāhmaṇassa putto hutvā nibbattaḥ mātu gotta vasena pana  kātiyānaḥ ti laddha nāmaḥ vaya ppatto sāmaññakāni therassa gihi sahāyaḥ theram disvā pabbajitaḥ
translated: as the son of a brahmin of the Kosiya clan. But because of his mother’s clan,🔽he was called Kātiyāna. When he reached maturity, he became a friend of the householder of the Elder Sāmaññakāni. Seeing the elder, he went forth

original: samaṇadhammaṃ karonto rattiṃ “niddābhibhavaṃ vinodessāmī”ti caṅkamaṃ āruhi. So caṅkamanto
analyzed: samaṇa dhammam karontaḥ rattim niddā abhibhavam vinodessāmi iti caṅkamam āruhi saḥ caṅkamantaḥ
translated: and while he was practicing the life of a recluse, he thought, “I will dispel the oppression of sleep.” So he went up into the walk. As he was walking up and down,

original: niddāya abhibhūto pacalāyamāno paripatitvā tattheva anantarahitāya bhūmiyā nipajji,
analyzed: niddāya abhibhūtaḥ pacalāyamānaḥ paripatitvā tattha iva anantarahitāya bhūmiyā nipajji
translated: he was overcome by sleep and fell down, swaying, right on the bare ground.

original: satthā tassa taṃ pavattiṃ disvā sayaṃ tattha gantvā ākāse ṭhatvā “kātiyānā”ti saññaṃ
analyzed: satthā tassa tam pavattim disvā sayam tattha gantvā ākāse ṭhatvā saññam
translated: The Teacher, seeing what had happened, went there himself, and standing in the air, said, “Kātiyānā!”🔽

original: adāsi. So satthāraṃ disvā uṭṭhahitvā vanditvā saṃvegajāto aṭṭhāsi. Athassa satthā dhammaṃ desento –
analyzed: adāsi saḥ satthāram disvā uṭṭhahitvā vanditvā saṃvega jātaḥ aṭṭhāsi athassa satthā dhammaṃ desento
translated: The Teacher, seeing this, went there himself, and standing in the air, gave the name of Kātiyāna to the child. The child, seeing the Teacher, rose up, and after worshipping him, stood there filled with emotion. Then the Teacher, preaching the Law, said:

original: “Uṭṭhehi nisīda kātiyāna, mā niddābahulo ahu jāgarassu;
analyzed: uṭṭhehi nisīda kātiyāna mā niddā bahulaḥ ahu jāgarassu
translated: “Rise up, sit down, Kātiyāna, be not given to sleep, but watch;

original: Mā taṃ alasaṃ pamattabandhu, kūṭeneva jinātu maccurājā.
analyzed: mā tam alasam pamatta bandhu kūṭena iva jinātu maccu rājā
translated: Let not the King of Death, as with a bolt, overcome thee, who art idle and negligent.

original: “Seyyathāpi mahāsamuddavego, evaṃ jātijarāti vattate taṃ;
analyzed: sa iyyathā api mahā samudda vegaḥ evam jāti jarāti vattate tam
translated: “As the great ocean is swept on by the wind, so old age and death sweep on the world;

original: So karohi sudīpamattano tvaṃ, na hi tāṇaṃ tava vijjateva aññaṃ.
analyzed: saḥ karohi su dīpa mattano tvam na hi tāṇam tava vijjate iva aññam
translated: Therefore make an island for thyself, for there is no other refuge for thee.

original: “Satthā hi vijesi maggametaṃ, saṅgā jātijarābhayā atītaṃ;
analyzed: satthā hi vijesi maggam etam saṅgā jāti jarā bhayā atītam
translated: “The Teacher hath discovered this path, by which one may pass beyond the fear of old age and death;

original: Pubbāpararattamappamatto, anuyuñjassu daḷhaṃ karohi yogaṃ.
analyzed: pubba apara rattam appamattaḥ anuyuñjassu daḷham karohi yogam
translated: Therefore, being heedful, day and night, apply thyself, and make thy efforts strong.

original: “Purimāni pamuñca bandhanāni, saṅghāṭikhuramuṇḍabhikkhabhojī;
analyzed: purimāni pamuñca bandhanāni saṅghāṭi khura muṇḍa bhikkha bhojī
translated: “Cast off the bonds of the past, and being a monk, with the yellow robe and shaven head,

original: Mā khiḍḍāratiñca mā niddaṃ, anuyuñjittha jhāya kātiyāna.
analyzed: mā khiḍḍa aratim ca mā niddam anuyuñjittha jhāya kātiyāna
translated: Living on alms, be not given to play and sleep, but apply thyself, and meditate, Kātiyāna.

original: “Jhāyāhi jināhi kātiyāna, yogakkhemapathesu kovidosi;
analyzed: jhāyāhi jināhi kātiyāna yogakkhema pathesu kovidaḥ asi
translated: “Meditate, Kātiyāna, be a victor, you who are skilled in the paths to the highest goal.

original: Pappuyya anuttaraṃ visuddhiṃ, parinibbāhisi vārināva joti.
analyzed: pappuyya anuttaram visuddhim parinibbāhisi vārinā ava joti
translated: Having attained the unsurpassed purity, you will be extinguished like a flame in water.

original: “Pajjotakaro parittaraṃso, vātena vinamyate latāva;
analyzed: paritta raṃsaḥ vātena vinamyate
translated: “You who are a light-bringer, of limited radiance, are swayed by the wind like a creeper.

original: Evampi tuvaṃ anādiyāno, māraṃ indasagotta niddhunāhi;
analyzed: evam pi tuvam an ādiyānaḥ mā aram indasa gotta niddhunāhi
translated: So, disregarding him, O you of the lineage of Indra, shake off Mara.

original: So vedayitāsu vītarāgo, kālaṃ kaṅkha idheva sītibhūto”ti. –
analyzed: saḥ vedayitāsu vīta rāgaḥ kālam kaṅkhaḥ idhā iva sīti bhūtā uti
translated: He who is free from passion in regard to the feelings, may wait for his time here, having become cool.”

original: Imā gāthā abhāsi.🔽Tattha uṭṭhehīti niddūpagamanato uṭṭhahanto uṭṭhānavīriyaṃ karohi. Yasmā nipajjā🔽nāma kosajjapakkhiyā, tasmā mā sayi. Nisīdāti pallaṅkaṃ ābhujitvā ujuṃ kāyaṃ paṇidhāya🔽parimukhaṃ satiṃ upaṭṭhapetvā nisīda. Kātiyānāti taṃ nāmena ālapati. Mā niddābahulo
analyzed: imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi  tattha uṭṭhehi iti niddūpagamanataḥ uṭṭhahantaḥ uṭṭhāna vīriyam karohi yasmai nipajjā  nāma kosajja pakkhiyā tasmai mā sayi nisīdāti pallaṅkam ābhujitvā ujum kāyam paṇidhāya  parimukham satim upaṭṭhapetvā nisīda tam nāmena ālapati mā niddā bahulaḥ
translated: He spoke these verses.🔽Herein, rise up means you should rise up from the state of lying down and do the energy of rising up. Because lying down is on the side of laziness, therefore do not lie down. Sit means having folded your legs crosswise, having set your body erect,

original: ahūti niddābahulo niddābhibhūto mā ahu. Jāgarassūti jāgara, jāgariyamanuyutto hohi.
analyzed: ahu uti niddā bahulaḥ niddā abhibhūtaḥ mā ahu jāgarassu iti jāgara jāgariyam anuyuttaḥ hohi
translated: having established mindfulness in front of you, sit down. Kātiyāna means he addresses him by name. Do not be one who is much asleep means do not be one who is much asleep, do not be one who is overcome by sleep. Be watchful means be watchful, be devoted to watchfulness.

original: Mā taṃ alasanti jāgariyaṃ ananuyuñjantaṃ taṃ alasaṃ kusītaṃ pamattabandhu maccurājā🔽kūṭeneva adduhanena viya nesādo migaṃ vā pakkhiṃ vā jarārogehi mā jinātu mā abhibhavatu,
analyzed: mā tam alasanti jāgariyam an anuyuñjantam tam alasam kusītam pamatta bandhu maccu rājā  kūṭena iva adduhanena viya nesādaḥ migam vā pakkhim vā jarā rogehi mā jinātu mā abhibhavatu
translated: Let not the King of Death, who is the kinsman of the negligent, the slothful, the heedless,🔽overcome you with the arrows of aging and disease, as a hunter does a deer or a bird with his arrows.

original: mā ajjhottharatūti attho.
analyzed: mā ajjhottharatu iti attho
translated: Let him not overcome you, let him not conquer you, let him not attack you, is the meaning.

original: Seyyathāpīti seyyathā api. Mahāsamuddavegoti mahāsamuddassa ūmivego. Evanti yathā
analyzed: seyyathā api iti seyyathā api mahā samudda vego ti mahā samuddassa ūmi vego evam ti yathā
translated: As if in a great flood: as if in the great flood of the ocean. Thus: just as

original: nāma mahāsamuddaūmivego uparūpari uṭṭhahanto taṃ abhikkamituṃ asakkontaṃ purisaṃ
analyzed: nāma mahā samudda ūmi vegaḥ upari upari uṭṭhahantaḥ tam abhikkamitum a sakkontam purisam
translated: the great flood of the ocean, rising up higher and higher, overcomes a man who is unable to cross it,

original: abhibhavati, evaṃ jāti jarā ca kosajjābhibhūtaṃ taṃ ativattate uparūpari ajjhottharati.🔽So karohīti so tvaṃ, kātiyāna, catūhi oghehi anajjhottharaṇīyaṃ arahattaphalasaṅkhātaṃ
analyzed: abhibhavati evam jāti jarā ca kosajja abhibhūtam tam ativattate upari upari ajjhottharati  saḥ karohi iti saḥ tvam kātiyāna catūhi oghehi an ajjhottharaṇīyam arahatta phala saṅkhātam
translated: so aging and death overcome you who are overcome by sloth. They attack you, they rise up higher and higher against you.🔽Do it: you, Kātiyāna, do it, make it your own, bring it about in your own mind-continuum,

original: sudīpaṃ attano karohi attano santāne uppādehi. Na hi tāṇaṃ tava vijjateva aññanti
analyzed: su dīpam attano karohi attano santāne uppādehi na hi tāṇam tava vijjateva aññanti
translated: the well-lighted state called the fruit of arahantship, which cannot be overcome by the four floods. For you have no other refuge.

original: hīti hetuatthe nipāto. Yasmā tato aggaphalato aññaṃ tava tāṇaṃ nāma idha vā huraṃ
analyzed: hi iti hetu atthe nipātaḥ yasmā tatas agga phalataḥ aññam tava tāṇam nāma vā huram
translated: “Hī” is a particle in the sense of cause. Because there is no refuge for you here or beyond,🔽

original: vā na upalabbhati, tasmā taṃ arahattasaṅkhātaṃ sudīpaṃ karohīti.
analyzed: vā na upalabbhati tasmai tam arahatta saṅkhātam su dīpam karohi iti
translated: “Hī” is a particle in the sense of cause. Since no other refuge than that highest fruit is found either here or beyond, therefore make that good light, which is called arahatship,

original: Satthā hi vijesi maggametanti yaṃ sādhetuṃ avisahantā yato parājitā puthū aññatitthiyā,
analyzed: satthā hi vijesi maggam etat ti yam sādhetum a visahantā yatas parājitā puthū añña titthiyā
translated: For the Teacher has conquered the path, which many sectarians, unable to accomplish, have been defeated in the past.

original: tadetaṃ tassa sudīpassa kāraṇabhūtaṃ pañcavidhasaṅgato jātiādibhayato ca atītaṃ ariyamaggaṃ
analyzed: tat etam tassa sudīpassa kāraṇa bhūtam pañcavidha saṅgataḥ jāti ādi bhayataḥ ca atītam ariya maggaṃ
translated: This noble path, which is the cause of that good light, is the fivefold aggregate, which is free from the fear of birth, etc.

original: devaputtamārādike abhibhavitvā tuyhaṃ satthā vijesi sādhesi. Yasmā satthu santakaṃ
analyzed: deva putta māra ādike abhibhavitvā tuyham satthā vijesi sādhesi yasmai satthu santakam
translated: Your Teacher has conquered, has accomplished, having overcome the devaputtamārā, etc. Since what belongs to the Teacher

original: nāma sāvakena adhigantabbaṃ na vissajjetabbaṃ, tasmā tassa adhigamāya pubbarattāpararattaṃ
analyzed: nāma sāvakena adhigantabbam na vissajjetabbam tasmā tassa adhigamāya pubbaratta apararattam
translated: must be attained by the disciple and not relinquished, therefore, for its attainment, in the first and last watches of the night,

original: purimayāmaṃ pacchimayāmañca, appamatto sato sampajāno hutvā anuyuñja yogaṃ bhāvanaṃ daḷhañca karohi.
analyzed: purima yāmam pacchima yāmam ca appamattaḥ sataḥ sampajānaḥ hutvā anuyuñja yogam bhāvanam daḷham ca karohi
translated: being heedful, mindful, and clearly comprehending, apply yourself to the practice of meditation and make it strong.

original: Purimāni pamuñca bandhanānīti purimakāni gihikāle ābaddhāni gihibandhanāni kāmaguṇabandhanāni
analyzed: purimāni pamuñca bandhanāni iti purimakāni gihi kāle ābaddhāni gihibandhanāni kāma guṇa bandhanāni
translated: “Release the bonds of the past” — the bonds of the house life, the bonds of the sense pleasures, which were bound in the past during the house life,

original: pamuñca vissajjehi, tattha anapekkho hohi. Saṅghāṭikhuramuṇḍabhikkhabhojīti saṅghāṭidhārī
analyzed: pamuñca vissajjehi tattha anapekkhaḥ hohi saṅghāṭi khura muṇḍa bhikkha bhojī iti saṅghāṭi dhārī
translated: Let go, give up, be without concern for them. Wearing the outer robe, with shaven head, living on alms food: wearing the outer robe,

original: khurena katasiramuṇḍo bhikkhāhārabhojī, tividhampetaṃ purimabandhanapamokkhassa khiḍḍāratiniddānanuyogassa
analyzed: khurena kata sira muṇḍaḥ bhikkhāhāra bhojī purima bandhana pamokkhassa khiḍḍārati niddāna anuyogassa
translated: with a head shaven by a razor, living on alms food. This is said in three ways to be the reason for the release from the former bonds, for the practice of play, fun, and sleep.

original: ca kāraṇavacanaṃ. Yasmā tvaṃ saṅghāṭipāruto muṇḍo bhikkhāhāro jīvati, tasmā te kāmasukhānuyogo🔽khiḍḍāratiniddānuyogo ca na yuttoti tato purimāni pamuñca bandhanāni khiḍḍāratiṃ
analyzed: ca kāraṇa vacanam yasmai tvam saṅghāṭi pārutaḥ muṇḍaḥ bhikkhāhāraḥ jīvati tasmai te kāma sukha anuyogaḥ  khiḍḍārati niddā anuyogaḥ ca na yuttaḥ iti tatas purimāni bandhanāni khiḍḍāratim
translated: Since you, wearing the outer robe, shaven, living on alms food, live, therefore it is not proper for you to pursue sensual pleasures,

original: niddañca mānuyuñjitthāti yojanā. Jhāyāti jhāyassu ārammaṇūpanijjhānaṃ anuyuñja.
analyzed: niddam ca mā anuyuñjittha iti yojanā jhāyā ati jhāyassu ārammaṇa upanijjhānam anuyuñja
translated: to pursue play, fun, and sleep. Therefore let go of the former bonds, and practice play, fun, and sleep.🔽Meditate: meditate, practice the contemplation of the object.

original: Taṃ pana anuyuñjanto yena jhānena jhāyato kilesā sabbaso jitā honti, taṃ lakkhaṇūpanijjhānaṃ
analyzed: tam pana anuyuñjantaḥ yena jhānena jhāyataḥ kilesā sabbasas jitāḥ honti tam lakkhaṇa upanijjhānam
translated: But practicing that, since the defilements are completely conquered by the meditation of one who meditates, he shows the contemplation of the characteristics

original: anuyuñjāti dassento “jhāyāhi jināhī”ti āha. Yogakkhemapathesu kovidosīti catūhi yogehi
analyzed: anuyuñjāti dassentaḥ jhāyāhi jināhi iti āha yoga kkhema pathesu catūhi yogehi
translated: by saying “meditate, conquer.” Skilled in the paths to safety from bondage: by the four bonds

original: khemassa nibbānassa pathabhūtesu bodhipakkhiyadhammesu kusalo cheko asi, tasmā bhāvanaṃ
analyzed: khemassa nibbānassa patha bhūtesu bodhi pakkhiya dhammesu kusalaḥ chekaḥ asi tasmai bhāvanaṃ
translated: He is skilled in the factors of enlightenment, which are the path to the secure Nibbāna. Therefore, he is a sword.

original: ussukkāpento anuttaraṃ uttararahitaṃ, visuddhiṃ nibbānaṃ arahattañca pappuyya pāpuṇitvā
analyzed: anuttaram uttara rahitam visuddhim nibbānam arahattañca pappuyya pāpuṇitvā
translated: He is diligent in developing the path. He has attained the unsurpassed, the highest purity, Nibbāna, and arahatship.

original: pana tvaṃ parinibbāhisi. Vārināva jotīti mahatā salilavuṭṭhinipātena aggikhandho
analyzed: pana tvam parinibbāhisi vārinā ava jotī iti mahatā salila vuṭṭhi nipātena aggi khandho
translated: But you will attain Nibbāna. Like a flame by a flood of water,

original: viya ariyamaggavuṭṭhinipātena parinibbāyissati.
analyzed: viya ariya magga vuṭṭhi nipātena parinibbāyissati
translated: by a flood of the noble path.

original: Pajjotakaroti pajjotiṃ karo padīpo. Parittaraṃsoti khuddakacciko. Vinamyateti vinamīyati
analyzed: pajjota karoti pajjotim karo padīpo paritta raṃso ti khudda kaccikaḥ vinamyate iti vinamīyati
translated: The maker of light, the light-maker, the lamp. Of little substance, of little wick. It is shaken, it is shaken down,

original: apaniyyati. Latāvāti valli viya. Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yathā vaṭṭiādipaccayavekallena
analyzed: apaniyyati latā vāti valli viya idam vuttam hoti yathā vaṭṭi ādi paccaya vekallena
translated: it is driven away. Like a creeper, like a creeper. This is what is said: Just as a lamp of little substance, of little wick, of little light,

original: parittaraṃso mandapabho padīpo appikā latā vā vātena vidhamiyyati viddhaṃsiyyati,
analyzed: paritta raṃsaḥ manda pabhaḥ padīpaḥ appikā latā vā vātena vidhamiyyati viddhaṃsiyyati
translated: is shaken, is destroyed, is driven away by the wind,

original: evaṃ tuvampi. Kosiyagottatāya, indasagotta, indasamānagottaṃ. Māraṃ tassa vase anāvattanā
analyzed: evam tuvam pi kosiya gotta tāya indasa gottaḥ indasamāna gottam māram tassa vase an āvattanā
translated: so are you. Of the Kosiya clan, of the Inda clan, of the same clan as Indra. Mara, you are not in his power.

original: anupādānato ca anādiyāno, niddhunāhi vidhamehi viddhaṃsehi. Evaṃ pana viddhaṃsamāno
analyzed: an upādānataḥ ca an ādiyānaḥ niddhunāhi vidhamehi viddhaṃsehi evam pana viddhaṃsamānaḥ
translated: Thus shaking them off,

original: so tvaṃ vedayitāsu sabbāsu vedanāsu vigatacchandarāgo idheva imasmiṃyeva attabhāve
analyzed: saḥ tvam vedayitāsu sabbāsu vedanāsu vigata chanda rāgaḥ idhā iva imasmiṃyā iva atta bhāve
translated: you will be free from desire and passion for all feelings. Right here in this very life

original: sabbakilesadarathapariḷāhābhāvena sītibhūto nibbuto attano parinibbānakālaṃ kaṅkha🔽āgamehīti. Evaṃ satthārā anupādisesaṃ nibbānaṃ pāpetvā desanāya katāya thero desanāvasāne🔽vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Arahattaṃ pana patvā satthārā desitaniyāmeneva
analyzed: sabba kilesa daratha pariḷāha abhāvena sīti bhūtaḥ nibbutaḥ attanaḥ parinibbāna kālam kaṅkha  āgamehi iti evam satthārā anupādisesam nibbānam pāpetvā desanāya katāya theraḥ desanā avasāne  vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā arahattam pāpuṇi arahattam pana patvā satthārā desita niyāmena iva
translated: you will be cool and quenched, without any of the fever of the defilements, and you will await the time of your own Parinibbāna.🔽Wait for it.” When the Teacher had thus brought him to the attainment of Nibbāna without residue, the Elder attained Arahatship at the conclusion of the lesson.

original: imā gāthā abhāsi. Tā eva imā gāthā therassa aññābyākaraṇañca jātā.
analyzed: imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi tāḥ eva imāḥ gāthā therassa aññā byākaraṇañca jātā
translated: But when he had attained Arahatship, he repeated the following Stanza, which was the very Stanza recited by the Teacher:

original: Kātiyānattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽8. Migajālattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: kātiyāna thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  migajālatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Kātiyāna is finished.🔽Verses of the Elder Migajālin

original: Sudesitotiādikā āyasmato migajālattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: āyasmataḥ migajāla ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The Elder Migajālin’s verses begin with the words, “Well taught by the One Well Taught.” How did this Elder come to be called Migajālin?

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam
translated: having done his duty in various states of existence, accumulating merit, in this arising of the Buddha in Sāvatthī,

original: visākhāya mahāupāsikāya putto hutvā nibbatti, migajālotissa nāmaṃ ahosi. So vihāraṃ
analyzed: visākhāya mahā upāsikāya puttaḥ hutvā nibbatti migajālotissa nāmam ahosi saḥ vihāram
translated: Having thus made his provision, he was reborn in Sāvatthi, in the family of the lay-adherent Visākhā, and received the name Migajālo. He went to the monastery,

original: gantvā abhiṇhaso dhammassavanena paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā vipassanaṃ vaḍḍhetvā
analyzed: gantvā abhiṇhasaḥ dhammassavanena paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā vipassanam vaḍḍhetvā
translated: and by listening to the Dhamma he acquired faith. He went forth into homelessness, developed insight,

original: arahattaṃ patvā aññaṃ byākaronto –
analyzed: arahattam patvā aññam byākarontaḥ
translated: and attained Arahantship. When he had done so, he recited these verses of rejoicing:

original: “Sudesito cakkhumatā, buddhenādiccabandhunā;
analyzed: su desito cakkhumatā buddhena adicca bandhunā
translated: “Well taught by the Visionary One, the Kinsman of the Sun,

original: Sabbasaṃyojanātīto, sabbavaṭṭavināsano.
analyzed: sabba saṃyojana atītaḥ sabba vaṭṭa vināsanaḥ
translated: The Buddha, who has passed beyond all fetters, the destroyer of all becoming.

original: “Niyyāniko uttaraṇo, taṇhāmūlavisosano;
analyzed: niyyānikaḥ uttaraṇaḥ taṇhā mūla visosanaḥ
translated: “The way out, the crossing, the uprooting of the root of craving,

original: Visamūlaṃ āghātanaṃ, chetvā pāpeti nibbutiṃ.
analyzed: visa mūlam āghātanam chetvā pāpeti nibbutim
translated: The cutting down of the tree with the poisonous root, and the bringing of peace.

original: “Aññāṇamūlabhedāya, kammayantavighāṭano;
analyzed: aññāṇa mūla bhedāya
translated: “The breaking of the machine of action, the cutting of the root of ignorance,

original: Viññāṇānaṃ pariggahe, ñāṇavajiranipātano.
analyzed: viññāṇānam pariggahe ñāṇa vajira nipātano
translated: The hurling of the thunderbolt of knowledge against the grasping of consciousness.

original: “Vedanānaṃ viññāpano, upādānappamocano;
analyzed: vedanānam viññāpanaḥ upādāna ppamocano
translated: “The knowledge of feelings, the liberation from attachment,

original: Bhavaṃ aṅgārakāsuṃva, ñāṇena anupassano.
analyzed: bhavan ñāṇena anupassanaḥ
translated: The contemplation of becoming as a pit of glowing embers.

original: “Mahāraso sugambhīro, jarāmaccunivāraṇo;
translated: “The great taste, the deep, the warding off of old age and death,

original: Ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, dukkhūpasamano sivo.
analyzed: ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo dukkha upasamanaḥ sivo
translated: The Noble Eightfold Path, the peace, the calm, the stilling of suffering.

original: “Kammaṃ kammanti ñatvāna, vipākañca vipākato;
analyzed: kammam kammanti ñatvāna vipākam ca vipākato
translated: Knowing action as action, and knowing result as result,

original: Paṭiccuppannadhammānaṃ, yathāvālokadassano;
analyzed: paṭiccuppanna dhammānam yathā vā āloka dassano
translated: As one who sees the light of the present state of things,

original: Mahākhemaṅgamo santo, pariyosānabhaddako”ti. – imā gāthā abhāsi;
analyzed: mahā khemaṅgamaḥ santo pariyosāna bhaddakaḥ ti imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: The Great One, the One who has gone to safety, the Peaceful One, the One who has reached the end, the Blessed One.

original: Tattha sudesitoti suṭṭhu desito, veneyyajjhāsayānurūpaṃ diṭṭhadhammikasamparāyikaparamatthānaṃ
analyzed: tattha su desitaḥ ti suṭṭhu desitaḥ veneyya ajjhāsayā anurūpam diṭṭhadhammika samparāyika parama tthānam
translated: Herein, well taught is the meaning of well taught, well expounded is the meaning of well expounded.

original: yāthāvato vibhāvanavasena desitoti attho. Atha vā sudesitoti sammā desito, pavattinivattīnaṃ🔽tadubhayahetūnañca aviparītato pakāsanavasena bhāsito svākhyātoti attho. Cakkhumatāti🔽maṃsacakkhu, dibbacakkhu, paññācakkhu, buddhacakkhu, samantacakkhūti imehi pañcahi
analyzed: yāthāvataḥ vibhāvana vasena desito ti attho atha vā su desito ti sammā desito pavatti nivattīnam  tad ubhaya hetūnam ca aviparītataḥ pakāsana vasena bhāsito su ākhyāto ti attho cakkhumatā ti  maṃsacakkhu dibbacakkhu paññācakkhu buddhacakkhu samantacakkhu iti imehi pañcahi
translated: Or alternatively, well taught is the meaning of rightly taught, well expounded is the meaning of rightly expounded.🔽The Eye-Doctor is the meaning of Eye-Doctor.🔽The Buddha is the meaning of the Buddha.

original: cakkhūhi cakkhumatā. Buddhenāti sabbaññubuddhena. Ādiccabandhunāti ādiccagottena.
analyzed: cakkhūhi cakkhumatā buddhena ati sabbaññu buddhena ādiccabandhunā ati ādicca gottena
translated: The Sun-Clan is the meaning of the Sun-Clan.

original: Duvidho hi loke khattiyavaṃso – ādiccavaṃso, somavaṃsoti. Tattha ādiccavaṃso, okkākarājavaṃsoti
analyzed: duvidhaḥ hi loke khattiya vaṃsaḥ ādicca vaṃsaḥ soma vaṃsaḥ ti tattha ādicca vaṃsaḥ okkāka rāja vaṃso ti
translated: For there are two kinds of royal families in the world: the solar and the lunar. Herein, the solar family is the family of King Okkāka, which should be understood as the solar family.

original: jānitabbaṃ. Tato sañjātatāya sākiyā ādiccagottāti bhagavā “ādiccabandhū”ti vuccati.
analyzed: jānitabbam tatas sañjāta tāya sākiyā ādiccagottā ati bhagavā ādiccabandhū ti vuccati
translated: The Sakyans are called “solar” because they were born from that family. Therefore the Blessed One is called “a kinsman of the sun” .

original: Atha vā ādiccassa bandhūtipi bhagavā ādiccabandhu, svāyamattho heṭṭhā vuttoyeva.🔽Kāmarāgasaṃyojanādīnaṃ sabbesaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ samatikkamanabhāvato sabbasaṃyojanātīto
analyzed: atha vā ādiccassa bandhu utipi bhagavā ādiccabandhu heṭṭhā  kāma rāga saṃyojana ādīnam sabbesam saṃyojanānam samatikkamana bhāvataḥ sabba saṃyojana atītaḥ
translated: Or alternatively, the Blessed One is a kinsman of the sun because he is a kinsman of the sun god, and this meaning is given in the following passage: “The sun god is a kinsman of the Blessed One, and the Blessed One is a kinsman of the sun god” .🔽He has gone beyond all the fetters such as sensual desire, etc., and all the defilements, therefore he is called “gone beyond all the fetters” .

original: tato eva kilesakammavipākavaṭṭānaṃ vināsanato viddhaṃsanato sabbavaṭṭavināsano, saṃsāracārakato
analyzed: tatas eva kilesa kamma vipāka vaṭṭānam vināsanataḥ viddhaṃsanataḥ sabba vaṭṭa vināsanaḥ saṃsāra cārakato
translated: Because he has destroyed and crushed the round of defilements, kamma, and the results of kamma, he is the “destroyer of the round of existence” .🔽Because he has escaped from the round of rebirths, he is the “escape” .

original: niyyānato niyyāniko, saṃsāramahoghato samuttaraṇaṭṭhena uttaraṇo, kāmataṇhādīnaṃ
analyzed: niyyānataḥ niyyāniko saṃsāra mahoghato samuttaraṇa ṭṭhena uttaraṇaḥ kāma taṇhā ādīnam
translated: Because he has crossed over the great flood with its four currents, he is the “one who has crossed over” .

original: sabbataṇhānaṃ mūlaṃ avijjaṃ ayoniso manasikārañca visoseti sukkhāpetīti taṇhāmūlavisosano,
analyzed: sabba taṇhānam mūlam avijjam ayonisaḥ manasikārañca visoseti sukkhāpeti iti taṇhā mūla visosanaḥ
translated: He dries up and burns the root of craving, which is ignorance and unwise attention, therefore he is the “drier-up of the root of craving” .

original: tiṇṇampi vedānaṃ sampaṭivedhassa viddhaṃsanato visassa dukkhassa kāraṇattā visamūlaṃ,
analyzed: tiṇṇam pi vedānam sampaṭivedhassa viddhaṃsanataḥ visassa dukkhassa kāraṇa ttā visa mūlam
translated: Because it is the root of the poison of suffering, it is the “root of poison” .

original: sattānaṃ byasanuppattiṭṭhānatāya āghātanaṃ kammaṃ kilesaṃ vā chetvā samucchinditvā
analyzed: sattānam byasana uppatti ṭṭhāna tāya āghātanam kammam kilesam vā chetvā samucchinditvā
translated: “The destruction of the root of ignorance” is the severing and uprooting of the kamma and defilements that are the cause of the arising of beings’ misfortune.

original: nibbutiṃ nibbānaṃ pāpeti.
analyzed: nibbutim nibbānam pāpa iti
translated: “Leads to the bliss of Nibbāna” means it leads to the Nibbāna element.

original: Aññāṇassa mūlaṃ ayoniso manasikāro āsavā ca “āsavasamudayā avijjāsamudayo”ti hi vuttaṃ,🔽tassa bhedāya vajirūpamañāṇena bhindanatthāya. Atha vā “avijjāpaccayā saṅkhārā”tiādivacanato
analyzed: aññāṇassa mūlam ayonisaḥ manasikāraḥ āsavā ca āsava samudayā avijjā samudayo ti hi vuttam  tassa bhedāya vaji rūpam añāṇena bhindana tthāya atha vā avijjā paccayā saṅkhāra ati ādi vacanato
translated: “The root of ignorance” is the condition for ignorance, namely, unwise attention and the taints, for it is said: “With the arising of the taints there is the arising of ignorance” .🔽“For the breaking up of the root of ignorance” means for the purpose of breaking up the root of ignorance by means of the knowledge that is like a thunderbolt. Or alternatively, since the statement “With ignorance as condition there are formations” is made,

original: aññāṇaṃ mūlaṃ etassāti aññāṇamūlaṃ, bhavacakkaṃ, tassa maggañāṇavajirena padālanatthaṃ
analyzed: aññāṇam mūlam etassa ati aññāṇa mūlam bhava cakkam tassa magga ñāṇa vajirena padālana attham
translated: ignorance is the root of the round of rebirths. For the purpose of crushing that root with the thunderbolt of the knowledge of the path

original: desitoti sambandho. Kammayantavighāṭanoti kammaghaṭitassa attabhāvayantassa viddhaṃsano.
analyzed: desito ti sambandho kammayanta vighāṭano ti kamma ghaṭitassa atta bhāvayantassa viddhaṃsano
translated: is the meaning. The rest is as stated in the text. “The smashing of the machine of kamma” is the destruction of the machine of kamma that is the body.

original: Viññāṇānaṃ pariggaheti kāmabhavādīsu yathāsakakammunā viññāṇaggahaṇe upaṭṭhiteti
analyzed: viññāṇānam pariggaheti kāma bhava ādīsu yathā saka kammunā viññāṇa ggahaṇe upaṭṭhitā iti
translated: “The seizing of consciousness” is the taking up of consciousness by means of the kamma of each being in the case of the arising of the seizing of consciousness in the sense-sphere existence, etc.

original: vacanaseso. Tattha tattha hi bhave paṭisandhiyā gahitāya taṃtaṃbhavanissitaviññāṇānipi
analyzed: vacana sesaḥ tattha tattha hi bhave paṭisandhiyā gahitāya taṃ taṃ bhava nissita viññāṇāni pi
translated: The rest is as stated in the text. For when rebirth-linking has taken place in a certain existence, the consciousnesses associated with that existence

original: gahitāneva honti. Ñāṇavajiranipātanoti ñāṇavajirassa nipāto, ñāṇavajiraṃ nipātetvā🔽tesaṃ padāletā. Lokuttaradhammo hi uppajjamāno sattamabhavādīsu uppajjanārahāni viññāṇāni
analyzed: gahitāna eva honti ñāṇa vajira nipātanaḥ ti ñāṇa vajirassa nipātaḥ ñāṇa vajiram nipātetvā  tesam padāletā lokuttara dhammaḥ hi uppajjamānaḥ sattama bhava ādīsu uppajjana arahāni viññāṇāni
translated: They are already taken. He is the one who brings down the thunderbolt of knowledge: the bringing down of the thunderbolt of knowledge is the bringing down of the thunderbolt of knowledge, the shattering of them by letting fall the thunderbolt of knowledge.

original: bhindattameva uppajjatīti.
analyzed: uppajjati iti
translated: For supramundane states arise only after shattering the consciousnesses that are due to arise in the seventh existence, etc.

original: Vedanānaṃ viññāpanoti sukhādīnaṃ tissannaṃ vedanānaṃ yathākkamaṃ dukkhasallāniccavasena
analyzed: vedanānam viññāpanā ti sukha ādīnam tissannam vedanānam yathākkamam dukkha salla anicca vasena
translated: He is the one who reveals the feelings: he is the one who reveals the three kinds of feelings, that is to say, pleasure, pain, and neither-pain-nor-pleasure, as the basis for sorrow, etc., respectively.

original: yāthāvato pavedako. Upādānappamocanoti kāmupādānādīhi catūhipi upādānehi cittasantānassa🔽vimocako. Bhavaṃ aṅgārakāsuṃva, ñāṇena anupassanoti kāmabhavādinavavidhampi bhavaṃ
analyzed: yāthāvataḥ pavedako upādāna pamocanaḥ ti kāma upādāna ādīhi catūhi pi upādānehi citta santānassa  vimocakaḥ bhavam ñāṇena anupassanoti kāma bhava ādi navavidham pi bhavam
translated: He is the one who frees from attachment: he is the one who frees the continuity of consciousness from the four attachments, that is to say, from sense desires, etc.

original: ekādasahi aggīhi ādittabhāvato sādhikaporisaṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ viya maggañāṇena anupaccakkhato dassetā.
analyzed: ekādasahi aggīhi āditta bhāvato sādhika porisam aṅgāraka asum viya magga ñāṇena anupaccakkhataḥ dassetā
translated: He is the one who sees existence as a pit of glowing embers: he is the one who shows existence, which is of nine kinds with the sense-desire existence, etc., as if it were a pit of glowing embers with eleven fires burning in it, by means of the path knowledge, by seeing it with his own eyes.

original: Santapaṇītabhāvato atittikaraṭṭhena mahāraso pariññādivasena vā mahākiccatāya sāmaññaphalavasena
analyzed: santa paṇīta bhāvataḥ a tittika raṭṭhena mahāraso pariññā ādi vasena vā mahā kicca tāya sāmañña phala vasena
translated: He is the one who has the great taste: he is the one who has the great taste of the fruit of recluseship, which is peaceful and sublime, like the great ocean, because it is difficult to fill, or because it has a great function by means of the four kinds of perfect knowledge, etc.

original: mahāsampattitāya ca mahāraso, anupacitasambhārehi duravagāhatāya alabbhaneyyapatiṭṭhatāya
analyzed: mahā sampatti tāya ca mahārasaḥ an upacita sambhārehi duravagāha tāya a labbha neyya patiṭṭha tāya
translated: and it is of great savour because it is the great attainment. It is very deep because it is hard to fathom for those who have not accumulated the requisites, and because it is not to be attained by one who is not well established in the requisites.

original: ca suṭṭhu gambhīro jarāmaccunivāraṇo, āyatiṃ bhavābhinipphattiyā nivattanena jarāya
analyzed: ca suṭṭhu gambhīraḥ jarā maccu nivāraṇaḥ āyatim bhava abhinipphattiyāḥ nivattanena jarāya
translated: It is the repeller of ageing and death because it is the prevention of the production of future becoming,

original: maccuno ca paṭisedhako. Idāni yathāvuttaguṇavisesayuttaṃ dhammaṃ sarūpato dassento🔽“ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko”ti vatvā punapi tassa katipaye guṇe vibhāvetuṃ “dukkhūpasamano
analyzed: ca paṭisedhakaḥ idāni yathāvutta guṇa visesa yuttam dhammam sarūpataḥ dassento  ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgiko ti vatvā puna api tassa katipaye guṇe vibhāvetum dukkha upasamanaḥ
translated: and because it is the prevention of ageing and death. Now, showing the Dhamma endowed with the special qualities just mentioned in its individual essence,

original: sivo”tiādimāha. Tassattho – parisuddhaṭṭhena ariyo, sammādiṭṭhiādiaṭṭhadhammasamodhānatāya
analyzed: siva iti ādim āha tassa atthaḥ parisuddha aṭṭhena ariyaḥ sammādiṭṭhi ādi aṭṭha dhamma samodhāna tāya
translated: he said, “The Noble Eightfold Path.” Then in order to reveal some of its special qualities he said, “Which leads to peace from suffering,” etc. The meaning is this. It is Noble in the sense of being purified. It is the Eightfold Path because it is the combination of eight dhammas beginning with right view.

original: aṭṭhaṅgiko, nibbānagavesanaṭṭhena maggo sakalavaṭṭadukkhavūpasamanaṭṭhena dukkhavūpasamano, khemaṭṭhena sivo.
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ nibbāna gavesana ṭhena maggo sakala vaṭṭa dukkha vūpasamana ṭhena dukkha vūpasamanaḥ khema ṭṭhena sivo
translated: It is the way in the sense of seeking Nibbāna. It is the peace from suffering in the sense of the cessation of all suffering in the round of rebirths. It is auspicious in the sense of being a refuge.

original: Yathā ito bāhirakasamaye asammāsambuddhapaveditattā kammavipāko vipallāso siyāti
analyzed: yathā itas bāhiraka samaye asammāsambuddha pavedita ttā kamma vipākaḥ vipallāsaḥ siyāti
translated: Because it is taught by a Perfectly Enlightened One, it is not perverted in the sense of the ripening of kamma.

original: evaṃ avipallāsetvā paṭiccuppannadhammānaṃ paṭiccasamuppannesu dhammesu kammaṃ kammanti🔽vipākañca vipākato ñatvāna pubbabhāgañāṇena jānanahetu sassatucchedaggāhānaṃ vidhamanena
analyzed: evam a vipallāsetvā paṭiccuppanna dhammānam paṭicca samuppannesu dhammesu kammam kammanti  vipākañca vipākataḥ ñatvāna pubbabhāga ñāṇena jānana hetu vidhamanena
translated: Having thus made them non-inverted, he acts with regard to the things that are conditionally arisen in the way that they are conditionally arisen, and with regard to the things that are conditionally produced in the way that they are conditionally produced.

original: yāthāvato ālokadassano takkarassa lokuttarañāṇālokassa dassano. Kenaci kañci kadācipi🔽anupaddutattā mahākhemaṃ nibbānaṃ gacchati satte gameti cāti mahākhemaṅgamo, sabbakilesadarathapariḷāhavūpasamanato🔽santo, akuppāya cetovimuttiyā anupādisesāya ca nibbānadhātuyā pāpanena pariyosānabhaddako
analyzed: yāthāvataḥ āloka dassano takkarassa lokuttara ñāṇa ālokassa dassano kenaci kañci kadācipi  an upadduta ttā mahākhemam nibbānam gacchati satte gameti ca ati mahā khemaṅgamaḥ sabba kilesa daratha pariḷāha vūpasamanato  santaḥ akuppāya cetovimuttiyā anupādisesāya ca nibbāna dhātuyā pāpanena pariyosāna bhaddako
translated: Having thus understood the kamma and its result, he understands by means of the knowledge of the preliminary stage that the seeing of things as they really are is the seeing of the light of supramundane knowledge, which is the cause of the knowledge of the path of arahantship.🔽He goes to the great security of Nibbāna, which is the great refuge, because it is never troubled by any kind of misfortune at any time.🔽It is peaceful because it is the stilling of all the defilements, the fevers, and the burnings.

original: sudesito cakkhumatāti yojanā.
analyzed: su desito cakkhumatā ati yojanā
translated: It is well proclaimed by the one of wide-open eyes, the Buddha, because it is the best of all things, since it is the culmination of the imperturbable deliverance of mind and of the element of Nibbāna without residue left.🔽This is the method of explanation.

original: Evaṃ thero nānānayehi ariyadhammaṃ pasaṃsanto tassa dhammassa attanā adhigatabhāvaṃ aññāpadesena pakāsesi.
analyzed: evam theraḥ nānā nayehi ariya dhammam pasaṃsantaḥ tassa dhammassa attanā adhigata bhāvam añña apadesena pakāsesi
translated: Thus the Elder praised the Noble Dhamma in various ways and proclaimed his own attainment of it by way of the knowledge of others’ minds.

original: Migajālattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: migajāla thera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The exposition of the verses of the Elder Migajālapāda is finished.

original: 9. Purohitaputtajentattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
translated: The verses of the Elder Jentatissa, the son of the chaplain

original: Jātimadena mattohantiādikā āyasmato jentattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: jāti madena mattohanti ādikā āyasmataḥ jenta ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: How was it that he came to do this? He also rendered service to former Buddhas,

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinitvā imasmiṃ buddhuppāde sāvatthiyaṃ
analyzed: kata adhikāraḥ tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinitvā imasmin buddhuppāde sāvatthiyam
translated: and in various states of existence accumulated works of merit. At the time of the appearance of this Buddha, he was reborn in Sāvatthi

original: kosalarañño purohitassa putto hutvā nibbatti, tassa jentoti nāmaṃ ahosi. So vayappatto
analyzed: kosala raññaḥ purohitassa putto hutvā nibbatti tassa jento ti nāmam ahosi saḥ vaya ppatto
translated: as the son of a chaplain of the King of Kosala. His name was Jenta. When he reached years of maturity,

original: jātimadena bhogaissariyarūpamadena ca matto aññe hīḷento garuṭṭhāniyānampi apacitiṃ
analyzed: jāti madena bhoga issariya rūpa madena ca mattaḥ aññe hīḷentaḥ apacitim
translated: he became intoxicated with the pride of birth, with the pride of wealth and power, and with the pride of beauty. Despising others, he showed no respect even for those who were worthy of respect.

original: akaronto mānathaddho vicarati. So ekadivasaṃ satthāraṃ mahatiyā parisāya parivutaṃ🔽dhammaṃ desentaṃ disvā upasaṅkamanto “sace maṃ samaṇo gotamo paṭhamaṃ ālapissati,
analyzed: a karontaḥ mānathaddhaḥ vicarati saḥ eka divasam satthāram mahatiyā parisāya parivutam  dhammam desentam disvā upasaṅkamantaḥ sace mama samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ paṭhamam ālapissati
translated: Drunk with pride, he went about his business. One day he saw the Teacher surrounded by a great company,

original: ahampi ālapissāmi; no ce, nālapissāmī”ti cittaṃ uppādetvā upasaṅkamitvā ṭhito bhagavati
analyzed: aham pi ālapissāmi no ce na ālapissāmi iti cittam uppādetvā upasaṅkamitvā ṭhitaḥ bhagavati
translated: preaching the Law. As he approached, he formed the following resolution, “If the monk Gotama addresses me first, I will address him in return; if he does not, neither will I.” So saying, he approached the Teacher and stood waiting. The Teacher,

original: paṭhamaṃ anālapante sayampi mānena anālapitvā gamanākāraṃ dassesi. Taṃ bhagavā –
analyzed: paṭhamam an ālapante sayam pi mānena an ālapitvā gamana ākāram dassesi tam bhagavā
translated: not addressing him first, remained silent. He also, out of pride, remained silent. Then he turned and departed, giving the Teacher to understand that he was ready to go. The Teacher said to him,🔽“Jenta, Jenta, you are a fool.

original: “Na mānaṃ brāhmaṇa sādhu, atthikassīdha brāhmaṇa;
analyzed: na mānam brāhmaṇa sādhu atthikassa idha brāhmaṇa
translated: “No, brahmin, conceit is not good; here, brahmin, is what you should do:

original: Yena atthena āgacchi, tamevamanubrūhaye”ti. –
analyzed: yena atthena āgacchi tam evam anubrūha yad iti
translated: Whatever your purpose in coming here, you should pursue that.”

original: Gāthāya ajjhabhāsi. So “cittaṃ me samaṇo gotamo jānātī”ti abhippasanno bhagavato pādesu sirasā nipatitvā paramanipaccākāraṃ katvā –
analyzed: gāthāya ajjhabhāsi saḥ cittam me samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ jānāti iti abhippasannaḥ bhagavataḥ pādesu sirasā nipatitvā parama nipacca ākāram katvā
translated: He spoke this verse to him. The brahmin thought, “The ascetic Gotama knows my mind,” and full of faith, he fell prostrate at the feet of the Blessed One, and after doing acts of respect and courtesy,

original: “Kesu na mānaṃ kayirātha, kesu cassa sagāravo;
analyzed: kesu na mānam kayirātha kesu ca assa sa gāravaḥ
translated: “Where should one not be conceited? Where should one have respect?

original: Kyassa apacitā assu, kyassu sādhu supūjitā”ti. –
analyzed: kyassa apacitā assu kyassu sādhu su pūjitā ati
translated: Where should one be grateful? Where is it good to make offerings?”

original: Pucchi. Tassa bhagavā –
analyzed: pucchi tassa bhagavā
translated: He asked. The Blessed One said to him:

original: “Mātari pitari cāpi, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari;
analyzed: mātari pitari ca api atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari
translated: “In mother, father, and the elder brother,

original: Ācariye catutthamhi, samaṇabrāhmaṇesu ca.
analyzed: ācariye catutthamhi samaṇa brāhmaṇesu ca
translated: In the teacher, and fourth, in ascetics and brahmins.

original: “Tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha, tesu assa sagāravo;
analyzed: tesu na mānam kayirātha tesu assa sa gāravaḥ
translated: “There one should not be conceited; there one should have respect.

original: Kyassa apacitā assu, tyassu sādhu supūjitā.
analyzed: kyassa apacitā assu tyassu sādhu supūjitā
translated: There one should be grateful; there it is good to make offerings.

original: “Arahante sītibhūte, katakicce anāsave;
analyzed: a rahante sīti bhūte kata kicce an āsave
translated: “In the Worthy One, who is cool, whose work is done, who is free from taints,

original: Nihacca mānaṃ atthaddho, te namasse anuttare”ti. –
analyzed: nihacca mānam te namasse anuttara iti
translated: Having put down conceit, one should pay homage to the unsurpassed.”

original: Pañhaṃ vissajjento dhammaṃ desesi. So tāya desanāya sotāpanno hutvā pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammaṃ karonto arahattaṃ patvā attano paṭipattikittanamukhena aññaṃ byākaronto –
analyzed: pañham vissajjentaḥ dhammaṃ desesi so tāya desanāya sotāpannaḥ hutvā pabbajitvā vipassanāya kammam karontaḥ arahattam patvā attanaḥ paṭipatti kittana mukhena aññam byākarontaḥ
translated: and he preached the Dhamma to him. The young man became a stream-enterer through that sermon, went forth, and by developing insight attained arahatship. translated: and with wealth and sovereignty,🔽and with my figure and beauty,

translated: I was intoxicated with conceit.🔽“I thought there was no one equal to me,

translated: and no one superior;🔽I was a fool, puffed up with conceit,

analyzed: atimāna hataḥ bālo patthaddhaḥ ussitaddhajo  mātaram pitaram ca api aññe pi garu sammate
translated: with my flag raised high.🔽“I did not pay homage to my mother🔽or to my father, or to others held in respect,🔽I was arrogant, puffed up with conceit,

analyzed: a smimānaḥ samucchinnaḥ sabbe māna vidhāḥ hatā ati
translated: All forms of conceit are destroyed.”

original: veneyyānaṃ vinayanato sayambhutāya nāyakabhāvato ca vināyakaṃ. Sadevake loke sīlādiguṇehi
analyzed: veneyyānam vinayanataḥ sayambhutāya nāyaka bhāvataḥ ca vināyakam sa devake loke sīla ādi guṇehi
translated: and because he is a leader by himself, he is the “Leader” . Because he is the best in the world with its gods by way of virtue, etc.,

original: seṭṭhabhāvato aggaṃ. Purisadammānaṃ accantatāya damanato sārathīnaṃ varuttamaṃ, ativiya
analyzed: seṭṭha bhāvataḥ aggam purisa dammānam accanta tāya damanataḥ sārathīnam vara uttamam ativiya
translated: he is the “Foremost” . Because he is the most excellent of all charioteers by way of taming men to the utmost, he is the “Best of Charioteers” .

original: uttamaṃ byāmappabhādiobhāsena ādiccamiva tapantaṃ, obhāsantaṃ bhikkhusaṅghapurakkhataṃ
analyzed: uttamam byāma ppabhā ādi obhāsena ādiccam iva tapantam obhāsantam bhikkhu saṅgha purakkhatam
translated: He was shining with the supreme radiance of his own aura, like the sun shining with its own rays, illuminating the supreme teacher of all beings, the Buddha, who was teaching the Dhamma, surrounded by the community of bhikkhus.

original: dhammaṃ desentaṃ sabbasattānaṃ uttamaṃ satthāraṃ disvā buddhānubhāvena santajjito
analyzed: dhammaṃ desentam sabba sattānam uttamam satthāram disvā buddha anubhāvena santajjitaḥ
translated: Seeing the Buddha, he was overcome with the Buddha’s power,

original: “ahameva seṭṭho, aññe hīnā”ti pavattamānaṃ bhogamadādimadañca chaḍḍetvā pahāya vippasannena
analyzed: aham eva seṭṭhaḥ aññe hīnā ti pavattamānam bhoga mada ādi madam ca chaḍḍetvā pahāya vippasannena
translated: and he abandoned the intoxication of wealth and the intoxication of conceit, thinking, “I am the best, others are inferior.” With a serene mind,

original: cetasā sirasā abhivādesinti yojanā. Kathaṃ panāyaṃ mānathaddho samāno satthu dassanamattena
analyzed: cetasā sirasā abhivādesinti yojanā katham pana ayam mānathaddhaḥ samānaḥ satthu dassana mattena
translated: he paid homage with his head at the Buddha’s feet. The commentary explains it like this. But how is it that he, being so full of conceit, abandoned his conceit

original: mānaṃ pahāsīti? Na kho panetaṃ evaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Satthu dassanamattena mānaṃ na pahāsi
analyzed: mānam pahāsi iti na kho pana itam evam daṭṭhabbam satthu dassana mattena mānam na pahāsi
translated: simply by seeing the Teacher? It should not be regarded in this way. He did not abandon his conceit simply by seeing the Teacher.🔽But he abandoned his conceit through the teaching beginning with the words, “Conceit, brahmin, is not good” .

original: “na mānaṃ, brāhmaṇa, sādhū”tiādikāya pana desanāya mānaṃ pahāsi. Taṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ
analyzed: na mānam brāhmaṇa sādhu uti ādikāya pana desanāya mānam pahāsi tam sandhāya vuttam
translated: With reference to that it was said:🔽“Abandoning conceit and intoxication, with a serene mind,

original: “mānaṃ madañca chaḍḍetvā, vippasannena cetasā. Sirasā abhivādesi”nti. Vippasannena
analyzed: mānam madañca chaḍḍetvā vippasannena cetasā sirasā abhivādesinti vippasannena
translated: he paid homage with his head at the Buddha’s feet.”

original: cetasāti ca itthambhūtalakkhaṇe karaṇavacanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: cetasā iti ca ittham bhūta lakkhaṇe karaṇa vacanam daṭṭhabbam
translated: And “with a serene mind” should be regarded as an instrumental expression indicating the manner in which the homage was paid.

original: “Ahameva seṭṭho”ti pavatto māno atimāno. “Ime pana nihīnā”ti aññe hīnato dahantassa
analyzed: aham eva seṭṭhaḥ ti pavattaḥ mānaḥ atimānaḥ ime pana nihīnā ati aññe hīnataḥ dahantassa
translated: Arrogance that occurs thinking “I am the best” is over-arrogance.

original: māno “omāno”ti vadanti. “Seyyohamasmī”ti pana aññaṃ atikkamitvā attānaṃ seyyato dahantassa🔽pavatto seyyamāno atimāno. “Hīnohamasmī”ti pavatto hīnamāno omāno. Pahīnā susamūhatāti
analyzed: māno omāno ti vadanti seyyā uham asmi iti pana aññam atikkamitvā attānam seyyataḥ dahantassa  pavattaḥ seyyamānaḥ atimānaḥ hīnaḥ aham asmi iti pavattaḥ hīna mānaḥ omānaḥ pahīnā su samūha tā ati
translated: They say that the kind of conceit that occurs burning with the thought “But they are inferior”🔽is “under-conceit.” But the kind that occurs burning with the thought “I am better” by surpassing another is🔽over-conceit. The kind that occurs with the thought “I am inferior” is under-conceit.

original: heṭṭhimamaggehi pahīnā hutvā aggamaggena suṭṭhu samugghāṭitā. Asmimānoti “esohamasmī”ti
analyzed: heṭṭhima maggehi pahīnā hutvā agga maggena suṭṭhu samugghāṭitā esā uham asmi iti
translated: “Abandoned, well abandoned”: abandoned by the lower paths and well abandoned by the supreme path.🔽“I-making”: that which occurs by way of apprehending the aggregates as “I” with the thought “This is I.”

original: khandhe “aha”nti gahaṇavasena pavattamāno. Sabbeti na kevalaṃ atimānaomānaasmimānā🔽eva, atha kho seyyassa seyyamānādayo navavidhā antarabhedena anekavidhā ca sabbe
analyzed: khandhe ahanti gahaṇa vasena pavattamāno sabbe iti na kevalam atimāna omāna asmimānā  eva atha kho seyyassa seyyamāna ādayaḥ navavidhāḥ antara bhedena anekavidhā ca sabbe
translated: “All”: not only over-conceit, under-conceit, and I-making,🔽but also the nine kinds of conceit beginning with better-conceit and the many kinds of conceit by way of the various divisions.

original: mānavidhā mānakoṭṭhāsā hatā aggamaggena samugghāṭitāti.
analyzed: māna vidhāḥ māna koṭṭhāsāḥ hatāḥ agga maggena samugghāṭitā ati
translated: All these kinds of conceit, all the categories of conceit, are destroyed, well destroyed, by the supreme path.

original: Purohitaputtajentattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The commentary on the verses of the Elder Jentatissa, the chaplain’s son, is finished.

original: 10. Sumanattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: sumanatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: Sumanattheragāthāvaṇṇanā

original: Yadā navo pabbajitotiādikā āyasmato sumanattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayampi purimabuddhesu
analyzed: yadā navaḥ pabbajito ti ādikā āyasmataḥ sumana ttherassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam pi purima buddhesu
translated: The story of the Elder Sumana is told in the Theragāthā Commentary on the verse beginning, “When I had newly gone forth. ”

original: katādhikāro tattha tattha bhave puññāni upacinanto sikhissa bhagavato kāle mālākārakule🔽nibbattitvā viññutaṃ patto ekadivasaṃ sikhiṃ bhagavantaṃ passitvā pasannamānaso sumanapupphehi🔽pūjaṃ akāsi. So tena puññakammena devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde aññatarassa
