original: “esa mama santike asubhakathaṃ sutvā kāmesu virattacitto hutvā pabbajitvā arahattaṃ
analyzed: esa mama santike asubha katham sutvā kāmesu viratta cittaḥ hutvā pabbajitvā arahattam
translated: “This man,” he thought, “having heard the discourse on foulness from me, will become disgusted with sensual desires, will go forth from the home life, and will attain arahantship.

original: pāpuṇissatī”ti ñatvā ākāsena tattha gantvā –
analyzed: pāpuṇissati iti ñatvā ākāsena tattha gantvā
translated: ” So he went through the air to that place and recited this stanza:

original: “Nānākulamalasampuṇṇo, mahāukkārasambhavo;
analyzed: nānā kula mala sampuṇṇaḥ mahā ukkāra sambhavaḥ
translated: “Filled with various kinds of filth, the source of great stench,

analyzed: candanikam iva paripakkam mahā gaṇḍaḥ mahā vaṇaḥ
translated: Like a ripe boil is the body, a great sore, a great carbuncle.

original: “Pubbaruhirasampuṇṇo, gūthakūpena gāḷhito;
analyzed: pubbaruhira sampuṇṇaḥ gūtha kūpena gāḷhitaḥ
translated: “Filled with old blood, blocked up with feces,

original: Āpopaggharaṇo kāyo, sadā sandati pūtikaṃ.
analyzed: kāyaḥ sadā sandati pūtikam
translated: The body constantly trickles pus and other impurities.

original: “Saṭṭhikaṇḍarasambandho, maṃsalepanalepito;
analyzed: saṭṭhi kaṇḍara sambandhaḥ maṃsa lepana lepitaḥ
translated: “Joined together by sixty sinews, plastered over with flesh,

original: Cammakañcukasannaddho, pūtikāyo niratthako.
analyzed: camma kañcuka sannaddho pūti kāyaḥ niratthako
translated: Cased in the garment of skin, the body is foul and useless.

original: “Aṭṭhisaṅghātaghaṭito, nhārusuttanibandhano;
analyzed: aṭṭhi saṅghāta ghaṭito nhāru sutta nibandhano
translated: “Put together with a framework of bones, bound together with ligaments,

analyzed: nekesam saṃgatībhāvā kappeti iriyāpatham
translated: The body is made to move by the coming together of many things.

original: “Dhuvappayāto maraṇāya, maccurājassa santike;
analyzed: dhuva ppayātaḥ maraṇāya maccu rājassa santike
translated: “Always on the way to death, in the presence of the king of death,

original: Idheva chaḍḍayitvāna, yenakāmaṅgamo naro.
analyzed: idhā iva chaḍḍayitvāna yenakāmaṅgamaḥ naraḥ
translated: Having cast it off right here, a man goes wherever he wishes.

analyzed: avijjāya nivutaḥ kāyaḥ catu ganthena ganthitaḥ
translated: “The body is shrouded in ignorance, bound by the four bonds,

original: Oghasaṃsīdano kāyo, anusayājālamotthato.
analyzed: ogha saṃsīdanaḥ kāyaḥ
translated: The body is the seat of the floods, arisen from the net of underlying tendencies.

original: “Pañcanīvaraṇe yutto, vitakkena samappito;
analyzed: pañca nīvaraṇe yuttaḥ vitakkena samappitaḥ
translated: “The body is fettered by the five hindrances, bound by applied thought,

original: Taṇhāmūlenānugato, mohacchādanachādito.
analyzed: taṇhā mūlena anugataḥ moha chādana chāditaḥ
translated: Followed by the root of craving, covered by the covering of delusion.

original: “Evāyaṃ vattate kāyo, kammayantena yantito;
analyzed: eva ayam vattate kāyo yantitaḥ
translated: “Thus does this body move, being driven by the machine of kamma,

original: Sampatti ca vipatyantā, nānābhāvo vipajjati.
analyzed: ca vipatyantāḥ nānābhāvaḥ vipajjati
translated: And when it is successful it fails, and when it is united it is dispersed.

original: “Yemaṃ kāyaṃ mamāyanti, andhabālā puthujjanā;
analyzed: ye imam kāyam mamāyanti andha bālā puthujjanā
translated: “Those who are attached to this body, the blind fools, the worldlings,

analyzed: vaḍḍhenti kaṭasim ghoram ādiyanti punarbhavam

original: “Yemaṃ kāyaṃ vivajjenti, gūthalittaṃva pannagaṃ;
analyzed: ye imam kāyam vivajjenti gūtha littam iva pannagam
translated: “But those who avoid this body, as one would a snake’s slough,

original: Bhavamūlaṃ vamitvāna, parinibbissantināsavā”ti. –🔽Imāhi gāthāhi tassa asubhakathaṃ kathesi. So satthu sammukhā anekākāravokāraṃ yāthāvato
analyzed: bhava mūlam vamitvāna  imāhi gāthāhi tassa asubha katham kathesi saḥ satthu sammukhā aneka ākāra vokāram yāthāvataḥ
translated: Having vomited up the root of existence, will attain final Nibbāna, free from taints.”🔽He expounded the discourse on foulness to him with these verses. Having heard the discourse on foulness, which is the correct analysis of the nature of the body in its various aspects,

original: sarīrasabhāvavibhāvanaṃ asubhakathaṃ sutvā sakena kāyena aṭṭīyamāno harāyamāno jigucchamāno
analyzed: sarīra sabhāva vibhāvanam asubha katham sutvā sakena kāyena aṭṭīyamānaḥ harāyamānaḥ jigucchamānaḥ
translated: from the Teacher himself, he became alarmed, ashamed, and disgusted with his own body.

original: saṃviggahadayo satthāraṃ vanditvā, “labheyyāhaṃ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajja”nti
analyzed: saṃvigga hadayaḥ satthāram vanditvā labheyya aham bhante bhagavato santike pabbajjanti
translated: “Reverend Sir, may I receive the monk’s Pabbajjā ordination at the hands of the Exalted One?”

original: pabbajjaṃ yāci. Satthā samīpe ṭhitamaññataraṃ bhikkhuṃ āṇāpesi – “gaccha, bhikkhu,
analyzed: pabbajjam yāci satthā samīpe ṭhitam aññataram bhikkhuṃ āṇāpesi gaccha bhikkhu
translated: The Teacher commanded a certain monk who stood near him, saying, “Go, monk,

original: imaṃ pabbājetvā upasampādetvā ānehī”ti. So taṃ tacapañcakakammaṭṭhānaṃ datvā pabbājesi.
analyzed: imam pabbājetvā upasampādetvā ānehi iti saḥ tam tacapañcaka kammaṭṭhānam datvā pabbājesi
translated: and bring him back after you have given him the Pabbajjā ordination and the Upasampadā ordination.” The monk gave him the three-refuge formula and the ten precepts, and then gave him the five-hundred-league meditation-subject consisting of the thirty-two parts of the body.

original: So khuraggeyeva saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: saḥ saha paṭisambhidāhi arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: The very moment he received the Pabbajjā ordination, he attained Arahatship together with the Supernatural Faculties. Therefore it is said in the Apadāna,

analyzed: siddhatthassa bhagavataḥ thūpa seṭṭhassa sammukhā
translated: “In the presence of the Blessed One, Siddhattha, the best of all who bear the marks of distinction,

analyzed: yam yam deva ttam atha mānusam
translated: “Wherever I was reborn, whether as deva or as man,

analyzed: sobhayantaḥ mama dvāram kapparukkho patiṭṭhati
translated: the Bodhi Tree stood at the gate, beautifying the place.

original: “Ahañca parisā ceva, ye keci mamavassitā;
analyzed: aham ca parisā ca iva ye
translated: “I and all my retinue, all who were subject to my sway,

original: Tamhā dussaṃ gahetvāna, nivāsema mayaṃ sadā.
analyzed: tamhā dussam gahetvāna nivāsema mayam sadā
translated: always took that cloth and made use of it.

original: “Catunnavutito kappe, yaṃ rukkhaṃ ṭhapayiṃ ahaṃ;
analyzed: catunnavutitaḥ kappe yam rukkham ṭhapayim aham
translated: “For ninety-four cycles of time, I placed that cloth on the Bodhi Tree.

original: Duggatiṃ nābhijānāmi, kapparukkhassidaṃ phalaṃ.
analyzed: duggatim na abhijānāmi kappa rukkhassa idam phalam
translated: I do not know of any bad destination; this is the fruit of the tree of merit.

original: “Ito ca sattame kappe, suceḷā aṭṭha khattiyā;
analyzed: itas ca sattame kappe suceḷāḥ aṭṭha khattiyā
translated: And in the seventh future age, eight kings named Suceḷa,

original: Sattaratanasampannā, cakkavattī mahabbalā.
analyzed: satta ratana sampannā cakkavattī mahat balā
translated: Endowed with the seven treasures, will appear, mighty universal monarchs.

original: “Paṭisambhidā catasso…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: paṭisambhidā katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: The four analytical knowledges … The Buddha’s teaching has been done.

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā laddhūpasampado satthāraṃ upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā ekamantaṃ nisinno aññaṃ byākaronto tā eva gāthā abhāsi. Teneva tā theragāthā nāma jātā.
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā laddha upasampadaḥ satthāram upasaṅkamitvā vanditvā ekamantam nisinnaḥ aññam byākaronto tāḥ eva gāthāḥ abhāsi tena iva tā theragāthā nāma jātā
translated: But after attaining arahatship and receiving the higher ordination, he approached the Teacher, paid homage to him, sat down, and while reciting the same verses, he declared his enlightenment. Therefore they became known as the verses of the elder.

original: Tattha nānākulamalasampuṇṇoti, nānākulehi nānābhāgehi malehi sampuṇṇo, kesalomādinānāvidhaasucikoṭṭhāsabharitoti
analyzed: tattha nānā kula mala sampuṇṇoti nānā kulehi nānābhāgehi malehi sampuṇṇaḥ kesa loma ādi nānāvidha asuci koṭṭhāsa bharitoti
translated: Herein, filled with various kinds of stains means filled with various kinds of stains belonging to various families, filled with various kinds of impure substances such as head hairs, body hairs, etc.🔽The great womb is called the womb. For as long as the mother

original: attho. Mahāukkārasambhavoti, ukkāro vuccati vaccakūpaṃ. Yattakavayā mātā, tattakaṃ🔽kālaṃ kārapariseditavaccakūpasadisatāya mātu kucchi idha “mahāukkāro”ti adhippeto.
analyzed: attho mahā ukkāra sambhavaḥ ti ukkāraḥ vuccati vaccakūpam yattaka vayā mātā tattakam 🔽kālam kāra parisedita vacca kūpa sadisa tāya mātu idha mahā ukkāraḥ ti adhippeto
translated: lives, the mother’s womb is like a privy that has been plastered with excrement.

original: So kucchi sambhavo uppattiṭṭhānaṃ etassāti mahāukkārasambhavo. Candanikaṃvāti candanikaṃ
analyzed: so sambhavaḥ uppatti ṭhānaṃ etassa ati mahā ukkāra sambhavaḥ candanikam vā iti candanikam
translated: It has a great cry, because it is the source of the arising of the belly.

original: nāma ucchiṭṭhodakagabbhamalādīnaṃ chaḍḍanaṭṭhānaṃ, yaṃ jaṇṇumattaṃ asucibharitampi
analyzed: nāma ucchiṭṭha udaka gabbha mala ādīnam chaḍḍana ṭhānam yam jaṇṇumattam asuci bharitam pi
translated: A cesspit is a place for throwing away such things as the wash-water from rice and so on. It is a place where even knee-deep there is a mass of impurity.🔽The meaning is that it is like that.🔽It is ripe: it is decayed, old.

original: hoti, tādisanti attho. Paripakkanti, pariṇataṃ purāṇaṃ. Tena yathā caṇḍālagāmadvāre
analyzed: hoti tādisanti attho paripakkanti pariṇatam purāṇam tena yathā caṇḍāla gāma dvāre
translated: By this he shows that it is like a cesspit at the gate of a village of outcasts,

original: nidāghasamaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udakena samupabyūḷhamuttakarīsaaṭṭhicammanhārukhaṇḍakheḷasiṅghāṇikādinānākuṇapabharitaṃ
analyzed: nidāgha samaye thullaphusitake deve vassante udakena samupabyūḍha mutta karīsa aṭṭhi camma nhāru khaṇḍa kheḷa siṅghāṇika ādi nānā kuṇapa bharitam
translated: which is filled with a mass of various kinds of filth such as excrement, urine, spittle, snot, and so on, which is mixed with mud and water,

original: kaddamodakāluḷitaṃ katipayadivasātikkamena saṃjāta kimikulākulaṃ sūriyātapasantāpakuthitaṃ🔽upari pheṇapubbuḷakāni muñcantaṃ abhinīlavaṇṇaṃ paramaduggandhaṃ jegucchaṃ candanikāvāṭaṃ
analyzed: kaddama udaka āluḷitam katipaya divasa atikkamena saṃjāta kimi kula ākulam sūriya ātapa santāpa kuthitam  upari pheṇa pubbuḷakāni muñcantam abhinīla vaṇṇam parama duggandham jeguccham candanikā vāṭam
translated: which is infested with a multitude of worms that have arisen there within a few days, which is boiling with the heat of the sun,

original: neva upagantuṃ, na daṭṭhuṃ araharūpaṃ hutvā tiṭṭhati, tathārūpoyaṃ kāyoti dasseti.
analyzed: na iva upagantum na daṭṭhum araharūpam hutvā tiṭṭhati tathārūpaḥ yam kāyaḥ ti dasseti
translated: and which emits bubbles of froth on the top, which has a very bad smell, which is repulsive, and which is so blue-black in colour that it is not fit to be approached or looked at.

original: Sadā dukkhatāmūlayogato asucipaggharaṇato uppādajarāmaraṇehi uddhumāyanaparipaccanabhijjanasabhāvattā🔽ca mahanto gaṇḍo viyāti mahāgaṇḍo. Sabbatthakameva dukkhavedanānubaddhattā gaṇḍānaṃ
analyzed: sadā dukkha tā mūla yogataḥ a suci paggharaṇataḥ uppāda jarā maraṇehi  ca mahantaḥ gaṇḍaḥ viyāti mahā gaṇḍo sabbatthakam eva dukkha vedanā anubaddha ttā gaṇḍānaṃ
translated: Because it is always connected with the root of suffering, because it discharges impurity, and because it is by nature a swelling, a festering, a rotting, a running sore, and a place of oozing,🔽it is a great boil. Because it is connected with painful feeling everywhere,

original: sahanato asucivissandanato ca mahanto vaṇo viyāti mahāvaṇo gūthakūpena gāḷitoti,
analyzed: sahanataḥ asuci vissandanataḥ ca mahantaḥ vaṇaḥ viyāti mahā vaṇaḥ gūtha kūpena gāḷitaḥ iti
translated: it is a great sore, like a sore that is a great open wound.🔽It is filled with excrement, like a cesspit.

original: vaccakūpena vacceneva vā bharito. “Gūthakūpanigāḷhito”tipi pāḷi, vaccakūpato nikkhantoti
analyzed: vacca kūpena vaccena iva vā bharitaḥ gūtha kūpa nigāḍhitaḥ tipi vacca kūpataḥ nikkhantoti
translated: The meaning is that it has emerged from the cesspit.🔽The body is always oozing water, and it trickles with pus.

original: attho. Āpopaggharaṇo kāyo, sadā sandati pūtikanti, ayaṃ kāyo āpodhātuyā sadā paggharaṇasīlo,
analyzed: attho āpa upaggharaṇo kāyo sadā sandati pūti kanti ayam kāyaḥ āpaḥ dhātuyā sadā paggharaṇa sīlo
translated: This body is always oozing the water element,

original: tañca kho pittasemhasedamuttādikaṃ pūtikaṃ asuciṃyeva sandati, na kadāci sucinti attho.
analyzed: tat ca kho pitta semha sedam utta ādikam pūtikam asuciṃya iva sandati na kadāci
translated: and it trickles with pus, bile, phlegm, and other impurities, with what is always impure, never pure.🔽It is joined by sixty sinews.

original: Saṭṭhikaṇḍarasambandhoti, gīvāya uparimabhāgato paṭṭhāya sarīraṃ vinaddhamānā sarīrassa
analyzed: saṭṭhi kaṇḍara sambandho ti gīvāya uparima bhāgataḥ paṭṭhāya sarīram vinaddha mānā sarīrassa
translated: From the upper part of the neck down to the feet, the body is bound together by sixty sinews.

original: purimapacchimadakkhiṇavāmapassesu paccekaṃ pañca pañca katvā vīsati, hatthapāde vinaddhamānā
analyzed: purima pacchima dakkhiṇa vāma passesu paccekam pañca pañca katvā vīsati hattha pāde vinaddha mānā
translated: and five each in the front, back, right and left sides, making twenty.🔽The hands and feet are bound together by the large sinews,

original: tesaṃ purimapacchimapassesu pañca pañca katvā cattālīsāti saṭṭhiyā kaṇḍarehi mahānhārūhi
analyzed: tesam purima pacchima passesu pañca pañca katvā saṭṭhiyā kaṇḍarehi
translated: which are twenty in number, ten in each, making forty. So the body is bound together by sixty large sinews.

original: sabbaso baddho vinaddhoti saṭṭhikaṇḍarasambandho. Maṃsalepanalepitoti, maṃsasaṅkhātena
analyzed: sabbasas baddhaḥ vinaddhaḥ ti saṭṭhi kaṇḍara sambandhaḥ maṃsa lepana lepitaḥ iti maṃsa saṅkhātena
translated: Smeared with flesh and blood: smeared with flesh that is called🔽smearing. The meaning is: smeared with nine hundred pieces of flesh.

original: lepanena litto, navamaṃsapesisatānulittoti attho. Cammakañcukasannaddhoti, cammasaṅkhātena🔽kañcukena sabbaso onaddho pariyonaddho paricchinno. Pūtikāyoti, sabbaso pūtigandhiko
analyzed: lepanena littaḥ nava maṃsa pesi sata anulitto ti attho camma kañcuka sannaddho ti camma saṅkhātena  kañcukena sabbaso onaddhaḥ pariyonaddhaḥ paricchinno pūti kāyaḥ ti sabbaso pūti gandhiko
translated: Clad in skin: completely covered, enclosed, hemmed in by the skin that is called🔽the coat of mail. The body is foul-smelling: it smells foul all over.

original: kāyo. Niratthakoti, nippayojano. Aññesañhi pāṇīnaṃ kāyo cammādiviniyogena siyā sappayojano,
analyzed: kāyaḥ niratthakaḥ ti nippayojanaḥ aññesam hi pāṇīnam kāyo camma ādi viniyogena siyā sa payojanaḥ
translated: It is useless: it has no purpose. For the body of other living beings may have a purpose in that the skin, etc., can be used for something,🔽but not so the human body. It is a lump of bones held together:

original: na tathā manussakāyoti. Aṭṭhisaṅghātaghaṭitoti, atirekatisatānaṃ aṭṭhīnaṃ saṅghātena
analyzed: na tathā manussa kāyaḥ ti aṭṭhi saṅghāta ghaṭito ti atireka tisatānam aṭṭhīnam saṅghātena
translated: it is held together by the heap of more than three hundred bones.

original: ghaṭito sambandho. Nhārusuttanibandhanoti, suttasadisehi navahi nhārusatehi nibandhito.
analyzed: ghaṭitaḥ sambandhaḥ nhāru sutta nibandhano ti sutta sadisehi navahi nhāru satehi nibandhitaḥ
translated: The connection is made by the sinews. The binding together by the sinews is like the binding together by the nine hundred sinews mentioned in the Suttas.

original: Nekesaṃ saṃgatībhāvāti, catumahābhūtajīvitindriyaassāsapassāsaviññāṇādīnaṃ samavāyasambandhena
analyzed: saṃgatībhāvā ti catu mahābhūta jīvita indriya assāsa passāsa viññāṇa ādīnam samavāya sambandhena
translated: The coming together of many things: the four great entities, the life faculty, in-breath and out-breath, consciousness, etc., are bound together by the relation of co-existence.

original: suttamerakasamavāyena yantaṃ viya ṭhānādiiriyāpathaṃ kappeti.
analyzed: sutta meraka samavāyena yantam viya ṭhāna ādi iriyāpatham kappeti
translated: The coming together of the strands is like the coming together of the parts of a chariot. It makes the postures, standing, etc., possible.

original: Dhuvappayāto maraṇāyāti, maraṇassa atthāya ekantagamano, nibbattito paṭṭhāya maraṇaṃ🔽pati pavatto. Tato eva maccurājassa maraṇassa santike ṭhito. Idheva chaḍḍayitvānāti,🔽imasmiṃyeva loke kāyaṃ chaḍḍetvā, yathārucitaṭṭhānagāmī ayaṃ satto, tasmā “pahāya
analyzed: dhuvappayātaḥ maraṇāya ati maraṇassa atthāya ekanta gamanaḥ nibbattitaḥ paṭṭhāya maraṇam  pati pavatto tatas eva maccurājassa maraṇassa santike ṭhitaḥ idha iva chaḍḍayitvā anāti  imasmin yeva loke kāyam chaḍḍetvā yathārucita ṭṭhāna gāmī ayam satto tasmā pahāya
translated: Constantly on the way to death: going straight to death, going towards death. From the moment of rebirth he is on the way to death.

original: gamanīyo ayaṃ kāyo”ti evampi saṅgo na kātabboti dasseti.
analyzed: gamanīyaḥ ayam kāyaḥ iti evam pi saṅgaḥ na kātabbaḥ iti dasseti
translated: Therefore he is standing close to the king of death, to death. Having left it here: having left the body here in this world, the being goes to the place he likes. Therefore he shows that one should not be attached to the body, thinking: “This body is to be left and gone from.”

original: Avijjāya nivutoti, avijjānīvaraṇena nivuto paṭicchāditādīnavo, aññathā ko ettha saṅgaṃ
analyzed: avijjāya nivuto ti avijjā nīvaraṇena nivutaḥ paṭicchādita ādīnavaḥ aññathā kaḥ ettha saṅgam
translated: Covered by ignorance: covered by the obstruction of ignorance, hidden from the danger of it, otherwise what attachment could there be here?

original: janeyyāti adhippāyo. Catuganthenāti, abhijjhākāyaganthādinā catubbidhena ganthena🔽ganthito, ganthaniyabhāvena vinaddhito. Oghasaṃsīdanoti, oghaniyabhāvena kāmoghādīsu
analyzed: janeyya ati adhippāyaḥ catu ganthena ati abhijjhā kāya gantha ādinā catubbidhena ganthena  ganthitaḥ ganthaniya bhāvena vinaddhitaḥ ogha saṃsīdanaḥ ogha niya bhāvena kāma ogha ādīsu
translated: the meaning intended is: ‘he would know’. ‘With the four fetters’: fettered by the fourfold fetter beginning with covetousness,🔽fettered by the fetter of the fetterable. ‘With the four floods as mire’: sinking in the four floods beginning with the flood of sense desires,

original: catūsu oghesu saṃsīdanako. Appahīnabhāvena santāne anu anu sentīti anusayā, kāmarāgādayo🔽anusayā. Tesaṃ jālena otthato abhibhūtoti anusayājālamotthato. Makāro padasandhikaro,🔽gāthāsukhatthaṃ dīghaṃ katvā vuttaṃ. Kāmacchandādinā pañcavidhena nīvaraṇena yutto🔽adhimuttoti pañcanīvaraṇe yutto, karaṇatthe bhummavacanaṃ.🔽Kāmavitakkādinā micchāvitakkena samappito samassitoti vitakkena samappito. Taṇhāmūlenānugatoti,
analyzed: catūsu oghesu saṃsīdanakaḥ appahīna bhāvena santāne anu anu senti iti kāma rāga ādayo  tesam jālena otthataḥ abhibhūto ti makāro pada sandhi karo  gāthā sukha attham dīgham katvā vuttam kāmacchanda ādinā pañcavidhena nīvaraṇena yuttaḥ  adhimuttaḥ ti pañca nīvaraṇe yuttaḥ karaṇa atthe bhumma vacanam  kāma vitakka ādinā micchā vitakkena samappitaḥ samassitaḥ iti vitakkena samappitaḥ taṇhā mūlena anugataḥ ti
translated: because of the state of being flooded. ‘With the seven underlying tendencies as a net’: covered by the net of the underlying tendencies, because of the state of being covered by the net of the underlying tendencies. The underlying tendencies are the underlying tendencies of sense desire, etc.🔽They are called ‘underlying tendencies’ because they lie hidden in the continuum of one who has not abandoned them. ‘With the five lower fetters as a snare’: caught in the snare of the five lower fetters, because of the state of being caught in the snare of the five lower fetters. The five lower fetters are sense desire, resentment, adherence to rules and vows, sense of ‘I am’, and sense of ‘I am this’.

original: taṇhāsaṅkhātena bhavamūlena anubaddho. Mohacchādanachāditoti, sammohasaṅkhātena āvaraṇena
analyzed: taṇhā saṅkhātena bhava mūlena anubaddhaḥ moha chādana chāditaḥ iti sammoha saṅkhātena āvaraṇena
translated: ‘With the five hindrances as a yoke’: yoked to the five hindrances, because of the state of being yoked to the five hindrances. The five hindrances are the hindrance of sense desire, the hindrance of resentment, the hindrance of sloth and torpor, the hindrance of restlessness and remorse, and the hindrance of doubt.🔽‘With wrong reflection as a covering’: covered by wrong reflection, because of the state of being covered by wrong reflection. Wrong reflection is wrong reflection beginning with sense desire.

original: paliguṇṭhito. Sabbametaṃ saviññāṇakaṃ karajakāyaṃ sandhāya vadati. Saviññāṇako hi
analyzed: paliguṇṭhitaḥ sabbam etam sa viññāṇakam karaja kāyam sandhāya vadati sa viññāṇakaḥ hi
translated: and is wrapped up. All this he says with reference to the physical frame with consciousness. For the physical frame with consciousness🔽is called “body” in such passages as “The body of the Tathāgata remains, monks, with the guide to becoming cut off” ,

original: attabhāvo “ucchinnabhavanettiko, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa kāyo tiṭṭhati, ayañceva🔽kāyo bahiddhā ca nāmarūpa”ntiādīsu kāyoti vuccati, evāyaṃ vattate kāyoti evaṃ “nānākulamalasampuṇṇo”tiādinā🔽“avijjāya nivuto”tiādinā ca vuttappakārena ayaṃ kāyo vattati, vattanto ca kammayantena🔽sukatadukkaṭena kammasaṅkhātena yantena yantito saṅghaṭito. Yathā vā khemantaṃ gantuṃ🔽na sakkoti, tathā saṅkhobhito sugatiduggatīsu vattati paribbhamati. Sampatti ca vipatyantāti
analyzed: atta bhāvaḥ ucchinna bhavanettikaḥ bhikkhave tathāgatassa kāyaḥ tiṭṭhati ayam ca eva  kāyaḥ bahiddhā ca nāma rūpa nti ādīsu kāyo iti vuccati eva ayam vattate kāyo iti evam nānā kula mala sampuṇṇaḥ iti ādinā  ca vutta ppakārena ayam kāyaḥ vattati ca  su kata dukkaṭena kamma saṅkhātena yantena yantitaḥ saṅghaṭitaḥ yathā vā khemantam gantum  na sakkoti tathā saṅkhobhito sugati duggatīsu vattati paribbhamati sampatti ca
translated: and “This body and the external material form” . So this body goes on🔽being as described in the passage beginning “Full of various kinds of filth”🔽and ending “Enveloped in ignorance” . And while it goes on, it is driven

original: yā ettha sampatti, sā vipattipariyosānā. Sabbañhi yobbanaṃ jarāpariyosānaṃ, sabbaṃ
analyzed: yā ettha sampatti sā vipatti pariyosānā sabbam hi yobbanam jarā pariyosānam sabbam
translated: by the machine of kamma consisting of good and bad kamma, and it is put together by it. Or just as a ship cannot go without being put together with planks and so on, so this body cannot go without being put together by the machine of kamma consisting of good and bad kamma. It goes on being driven and put together. And it goes on being driven and put together in the various kinds of becoming, generation, destiny, station, and abode of consciousness, and in the several kinds of families, etc., according to the good and bad kamma done. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of wombs, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of births, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of abodes, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of states of existence, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of ways of departure from one existence to another, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of ways of arrival at a new existence, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of ways of being, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of ways of rebirth, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of ways of becoming, according as the kamma is good or bad. And it goes on being driven and put together in the several kinds of ways of standing, according as the kamma is good or bad.

original: ārogyaṃ byādhipariyosānaṃ, sabbaṃ jīvitaṃ maraṇapariyosānaṃ, sabbo samāgamo viyogapariyosāno.🔽Tenāha “nānābhāvo vipajjatī”ti. Nānābhāvoti, vinābhāvo vippayogo, so kadāci vippayuñjakassa
analyzed: ārogyam byādhi pariyosānam sabbam jīvitam maraṇa pariyosānam sabbaḥ samāgamaḥ viyoga pariyosānaḥ  tena āha nānābhāvaḥ vipajjati iti vinābhāvaḥ vippayogo saḥ kadāci vippayuñjakassa
translated: Health ends in sickness, all life ends in death, all coming together ends in separation.🔽Hence it is said: “Separation ends in loss.” “Separation” means absence, separation, parting. Sometimes it is used in the sense of the one who separates, and sometimes in the sense of the one who is separated.

original: vasena, kadāci vippayuñjitabbassa vasenāti vividhaṃ pajjati pāpuṇīyati.🔽Yemaṃ kāyaṃ mamāyantīti ye andhabālā puthujjanā evaṃ asubhaṃ aniccaṃ adhuvaṃ dukkhaṃ🔽asāraṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ “mama ida”nti gaṇhantā mamāyanti chandarāgaṃ uppādenti, te jātiādīhi
analyzed: vasena kadāci vippayuñjitabbassa vasena ati vividham pajjati pāpuṇīyati  ye imam kāyam mamāyanti iti ye andha bālāḥ puthujjanāḥ evam asubham aniccam a dhuvam dukkham  asāram imam kāyam mama chanda rāgam uppādenti te jāti ādīhi
translated: Thus it is said that “separation ends in loss” in the sense that it is subject to loss.🔽“Those who cling to this body as ‘mine’”: those blind fools, the worldlings, who take this foul, impermanent, unstable, painful,🔽insubstantial body as “mine,” as “I,” as “my self,” and arouse craving and attachment,

original: nirayādīhi ca ghoraṃ bhayānakaṃ apaṇḍitehi abhiramitabbato kaṭasisaṅkhātaṃ saṃsāraṃ
analyzed: niraya ādīhi ca ghoram bhayānakam apaṇḍitehi kaṭasi saṅkhātam saṃsāram
translated: they increase the fearful, terrifying round of existence, which is called the “wilderness,” because the unwise must delight in it again and again, through the process of birth, etc.,

original: punappunaṃ jananamaraṇādīhi vaḍḍhenti, tenāha “ādiyanti punabbhava”nti.
analyzed: punar punar janana maraṇa ādīhi vaḍḍhenti tena āha ādiyanti punar bhavanti
translated: and through the process of hell, etc. Hence it is said: “They take up existence again.”

original: Yemaṃ kāyaṃ vivajjenti, gūthalittaṃva pannaganti yathā nāma puriso sukhakāmo jīvitukāmo
analyzed: ye imam kāyam vivajjenti gūtha littam iva pannaganti yathā nāma purisaḥ sukha kāmaḥ jīvitu kāmaḥ
translated: “Those who avoid this body, as one would avoid a pit of excrement”: just as a man who desires happiness and life

original: gūthagataṃ āsīvisaṃ disvā jigucchaniyatāya vā sappaṭibhayatāya vā vivajjeti na allīyati,
analyzed: gūtha gatam āsīvisam disvā jiguccha niyatāya vā sa paṭibhaya tāya vā vivajjeti na allīyati
translated: Just as a wise man, seeing a poisonous snake in the excrement, would avoid it, would not approach it, because of its repulsiveness or because of its danger,

original: evamevaṃ ye paṇḍitā kulaputtā asucibhāvena jegucchaṃ aniccādibhāvena sappaṭibhayaṃ
analyzed: evam evam ye paṇḍitā kula puttāḥ asuci bhāvena jeguccham anicca ādi bhāvena sa paṭibhayam
translated: so too, those wise sons of good family avoid this body, which is repulsive because of its impurity, and which is dangerous because of its impermanence, etc.,

original: imaṃ kāyaṃ vivajjenti chandarāgappahānena pajahanti. Te bhavamūlaṃ avijjaṃ bhavataṇhañca🔽vamitvā chaḍḍetvā accantameva pahāya tato eva sabbaso anāsavā saupādisesāya anupādisesāya
analyzed: imam kāyam vivajjenti chanda rāga pahānena pajahanti te bhava mūlam avijjam bhava taṇham ca  vamitvā chaḍḍetvā accantam eva pahāya tatas eva sabbasas anāsavā sa aupādisesāya anupādisesāya
translated: by abandoning desire and lust for it. They will vomit up and cast off the root of existence, ignorance, and craving for existence,

original: ca nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyissantīti.
analyzed: ca nibbāna dhātuyā parinibbāyissanti iti
translated: and having completely abandoned it, they will attain final Nibbāna in the Nibbāna-element without residue left, and also with residue left.

original: Kappattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kappatthera gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Elder Kappā is finished.

original: 6. Vaṅgantaputtaupasenattheragāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vaṅganta putta aupasena thera gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Verses of the Elder Upasena, the Son of Vaṅganta

original: Vivittaṃ appanigghosantiādikā āyasmato upasenattherassa gāthā. Kā uppatti? Ayaṃ kira
analyzed: vivittam āyasmataḥ upasena therassa gāthā kā uppatti ayam kira
translated: “Secluded, with little noise” — these are the verses of the venerable Upasena. What is their origin? It seems that in the time of the Blessed One Padumuttara,🔽having been reborn in a good family in the city of Haṃsavatī,

original: padumuttarassa bhagavato kāle haṃsavatīnagare kulagehe nibbattitvā vayappatto satthu
analyzed: padumuttarassa bhagavataḥ kāle haṃsavatīnagare kula gehe nibbattitvā vaya patto satthu
translated: he reached maturity.

original: santikaṃ gantvā dhammaṃ suṇamāno satthāraṃ ekaṃ bhikkhuṃ samantapāsādikānaṃ aggaṭṭhāne
analyzed: santikam gantvā dhammam suṇamāno satthāram ekam bhikkhum samantapāsādikānam aggaṭṭhāne
translated: and going to the Teacher, listening to the Dhamma, the Teacher placed one monk at the head of those who were entirely lovely,

original: ṭhapentaṃ disvā satthu adhikārakammaṃ katvā taṃ ṭhānantaraṃ patthetvā yāvajīvaṃ kusalaṃ
analyzed: ṭhapentam disvā satthu adhikāra kammam katvā tam ṭhāna antaram patthetvā yāvajīvam kusalam
translated: and going to the Teacher, heard the Law. Seeing the Teacher place a certain monk in the foremost position among those who are lovely in all ways, he performed a service for the Teacher, and aspiring to that position, did good for the space of life,

original: katvā devamanussesu saṃsaranto imasmiṃ buddhuppāde nālakagāme rūpasārībrāhmaṇiyā
analyzed: katvā deva manussesu saṃsarantaḥ imasmin buddhuppāde nālakagāme rūpasārī brāhmaṇiyā
translated: and after transmigrating through the round of existences among gods and men, he was born in the family of a Brahman of the Rūpasārī village in this arising of the Buddha,

original: kucchimhi nibbatti, upasenotissa nāmaṃ ahosi. So vayappatto tayo vede uggahetvā satthu
analyzed: kucchimhi nibbatti upasena utissa nāmam ahosi saḥ vaya pattaḥ tayaḥ vede uggahetvā satthu
translated: and received the name Upasena. He, having attained to years of discretion, having learned the three Vedas,

original: santike dhammaṃ sutvā paṭiladdhasaddho pabbajitvā upasampadāya ekavassiko “ariyagabbhaṃ🔽vaḍḍhemī”ti ekaṃ kulaputtaṃ attano santike upasampādetvā tena saddhiṃ satthu santikaṃ🔽gato. Satthārā cassa tassa avassikassa bhikkhuno saddhivihārikabhāvaṃ sutvā, “atilahuṃ
analyzed: santike dhammam sutvā paṭiladdha saddhaḥ pabbajitvā upasampadāya ekavassikaḥ ariya gabbham  vaḍḍhemi iti ekam kula puttam attano santike upasampādetvā tena saddhim satthu santikam  gataḥ satthārā ca ssa tassa avassikassa bhikkhuno saddhivihārika bhāvam sutvā ati lahum
translated: having heard the Law in the presence of the Teacher, having obtained faith, having gone forth, having received the higher ordination, having been one year, thinking, “I will increase the noble womb,”

original: kho tvaṃ, moghapurisa, bāhullāya āvatto”ti garahito. “Idānāhaṃ yadipi parisaṃ nissāya
analyzed: kho tvam mogha purisa bāhullāya āvatto ti garahitaḥ idānā aham yadi pi parisam nissāya
translated: having ordained a young man in his own presence, went with him to the presence of the Teacher. The Teacher, having heard that that monk of one year’s standing was the preceptor of that young man, rebuked him, saying, “You have, foolish man, gone too far in your indulgence.” “Now, if I am to be rebuked by the Teacher in the midst of the assembly,

original: satthārā garahito, parisaṃyeva pana nissāya satthu pāsaṃsopi bhavissāmī”ti vipassanāya
analyzed: satthārā garahito parisaṃyā iva pana nissāya satthu pāsaṃsaḥ api bhavissāmi iti vipassanāya
translated: and he thought, “I have been reproved by the Teacher, but I will win the praise of the Teacher by depending upon the company of monks.”

original: kammaṃ karonto nacirasseva arahattaṃ pāpuṇi. Tena vuttaṃ apadāne –
analyzed: kammam karontaḥ nacirassa iva arahattam pāpuṇi tena vuttam apadāne
translated: and in a short time he attained Arahatship. Therefore it is said in the Apadana:🔽I saw the Blessed One Padumuttara,

original: “Padumuttaraṃ bhagavantaṃ, lokajeṭṭhaṃ narāsabhaṃ;
analyzed: padumuttaram bhagavantam loka jeṭṭham narāsabham
translated: The Chief of the world, the Best of Men,🔽Seated on the mountain top,

original: Pabbhāramhi nisīdantaṃ, upagacchiṃ naruttamaṃ.
analyzed: pabbhāramhi nisīdantam upagacchim naruttamam
translated: The Supreme of Men.🔽Seeing the flower of the Kanikara tree,

original: “Kaṇikārapupphaṃ disvā, vaṇṭe chetvānahaṃ tadā;
analyzed: kaṇikāra puppham disvā vaṇṭe chetvān aham tadā
translated: I cut it from the stalk,🔽And having adorned it with a parasol,

original: Alaṅkaritvā chattamhi, buddhassa abhiropayiṃ.
analyzed: alaṅkaritvā chattamhi buddhassa
translated: I offered it to the Buddha.🔽And I gave him alms,

original: “Piṇḍapātañca pādāsiṃ, paramannaṃ subhojanaṃ;
analyzed: piṇḍapātam ca pāda asim param annam su bhojanam
translated: The choicest food, the best of viands.🔽The Buddha, with the eight monks,

original: Buddhena navame tattha, samaṇe aṭṭha bhojayiṃ.🔽“Anumodi mahāvīro, sayambhū aggapuggalo;
analyzed: buddhena navame tattha samaṇe aṭṭha bhojayiṃ  anumodi mahāvīro sayambhū agga puggalo
translated: Ate the food I gave.🔽The Great Hero, the Self-Existent One,🔽The Chief of men, rejoiced.

original: Iminā chattadānena, paramannapavecchanā.
analyzed: iminā chatta dānena param anna pavā icchanā
translated: “By the gift of the parasol,🔽And by the gift of the choicest food,🔽By the faith that was in my heart,

original: “Tena cittappasādena, sampattimanubhossasi;🔽Chattiṃsakkhattuṃ devindo, devarajjaṃ karissati.
analyzed: tena citta ppasādena sampattim anubhossasi  chattiṃsa khattum devindaḥ deva rajjam karissati
translated: I attained to prosperity.🔽Thirty-six times he was the Chief of the Gods,🔽And thirty-six times a Universal Monarch.

original: “Ekavīsatikkhattuñca, cakkavattī bhavissati;
analyzed: ekavīsati kkhattum ca cakkavattī bhavissati
translated: Twenty-one times he was a king of men,

original: Padesarajjaṃ vipulaṃ, gaṇanāto asaṅkhiyaṃ.
analyzed: padesa rajjam vipulam gaṇanātaḥ asaṅkhiyam
translated: And a vast kingdom, beyond reckoning,

original: “Satasahassito kappe, okkākakulasambhavo;
analyzed: sata sahassitaḥ kappe okkāka kula sambhavaḥ
translated: “After a hundred thousand eons, one born in the Okkāka family,

original: Gotamo nāma gottena, satthā loke bhavissati.
analyzed: gotamaḥ nāma gottena satthā loke bhavissati
translated: Will be a teacher in the world, named Gotama by clan.

original: “Sāsane dibbamānamhi, manussattaṃ gamissati;
analyzed: sāsane dibba mānamhi manussattam gamissati
translated: “When the divine glory of his Dispensation has declined, he will be reborn as a human being,

original: Tassa dhammesu dāyādo, oraso dhammanimmito.
analyzed: tassa dhammesu dāyādaḥ orasaḥ dhamma nimmito
translated: And will be an heir in the Dhamma, a disciple created by the Dhamma.

original: “Upasenoti nāmena, hessati satthu sāvako;
analyzed: upasenaḥ uti nāmena hessati satthu sāvako
translated: “Named Upasena, he will be a disciple of the Teacher,

original: Samantapāsādikattā, aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapessati.
analyzed: samantapāsādikattā aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapessati
translated: And because of his all-round pleasingness, he will be placed in the foremost position.

original: “Carimaṃ vattate mayhaṃ, bhavā sabbe samūhatā;
analyzed: carimam vattate mayham sabbe samūhatā
translated: “This is my last birth, all my future states of existence are destroyed;

original: Dhāremi antimaṃ dehaṃ, jetvā māraṃ savāhanaṃ.
analyzed: dhāremi antimam deham jetvā māram sa vāhanam
translated: Having conquered Māra with his vehicle, I bear my last body.

original: “Paṭisambhidā catasso…pe… kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: paṭisambhidā katam buddhassa sāsananti
translated: He has attained the four analytical knowledges … He has done the Buddha’s bidding.”

original: Arahattaṃ pana patvā sayampi sabbe dhutaṅgadhamme samādāya vattati, aññepi tadatthāya
analyzed: arahattam pana patvā sayam pi sabbe dhutaṅga dhamme samādāya vattati aññe pi tad atthāya
translated: But after attaining arahatship, he himself undertook all the ascetic practices and

original: samādapeti, tena naṃ bhagavā samantapāsādikānaṃ aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi. So aparena samayena
analyzed: samādapa iti tena nam bhagavā samantapāsādikānam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi saḥ aparena samayena

original: kosambiyaṃ kalahe uppanne bhikkhusaṅghe ca dvidhābhūte ekena bhikkhunā taṃ kalahaṃ
analyzed: kosambiyam kalahe uppanne bhikkhu saṅghe ca dvidhā bhūte ekena bhikkhunā tam kalahaṃ

translated: asked, “Now a dispute has arisen, the Order has split into two factions. How should I conduct myself?

original: mayā paṭipajjitabba”nti puṭṭho vivekavāsato paṭṭhāya tassa paṭipattiṃ kathento –
analyzed: mayā paṭipajjitabbanti puṭṭhaḥ viveka vāsataḥ paṭṭhāya tassa paṭipattim kathentaḥ
translated: ” and, beginning with living in solitude, he told him the way to conduct himself:

original: “Vivittaṃ appanigghosaṃ, vāḷamiganisevitaṃ;
analyzed: vivittam appa nigghosam vāḷa miga nisevitam
translated: “Solitary, with little noise, frequented by wild beasts,

analyzed: seve senāsanam bhikkhu paṭisallāna kāraṇā
translated: A monk should frequent a lodging for the sake of seclusion.

analyzed: saṅkāra puñjāḥ āhatvā su sānāḥ rathiyāhi ca
translated: “Having brought together a heap of rubbish, from charnel grounds and from roads,

analyzed: tatas saṅghāṭikam katvā lūkham dhāreyya cīvaram
translated: And having made a patchwork cloak, he should wear a coarse cloak.

original: “Nīcaṃ manaṃ karitvāna, sapadānaṃ kulā kulaṃ;
analyzed: nīcam manam karitvāna sapadānam kulā kulam
translated: “Having made his mind humble, from house to house in order,

original: Piṇḍikāya care bhikkhu, guttadvāro susaṃvuto.
analyzed: piṇḍikāya care bhikkhu gutta dvāraḥ su saṃvutaḥ
translated: A monk should wander for alms, his sense doors guarded, well concentrated.

original: “Lūkhenapi vā santusse, nāññaṃ patthe rasaṃ bahuṃ;
analyzed: lūkhena api vā santusse na aññam patthe rasam bahum
translated: “If he is satisfied even with coarse , he does not seek another, much finer, taste.

original: Rasesu anugiddhassa, jhāne na ramatī mano.
analyzed: rasesu anugiddhassa jhāne na ramatī manaḥ
translated: The mind of one who is greedy for tastes does not delight in jhāna.

original: “Appiccho ceva santuṭṭho, pavivitto vase muni;
analyzed: appicchaḥ ca iva santuṭṭhaḥ pavivittaḥ vase muni
translated: “The sage should live with little desire and be content, secluded;

original: Asaṃsaṭṭho gahaṭṭhehi, anāgārehi cūbhayaṃ.
analyzed: a saṃsaṭṭhaḥ gahaṭṭhehi anāgārehi ca ubhayam
translated: Not associating with householders and renunciates on both sides.

original: “Yathā jaḷo va mūgo va, attānaṃ dassaye tathā;🔽Nātivelaṃ sambhāseyya, saṅghamajjhamhi paṇḍito.
analyzed: yathā jaḷaḥ va mūgaḥ va attānam dassaye tathā  na ativelam sambhāseyya saṅgha majjhamhi paṇḍitaḥ
translated: “As if he were dumb or mute, So should he act in the midst of the Saṅgha.🔽The wise one should not speak too much.

original: “Na so upavade kañci, upaghātaṃ vivajjaye;
analyzed: na saḥ upavade kañci upaghātam vivajjaye
translated: “He should not revile anyone, He should avoid doing harm.

analyzed: saṃvutaḥ pātimokkhasmim mattaññū ca ssa bhojane
translated: Restrained in the Pāṭimokkha, He should know the right amount in eating.

original: 584. “Suggahītanimittassa, cittassuppādakovido.
analyzed: suggahīta nimittassa
translated: “One who has well grasped the sign, Skilled in the arising of consciousness,

original: Samathaṃ anuyuñjeyya, kālena ca vipassanaṃ.
analyzed: samatham anuyuñjeyya kālena ca vipassanam
translated: Should apply himself to serenity, And at the right time to insight.

original: “Vīriyasātaccasampanno, yuttayogo sadā siyā;
analyzed: vīriya sātacca sampannaḥ yutta yogaḥ sadā siyā
translated: “Endowed with energy and self-control, He should always be devoted to meditation.

original: Na ca appatvā dukkhantaṃ, vissāsaṃ eyya paṇḍito.
analyzed: na ca a patvā dukkhantam vissāsam eyya paṇḍito
translated: The wise one should not be confident Until he has reached the end of suffering.

original: “Evaṃ viharamānassa, suddhikāmassa bhikkhuno;
analyzed: evam viharamānassa suddhi kāmassa bhikkhunaḥ
translated: “For a bhikkhu who lives thus, Who is pure and desires purity,

original: Khīyanti āsavā sabbe, nibbutiñcādhigacchatī”ti. –
analyzed: khīyanti āsavā sabbe nibbutiñca adhigacchati iti
translated: All his cankers will be destroyed, And he will attain nibbāna.”

original: Imā gāthā abhāsi.
analyzed: imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāsi
translated: He spoke these verses.

original: Tattha vivittanti, janavivittaṃ suññaṃ araññādiṃ. Appanigghosanti, nissaddaṃ saddasaṅghaṭṭanarahitaṃ.
analyzed: tattha vivittam ti jana vivittam suññam arañña ādim appanigghosam nissaddam sadda saṅghaṭṭana rahitam

original: Vāḷamiganisevitanti, sīhabyagghadīpivāḷamigehi caritaṃ. Imināpi janavivekaṃyeva dasseti
analyzed: vāḷamiga nisevitanti sīha byaggha dīpi vāḷamigehi caritam iminā api jana vivekaṃ yā iva dasseti
translated: Frequented by animals means frequented by lions, tigers, panthers, hyenas, and so on. This too shows seclusion from the clamorous crowd.

original: pantasenāsanabhāvadīpanato. Senāsananti, sayituṃ āsayituñca yuttabhāvena vasanaṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: senāsananti sayitum āsayitum ca yutta bhāvena vasana ṭṭhānam
translated: It is called “a lodging” because it is suitable for lying down and sitting in.🔽Herein, “lodging” is intended as a place for living in.

original: idha senāsananti adhippetaṃ. Paṭisallānakāraṇāti, paṭisallānanimittaṃ, nānārammaṇato
analyzed: idha senāsananti adhippetam paṭisallāna kāraṇā ati paṭisallāna nimittam nānā ārammaṇataḥ
translated: “Reason for seclusion” is the cause for seclusion, for the purpose of seclusion.

original: nivattetvā kammaṭṭhāneyeva cittassa paṭi paṭi sammadeva allīyanatthaṃ.
analyzed: nivattetvā kammaṭṭhāneyā iva cittassa paṭi paṭi sammad eva allīyana ttham
translated: For the purpose of making the mind enter into and settle on the meditation subject by turning away from the various objects.

original: Evaṃ bhāvanānurūpaṃ senāsanaṃ niddisanto senāsane santosaṃ dassetvā idāni cīvarādīsupi🔽taṃ dassetuṃ “saṃkārapuñjā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha saṃkārapuñjāti saṃkārānaṃ puñjaṃ
analyzed: evam bhāvanā anurūpam senāsanam niddisantaḥ senāsane santosam dassetvā idāni cīvara ādīsu pi  tam dassetum saṃkāra puñja āti ādi vuttam tattha saṃkāra puñjā ati saṃkārānam puñjam
translated: Having thus shown contentment with a lodging suitable for development, he now shows contentment with robes, etc.,🔽saying “In a heap of discarded rubbish” and so on. Herein, a heap of discarded rubbish is a heap of rubbish discarded in a rubbish place.🔽From there: from that place.🔽Having brought: having fetched.

original: saṃkārapuñjaṃ, tato kacavaraṭṭhānā. Āhatvāti āharitvā. Tatoti tathā āhaṭacoḷakkhaṇḍehi.
analyzed: saṃkāra puñjam tatas kaca vara ṭṭhānā āhatvā iti āharitvā tatas ti tathā āhaṭa coḷa khaṇḍehi
translated: There: from the pieces of cloth thus fetched.

original: Karaṇe hi idaṃ nissakkavacanaṃ lūkhanti satthalūkharajanalūkhādinā lūkhaṃ avaṇṇāmaṭṭhaṃ.
analyzed: karaṇe hi idam nissakka vacanam lūkhanti sattha lūkhara jana lūkha ādinā lūkham avaṇṇāmaṭṭham

original: Dhāreyyāti nivāsanādivasena parihareyya, etena cīvarasantosaṃ vadati.
analyzed: dhāreyya ati nivāsanā divasena parihareyya etena cīvara santosam vadati
translated: He should wear: he should use by way of wearing under-robes, etc. With this he shows contentment with robes.

original: Nīca manaṃ karitvānāti “antamidaṃ, bhikkhave, jīvikāna”ntiādikaṃ sugatovādaṃ anussaritvā
analyzed: nīca manam anussaritvā
translated: Having made the mind low, having recollected the Sugata’s words beginning with: “Monks, this is the end of living in a home” ,

original: nihatamānadappaṃ cittaṃ katvā. Sapadānanti gharesu avakhaṇḍarahitaṃ; anugharanti
analyzed: nihata māna dappam cittam katvā sa padānanti gharesu avakhaṇḍa rahitam anugharanti
translated: Having lowered his mind: having made his mind free from conceit by recollecting the Sugata’s words beginning with: “Monks, this is the end of the search for a living” .🔽House to house: without skipping houses; the meaning is,

analyzed: attho tena āha kulā kulanti kulā kulanti kulatas kulam kula anupubbiyā ghara paṭipāṭiyā iti
translated: without omitting. House to house: from house to house; the meaning is, in the order of the houses.

original: attho. Piṇḍikāyāti missakabhikkhāya, iminā piṇḍapātasantosaṃ vadati. Guttadvāroti
analyzed: piṇḍikāya ti missaka bhikkhāya iminā piṇḍapāta santosam vadati gutta dvārā ti
translated: For alms food: for mixed alms; by this he shows contentment with alms food.🔽With doors well guarded: with the doors of the eye, etc., well closed.

original: supihitacakkhādidvāro. Susaṃvutoti hatthakukkuccādīnaṃ abhāvena suṭṭhu saṃvuto.
analyzed: su pihita cakkha ādi dvāraḥ su saṃvutaḥ ti hattha kukkucca ādīnaṃ abhāvena suṭṭhu saṃvutaḥ
translated: Well restrained: well restrained by the absence of such faults as haste.

original: Lūkhenapi vāti apisaddo samuccaye, vā-saddo vikappe. Ubhayenapi lūkhenapi appenapi
analyzed: lūkhena api vā ati api saddo samuccaye vā saddaḥ vikappe ubhayena api lūkhena api appena api
translated: Even with coarse food: the word api has the meaning of “even” ; the word vā has the meaning of “or.” With coarse food or with fine food,

analyzed: yena kenacid sulabhena itarītarena santusse samam sammā tusseyya tena āha na aññam patthe
translated: with whatever is easily obtained, with whatever is available, he should be content, satisfied, and fully content. Therefore it is said: “He should not long for other tastes, for many flavors.”

original: rasaṃ bahu”nti. Nāññaṃ patthe rasaṃ bahunti attanā yathāladdhato aññaṃ madhurādirasaṃ
analyzed: rasam bahunti na aññam patthe rasam bahunti attanā yathā laddhataḥ aññam madhura ādi rasam
translated: He should not long for other tastes, for many flavors: he should not long for other tastes such as sweet, etc., than the one he has obtained.

original: bahuṃ paṇītañca na pattheyya na piheyya, iminā gilānapaccayepi santoso dassito hoti.🔽Rasesu gedhavāraṇatthaṃ pana kāraṇaṃ vadanto rasesu anugiddhassa, jhāne na ramatī
analyzed: bahum paṇītam ca na pattheyya na piheyya iminā gilāna paccaye pi santosaḥ dassito hoti  rasesu gedha vāraṇa attham pana kāraṇam vadantaḥ rasesu anugiddhassa jhāne na ramati
translated: He would not wish for or long for much or choice food. This shows contentment with the requisite of medicine.🔽But when he is greedy for tastes, his mind does not delight in jhāna.

original: mano”ti āha. Indriyasaṃvarampi aparipūrentassa kuto vikkhittacittasamādhānanti adhippāyo.🔽Evaṃ catūsu paccayesu sallekhapaṭipattiṃ dassetvā idāni avasiṭṭhakathāvatthūni dassetuṃ
analyzed: manaḥ ti āha indriya saṃvaram pi a paripūrentassa kutas vikkhitta citta samādhānan ti adhippāyaḥ  evam catūsu paccayesu sallekha paṭipattim dassetvā idāni avasiṭṭha kathā vatthūni dassetum
translated: The intention is that how can there be concentration in one whose mind is distracted because he does not fulfil the virtue of restraint of the sense faculties?🔽Having thus shown the practice of renunciation in regard to the four requisites, he now said, “If he is not greedy for tastes” in order to show the remaining topics of the teaching.

original: “appiccho cevā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tattha appicchoti, aniccho catūsu paccayesu icchārahito,🔽tena catubbidhapaccayesu taṇhuppādavikkhambhanamāha. Santuṭṭhoti, catūsu paccayesu
analyzed: appiccho ca iva atiādi vuttam tattha appiccho ti aniccho catūsu paccayesu icchā rahito  tena catubbidha paccayesu taṇhā uppāda vikkhambhanam āha santuṭṭhaḥ ti catūsu paccayesu
translated: Herein, not greedy means not desirous, free from desire for the four requisites.🔽This shows the prevention of the arising of craving for the four requisites.🔽Content means content with what one gets, etc., in regard to the four requisites.

original: yathālābhasantosādinā santuṭṭho. Yo hi –
analyzed: yathā lābha santosa ādinā santuṭṭhaḥ yaḥ hi
translated: For he who is content is said to be

original: “Atītaṃ nānusoceyya, nappajappeyyanāgataṃ;
analyzed: atītam na anusoceyya na ppajappeyya anāgatam
translated: “Not sorrowing over the past, not longing for the future,

original: Paccuppannena yāpeyya, so ‘santuṭṭho’ti pavuccatī”ti.
analyzed: paccuppannena yāpeyya so santuṭṭhaḥ iti pavuccati iti
translated: Living content with present бods—he is called ‘content.’”

original: Pavivittoti gaṇasaṅgaṇikaṃ pahāya kāyena pavivitto vūpakaṭṭho. Cittavivekādike hi
analyzed: pavivittaḥ iti gaṇa saṅgaṇikam pahāya kāyena pavivittaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ citta viveka ādike hi
translated: “Alone”: having abandoned the company of a crowd, he is physically alone, secluded. For the seclusion of mind, etc.,🔽will be explained later on.

original: parato vakkhati. Vaseti sabbattha yojetabbaṃ. Moneyyadhammasamannāgamena muni. Asaṃsaṭṭhoti
analyzed: paratas vakkhati vasa iti sabbattha yojetabbam moneyya dhamma samannāgamena asaṃsaṭṭho ti
translated: “He controls his speech and is endowed with virtue”: he is a sage in the sense of one who has attained the virtue of self-control.

original: dassanasavanasamullapanasambhogakāyasaṃsaggānaṃ abhāvena asaṃsaṭṭho yathāvuttasaṃsaggarahito.
analyzed: dassana savana samullapana sambhoga kāya saṃsaggānam abhāvena asaṃsaṭṭhaḥ yathāvutta saṃsagga rahitaḥ
translated: “Unassociated”: he is unassociated with the five kinds of association, i.e., with seeing, hearing, etc., as explained above.

original: Ubhayanti, gahaṭṭhehi anāgārehi cāti ubhayehipi asaṃsaṭṭho. Karaṇe hi idaṃ paccattavacanaṃ.
analyzed: ubhayanti gahaṭṭhehi anāgārehi ca ati ubhayehi pi asaṃsaṭṭhaḥ karaṇe hi idam paccatta vacanam
translated: “With both”: he is unassociated with both householders and those gone forth. This is a reflexive pronoun.

original: Attānaṃ dassaye tathāti ajaḷo amūgopi samāno yathā jaḷo vā mūgo vā, tathā attānaṃ
analyzed: attānam dassaye tathā ati a jaḷaḥ a mūgaḥ api samānaḥ yathā jaḷaḥ vā mūgaḥ vā tathā attānam
translated: “He shows himself as if he were dull”: although he is not dull or stupid, he shows himself as if he were.

original: dasseyya, etena pāgabbiyappahānamāha. Jaḷo va mūgo vāti ca gāthāsukhatthaṃ rassattaṃ
analyzed: dasseyyaḥ etena pāgabbiya pahānam āha jaḷaḥ va mūgaḥ vā ati ca gāthā sukha attham
translated: This refers to the abandoning of ostentation. The expression “as if he were dull or stupid” is used for the sake of meter.

original: kataṃ, samuccayattho ca vāsaddo. Nātivelaṃ sambhāseyyāti ativelaṃ atikkantapamāṇaṃ
analyzed: katam samuccaya tthaḥ ca vā saddaḥ na ativelam sambhāseyyāti ativelam atikkanta pamāṇam
translated: “He should not speak too much”: he should not speak beyond the proper measure. The meaning is: he should be a moderate speaker.

original: na bhāseyya, mattabhāṇī assāti attho. Saṅghamajjhamhīti bhikkhusaṅghe, janasamūhe vā.
analyzed: na bhāseyya matta bhāṇī assa ati attho saṅgha majjhamhi iti bhikkhu saṅghe jana samūhe vā
translated: “In the midst of the Sangha”: in the midst of the bhikkhu Sangha or in the midst of a crowd of people.

original: Na so upavade kañcīti so yathāvuttapaṭipattiko bhikkhu hīnaṃ vā majjhimaṃ vā ukkaṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: na saḥ upavade kañci iti saḥ yathāvutta paṭipattikaḥ bhikkhu hīnam vā majjhimam vā ukkaṭṭham
translated: He would not revile another: this bhikkhu who has the aforesaid practice would not revile anyone, whether low, middling, or superior,

original: vā yaṃkiñci na vācāya upavadeyya. Upaghātaṃ vivajjayeti kāyena upaghātaṃ pariviheṭhanaṃ🔽vajjeyya. Saṃvuto pātimokkhasminti pātimokkhamhi pātimokkhasaṃvarasīle saṃvuto assa,🔽pātimokkhasaṃvarena pihitakāyavāco siyāti attho. Mattaññū cassa bhojaneti pariyesanapaṭiggahaṇaparibhogavissajjanesu
analyzed: vā yaṃkiñcid na vācāya upavadeyya upaghātam vivajjaya iti kāyena upaghātam pariviheṭhanam  vajjeyya saṃvutaḥ pātimokkhasmin ti pātimokkhamhi pātimokkha saṃvara sīle saṃvutaḥ assa  pātimokkha saṃvarena pihita kāya vācaḥ siyāti atthaḥ mattaññū ca ssa bhojane iti pariyesana paṭiggahaṇa paribhoga vissajjanesu
translated: with speech. He would avoid a blow: he would avoid striking with the hand, etc.,

original: bhojane pamāṇaññū siyā.🔽Suggahītanimittassāti “evaṃ me manasi karoto cittaṃ samāhitaṃ ahosī”ti tadākāraṃ🔽sallakkhento suṭṭhu gahitasamādhinimitto assa. “Suggahītanimitto so”tipi pāṭho, so
analyzed: bhojane pamāṇaññū siyā  suggahīta nimittassa ati evam me manasi karotaḥ cittam samāhitam ahosi iti tad ākāram  sallakkhentaḥ suṭṭhu gahita samādhi nimittaḥ assa su gahīta nimittaḥ saḥ ti pi pāṭhaḥ so
translated: and molesting with the body. He would be restrained by the Pātimokkha: he would be restrained by the restraint of the Pātimokkha rules of training. The meaning is: he would be one who has closed the door of offenses by means of the restraint of the Pātimokkha. He would know the proper amount in eating: he would know the proper amount in the search for, the acceptance of, the enjoyment of, and the evaluation of food.

original: yogīti attho. Cittassuppādakovidoti evaṃ bhāvayato cittaṃ līnaṃ hoti, “evaṃ uddhata”nti
analyzed: yogī iti attho cittassa uppāda kovido ti evam bhāvayato cittam līnam hoti evam uddhatanti
translated: He would be one who has well apprehended the sign: he would be one who has well apprehended the sign of concentration by reflecting thus, “When I attend in such a way, my mind becomes concentrated.” The reading “Suggahītanimitto so” is also allowable; the meaning is, that yogi. He would be skilled in the arising of consciousness: he would be skilled in the arising of consciousness in one who develops concentration in this way.

original: līnassa uddhatassa ca cittassa uppattikāraṇe kusalo assa. Līne hi citte dhammavicayavīriyapītisambojjhaṅgā
analyzed: līnassa uddhatassa ca cittassa uppatti kāraṇe kusalaḥ assa līne hi citte dhamma vicaya vīriya pīti sambojjhaṅgā
translated: He should be skilled in the causes for the arising of sluggish and excited consciousness. For when consciousness is sluggish, the enlightenment factors of investigation of states, energy, and rapture

original: bhāvetabbā, uddhate passaddhisamādhiupekkhāsambojjhaṅgā. Satisambojjhaṅgo pana sabbattha🔽icchitabbo. Tenāha bhagavā – “yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave, samaye līnaṃ cittaṃ hoti,
analyzed: bhāvetabbā uddhate passaddhi samādhi upekkhā sambojjhaṅgā sati sambojjhaṅgo pana sabbattha  icchitabbaḥ tena āha bhagavā yasmin ca kho bhikkhave samaye līnam cittam hoti
translated: should be developed; when it is excited, those of tranquillity, concentration, and equanimity. But the enlightenment factor of mindfulness is desirable in all instances.

original: kālo tasmiṃ samaye dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāyā”tiādi. Samathaṃ anuyuñjeyyāti
analyzed: kālo tasmin samaye dhammavicaya sambojjhaṅgassa bhāvanāya atiādi samatham anuyuñjeyya ati
translated: Hence the Blessed One said: “Bhikkhus, when consciousness is sluggish, the time has come to develop the enlightenment factor of investigation of states; … the enlightenment factor of energy; … the enlightenment factor of rapture” .

original: samathabhāvanaṃ bhāveyya, anuppannaṃ samādhiṃ uppādeyya, uppannañca yāva vasībhāvappatti,🔽tāva vaḍḍheyya byūheyyāti attho. Kālena ca vipassananti yathāladdhaṃ samādhiṃ nikantiyā

translated: “Should resort to seclusion”: should develop the meditation subject, should arouse concentration that has not arisen, and should increase and perfect that which has arisen.🔽This is the meaning: “should extend and expand it.”

original: apariyādānena hānabhāgiyaṃ ṭhitibhāgiyaṃ vā akatvā nibbedhabhāgiyaṃva katvā kālena

original: “Atha vā samādhilābhena, vivittasayanena vā;

translated: Or by the solitude of dwelling,🔽The bhikkhu gains self-confidence,

analyzed: bhikkhu

analyzed: tena sampannaḥ samannāgataḥ satata pavatta vīriyaḥ nicca paggahita vīriyaḥ ti atthaḥ yutta yogo
translated: Endowed with that, possessed of that, he is one whose energy is steady, whose energy occurs constantly; the meaning is, whose energy is always exerted.

original: amhākaṃ bhagavato uppattito puretarameva sāvatthiyaṃ udiccabrāhmaṇakule nibbattitvā🔽vayappatto tiṇṇaṃ vedānaṃ pāragū hutvā, vādamaggaṃ uggahetvā attano vādassa upari

original: bhagavā loke uppajjitvā pavattitavaradhammacakko anupubbena yasādike veneyye vinetvā
analyzed: bhagavā loke uppajjitvā pavattita vara dhamma cakkaḥ anupubbena yasa ādike veneyye vinetvā
translated: Then our Lord Buddha appeared in the world, set rolling the wheel of the Law, and gradually converted all who were capable of being converted.

translated: What is fitting for one who has entered homelessness,
