original: maṃ na byādhayissanti sukhadukkhasomanassadomanassānaṃ jhānehi paṭibāhitattāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: mam na byādhayissanti sukha dukkha somanassa domanassānam jhānehi paṭibāhita ttā ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Sloth: laziness. Hunger: appetite. Insects and reptiles: insects and snakes. Will not afflict: will not torment. The idea is that they will not afflict him with pleasure, pain, joy, or grief, because he has warded them off with the jhānas.

original: Giribbajeti pabbatakandarāya. Atthatthiyanti sadatthasaṅkhātena atthena atthikaṃ.🔽Yaṃ viditaṃ mahesināti yaṃ catusaccaṃ mahesinā sammāsambuddhena sayambhūñāṇena ñātaṃ
analyzed: giribbaja iti pabbata kandarāya atthatthiyanti sadattha saṅkhātena atthena atthikam  yam viditam mahesinā ati yam catu saccam mahesinā sammāsambuddhena sayambhu ñāṇena ñātam
translated: In the mountain cave: in a mountain cavern. Rich in what is good: rich with what is called the good.🔽What was known by the Great Seer: the four truths, which were known,

original: paṭividdhaṃ, tāni cattāri saccāni anupacitakusalasambhārehi suṭṭhu duddasāni maggasamādhinā
analyzed: paṭividdham tāni cattāri saccāni anupacita kusala sambhārehi suṭṭhu duddasāni magga samādhinā
translated: penetrated, by the Great Seer, the Enlightened One, the Self-becoming One, by his own knowledge. Those four truths are very difficult to see by those who have not accumulated the requisites of merit, but they are easily seen by one who has accumulated them, by means of the concentration of the path.

original: samāhitatto, sammāsatiyā satimā, ariyamaggapaññāya ahaṃ agacchaṃ paṭivijjhissaṃ adhigamissanti attho.
analyzed: samāhita ttaḥ sammā satiyā satimā ariya magga paññāya aham agaccham paṭivijjhissam adhigamissanti attho
translated: “I will go and penetrate, I will reach, I will arrive at” is the meaning.

original: Rūpeti cakkhuviññeyyarūpe. Amiteti ñāṇena amite, aparicchinne apariññāteti attho.
analyzed: rūpa iti cakkhu viññeyya rūpe amita iti ñāṇena amite aparicchinne apariññāta iti attho
translated: “Form” : in visible objects cognizable by the eye. “Unmeasured” : unmeasured by knowledge, unknown, uncognized, is the meaning.

original: Phusitabbeti, phoṭṭhabbe. Dhammeti manoviññeyyadhamme. Amiteti vā aparimāṇe nīlādivasena🔽anekabhedabhinne rūpe bherisaddādivasena, mūlarasādivasena, kakkhaḷamudutādivasena,
analyzed: phusitabba iti phoṭṭhabbe dhamme iti manaḥ viññeyya dhamme amita iti vā aparimāṇe nīla ādi vasena  aneka bheda bhinne rūpe bheri sadda ādi vasena mūla rasa ādi vasena kakkhaḷa mudu tā ādi vasena
translated: “Tangible” : in tangible objects. “Idea” : in ideas cognizable by the mind. “Unmeasured” : in the immeasurable, in the many kinds of visible forms classed as blue, etc.,🔽in the many kinds of sounds, etc., classed as drum-sound, etc., as root-juice, etc., as harsh, etc., as pleasant, etc., as painful, etc., is the meaning.

original: sukhadukkhādivasena ca, anekabhedasaddādike cāti attho. Ādittatoti ekādasahi aggīhi
analyzed: sukha dukkha ādi vasena ca aneka bheda sadda ādike ca ati attho ekādasahi aggīhi
translated: “As burning” : as burning with the eleven fires.

original: ādittabhāvato. Samathehi yuttoti jhānavipassanāmaggasamādhīhi samannāgato. Paññāya
analyzed: āditta bhāvataḥ samathehi yuttaḥ ti jhāna vipassanā magga samādhīhi samannāgataḥ paññāya
translated: “Endowed with quiet” : endowed with the quiet of jhana, insight, and path concentration.

original: dacchanti vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya dakkhissaṃ.
analyzed: dacchanti vipassanā paññā sahitāya magga paññāya dakkhissam
translated: “I will see with understanding” : I will see with the understanding of the path accompanied by the understanding of insight.

original: Dubbacanena vuttoti duruttavacanena ghaṭṭito. Tato nimittanti pharusavācāhetu. Vimano na hessanti domanassito na bhaveyyaṃ. Athoti atha. Pasatthoti kenaci pasaṃsito.🔽Kaṭṭheti dārukkhandhe. Tiṇeti tiṇānaṃ khandhe. Imeti ime mama santatipariyāpanne
analyzed: dubbacanena vuttaḥ ti durutta vacanena ghaṭṭitaḥ tatas nimittanti pharusa vācā hetu vimanaḥ na hessanti domanassitaḥ na bhaveyyam atho ti atha pasattho ti kenacid pasaṃsitaḥ  kaṭṭhe iti dāru khandhe tiṇa iti tiṇānam khandhe ime iti ime mama santati pariyāpanne
translated: “By one who speaks roughly” means by one who speaks harsh words. “From that sign” means from the cause of harsh speech. “I would not be displeased” means I would not be sorrowful. “Then” means afterwards. “Praised” means praised by someone.🔽“A log” means a piece of wood. “A bundle of grass” means a bundle of grass. “These” means these five aggregates included in my continuity.

original: pañca khandhe. Amite ca dhammeti tato aññena indriyakkhandhena amite rūpadhamme.🔽Tenāha – “ajjhattikāneva ca bāhirāni cā”ti. Samaṃ tuleyyanti aniccādivasena ceva
analyzed: pañca khandhe amite ca dhamme iti tatas aññena indriya kkhandhena amite rūpa dhamme  tena āha ajjhattikān eva ca bāhirāni ca ati samam anicca ādi vasena ca iva
translated: “And these other things” means the other things, the other aggregates of form, which are immeasurable.🔽Therefore it is said: “both internal and external.” “I would measure them equally” means I would measure them all equally by way of impermanence, etc.,

original: asārādiupamāvasena ca sabbaṃ samameva katvā tīreyyaṃ.
analyzed: asāra ādi upamā vasena ca sabbam samam eva katvā
translated: and by way of the similes of the worthless, etc.

original: Isippayātamhi pathe vajantanti buddhādīhi mahesīhi sammadeva payāte samathavipassanāmagge
analyzed: isi ppayātamhi pathe vajantanti buddha ādīhi mahesīhi sammat eva payāte samatha vipassanā magge
translated: “Going along the path that the seers have gone” means going along the path of serenity and insight that has been well gone by the great seers, the Buddhas, etc.

original: vajantaṃ paṭipajjantaṃ. Pāvusasamaye kālamegho navena toyena vassodakena sacīvaraṃ
analyzed: vajantam paṭipajjantam pāvusa samaye kāla meghaḥ navena toyena vassa udakena sa cīvaram
translated: “At the time of the rains” means at the time of the rains, when the sky is covered with clouds, and the rain-water is new. “With my robe on” means

original: pavane kadā nu ovassati, temetīti attano abbhokāsikabhāvaparivitakkitaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: pavane kadā nu ovassati temeti iti attanaḥ abbhokāsika bhāva parivitakkitam dasseti
translated: “When will I be able to enter the wind?” He shows that he was thinking of going forth as a naked ascetic.

original: Mayūrassa sikhaṇḍino vane dijassāti mātukucchito aṇḍakosato cāti dvikkhattuṃ jāyanavasena🔽dijassa, sikhāsambhavena sikhaṇḍino ca mayūrassa vane kadā pana girigabbhare rutaṃ
analyzed: mayūrassa sikhaṇḍinaḥ vane dijassa ati mātukucchitaḥ aṇḍakosataḥ ca ati dvi khattum jāyana vasena  dijassa sikhāsambhavena sikhaṇḍino ca mayūrassa vane kadā pana giri gabbhare rutam
translated: “In the wood of the peacock with the crest”: he is a “bird” because he is born twice, that is, from the womb of a mother and from an egg.🔽“In the wood of the peacock with the crest” means in the wood of the peacock born from a crest. When will he be able to hear the peacock’s cry

original: kekāravaṃ sutvā velaṃ sallakkhitvā sayanato vuṭṭhahitvā amatassa pattiyā nibbānādhigamāya.
analyzed: kekāravam sutvā velam sallakkhitvā sayanataḥ vuṭṭhahitvā amatassa pattiyā nibbāna adhigamāya
translated: in the mountain cave? Having heard the cry, he would consider the time and get up from his bed to attain the deathless, that is, to attain Nibbāna.

original: Saṃcintayeti vuccamāne bhave aniccādito manasi kareyyaṃ vipasseyyanti attho.🔽Gaṅgaṃ yamunaṃ sarassatinti etā mahānadiyo asajjamāno bhāvanāmayāya iddhiyā kadā
analyzed: saṃcintaya iti vuccamāne bhave anicca āditas manasi kareyyam vipasseyyan ti attho  gaṅgam yamunam sarassatinti etāḥ mahā nadiyaḥ a sajjamānaḥ bhāvanā mayāya iddhiyā kadā
translated: “When will I be able to think” means that he would pay attention to impermanence, etc., in the world of becoming. The meaning is that he would develop insight.🔽“The Ganges, the Yamunā, and the Sarabhū”: when will he be able to cross these great rivers without hesitation by means of the supernormal power that is the result of development?

original: nu patareyyanti yojanā. Pātālakhittaṃ baḷavāmukhañcāti pātāya alaṃ pariyattanti pātālaṃ,
analyzed: nu patareyyanti yojanā pātāla khittam baḷavāmukham ca ati pātāya alam pariyattanti pātālam
translated: “The deep abyss and the wide mouth”: the abyss is suitable for going down, thus it is a “deep abyss” .🔽It is “deep” because it is thrown down there, and it is “thrown down” because it is placed there at the time of the destruction of the earth.

original: tadeva khittaṃ, pathaviyā saṇṭhahanakāle tathā ṭhitanti pātālakhittaṃ. Yojanasatikādibhedāni
analyzed: tat eva khittam pathaviyā saṇṭhahana kāle tathā pātālakhittam yojana satika ādi bhedāni
translated: “The wide mouth” is the mouths of the great oceans, etc., which are a hundred leagues in size.

original: samuddassa antopathaviyā tīraṭṭhānāni, yesu kānici nāgādīnaṃ vasanaṭṭhānāni honti,
analyzed: samuddassa anto pathaviyā tīra ṭṭhānāni yesu kānici nāga ādīnam vasana ṭṭhānāni honti
translated: The shores of the ocean are the places on the edge of the ocean floor where some of the nāgas and so on live,

original: kānici suññāniyeva hutvā tiṭṭhanti. Baḷavāmukhanti mahāsamudde mahantaṃ āvaṭṭamukhaṃ.🔽Mahānirayadvārassa hi vivaṭakāle mahāaggikkhandho tato nikkhanto tadabhimukhaṃ anekayojanasatāyāmavitthāraṃ🔽heṭṭhā samuddapadesaṃ ḍahati, tasmiṃ daḍḍhe upari udakaṃ āvaṭṭākārena paribbhamantaṃ
analyzed: kānici suññāniyā iva hutvā tiṭṭhanti baḷavāmukhanti mahā samudde mahantam āvaṭṭa mukham  mahāniraya dvārassa hi vivaṭa kāle mahāaggi kkhandho tatas nikkhantaḥ tad abhimukham aneka yojana sata āyāma vitthāram  heṭṭhā samudda padesam ḍahati tasmin daḍḍhe upari udakam āvaṭṭa ākārena paribbhamantam
translated: and some of which are empty. The mouth of the fish is a great whirlpool in the ocean.🔽For when the door of the Great Hell is opened, a great mass of fire comes out of it and burns the ocean floor for many hundreds of leagues in extent that faces it.

original: mahatā saddena heṭṭhā nipatati. Tattha baḷavāmukhasamaññā, iti tañca pātālakhittaṃ
analyzed: mahatā saddena heṭṭhā nipatati tattha baḷavāmukha samaññā iti tat ca pātālakhittam
translated: When that is burnt, the water above it whirls around in a whirlpool and falls down below with a great noise. That is called the mouth of the fish.🔽So the poet asks himself, “When will I, without hesitation, fly through the sky to the bottom of the ocean,

original: baḷavāmukhañca vibhiṃsanaṃ bhayānakaṃ asajjamāno iddhiyā kadā nu patareyyanti yaṃ
analyzed: vaḷavāmukham ca vibhiṃsanam bhayānakam a sajjamānaḥ id hiyā kadā nu patareyyanti yam
translated: to the mouth of the fish, which is terrifying and frightening?”

original: parivitakkitaṃ, taṃ kadā nu bhavissati, bhāvanāmayaṃ iddhiṃ nibbattetvā kadā nu evaṃ🔽iddhiṃ vaḷañjissāmīti attho.
analyzed: parivitakkitam tam kadā nu bhavissati bhāvanā mayam iddhim nibbattetvā kadā nu evam 🔽iddhim vaḷañjissāmi iti attho
translated: The meaning is: “When will I develop supernormal power and then display such supernormal power?”

original: Nāgova asaṅgacārī padālayeti yathā mattavāraṇo daḷhathambhaṃ bhinditvā ayasaṅkhalikaṃ
analyzed: yathā matta vāraṇaḥ daḷha thambham bhinditvā aya saṅkhalikam
translated: As a mad elephant breaks a stout iron chain,

original: viddhaṃsetvā asaṅgacārī vanaṃ pavisitvā eko adutiyo hutvā attano rucivasena carati,
analyzed: asaṅga cārī vanam pavisitvā ekaḥ adutiyaḥ hutvā ruci vasena carati
translated: and, free from bonds, enters the forest and goes alone, without a companion, according to his own wish,

original: evamahaṃ kadā nu sabbasubhaṃ nimittaṃ nibbajjayaṃ niravasesato vajjayanto kāmacchandavaso
analyzed: evam aham kadā nu sabba subham nimittam nibbajjayam niravasesataḥ vajjayantaḥ kāmacchanda vaso
translated: so when shall I, free from the bonds of lust,

original: ahutvā jhāne yuto payutto kāmaguṇesu chandaṃ sammadeva padāleyyaṃ chindeyyaṃ pajaheyyanti
analyzed: a hutvā jhāne yutaḥ payuttaḥ kāma guṇesu chandam sammat eva padāleyyam chindeyyam pajaheyyanti
translated: break the desire for the five strands of sense pleasure, which is like a tethering-post,

original: yaṃ parivitakkitaṃ, taṃ nu kadā bhavissati.
analyzed: yam parivitakkitam tam nu kadā bhavissati
translated: and be intent on and devoted to the jhānas?🔽As a poor man, in debt, finds a treasure-trove,

original: Iṇaṭṭova daliddako nidhiṃ ārādhayitvāti yathā koci daliddo jīvikapakato iṇaṃ gahetvā
analyzed: iṇa ṭṭaḥ uva daliddakaḥ nidhim ārādhayitvā ati yathā koci daliddaḥ jīvika pakataḥ iṇam gahetvā
translated: Just as a poor man, who has borrowed money,

original: taṃ sodhetuṃ asakkonto iṇaṭṭo iṇena aṭṭito dhanikehi pīḷito nidhiṃ ārādhayitvā adhigantvā
analyzed: tam sodhetum a sakkontaḥ iṇaṭṭaḥ iṇena aṭṭitaḥ dhanikehi pīḍitaḥ nidhim ārādhayitvā adhigantvā
translated: and, unable to repay it, is in debt, oppressed by his creditors, finds a treasure-trove, and, having found it,

original: iṇañca sodhetvā sukhena ca jīvanto tuṭṭho bhaveyya, evaṃ ahampi kadā nu iṇasadisaṃ
analyzed: iṇam ca sodhetvā sukhena ca jīvanto tuṭṭhaḥ bhaveyya evam aham pi kadā nu iṇa sadisam
translated: repays his debts and lives happily and contentedly, so when shall I, like the man who found the treasure-trove,

original: kāmacchandaṃ pahāya mahesino ariyadhanasampuṇṇatāya maṇikanakādiratanasampuṇṇanidhisadisaṃ
analyzed: kāma chandam pahāya mahesinaḥ ariya dhana sampuṇṇa tāya maṇi kanaka ādi ratana sampuṇṇa nidhi sadisam
translated: The Buddha’s Dispensation is like a treasure-store filled with gems, gold, etc., because it is filled with the Noble Wealth .

original: buddhassa sāsanaṃ adhigantvā tuṭṭho bhaveyyanti yaṃ parivitakkitaṃ, taṃ kadā nu bhavissatīti.
analyzed: buddhassa sāsanam adhigantvā tuṭṭhaḥ bhaveyyan ti yam parivitakkitam tam kadā nu bhavissati iti
translated: When will that be?

original: Evaṃ pabbajjato pubbe nekkhammavitakkavasena pavattaṃ attano vitakkapavattiṃ dassetvā
analyzed: evam pabbajjataḥ pubbe nekkhamma vitakka vasena pavattam attanaḥ vitakka pavattim dassetvā
translated: Having thus shown the occurrence of his own thoughts in the form of renunciation prior to his going forth,

original: idāni pabbajitvā yehākārehi attānaṃ ovaditvā adhigacchi, te dassento “bahūni vassānī”tiādikā
analyzed: idāni pabbajitvā yehākārehi attānam ovaditvā adhigacchi te dassentaḥ bahūni vassāni iti ādikā
translated: now, showing the way in which he attained the goal by admonishing himself after going forth, he spoke the stanzas beginning with “For many a year I’ve been entreated.”

original: gāthā abhāsi. Tattha bahūni vassāni tayāmhi yācito, agāravāsena alaṃ nu te idanti
analyzed: gāthāḥ abhāsi tattha bahūni vassāni tayā amhi yācitaḥ agāra vāsena alam nu te idam ti
translated: Therein, for many a year I’ve been entreated, agāravāsena alaṃ nu te idanti

original: anekasaṃvaccharāni vividhadukkhānubandhena agāramajjhe vāsena alaṃ pariyattameva
analyzed: aneka saṃvaccharāni vividha dukkha anubandhena agāra majjhe vāsena alam pariyattam eva
translated: for many a year, because of the succession of various kinds of suffering in the midst of the household life, it is enough for you, it is sufficient for you,

original: teti, ambho citta, idaṃ tayā anekāni saṃvaccharāni ahaṃ amhi nanu yācito. Taṃ dāni
analyzed: teti ambho citte idam tayā anekāni aham nanu yācitaḥ tam dāni
translated: O mind, I have been entreated by you for many a year. Now🔽me, who have gone forth,

original: maṃ pabbajitaṃ samānanti taṃ maṃ tayā tathā ussāhanena pabbajitaṃ samānaṃ kena kāraṇena
analyzed: mam pabbajitam samānanti tam mam tayā tathā ussāhanena pabbajitam samānam kena kāraṇena
translated: by what means,

original: citta tuvaṃ na yuñjasi, samathavipassanaṃ chaḍḍetvā nihīne ālasiye niyojesīti attho.
analyzed: citta tuvam na yuñjasi samatha vipassanam chaḍḍetvā nihīne ālasiye niyojesi iti attho
translated: You do not apply yourself, mind, but abandon concentration and insight and engage in lowliness and sloth.

original: Nanu ahaṃ, citta, tayāmhi yācitoti, ambho citta, ahaṃ tayā nanu yācito amhi āyācito
analyzed: nanu aham citta tayā amhi yācitaḥ uti ambho citta aham tayā nanu yācitaḥ amhi āyācitaḥ
translated: Did I not ask you, mind? — Friend mind, did I not ask you, did I not request you?🔽I think so. If you asked, why do you not practice in accordance with that now? The meaning is the intention.

original: maññe. Yadi yācito, kasmā idāni tadanurūpaṃ na paṭipajjasīti adhippāyo. “Giribbaje”tiādinā
analyzed: maññe yadi yācito kasmai idāni tad anurūpam na paṭipajjasi iti adhippāyaḥ giribbaja iti ādinā
translated: In Giribbaja, etc.

original: yācitākāraṃ dasseti. Citrachadā vihaṅgamā vicitrapekhuṇapakkhino, mayūrāti attho.
analyzed: yācita ākāram dasseti citra chadāḥ vihaṅgamāḥ vicitra pekhuṇa pakkhinaḥ mayūrāḥ ti attho
translated: he shows the way he was asked. Citrachadā vihaṅgamā are birds with variegated peacock feathers, the meaning is peacocks.

original: Mahindaghosatthanitābhigajjinoti jalaghosatthanitena hetunā suṭṭhu gajjanasīlā. Te
analyzed: mahinda ghosa tthanita abhigajjinoti jala ghosa tthanitena hetunā suṭṭhu gajjana sīlā te
translated: Mahindaghosatthanitābhigajjinoti means by the reason of the sound of the rain-bearing cloud, they are of the habit of calling out well.

original: taṃ ramessanti vanamhi jhāyinanti te mayūrā taṃ vane jhānapasutaṃ ramessantīti nanu
analyzed: tam ramessanti vanamhi te mayūrā tam vane jhānapa sutam ramessanti iti nanu
translated: They will delight you in the forest while you are meditating. — Those peacocks will delight you in the forest while you are absorbed in jhāna.

original: tayā yācitoti dasseti.
analyzed: tayā yācitaḥ uti dassa iti
translated: Did I not ask you? — he shows.

original: Kulamhīti kulaparivaṭṭe. Imamajjhupāgatoti imaṃ araññaṭṭhānaṃ pabbajjaṃ vā ajjhupāgato. Athopi tvaṃ, citta, na mayha tussasīti tvaṃ anuvattitvā ṭhitampi maṃ nārādhessasīti attho.
analyzed: kulamhi iti kula parivaṭṭe imam ajjhupāgataḥ ti imam arañña ṭhānam pabbajjam vā ajjhupāgataḥ atho pi tvam citta na tussasi iti tvam anuvattitvā ṭhitam api mama na ārādhessasi iti attho
translated: Kulamhīti kulaparivaṭṭe: “I am the one who goes round the families.” Imamajjhupāgato: “I have come to this forest-place or to the going-forth.” Athopi tvaṃ, citta, na mayha tussasīti: “Even then you will not satisfy me.” The meaning is: “Even though you are standing by following me, you will not please me.”🔽Mameva etaṃ na hi tvaṃ paresanti: “This is only for me, you are not for others.”🔽The intention is this: “You are not for others, but you are for me.

original: Mameva etaṃ na hi tvaṃ paresanti etaṃ, citta, mameva tasmā tvaṃ paresaṃ na hosi.
analyzed: mama eva etam na hi tvam paresanti etam citta mama eva tasmai tvam paresam na hosi
translated: But you are not for others, you are for me.

original: Tvaṃ pana aññesaṃ viya katvā sannāhakāle kilesamāre yujjhituṃ bhāvanāsannāhakāle
analyzed: tvam pana aññesam viya katvā sannāha kāle kilesa māre yujjhitum bhāvanā sannāha kāle
translated: What is the use of lamenting after saying: ‘I will fight with the defilement-Mara at the time of donning the armour,

original: nati vatvā paridevitena kiṃ payojanaṃ, idāni taṃ aññathā vattituṃ na dassāmīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: nati vatvā paridevitena kim payojanam idāni tam aññathā vattitum na dassāmi iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: and with the Death-Mara at the time of entering into Nibbāna’?” The intention is: “Now I will not allow you to speak in a different way.”

original: Sabbaṃ idaṃ calamiti pekkhamānoti yasmā “idaṃ cittaṃ aññañca sabbaṃ tebhūmakasaṅkhāraṃ
analyzed: sabbam idam calam iti pekkhamāno ti yasmai idam cittam aññam ca sabbam tebhūmaka saṅkhāram
translated: Sabbaṃ idaṃ calamiti pekkhamānoti: “Seeing all this as unsteady,”🔽with the eye of wisdom, “I went forth from home to homelessness and to the state of Nibbāna,

original: calaṃ anavaṭṭhita”nti paññācakkhunā olokento gehato kāmehi ca abhinikkhamiṃ amatapadaṃ
analyzed: calam anavaṭṭhitanti paññā cakkhunā olokentaḥ gehataḥ kāmehi ca abhinikkhamim amata padam
translated: which is free from the sensual pleasures.”

original: nibbānaṃ jigīsaṃ pariyesanto, tasmā, citta, ananuvattanto nibbānaṃ pariyesanameva karomīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: nibbānam jigīsam pariyesantaḥ tasmā citta an anuvattantaḥ nibbānam pariyesanam eva karomi iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: He is seeking Nibbāna, seeking it out, and therefore, Cittā, I am not following you, I am seeking only Nibbāna.” This is the meaning.

original: Avītarāgena sudunnivārayaṃ cittaṃ calaṃ makkaṭasannibhaṃ vanamakkaṭasadisaṃ iti suyuttavādī subhāsitavādī dvipadānamuttamo mahābhisakko naradammasārathīti yojanā.
analyzed: avīta rāgena cittam calam makkaṭa sannibham vana makkaṭa sadisam iti su yutta vādī su bhāsita vādī dvipa dānam uttamaḥ mahā abhisakkaḥ nara damma sārathi iti yojanā
translated: The mind of one not free from lust is hard to restrain, unsteady, like a monkey, like a forest monkey. The one who speaks well, the one who speaks well-connected speech, the supreme one among men, the great physician, the charioteer of men to be tamed—this is the construction.

original: Aviddasū yattha sitā puthujjanāti yattha yesu vatthukāmesu kilesakāmesu ca sitā paṭibaddhā
analyzed: yattha sitā yattha yesu vatthu kāmesu kilesa kāmesu ca sitā paṭibaddhā
translated: In the Aviddasutta, “those who are attached to the white, the ordinary people” are those who are attached to the sense pleasures of the objects and the sense pleasures of defilements.

original: te andhaputhujjanā tena kāmarāgena punabbhavesino ekanteneva dukkhamicchanti. Icchantā
analyzed: te andha puthujjanā tena kāma rāgena punabbhavesinaḥ ekantena iva dukkham icchanti icchantā
translated: Those blind ordinary people, by that lust for sense pleasures, are desirous of existence again, and they seek only suffering.🔽And those who seek

original: ca cittena nītā niraye nirākatāti cittavasikā nirayasaṃvattanikaṃ kammaṃ karontā
analyzed: ca cittena nītā niraye nirākatā ati cittavasikā niraya saṃvattanikam kammam karontā
translated: are led by the mind to hell, to be rejected. Those who are under the control of the mind, doing kamma that leads to hell,

original: hitasukhato nirākatā hutvā attano citteneva niraye nītā na aññathāti cittasseva niggahetabbataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: hita sukhataḥ nirākatāḥ hutvā attano cittena iva niraye nītāḥ na aññathā ati cittassa iva niggahetabba tam dasseti
translated: are rejected from what is beneficial and pleasant, and are led to hell by their own mind, not otherwise. This shows that the mind should be restrained.

original: Punapi cittaṃyeva niggahetuṃ mantento “mayūrakoñcābhirutamhī”tiādimāha. Tattha mayūrakoñcābhirutamhīti
analyzed: puna api cittam yā iva niggahetum mantentaḥ mayūra koñca abhirutamhi iti ādim āha tattha mayūra koñca abhirutamhi iti
translated: Herein, when peacocks and cranes are crying out means🔽when peacocks and geese are calling out.

original: sikhīhi sārasehi ca abhikūjite. Dīpīhi byagghehi purakkhato vasanti mettāvihāritāya
analyzed: sikhīhi sārasehi ca abhikūjite dīpīhi byagghehi purakkhataḥ vasanti mettā vihāritāya
translated: He lives in the forest surrounded by leopards and tigers,

original: evarūpehi tiracchānagatehi purakkhato parivārito hutvā vane vasanto, etena suññabhāvaparibrūhanamāha.
analyzed: evarūpehi tiracchāna gatehi purakkhataḥ parivāritaḥ hutvā vane vasantaḥ etena suñña bhāva paribrūhanam āha
translated: by such animals as these, because he dwells in loving-kindness. By this he shows the solitude of the place.

original: Kāye apekkhaṃ jahāti sabbaso kāye nirapekkho jaha, etena pahitattataṃ vadati. Mā
analyzed: kāye apekkham jahāti sabbaso kāye nirapekkhaḥ jahe etena pahitattatam vadati mā
translated: He leaves off all concern for the body: he leaves off concern for the body altogether. By this he shows his devotion.

original: virādhayāti imaṃ sudullabhaṃ navamaṃ khaṇaṃ mā virādhehi. Itissu maṃ, citta, pure
analyzed: virādhayāti imam su dullabham navamam khaṇam mā virādhehi mam citta pure
translated: Do not fail me now: do not fail me now in this opportunity so hard to find.

original: niyuñjasīti evañhi tvaṃ, citta, maṃ pabbajjato pubbe sammāpaṭipattiyaṃ uyyojesīti attho.
analyzed: niyuñjasi iti evam hi tvam citta mam pabbajjataḥ pubbe sammāpaṭipattiyam uyyojesi iti attho
translated: You used to urge me thus: the meaning is, you used to urge me to right practice before I went forth.

original: Bhāvehīti uppādehi vaḍḍhehi ca. Jhānānīti paṭhamādīni cattāri jhānāni. Indriyānīti
analyzed: bhāvehi iti uppādehi vaḍḍhehi ca jhānāni iti paṭhama ādīni cattāri jhānāni indriyāni iti
translated: Develop the jhanas: arouse and increase the four jhanas beginning with the first.

original: saddhādīni pañcindriyāni. Balānīti tāniyeva pañca balāni. Bojjhaṅgasamādhibhāvanāti
analyzed: saddhā ādīni pañca indriyāni balāni iti pañca balāni
translated: The five faculties are faith, etc. The five powers are the same five. The development of the enlightenment factors and concentration is

original: satta bojjhaṅge catasso samādhibhāvanā ca. Tisso ca vijjāti pubbenivāsañāṇādikā tisso
analyzed: satta bojjhaṅge catasso samādhi bhāvanā ca tisso ca vijjā ati pubbenivāsa ñāṇa ādikā tisso
translated: the development of the seven enlightenment factors and the four kinds of concentration. The three true insights are the three insights beginning with that of the recollection of past lives.

original: vijjā ca. Phusa pāpuṇāhi buddhasāsane sammāsambuddhaovāde ṭhito.
analyzed: vijjā ca phusa pāpuṇāhi buddha sāsane sammāsambuddha ovāde ṭhito
translated: You have reached, you have attained, you have penetrated, you have fully understood, you have directly known, you have seen with the eye of knowledge, the Buddha’s Dispensation, the advice of the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: Niyyānikanti vaṭṭadukkhato niyhānavahaṃ. Sabbadukkhakkhayogadhanti amatogadhaṃ nibbānapatiṭṭhaṃ nibbānārammaṇaṃ. Sabbakilesasodhananti anavasesakilesamalavisodhanaṃ.🔽Khandheti upādānakkhandhe. Paṭipassa yonisoti rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhatoti
analyzed: niyyānikanti vaṭṭa dukkhataḥ niyhāna vaham sabba dukkha kkhaya ogadham ati amata ogadham nibbāna patiṭṭham nibbāna ārammaṇam sabba kilesa sodhanam ti anavasesa kilesa mala visodhanam  khandhe iti upādāna khandhe paṭipassa yonisas ti rogataḥ gaṇḍataḥ sallataḥ aghataḥ ābādhataḥ ti
translated: The escape is that which leads to the escape from the suffering of the round of rebirths. The deathless is the foundation of the deathless, the state of Nibbāna, the support of Nibbāna, Nibbāna as object. The purification of all taints is the purification of all the defilements that are called “taints” without exception.

original: evamādīhi vividhehi pakārehi vipassanāñāṇena sammā upāyena nayena passa. Taṃ jahāti
analyzed: evamādīhi vividhehi pakārehi vipassanā ñāṇena sammā upāyena nayena passa tam jahāti
translated: The aggregates are the five aggregates subject to clinging. You should see them wisely is you should see them with insight knowledge in various ways, as “sickness,” as “a boil,” as “a dart,” as “a calamity,” as “an affliction,”

original: taṃ dukkhassa samudayaṃ taṇhaṃ pajaha, samucchinda. Idhevāti imasmiṃyeva attabhāve.
analyzed: tam dukkhassa samudayam taṇham pajaha samucchinda idha iva ati imasmin yā iva atta bhāve
translated: and so on. You should abandon is you should abandon the craving that is the origin of suffering. You should cut off is you should cut off. Right here is right in this very selfhood.

original: Aniccantiādi antavantato aniccantikato tāvakālikato niccapaṭikkhepato ca aniccanti
analyzed: anicca nti ādi antavantataḥ aniccantikato tāvakālikato nicca paṭikkhepato ca anicca nti
translated: “Impermanent”: see it as impermanent in the sense of being limited, in the sense of having a nature that ends, in the sense of being temporary, and in the sense of being the opposite of permanent.

original: vā passa. Dukkhanti te udayabbayapaṭipīḷanato sappaṭibhayato dukkhamato sukhapaṭikkhepato
analyzed: vā passa dukkhanti te udaya bbaya paṭipīḷanato sa paṭibhayataḥ dukkhamataḥ sukha paṭikkhepato
translated: “Painful”: see it as painful in the sense of being oppressed by rise and fall, in the sense of being subject to change, in the sense of being suffering, and in the sense of being the opposite of pleasure.

original: dukkhanti vā passa. Suññanti avasavattanato asāmikato asārato attapaṭikkhepato ca
analyzed: dukkhanti vā passa suññanti a vasavattanato a sāmikataḥ a sārataḥ atta paṭikkhepato ca
translated: “Empty”: see it as empty in the sense of being without self-control, in the sense of having no Overlord, in the sense of being insubstantial, and in the sense of being the opposite of a self. “Nonself”: see it as nonself in the sense of being blameworthy, in the sense of being subject to increase and decrease, and in the sense of being the opposite of a self.

original: suññaṃ, tato eva anattāti. Vigarahitabbato avaḍḍhiābādhanato ca aghanti ca vadhanti
analyzed: suññam tatas eva anattā ati vigarahitabbataḥ a vaḍḍhi ābādhanataḥ ca aghanti ca vadhanti
translated: “The body is a corpse”: see it as a corpse in the sense of being a collection of bones, in the sense of being a collection of diseases, in the sense of being a collection of fevers, and in the sense of being a collection of impurities.🔽“The body is a field”: see it as a field in the sense of being a field for the seed of merit, in the sense of being a field for the seed of demerit, and in the sense of being a field for the seed of imperturbability.

original: ca vipassa yonisoti yojanā. Manovicāre uparundha cetasoti manovicārasaññino gehasitasomanassupavicārādike🔽aṭṭhārasa cetaso uparundha vārehi nirodhehi.🔽Muṇḍoti muṇḍabhāvaṃ upagato, ohāritakesamassuko. Virūpoti tena muṇḍabhāvena parūḷhalomatāya
analyzed: ca vipassa yoniso ti yojanā manaḥ vicāre uparundha cetasaḥ ti manaḥ vicāra saññinaḥ geha sita somanassa upavicāra ādike  aṭṭhārasa cetasaḥ uparundha vārehi nirodhehi  muṇḍaḥ iti muṇḍa bhāvam upagataḥ ohārita kesa massukaḥ virūpaḥ iti tena muṇḍa bhāvena parūḍha loma tāya
translated: “The body is a tool”: see it as a tool in the sense of being a tool for the performance of action, in the sense of being a tool for the performance of merit, and in the sense of being a tool for the performance of demerit.🔽“The body is a danger”: see it as a danger in the sense of being a danger to oneself, in the sense of being a danger to others, and in the sense of being a danger to both oneself and others.🔽“The body is a disease”: see it as a disease in the sense of being a disease of the body, in the sense of being a disease of the mind, and in the sense of being a disease of both body and mind.🔽“The body is a boil”: see it as a boil in the sense of being a boil of the body, in the sense of being a boil of the mind, and in the sense of being a boil of both body and mind.

original: chinnabhinnakāsāya vatthatāya virūpo vevaṇṇiyaṃ upagato. Abhisāpamāgatoti “piṇḍolo
analyzed: chinna bhinna kāsāya vattha tāya virūpaḥ vevaṇṇiyam upagataḥ abhisā pamā gataḥ iti piṇḍolaḥ
translated: “The body is a dart”: see it as a dart in the sense of being a dart of the body,

original: vicarati pattapāṇī”ti ariyehi kātabbaṃ abhisāpaṃ upagato. Vuttañhetaṃ – “abhisāpoyaṃ,
analyzed: vicarati patta pāṇī iti ariyehi kātabbam abhisāpam upagataḥ vuttam ha etam abhisāpā uyam
translated: he wanders about with his bowl in his hand.” He has taken up the curse that should be done by the Noble Ones. For this is said: “This is a curse,

original: bhikkhave, lokasmiṃ piṇḍolo vicarasi pattapāṇī”ti. Tenāha “kapālahatthova kulesu
analyzed: bhikkhave lokasmim piṇḍolaḥ vicarasi patta pāṇī iti tena āha kapāla hatthaḥ uva kulesu
translated: he goes about with bowl in hand. ” He has taken up the curse that should be taken up by the Noble Ones. For this is said: “This is a curse in the world, bhikkhus, that you go about with bowl in hand. ” Therefore it is said: “With bowl in hand, go to the families for alms.”

original: bhikkhasū”ti. Yuñjassu satthuvacaneti sammāsambuddhassa ovāde yogaṃ karohi anuyuñjassu.
analyzed: bhikkhasu iti yuñjassu satthu vacane iti sammāsambuddhassa ovāde yogam karohi anuyuñjassu
translated: Apply yourself to the Teacher’s word: make effort in the advice of the Fully Enlightened One, follow it.🔽Well-restrained: well-controlled in body, speech, and mind.

original: Susaṃvutattoti suṭṭhu kāyavācācittehi sammadeva saṃvuto. Visikhantare caranti bhikkhācariyāya🔽icchāvisesesu caranto. Cando yathā dosinapuṇṇamāsiyāti vigatadosāya puṇṇamāya kulesu
analyzed: su saṃvuta tto ti suṭṭhu kāya vācā cittehi sammat eva saṃvutaḥ visikhantare caranti bhikkhā cariyāya  icchā visesesu carantaḥ candaḥ yathā vigata dosāya puṇṇamāya kulesu
translated: He goes about in the interstices of the cravings, going about for the practice of the life of a bhikkhu in the various families.

original: niccanavasāya pāsādikatāya candimā viya carāti yojanā.
analyzed: pāsādika tāya candimā viya carāti yojanā
translated: Like the moon in the clear full-moon night: he goes about like the moon in the families that are always free from fault, that are pleasing because of their fullness.

original: Sadā dhute ratoti sabbakālañca dhutaguṇe abhirato. Tathūpamaṃ cittamidaṃ karosīti
analyzed: sadā dhute rato ti sabbakālam ca dhuta guṇe abhirataḥ tathūpamam cittam idam karosi iti
translated: Always delighting in the ascetic practices: delighting in the ascetic qualities all the time.🔽Make your mind like that: just as a man who wants fruit plants a fruit tree, and then, not getting fruit from it, does not pull it up by the root

original: yathā koci puriso phalāni icchanto phalarukkhe ropetvā tato aladdhaphalova te mūlato
analyzed: yathā koci purisaḥ phalāni icchantaḥ phala rukkhe ropetvā tatas a laddha phalaḥ uva te mūlataḥ
translated: but rather

original: chindituṃ icchati, citta, tvaṃ tathūpamaṃ tappaṭibhāgaṃ idaṃ karosi. Yaṃ maṃ aniccamhi🔽cale niyuñjasīti yaṃ maṃ pabbajjāya niyojetvā pabbajitvā addhāgataṃ pabbajjāphalaṃ
analyzed: chinditum icchati citta tvam tathūpamam tad paṭibhāgam idam karosi yam mama aniccamhi  cale niyuñjasi iti yam mam pabbajjāya niyojetvā pabbajitvā addhāgatam pabbajjā phalam
translated: You are like him, Citta, in that you are doing the same sort of thing.🔽You are setting me in the mouth of the round of rebirths that is impermanent,

original: aniccamhi cale saṃsāramukhe niyuñjasi niyojanavasena pavattesi.
analyzed: aniccamhi cale saṃsāra mukhe niyuñjasi niyojana vasena pavattesi
translated: unstable, and subject to change, by urging me to go forth.

original: Rūpābhāvato arūpā. Cittassa hi tādisaṃ saṇṭhānaṃ nīlādivaṇṇabhedo vā natthi, tasmā🔽vuttaṃ arūpāti. Dūraṭṭhānappavattiyā dūraṅgama. Yadipi cittassa makkaṭasuttamattampi
analyzed: rūpa abhāvataḥ arūpā cittassa hi tādisam saṇṭhānam nīla ādi vaṇṇa bhedaḥ vā natthi tasmā  vuttam arūpā ati dūra ṭṭhāna ppavattiyā dūraṅgama yadi pi cittassa makkaṭasutta mattam pi
translated: It is formless because of the absence of form. For the mind has no such shape as blue and so on.🔽Therefore it is said to be formless. It is far-reaching because it occurs at a distance. Although the mind has no going in the east or any other direction even as far as the tip of a hair,

original: puratthimādidisābhāgena gamanaṃ nāma natthi, dūre santaṃ pana ārammaṇaṃ sampaṭicchatīti🔽dūraṅgama. Ekoyeva hutvā caraṇavasena pavattanato ekacāri, antamaso dve tīṇipi cittāni
analyzed: puratthima ādi disā bhāgena gamanam nāma natthi dūre santam pana ārammaṇam sampaṭicchati iti  dūraṅgamaḥ ekoyā iva hutvā caraṇa vasena pavattanataḥ ekacāri antamasaḥ dve cittāni
translated: it still apprehends an object that is far away.🔽Therefore it is far-reaching. It is a single unit because it occurs as a single unit. It is not possible for two or three consciousnesses to arise simultaneously in a single continuity.

original: ekato uppajjituṃ samatthāni nāma natthi, ekameva pana cittaṃ ekasmiṃ santāne uppajjati.
analyzed: ekatas uppajjitum samatthāni nāma natthi ekam eva pana cittam ekasmin santāne uppajjati
translated: Only a single consciousness arises in a single continuity.

original: Tasmiṃ niruddhe aparampi ekameva uppajjati, tasmā ekacāri. Na te karissaṃ vacanaṃ🔽idānihanti yadipi pubbe tava vase anuvattiṃ, idāni pana satthu ovādaṃ laddhakālato
analyzed: tasmin niruddhe aparam pi ekam eva uppajjati tasmai ekacāri na te karissam vacanam  yadi api pubbe tava vase anuvattim idāni pana satthu ovādam laddha kālataḥ
translated: When that has ceased, another arises, and so it is called “single-natured.”🔽“I will not do your bidding now”: although formerly I followed your lead, from the time I received the Teacher’s advice I will not be under your control.

original: paṭṭhāya cittavasiko na bhavissāmi. Kasmāti ce? Dukkhā hi kāmā kaṭukā mahabbhayā
analyzed: paṭṭhāya cittavasikaḥ na bhavissāmi kasmā ati ce dukkhāḥ hi kāmā kaṭukāḥ mahat bhayāḥ
translated: Why? Because sensual pleasures are painful, bitter, and full of fear.

original: kāmā nāmete atītepi dukkhā, āyatimpi kaṭukaphalā, attānuvādādibhedena mahatā bhayena
analyzed: kāmāḥ nāma ete atīte pi dukkhāḥ āyatim pi kaṭuka phalāḥ atta anuvāda ādi bhedena mahatā bhayena
translated: Sensual pleasures are painful in the past, bitter in the future, and full of fear in the present, because they are accompanied by great fear in the form of self-reproach, etc.

original: anubandhantā mahabbhayā. Nibbānamevābhimano carissaṃ tasmā nibbānameva uddissa abhimukhacitto viharissaṃ.
analyzed: anubandhantā mahabbhayā nibbānam eva abhimano carissam tasmai nibbānam eva uddissa abhimukha cittaḥ viharissam
translated: I will go forth to Nibbāna alone. Therefore, with my mind directed towards Nibbāna, I will live facing that direction.

original: Tameva nibbānābhimukhabhāvaṃ dassento “nāhaṃ alakkhyā”tiādimāha. Tattha nāhaṃ alakkhyāti alakkhikatāya nissirīkatāya nāhaṃ gehato nikkhaminti yojanā.
analyzed: tam eva nibbāna abhimukha bhāvam dassentaḥ na aham alakkhyā ti ādim āha tattha na aham alakkhyā ti alakkhikatāya nissirīkatāya na aham gehataḥ nikkhamin ti yojanā
translated: Showing that very state of being directed towards Nibbāna, he said: “I did not go forth from home to homelessness because I was ugly.” There, “I did not go forth from home to homelessness because I was ugly” means: because I was ugly, because I was without glory, is the construction.

original: Ahirikkatāyāti yathāvajjaṃ keḷiṃ karonto viya nillajjatāya. Cittahetūti ekadā nigaṇṭho,
analyzed: ahirikka tāya ati yathāvajjam keḷim karontaḥ nillajja tāya ekadā nigaṇṭhaḥ
translated: “Because of shamelessness”: because of shameless-ness, as if one were making fun of what is proper. “For the sake of the mind”: sometimes the Niganthas

original: ekadā paribbājakādiko honto anavaṭṭhitacitto puriso viya cittavasiko hutvā. Dūrakantanāti
analyzed: ekadā paribbājaka ādikaḥ hontaḥ anavaṭṭhita citto puriso viya cittavasikaḥ hutvā
translated: Far-gone:🔽having gone far by means of the evil action of having offended kings, etc., by not being friendly with them.

original: rājādīhi mettaṃ katvā tesu dubbhitvā dubbhibhāvena. Ājīvahetūti ājīvakāraṇā jīvikāpakato
analyzed: rāja ādīhi mettam katvā tesu ājīva hetu uti ājīva kāraṇā
translated: For the sake of livelihood: for the sake of a living, having made a living by means of evil action.🔽Through fear of livelihood I did not go forth.

original: hutvā ājīvikābhayena ahaṃ na nikkhamiṃ na pabbajiṃ. Kato ca te, citta, paṭissavo
analyzed: hutvā ājīvikā bhayena aham na nikkhamim na pabbajim kataḥ ca te citta paṭissavaḥ
translated: And now, mind, your promise is fulfilled.

original: mayāti, “pabbajitakālato paṭṭhāya na tava vase vattāmi, mameva pana vase vattāmī”ti,
analyzed: mayā ati pabbajita kālato paṭṭhāya na tava vase vattāmi mama eva pana vase vattāmi iti
translated: I am not under your control from the time of my going forth; I am under my own control.

original: citta, mayā nanu paṭiññā katāti dasseti.
analyzed: citta mayā nanu paṭiññā katā ati dasseti
translated: I show that I have made a promise, mind.

original: Appicchatā sappurisehi vaṇṇitāti “paccayesu sabbaso appicchā nāma sādhū”ti buddhādīhi🔽pasaṭṭhā, tathā makkhappahānaṃ paresaṃ guṇe makkhanassa pahānaṃ vūpasamo sabbassa
analyzed: appicchatā sappurisehi vaṇṇitā ti paccayesu sabbaso appicchā nāma sādhu iti buddha ādīhi  pasaṭṭhā tathā makkha ppahānam paresam guṇe makkhanassa pahānam vūpasamaḥ sabbassa
translated: Fewness of wishes is praised by the good: “In regard to requisites, fewness of wishes is good” is praised by the Buddhas, etc.🔽Likewise, the abandoning of conceit, the abandoning of the conceit of disparaging others, the stilling of all suffering, the extinguishing of all suffering is praised by the good.

original: dukkhassa vūpasamo nibbāpanaṃ sappurisehi vaṇṇitaṃ. Itissu maṃ, citta, tadā niyuñjasi,
analyzed: dukkhassa vūpasamaḥ nibbāpanam sappurisehi vaṇṇitam itissu mam citta tadā niyuñjasi
translated: Thus, mind, you urge me then,

original: “samma, tayā tesu guṇesu patiṭṭhātabba”nti, citta, tvaṃ evaṃ tadā niyuñjasi. Idāni🔽tvaṃ gacchasi pubbaciṇṇaṃ idāni maṃ tvaṃ pahāya attano purimāciṇṇaṃ mahicchatādiṃ
analyzed: samma tayā tesu guṇesu patiṭṭhātabbanti citta tvam evam tadā niyuñjasi idāni  tvam gacchasi pubba ciṇṇam idāni mam tvam pahāya attano purima āciṇṇam mahicchata ādim
translated: “You should be established in those qualities,” you urged me then.

original: paṭipajjasi, kiṃ nāmetanti adhippāyo.
analyzed: paṭipajjasi kim nāma etat ti adhippāyaḥ
translated: Now you are going back to your former ways. Now you are leaving me and reverting to your former habits of great desire, etc. What is this?🔽This is the meaning: “You are going back to your former ways” is said with reference to the following.

original: Yamatthaṃ sandhāya “gacchasi pubbaciṇṇa”nti vuttaṃ. Taṃ dassetuṃ “taṇhā avijjā cā”tiādi
analyzed: yam attham sandhāya gacchasi pubba ciṇṇan ti vuttam tam dassetum taṇhā avijjā ca atiādi
translated: In order to show this, he said: “Craving, ignorance, and the rest” .

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha taṇhāti paccayesu taṇhā, avijjāti tattheva ādīnavapaṭicchādikā avijjā.🔽Piyāpiyanti puttadārādīsu pemasaṅkhāto piyabhāvo ceva pantasenāsanesu adhikusaladhammesu🔽anabhiratisaṅkhāto appiyabhāvo ca ubhayattha anurodhapaṭivirodho. Subhāni rūpānīti
analyzed: vuttam tattha taṇhā ati paccayesu taṇhā avijjā ti tattha eva ādīnava paṭicchādikā avijjā  piya apiyanti putta dāra ādīsu pema saṅkhāto piya bhāvo ca eva panta senāsanesu adhi kusala dhammesu  anabhirati saṅkhātaḥ appiya bhāvo ca ubhayattha anurodha paṭivirodhaḥ subhāni rūpāni iti
translated: Herein, craving is craving for the conditions. Ignorance is ignorance about the dangers in them.

original: ajjhattaṃ bahiddhā ca subharūpāni. Sukhā vedanāti iṭṭhārammaṇe paṭicca uppajjanasukhavedanā.
analyzed: ajjhattam bahiddhā ca subha rūpāni sukhā vedanā ati iṭṭha ārammaṇe paṭicca uppajjana sukha vedanā
translated: Dear and not dear are the dear state consisting in affection for children, wife, etc., and the not dear state consisting in the lack of delight in the good things of the forest life, such as a secluded lodging, etc. Beautiful forms are beautiful visible objects internally and externally. Pleasant feeling is pleasant feeling that arises dependent on desirable objects.

original: Manāpiyā kāmaguṇāti vuttāvasesā manoramā kāmakoṭṭhāsā. Vantāti nirūpato taṃnissitassa🔽chandarāgassa vikkhambhanapahānena chaḍḍitatāya pariccattatāya ca vantā. Vante ahaṃ
analyzed: manāpiyā kāma guṇā ati vutta avasesā manoramā kāma koṭṭhāsā vantā ti nirūpataḥ tad nissitassa  chanda rāgassa vikkhambhana pahānena chaḍḍita tāya pariccatta tāya ca vantā vante aham
translated: The ‘pleasing objects of sensual desire’ are the remaining five strands of sensual desire, namely, sounds, odours, flavours, tangibles, and mental objects. ‘Spurned’ : because of the abandoning and casting out of the lust and desire based on them by means of the suppression of lust and desire. ‘Spurned’ :🔽because of the abandoning and casting out of the lust and desire based on them by means of the suppression of lust and desire. ‘Spurned’ :🔽

original: āvamituṃ na ussaheti evaṃ te chaḍḍite puna paccāvamituṃ ahaṃ na sakkomi, pariccattā eva hontīti vadati.
analyzed: āvamitum na ussaheti evam te chaḍḍite puna paccāvamitum aham na sakkomi pariccattāḥ eva honti iti vadati
translated: The ‘pleasing objects of sensual desire’ are the remaining pleasing sense-bases other than the five beginning with visible forms. ‘I have rejected’ : I have rejected them by abandoning the desire and lust for them by way of their specific characteristics, and I have given them up by abandoning them by way of their general characteristics. ‘I cannot now take them up again’ : I cannot now take up again those that I have rejected in this way, I say that they are given up.

original: Sabbatthāti sabbesu bhavesu sabbāsu yonīsu sabbāsu gatīsu viññāṇaṭṭhitīsu ca. Vaco
analyzed: sabbattha ati sabbesu bhavesu sabbāsu yonīsu sabbāsu gatīsu viññāṇa ṭṭhitīsu ca vacaḥ
translated: ‘Everywhere’ : in all kinds of becoming, all kinds of generation, all kinds of destinies, and all kinds of stations of consciousness.

original: kataṃ mayāti, ambho citta, tava vacanaṃ mayā kataṃ. Karonto ca bahūsu jātīsu na mesi
analyzed: katam mayā ati ambho citta tava vacanam mayā katam karontaḥ ca bahūsu jātīsu na mesi
translated: ‘Your words have been done’ : Your words, mind, have been done by me. And while doing them, I have not been angry

original: kopitoti anekāsu jātīsu pana mayā na kopito asi. Mayā neva paribhavito. Tathāpi ajjhattasambhavo🔽attani sambhūto hutvāpi tava akataññutāya dukkhe cīraṃ saṃsaritaṃ tayā kateti tayā
analyzed: kopitaḥ iti anekāsu jātīsu pana mayā na kopitaḥ asi mayā na iva paribhavito tathā api ajjhatta sambhavaḥ  attani sambhūtaḥ hutvā api tava akataññutāya dukkhe cīram saṃsaritam tayā kata iti tayā
translated: with you in many kinds of births. ‘Not been angry’ : I have not been angry with you in many kinds of births. I have not despised you. Although you have arisen within me,

original: nibbattite anādimati saṃsāradukkhe sucirakālaṃ mayā saṃsaritaṃ paribbhamitaṃ.
analyzed: nibbattite anādimati saṃsāra dukkhe su cira kālam mayā saṃsaritam paribbhamitam
translated: you have not been grateful to me. Therefore, ‘the skin has been rubbed off in suffering by you’ : the skin has been rubbed off in the suffering of the round of rebirths, which has been produced by you, which has been created by you, and in which I have been wandering about for a long time.

original: Idāni “dukkhe ciraṃ saṃsaritaṃ tayā kate”ti saṅkhepato vuttamatthaṃ uppattibhedena
analyzed: idāni dukkhe ciram saṃsaritam tayā katā iti saṅkhepataḥ vuttam attham uppatti bhedena
translated: Now, the meaning of the words “You have wandered long in suffering” is explained in detail according to the kinds of origination.

original: gatibhedena ca vitthārato dassento “tvaññevā”tiādimāha. Tattha rājadasīti rājā asi,
analyzed: gati bhedena ca vitthārataḥ dassentaḥ tvaññeva iti ādim āha tattha rājadasī iti rājā asi
translated: Now, in order to show in detail the meaning stated in brief in the words “You have wandered long in suffering,” he says, “You alone,” etc. Herein, the king was the sword,

original: dakāro padasandhikaro, vessā ca suddā ca bhavāma ekadā taveva vāhasāti yojanā. Devattanaṃ🔽vāpīti devabhāvaṃ vāpi tvaṃyeva no amhākaṃ, citta, karosīti yojanā. Vāhasāti kāraṇabhāvena.🔽Taveva hetūti taveva hetubhāvena. Tvaṃmūlakanti tvaṃnimittaṃ.🔽Nanu dubbhissasi maṃ punappunanti punappunaṃ dubbhissasi nuna, yathā pubbe tvaṃ anantāsu🔽jātīsu, citta, mittapaṭirūpako sapatto hutvā mayhaṃ punappunaṃ dubbhi, idāni tathā
analyzed: dakāro pada sandhi karaḥ vessā ca suddā ca bhavāmaḥ ekadā tava iva yojanā devattanam  vāpi iti deva bhāvam vā api tvaṃyā iva naḥ amhākam citta karosi iti yojanā kāraṇa bhāvena  tava iva hetu iti tava iva hetu bhāvena tvaṃmūlakam ti tvaṃnimittam  nanu dubbhissasi mam punappunanti punappunam dubbhissasi nuna yathā pubbe tvam anantāsu  jātīsu sa pattaḥ hutvā mayham punappunam tathā
translated: the syllable da is a particle joining words, and the construction is: “Sometimes you have been a warrior, a brahmin, a merchant, and a worker.” You alone, Cittā, have made us gods,

original: dubbhissasi maññe, pubbe viya cāretuṃ na dassāmīti adhippāyo. Muhuṃ muhuṃ cāraṇikaṃva
analyzed: maññe pubbe viya cāretum na dassāmi iti adhippāyaḥ muhum muhum cāraṇikam va
translated: a tank, a tree, a road, a bridge, a boat, a house, a slave, a beast of burden, a reason, a cause, a root, a condition, a support, a refuge, a final relief, a resting place, a friend, a relative, a kinsman, a companion, a helper, a goad, a spur, a whip, a fetter, a chain, a prison, a jailer, a slave, a servant, a slave girl, a wife, a mother, a father, a son, a daughter, a brother, a sister, a friend, a foe, a neutral person, a human being, a non-human being, a god, a brahmin, a warrior, a merchant, a worker, a male animal, a female animal, a tree, a creeper, a medicinal herb, a grain, a grass, a clod of earth, water, fire, air, a quarter, a void, a void-spirit, a void-god, a void-brahmin, a void-warrior, a void-merchant, a void-worker, a void-male, a void-female, a void-human being, a void-non-human being, a void-animal, a void-hell being, a void-hungry ghost, a void-serpent, a void-god, a void-brahmin, a void-warrior, a void-merchant, a void-worker, a void-male, a void-female, a void-human being, a void-non-human being, a void-animal, a void-hell being, a void-hungry ghost, a void-serpent, a void-god, a void-brahmin, a void-warrior, a void-merchant, a void-worker, a void-male, a void-female, a void-human being, a void-non-human being, a void-animal, a void-hell being, a void-hungry ghost, a

original: dassayanti abhiṇhato caraṇārahaṃ viya mano dassento caraṇārahaṃ purisaṃ vañcetvā🔽caragopakaṃ nipphādento viya punappunaṃ taṃ taṃ bhavaṃ dassento. Ummattakeneva mayā
analyzed: dassayanti abhiṇhataḥ caraṇa araham viya manaḥ dassentaḥ caraṇa araham purisam vañcetvā  cara gopakam nipphādentaḥ viya punappunam tam tam bhavam dassentaḥ ummattakena iva mayā
translated: He shows himself to me again and again, as if he were worthy of worship, showing himself to me as if he were a man worthy of worship,🔽showing himself again and again as if he were a charmer producing a magic spell. As if I were a madman

original: palobhasīti ummattakapurisena viya mayā saddhiṃ kīḷanto taṃ taṃ palobhanīyaṃ dassetvā
analyzed: palobhasi iti ummattaka purisena viya mayā saddhim kīḷantaḥ tam tam palobhanīyam dassetvā
translated: you seduce me. As if I were a mad man, you play with me, showing me this and that to seduce me.

original: palobhasi. Kiñcāpi te, citta, virādhitaṃ mayāti, ambho citta, kiṃ nāma te mayā viraddhaṃ,🔽taṃ kathehīti adhippāyo.🔽Idaṃ pure cittanti idaṃ cittaṃ nāma ito pubbe rūpādīsu ārammaṇesu rajjanādinā, yena
analyzed: palobhasi kiñca api te citta virādhitam mayā ati ambho citta kim nāma te mayā viraddham  tam kathehi iti adhippāyaḥ  idam pure cittanti idam cittam nāma itas pubbe rūpa ādīsu ārammaṇesu rajjana ādinā yena
translated: What is it, mind, that you have against me? What is it, mind, that you have against me? Tell me that.🔽This mind of mine in the past

original: ākārena icchati, yattheva cassa kāmo uppajjati, tassa vasena yatthakāmaṃ yathā vicarantassa
analyzed: ākārena icchati yatthā iva cassa kāmo uppajjati tassa vasena yatthakāmam yathā vicarantassa
translated: In the past, this mind called “mine” in the case of visible forms, etc., by lusting after them in such and such a way,🔽it went where it liked, as it pleased,

original: sukhaṃ hoti, tatheva ca caranto yathāsukhaṃ dīgharattaṃ cārikaṃ acari. Ajjāhaṃ pabhinnamadaṃ
analyzed: sukham tathā iva ca carantaḥ yathāsukham dīgharattam cārikam acari ajja aham
translated: and it wandered about for a long time, as it liked, as it pleased. But now I have broken its intoxication,

original: mattahatthiṃ hatthācariyasaṅkhāto cheko aṅkusaggaho aṅkusena viya yonisomanasikārena
analyzed: matta hatthim hattha ācariya saṅkhāto chekaḥ aṅkusa ggahaḥ aṅkusena viya yoniso manasikārena
translated: I will restrain it with right reflection, as a skilled elephant driver restrains a mad elephant with the hook.

original: naṃ niggahessāmi, nassa vītikkamituṃ dassāmīti.
analyzed: nam niggahessāmi nassa vītikkamitum dassāmi iti
translated: I will not allow it to transgress.

original: Satthā ca me lokamimaṃ adhiṭṭhahīti mama satthā sammāsambuddho imaṃ anavasesakhandhalokaṃ🔽ñāṇena adhiṭṭhahi. Kinti? Hutvā abhāvaṭṭhena aniccato, kassacipi dhuvassa thāvarassa
analyzed: satthā ca me lokam imam adhiṭṭhahi iti mama satthā sammāsambuddhaḥ imam anavasesa khandha lokam  ñāṇena adhiṭṭhahi kinti hutvā abhāva ṭṭhena aniccato kassacipi dhuvassa thāvarassa
translated: And the Teacher has determined this world: my Teacher, the Perfect Sambuddha, has determined this world of beings and lands with his knowledge.

original: abhāvato addhuvato sukhasārādīnaṃ abhāvato asārato. Pakkhanda maṃ, citta, jinassa
analyzed: abhāvataḥ sukha sāra ādīnam abhāvataḥ asārataḥ pakkhanda mama citta jinassa
translated: How? As impermanent in the sense of non-existence after having been; as painful in the sense of being subject to the suffering of the three roots and the suffering of change; as not-self in the sense of being devoid of selfhood.

original: sāsaneti tasmā yāthāvato paṭipajjituṃ, citta, maṃ jinassa bhagavato sāsane pakkhandehi
analyzed: sāsanā iti tasmai yāthāvataḥ paṭipajjitum citta mam jinassa bhagavataḥ sāsane pakkhandehi
translated: “Go forth, O mind, into the Conqueror’s Dispensation.” Therefore, O mind, go forth into the Dispensation of the Blessed One, the Conqueror, and enter upon the way to the realization of the truths as they really are.

original: anuppavesehi. “Pakkhandima”ntipi pāḷi, jinassa sāsane imaṃ lokaṃ ñāṇena pakkhanda,🔽yāthāvato tārehi, pakkhandanto ca vipassanāñāṇamaggena yāpento suduttarato mahantato
analyzed: an uppavesehi jinassa sāsane imam lokam ñāṇena pakkhanda  yāthāvato tārehi pakkhandantaḥ ca vipassanā ñāṇa maggena yāpentaḥ su duttarataḥ mahantataḥ
translated: “Go forth” is also a reading. Go forth into the Dispensation of the Conqueror, enter upon this world with knowledge,

original: saṃsāramahoghato maṃ tārehi.
analyzed: saṃsāra mahoghataḥ mam tārehi
translated: and lead me across as it really is. And as you go forth, lead me across from the great flood of the round of rebirths, which is ever increasing and ever more expansive.

original: Na te idaṃ, citta, yathā purāṇakanti, ambho citta, idaṃ attabhāvagehaṃ porāṇakaṃ
analyzed: na te idam citta yathā ambho citte idam atta bhāva geham porāṇakam
translated: “This is not as it was before, O mind! This body-house of yours, O mind, is not as it was before.”

original: viya tava na hotīti attho. Kasmā? Nāhaṃ alaṃ tuyha vase nivattitunti idānāhaṃ tava
analyzed: viya tava na hoti iti kasmā na aham alam vase nivattitunti idānāham tava
translated: The meaning is: “It is not fit for you.” Why? “I am not fit to turn back to your control.”

original: vase nivattituṃ na yutto. Yasmā mahesino bhagavato pabbajitomhi sāsane. Pabbajitakālato
analyzed: vase nivattitum na yuttaḥ yasmā mahesinaḥ bhagavataḥ pabbajitaḥ amhi sāsane pabbajita kālataḥ
translated: Since I have gone forth in the Dispensation of the Great Seer,

original: ca paṭṭhāya samaṇā nāma mādisāva na honti vināsadhārino, ekaṃsato samaṇāyeva hontīti attho.🔽Nagāti sineruhimavantādayo sabbe pabbatā. Samuddāti puratthimasamuddādayo sītasamuddādayo,
analyzed: ca paṭṭhāya samaṇāḥ nāma na honti vināsa dhārino ekaṃsataḥ samaṇāya iva honti iti attho  nagāḥ ati sineru himavanta ādayaḥ sabbe pabbatāḥ samuddāḥ ati puratthima samudda ādayaḥ sītasamudda ādayaḥ
translated: and since the time of my going forth, those like me are not called “destroyers” but are called “monks” in the absolute sense.🔽“Mountains” are all the mountains such as Sineru and Himavant. “Oceans” are not all the oceans such as the eastern ocean and the cold ocean,

original: na sabbe samuddā. Saritāti gaṅgādayo sabbā nadiyo ca. Vasundharāti pathavī. Disā
analyzed: na sabbe samuddā saritā ati gaṅgā ādayaḥ sabbāḥ nadiyaḥ ca vasundharā ati pathavī disā
translated: but all the rivers such as the Ganges. “Earth” is the ground.

original: catassoti puratthimādibhedā catasso disā. Vidisāti puratthimadakkhiṇādayo catasso
analyzed: catasso ti puratthima ādi bhedā catasso disāḥ vidisā ati puratthima dakkhiṇa ādayo catasso
translated: “The four directions” are the four directions such as the east. “The four intermediate directions” are the four intermediate directions such as the southeast.

original: anudisā. Adhoti heṭṭhā yāva udakasandhārakavāyukhandhā. Divāti devalokā. Divāggahaṇena
analyzed: anudisā adhas ti heṭṭhā yāvaḥ udaka sandhāraka vāyu khandhāḥ divā ati deva lokāḥ divāggahaṇena
translated: “Below” is the downward direction as far as the water-bearing atmospheric stratum. “Above” is the heavenly world.🔽By the word “above”

original: cettha tattha gate sattasaṅkhāre vadati. Sabbe aniccā tibhavā upaddutāti sabbe kāmabhavādayo
analyzed: ca ittha tattha gate satta saṅkhāre vadati sabbe aniccā ti bhavāḥ upaddutā ati sabbe kāma bhava ādayaḥ
translated: Herein, he says to the cognizance that has gone there, to the six kinds of cognizance, “All are impermanent, afflicted by the three worlds’ suffering” . All the three worlds of sense desire, etc.,

original: tayo bhavā aniccā ceva jātiādīhi rāgādīhi kilesehi upaddutā pīḷitā ca, na ettha kiñci🔽khemaṭṭhānaṃ nāma atthi, tadabhāvato kuhiṃ gato, citta, sukhaṃ ramissasi, tasmā tato
analyzed: tayaḥ bhavā aniccā ca iva jāti ādīhi rāga ādīhi kilesehi upaddutā pīḍitā ca na ettha kiñci  khema ṭṭhānam nāma atthi tad abhāvato kuhim gataḥ citta sukham ramissasi tasmā tatas
translated: are impermanent and afflicted by the defilements of lust, etc., and by the kinds of suffering beginning with birth. There is nothing here

original: nissaraṇañcettha pariyesāhīti adhippāyo.
analyzed: nissaraṇam ca ittha pariyesāhi iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: that is a safe place. Since there is none, “Where have you gone, cognizance, to enjoy happiness? “ You should seek your escape from there. “ This is the meaning.

original: Dhitipparanti dhitiparāyaṇaṃ paramaṃ thirabhāve ṭhitaṃ mamaṃ, citta, kiṃ kāhisi,
analyzed: dhiti parāyaṇam paramam thira bhāve ṭhitam citta kim
translated: “I am steadfast, I am firm, I am set in the supreme steadfastness” . What will you do to me, cognizance?

original: tato īsakampi maṃ cāletuṃ nāsakkhissasīti attho. Tenāha “na te alaṃ, citta, vasānuvattako”ti.
analyzed: tatas īsakam pi mama cāletum na asakkhissasi iti attho tena āha na te alam citta vasa anuvattakaḥ ti
translated: The meaning is that you will not be able to move me even a little. That is why he said “You are not fit to be my follower, cognizance” .

original: Idāni tamevatthaṃ pākaṭataraṃ katvā dassento “na jātu bhastaṃ ubhatomukhaṃ chupe,
analyzed: idāni tam evattham pākaṭataram katvā dassentaḥ na jātu bhastam ubhatomukham chupe
translated: Now, showing that same meaning more clearly, he said “I shall never again be a vessel with both ends closed,

original: dhiratthu pūraṃ navasotasandani”nti āha. Tattha bhastanti ruttiṃ. Ubhatomukhanti
analyzed: dhiratthu pūram nava sota sandaninti āha tattha bhastanti ruttim ubhatomukhanti
translated: Filled with the firm and the nine openings’ seeker” . Herein, “vessel” is a word for “belly” . “With both ends closed” means

original: putoḷiyā ubhatomukhaṃ. Na jātu chupeti ekaṃseneva pādenāpi na chupeyya, tathā dhiratthu
analyzed: putoḷiyāḥ ubhatomukham na jātu chupeti eka aṃsena iva pādena api na tathā
translated: and a privy with its two doors. He should never enter it with his whole body, not even with his foot. So let him hate it.

original: pūraṃ navasotasandaninti nānappakārassa asucino pūraṃ navahi sotehi vaṇamukhehi asucisandaniṃ
analyzed: pūram nava sota sandanim ti nānappakārassa asucinaḥ pūram navahi sotehi vaṇa mukhehi asuci sandanim
translated: Filled with nine streams of filth: filled with various kinds of filth, with nine streams of filth issuing from the nine orifices.

original: savatiṃ. Tāya vaccakuṭiyā dhī atthu, tassā garahā hotu.
analyzed: savatim tāya vaccakuṭiyā dhī atthu tassā garahā hotu
translated: Let him hate that privy, let him despise it.

original: Evaṃ aṭṭhavīsatiyā gāthāhi niggaṇhanavasena cittaṃ ovaditvā idāni vivekaṭṭhānācikkhaṇādinā
analyzed: evam aṭṭhavīsatiyā gāthāhi niggaṇhana vasena cittam ovaditvā idāni viveka ṭṭhāna ācikkhaṇa ādinā
translated: Having thus admonished his mind by way of the twenty-eight verses of condemnation, he now encourages it by pointing out the advantages of solitude, etc.,

original: sampahaṃsento “varāhaeṇeyyavigāḷhasevite”tiādimāha. Tattha varāhaeṇeyyavigāḷhaseviteti🔽varāhehi ceva eṇeyyehi ca ogāhetvā sevite. Pabbhārakuṭṭeti pabbhāraṭṭhāne ceva pabbatasikhare🔽ca. Pakateva sundareti pakatiyā eva sundare atittimanohare. “Pakativasundhare”ti
analyzed: sampahaṃsentaḥ varāha eṇeyya vigāḷha sevita iti ādim āha tattha varāha eṇeyya vigāḷha sevita iti  varāhehi ca iva eṇeyyehi ca ogāhetvā sevite pabbhāra kuṭṭe iti pabbhāra ṭṭhāne ca iva pabbata sikhare  ca pakatā iva sundarā iti pakatiyāḥ eva sundare pakati vasundharā iti
translated: with the words “frequented by boars, by deer, and by men in quest of solitude.” Therein, frequented by boars, by deer, and by men in quest of solitude means frequented by boars and by deer and by men in quest of solitude who have gone there.🔽On a mountain slope, on a mountain peak means on a mountain slope and on a mountain peak.🔽Naturally beautiful means beautiful by nature, extremely delightful. Or the reading may be pakativasundhare, in which case the meaning is: in a naturally beautiful place, in a naturally good place.

original: vā pāṭho, pākatike bhūmipadeseti attho. Navambunā pāvusasittakānaneti pāvusavasena
analyzed: vā pāṭhaḥ pākatike bhūmi padese iti atthaḥ nava mbunā pāvusa sitta kānane ti pāvusa vasena
translated: In a forest where the ground is strewn with fresh blown flowers means in a forest where the ground is strewn with fresh blown flowers.

original: vuṭṭhena meghodakena upasittavasse sutheve vane. Tahiṃ guhāgehagato ramissasīti tasmiṃ
analyzed: vuṭṭhena megha udakena upasitta vasse sutheve vane tahim guhā geha gataḥ ramissasi iti tasmin
translated: And when the rain has fallen, and the clouds have passed away,🔽You will delight in that forest, in the cave that is your home.

original: pabbatakānane guhāsaṅkhātaṃ gehaṃ upagato bhāvanāratiyā abhiramissasi.
analyzed: pabbata kānane guhā saṅkhātam geham upagataḥ bhāvanā ratiyā abhiramissasi
translated: In that forest-grove, in a cave that is your home, you will delight in the pleasure of meditation.

original: Te taṃ ramessantīti te mayūrādayo vanasaññaṃ uppādentā taṃ ramessantīti attho.🔽Vuṭṭhamhi deveti meghe adhippavuṭṭhe. Caturaṅgule tiṇeti teneva gassodakapātena tattha🔽tattha tiṇe surattavaṇṇakambalasadise caturaṅgule jāte. Saṃpupphite meghanibhamhi
analyzed: te tam ramessanti iti te mayūra ādayaḥ vana saññam uppādentā tam ramessanti iti attho  vuṭṭhamhi deva iti meghe adhippavuṭṭhe caturaṅgule tiṇā iti tena iva gassa udaka pātena tattha  tattha tiṇe su ratta vaṇṇa kambala sadise catur aṅgule jāte saṃpupphite megha nibhamhi
translated: They will delight in you: the peacocks and so forth, thinking of you as a forest, will delight in you. This is the meaning.🔽When the rain has fallen: when the clouds have passed away. Grass four inches high: by that very grass-water-fall, here and there

original: kānaneti pāvusameghasaṅkāse kānane sammadeva pupphite. Nagantareti pabbatantare.
analyzed: kānana iti pāvusa megha saṅkāse kānane sammadeva pupphite naga antare iti pabbata antare
translated: the grass will be four inches high, like well-dyed woolen cloth. In the flowering forest, like a cloud: in the forest, which is like a rain-cloud, well-flowering. In the mountain-cave: in the mountain-cave.

original: Viṭapisamo sayissanti tarusadiso apariggaho hutvā nipajjissaṃ. Taṃ me mudū hehiti
analyzed: viṭapi samaḥ sayissanti taru sadisaḥ a pariggahaḥ hutvā nipajjissam tam me mudū hehiti
translated: I will lie down like a tree: I will lie down like a tree, without attachment. That will be soft for me:

original: tūlasannibhanti taṃ tiṇapaccattharaṇaṃ mudu sukhasamphassaṃ tūlasannibhaṃ tūlikasadisaṃ
analyzed: tūla sannibhanti tam tiṇa paccattharaṇam mudu sukha samphassam tūla sannibham tūlika sadisam
translated: That grass-bed will be soft, pleasant to the touch, like cotton, like a cotton-wool bed.

original: sayanaṃ me bhavissati.
analyzed: sayanam me bhavissati
translated: That will be my bed.

original: Tathā tu kassāmi yathāpi issaroti yathā koci issarapuriso attano vacanakaradāsādiṃ
analyzed: tathā tu kassāmi yathā api issara uti yathā koci issara purisaḥ attanaḥ vacana kara dāsa ādiṃ
translated: I’ll make it work for me as a master does his man.

original: vase vatteti, ahampi, citta, taṃ tathā karissāmi, mayhaṃ vase vattemiyeva. Kathaṃ?
analyzed: vase vattā iti aham pi citta tam tathā karissāmi mayham vase katham
translated: Just as a master, a lord, makes his man, his slave, his servant, work for him, so I will make you work for me, O mind. How?🔽With whatever I get, let that be enough for me.

original: Yaṃ labbhati tenapi hotu me alanti catūsu paccayesu yaṃ yādisaṃ vā tādisaṃ vā labbhati,
analyzed: yam labbhati tena api hotu me alanti catūsu paccayesu yam yādisam vā tādisam vā labbhati
translated: In the four requisites, with whatever kind of thing I get, good or bad,

original: tena ca mayhaṃ alaṃ pariyattaṃ hotu. Etena idaṃ dasseti – yasmā idhekacce sattā taṇhuppādahetu
analyzed: tena ca mayham alam pariyattam hotu etena idam dasseti yasmai idhekacce sattā taṇhuppāda hetu

original: cittassa vase anuvattanti, ahaṃ pana taṇhuppādaṃ dūrato vajjento cittaṃ dāsaṃ viya

original: karonto attano vase vattemīti. Na tāhaṃ kassāmi yathā atandito, biḷārabhastaṃva yathā🔽sumadditanti citta taṇhuppādaparivajjanahetu, puna tanti cittaṃ āmasati, yathā aññopi

original: koci sammappadhānayogena bhāvanāya atandito attano cittaṃ kammakkhamaṃ, kammayoggaṃ

original: Yathā kiṃ? Biḷārabhastaṃva yathā sumadditaṃ, naiti nipātamattaṃ. Yathā suṭṭhu madditaṃ

You lead me around from here to there.🔽‘Don’t you see that you are cutting the bonds and fetters?’ Don’t you see that you are attending on the great sage, the compassionate one, the one perfectly enlightened, the cutter of the bonds and fetters called the ten fetters?

analyzed: pabbatam labhitvā tattha nage ramissam asaṃsayam ekaṃsena iva tvam citta parābhavissasi

original: Tassattho – ye naranāriyo, ambho citta, tuyhaṃ chandena vasena ruciyā ṭhitā yaṃ gehanissitaṃ
analyzed: tassa atthaḥ ye nara nāriyaḥ ambho citta tuyham chandena vasena ruciyā ṭhitāḥ yam geha nissitam
translated: The meaning is: “Those men and women, mind, who live by your will, by your power, by your wish, who are established in the household life,

analyzed: sukham anubhonti anubhavissanti te aviddasū andha bālāḥ māra vasā anuvattinaḥ kilesa māra ādīnam
translated: they are experiencing happiness and will experience it. They are ignorant, blind fools, who follow the will of Mara.

original: vase anuvattanasīlā, bhavābhinandī kāmādibhavameva abhinandanato, tava sāvakā anusiṭṭhikarā.

translated: They are of the nature to follow the will of the defilements, the enemies of Mara. They delight in existence, because they delight in sensual pleasures and the other kinds of existence. But your disciples are obedient to your instructions.

original: Mayaṃ pana sammāsambuddhassa sāvakā, na tuyhaṃ vase anuvattāmāti.
analyzed: mayam pana sammāsambuddhassa sāvakāḥ na tuyham vase anuvattāma ati
translated: But we are disciples of the Perfectly Enlightened One, not obedient to your will.”

analyzed: evam thero pubbe attanaḥ uppannam yoniso manasikāram cittassa niggaṇhana vasena pavattam
translated: Thus the Elder, having analyzed his own previous application of mind in various ways as a means of restraining the mind,

translated: The heir of the Buddha, the best of teachers, should be worshipped, brahmin.🔽“Even if one were to go through a hundred existences,

original: Sottiyo vedasampanno, manussesu punappunaṃ.
analyzed: sottiyaḥ veda sampannaḥ manussesu punappunam
translated: one would not be born again among humans, even though one is a brahmin by birth and has mastered the Vedas.

original: “Ajjhāyakopi ce assa, tiṇṇaṃ vedāna pāragū;
analyzed: ajjhāyakaḥ api ce assa tiṇṇam vedāna pāragū
translated: “Even if one were to be a teacher, having mastered the three Vedas,

original: Etassa vandanāyetaṃ, kalaṃ nāgghati soḷasiṃ.
analyzed: etassa vandanāya itam kalam soḷasim
translated: that would not be worth a sixteenth part of worshipping him.

original: “Yo so aṭṭha vimokkhāni, purebhattaṃ aphassayi;
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ aṭṭha vimokkhāni purebhattam aphassayi
translated: “The one who has attained the eight liberations before the meal,

original: Anulomaṃ paṭilomaṃ, tato piṇḍāya gacchati.
analyzed: anulomam paṭilomam piṇḍāya gacchati

original: “Tādisaṃ bhikkhuṃ māsādi, māttānaṃ khaṇi brāhmaṇa;🔽Abhippasādehi manaṃ, arahantamhi tādine;
analyzed: tādisam bhikkhum māttānam brāhmaṇa  abhippasādehi manam arahantamhi tādine
translated: “Such a monk, brahmin, should be worshipped by you,🔽have faith in the worthy one, the sage.

original: Khippaṃ pañjaliko vanda, mā te vijaṭi matthakaṃ.
analyzed: khippam pañjalikaḥ vanda mā te matthakam
translated: Quickly, with palms joined, worship him, lest your head split.

original: “Neso passati saddhammaṃ, saṃsārena purakkhato;
analyzed: na esaḥ passati saddhammam saṃsārena purakkhataḥ
translated: “He who is carried away by saṃsāra does not see the true Dhamma,

original: Adhogamaṃ jimhapathaṃ, kummaggamanudhāvati.🔽“Kimīva mīḷhasallitto, saṅkhāre adhimucchito;
analyzed: adhogamam jimha patham kummaggam anudhāvati  saṅkhāre adhimucchitaḥ
translated: He runs along the downward path, the crooked path, the wrong path.🔽Like a worm in rotting fish, he is attached to the defilements.

original: Pagāḷho lābhasakkāre, tuccho gacchati poṭṭhilo.
analyzed: pagāḷhaḥ lābha sakkāre tucchaḥ gacchati poṭṭhilaḥ

original: “Imañca passa āyantaṃ, sāriputtaṃ sudassanaṃ;
analyzed: imañca passe āyantam sāriputtam su dassanam
translated: Look at this one coming, Sāriputta, so good to look at,

original: Vimuttaṃ ubhatobhāge, ajjhattaṃ susamāhitaṃ.
analyzed: vimuttam ubhatobhāge ajjhattam su samāhitam
translated: Liberated in both ways, well concentrated within.

original: “Visallaṃ khīṇasaṃyogaṃ, tevijjaṃ maccuhāyinaṃ;
analyzed: visallam khīṇa saṃyogam tevijjam maccu hāyinam
translated: He is free from bonds, his fetters destroyed, he has the three knowledges, and has overcome death.

original: Dakkhiṇeyyaṃ manussānaṃ, puññakkhettaṃ anuttaraṃ.
analyzed: dakkhiṇeyyam manussānam puñña kkhettam anuttaram
translated: He is worthy of offerings from humans, the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: 1187. “Ete sambahulā devā, iddhimanto yasassino.
analyzed: ete sambahulāḥ devāḥ iddhimantaḥ yasassinaḥ
translated: These many gods, powerful and famous,

original: Dasa devasahassāni, sabbe brahmapurohitā;
analyzed: dasa deva sahassāni sabbe brahma purohitā
translated: Ten thousand gods, all of them Brahma’s retinue,

original: Moggallānaṃ namassantā, tiṭṭhanti pañjalīkatā.
analyzed: moggallānam namassantā tiṭṭhanti pañjalīkatā
translated: Stand with hands raised in reverence to Moggallāna.

original: “Namo te purisājañña, namo te purisuttama;
analyzed: namaḥ te purisājañña namaḥ te purisuttama

original: Yassa te āsavā khīṇā, dakkhiṇeyyosi mārisa.
analyzed: yassa te āsavā khīṇā dakkhiṇeyyā asi mārisa

original: “Pūjito naradevena, uppanno maraṇābhibhū;
analyzed: pūjitaḥ naradevena uppannaḥ maraṇa abhibhū

original: Puṇḍarīkaṃva toyena, saṅkhārenupalimpati.
analyzed: puṇḍarīkam iva toyena
translated: Like a lotus is not soiled by the water, so he is not soiled by the defilements.

original: “Yassa muhuttena sahassadhā loko, saṃvidito sabrahmakappo vasi;
analyzed: yassa muhuttena sahassadhā lokaḥ saṃviditaḥ sa brahma kappaḥ vasi

analyzed: iddhi guṇe cutupapāte kāle passati devatā sa bhikkhu

original: “Sāriputtova paññāya, sīlena upasamena ca;
analyzed: sāriputtaḥ uva paññāya sīlena upasamena ca

original: Yopi pāraṅgato bhikkhu, etāvaparamo siyā.
analyzed: yaḥ api pāraṅgataḥ bhikkhu etau aparamo siyā

analyzed: koṭi sata sahassassa atta bhāvam khaṇena nimmine

analyzed: aham vikubbanāsu kusalaḥ vasībhūtaḥ asmi iddhiyā
translated: I am skilled in transformations and have mastered psychic power.

original: “Samādhivijjāvasipāramīgato, moggallānagotto asitassa sāsane;

analyzed: pariciṇṇaḥ mayā satthā katam buddhassa sāsanam

analyzed: ohitaḥ garukaḥ bhāraḥ samūha tā

original: “Yassa catthāya pabbajito, agārasmānagāriyaṃ;

translated: “The purpose for which I went forth from the household life into homelessness

analyzed: īdisaḥ nirayaḥ āsi yattha dussī apaccatha

translated: Attacking such a bhikkhu, O Kakudha, you will go to suffering.

analyzed: majjhesarasmim tiṭṭhanti vimānā kappa ṭhāyinaḥ  veḷuriya vaṇṇāḥ rucirāḥ accimantaḥ pabhassarā

analyzed: accharā tattha naccanti puthu nānatta vaṇṇiyo

translated: “Brahmā answered him truthfully,

analyzed: passāmi vītivattantam brahma loke pabhassaram
translated: “I see the radiance in the Brahmā world fading away;

analyzed: saḥ uham ajja katham vajjam aham niccomhi sassataḥ

analyzed: yaḥ etam abhijānāti pe kaṇha dukkham nigacchasi
translated: “One who knows this …

analyzed: yaḥ mahāneruno kūṭam vimokkhena aphassayi

original: “Yo etamabhijānāti, bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako;
analyzed: yaḥ etam abhijānāti bhikkhu buddhassa sāvakaḥ
translated: “One who knows this, a disciple of the Buddha,

analyzed: tādisam bhikkhum āsajja kaṇha dukkham nigacchasi
translated: Having attacked such a monk, O Black One, you will go to suffering.

original: “Na ve aggi cetayati, ahaṃ bālaṃ ḍahāmiti;
analyzed: na veḥ aggi cetayati aham bālam ḍahām iti
translated: The fire does not think, “I will burn the fool.”

analyzed: bālaḥ iva jalitam aggim āsajja nam paḍayhati
translated: The fool, having attacked the burning fire, is himself burned.

original: “Evameva tuvaṃ māra, āsajja naṃ tathāgataṃ;
analyzed: evam eva tuvam māre āsajja nam tathāgatam
translated: In the same way, you, Māra, having attacked the Realised One,

analyzed: sayam ḍahissasi attānam bālaḥ aggim iva samphusam
