translated: The ground of trust, the continuum, the refuge for those seeking refuge.

original: “Evamādīhi sambuddhaṃ, santhavitvā mahāguṇaṃ;
analyzed: evamādīhi sambuddham santhavitvā mahā guṇam
translated: “Having thus consoled the Fully Enlightened One, of great qualities,

original: Avocaṃ vādisūdassa, gatiṃ pappomi bhikkhuno.
analyzed: avocam vādi sūdassa gatim pappomi bhikkhuno
translated: I said to the one who delights in debate: ‘I will attain the state of a monk.’

original: “Tadā avoca bhagavā, anantapaṭibhānavā;
analyzed: tadā avoca bhagavā ananta paṭibhānavā
translated: “Then the Blessed One, of infinite eloquence, said:

original: Yo so buddhaṃ abhojesi, sattāhaṃ sahasāvakaṃ.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ buddham abhojesi satta aham saha sāvakam
translated: ‘He who invited the Buddha, together with his disciples, for seven days,

original: “Guṇañca me pakittesi, pasanno sehi pāṇibhi;
analyzed: guṇañca me pakittesi pasannaḥ sehi pāṇibhi
translated: “And praised my qualities, being pleased, with his hands

original: Eso patthayate ṭhānaṃ, vādisūdassa bhikkhuno.
analyzed: eso patthayate ṭhānam vādi sūdassa bhikkhuno
translated: He will attain the state of a monk who is a lion in his roar.

original: “Anāgatamhi addhāne, lacchase taṃ manorathaṃ;
analyzed: anāgatamhi lacchase tam manoratham
translated: “In the future, you will fulfill that wish of yours,

original: Devamānusasampattiṃ, anubhotvā anappakaṃ.
analyzed: deva mānusa sampattim anubhotvā anappakam
translated: And will enjoy the company of gods and men for a long time.

original: “Satasahassito kappe, okkākakulasambhavo;
analyzed: sata sahassitaḥ kappe okkāka kula sambhavaḥ
translated: “After a hundred thousand eons, one born in the Okkāka family,

original: Gotamo nāma gottena, satthā loke bhavissati.🔽“Tassa dhammesu dāyādo, oraso dhammanimmito;
analyzed: gotamaḥ nāma gottena satthā loke bhavissati  tassa dhammesu dāyādaḥ orasaḥ dhamma nimmito
translated: Will be a teacher in the world, named Gotama.🔽“He will have a disciple named Vaṅgīsa,

original: Vaṅgīso nāma nāmena, hessati satthu sāvako.
analyzed: vaṅgīsaḥ nāma nāmena hessati satthu sāvako
translated: Who will be a heir to his Dhamma, and will be born from his Dhamma.

original: “Taṃ sutvā mudito hutvā, yāvajīvaṃ tadā jinaṃ;
analyzed: tam sutvā muditaḥ hutvā yāvajīvam tadā jinam
translated: “Having heard this, I was delighted, and for the rest of my life

original: Paccayehi upaṭṭhāsiṃ, mettacitto tathāgataṃ.
analyzed: paccayehi upaṭṭhāsim metta cittaḥ tathāgatam
translated: I served the Victor with requisites, with a mind full of love.

original: “Tena kammena sukatena, cetanāpaṇidhīhi ca;
analyzed: tena kammena su katena cetanā paṇidhīhi ca
translated: “By that good deed, by my intention and aspiration,

original: Jahitvā mānusaṃ dehaṃ, tusitaṃ agamāsahaṃ.
analyzed: jahitvā mānusam deham tusitam agama asaham
translated: I gave up my human body and went to the Tusita heaven.

original: “Pacchime ca bhave dāni, jāto vippakule ahaṃ;
analyzed: pacchime ca bhave dāni jātaḥ vippa kule aham
translated: “And in my last existence, I was born in a low family,

original: Paccājāto yadā āsiṃ, jātiyā sattavassiko.
analyzed: paccājātaḥ yadā āsim jātiyā sattavassikaḥ
translated: And when I was born, I was seven years old.

original: “Sabbavedavidū jāto, vādasatthavisārado;
translated: “I was born knowing all, confident in teaching the Dhamma,

original: Vādissaro cittakathī, paravādappamaddano.
translated: A lion in his roar, a clever speaker, a crusher of other doctrines.

original: “Vaṅge jātoti vaṅgīso, vacane issaroti vā;
analyzed: vaṅge jātaḥ iti vaṅgīsaḥ vacane vā
translated: “I was born in the land of Vanga, thus I was called a Vangiya, or I was a master of speech,

original: Vaṅgīso iti me nāmaṃ, abhavī lokasammataṃ.
analyzed: iti me nāmam abhavī loka sammatam
translated: thus I was called Vangiya, this was my name, approved by the world.

original: “Yadāhaṃ viññutaṃ patto, ṭhito paṭhamayobbane;
analyzed: yadā aham viññutam pattaḥ ṭhitaḥ paṭhama yobbane
translated: “When I attained maturity, standing in my first youth,

original: Tadā rājagahe ramme, sāriputtamahaddasaṃ.
analyzed: tadā rājagahe ramme sāri putta mahat dasam
translated: then in the delightful city of Rajagaha, I saw the great Sāriputta.

original: “Piṇḍāya vicarantaṃ taṃ, pattapāṇiṃ susaṃvutaṃ;
analyzed: piṇḍāya vicarantam tam patta pāṇim su saṃvutam
translated: “Wandering for alms, with bowl in hand, well-controlled,

original: Alolakkhiṃ mitabhāṇiṃ, yugamattaṃ nidakkhitaṃ.
analyzed: a lolakkhim mita bhāṇim yuga mattam nidakkhitam
translated: with steady eyes, speaking moderately, looking a yoke’s length ahead.

original: “Taṃ disvā vimhito hutvā, avocaṃ mamanucchavaṃ;
analyzed: tam disvā vimhitaḥ hutvā avocam mamanucchavam
translated: “Seeing him, I was delighted, and I spoke to him,

original: Kaṇikāraṃva nicitaṃ, cittaṃ gāthāpadaṃ ahaṃ.
analyzed: nicitam cittam gāthā padam aham
translated: like a heap of golden kanikāra flowers, my mind was full of verses.

original: “Ācikkhi so me satthāraṃ, sambuddhaṃ lokanāyakaṃ;
analyzed: ācikkhi saḥ me satthāram sambuddham loka nāyakam
translated: “He told me about the Teacher, the Enlightened One, the Leader of the World,

original: Tadā so paṇḍito vīro, uttariṃ samavoca me.
analyzed: tadā saḥ paṇḍitaḥ vīraḥ uttarim samavoca me
translated: then the wise hero spoke further to me.

original: “Virāgasaṃhitaṃ vākyaṃ, katvā duddasamuttamaṃ;
analyzed: virāga saṃhitam vākyam katvā duddasam uttamam
translated: “With words connected with dispassion, having spoken the supreme Dhamma,

original: Vicittapaṭibhānehi, tosito tena tādinā.
analyzed: vicitta paṭibhānehi tositaḥ tena tādinā
translated: with various explanations, I was satisfied by that One of Great Compassion.

original: “Nipacca sirasā pāde, pabbājehīti maṃ bravi;
analyzed: nipacca sirasā pāde pabbājehi iti mama bravi
translated: “I bowed my head to his feet, he said to me: ‘Go forth!’

original: Tato maṃ sa mahāpañño, buddhaseṭṭhamupānayi.
analyzed: tatas mam sa mahā paññaḥ buddha seṭṭham upānayi
translated: Then the one of great wisdom brought me to the best of Buddhas.

original: “Nipacca sirasā pāde, nisīdiṃ satthu santike;
analyzed: nipacca sirasā pāde nisīdim satthu santike
translated: “I bowed my head to his feet, I sat down in the presence of the Teacher,

original: Mamāha vadataṃ seṭṭho, kacci vaṅgīsa jānāsi.🔽“Kiñci sippanti tassāhaṃ, jānāmīti ca abraviṃ;
analyzed: mama āha vadatam seṭṭhaḥ kacci jānāsi  kiñci tassa aham jānāmi iti ca abravim
translated: The best of speakers said to me, “Do you know, Vangasattha, anything?”

original: Matasīsaṃ vanacchuddhaṃ, api bārasavassikaṃ;
analyzed: matasīsam vana chuddham api bāra savassikam
translated: “I know a little craft,” I said, “I know the head of the dead, pure in the forest, though only eight years old.

original: Tava vijjāvisesena, sace sakkosi vācaya.
analyzed: tava vijjā visesena sace sakkosi vācaya
translated: If you can, by your special knowledge, bring it back to life.”

original: “Āmoti me paṭiññāte, tīṇi sīsāni dassayi;
analyzed: āmoti me paṭiññāte tīṇi sīsāni dassayi
translated: “Yes,” I said, “I will bring it back to life,” and I showed him three heads.

original: Nirayanaradevesu, upapanne avācayiṃ.
analyzed: niraya naradevesu upapanne avācayim
translated: I brought back to life one who had been reborn in hell, one who had been reborn as a ghost, and one who had been reborn as a god.

original: “Tadā khīṇāsavasseva, sīsaṃ dassesi nāyako;
analyzed: tadā khīṇāsavassa iva sīsam dassesi nāyako
translated: Then the Leader showed me his own head, which was free from the asavas.

original: Tatohaṃ vihatārabbho, pabbajjaṃ samayācisaṃ.
analyzed: tatas ham vihata ārabbhaḥ pabbajjam samayācisam
translated: Then I was filled with faith, and I asked for the going forth.

original: “Pabbajitvāna sugataṃ, santhavāmi tahiṃ tahiṃ;
analyzed: pabbajitvāna sugatam santhavāmi tahim tahim
translated: Having gone forth under the Sugata, I conversed with him here and there.

original: Tato maṃ kabbavittosi, ujjhāyantiha bhikkhavo.
analyzed: tatas mama kabba vitto asi ujjhāyanti ha bhikkhavaḥ
translated: Then you said to me, “You are a braggart,” and the bhikkhus here complained.

original: “Tato vīmaṃsanatthaṃ me, āha buddho vināyako;
analyzed: tatas vīmaṃsana attham me āha buddhaḥ vināyako
translated: Then, in order to test me, the Buddha, the Leader, said,

original: Takkikā panimā gāthā, ṭhānaso paṭibhanti taṃ.
analyzed: takkikā panimā gāthāḥ tam
translated: “These verses, Vangasattha, will come back to you as you recite them.”

original: “Na kabbavittohaṃ vīra, ṭhānaso paṭibhanti maṃ;🔽Tena hi dāni vaṅgīsa, ṭhānaso santhavāhi maṃ.
analyzed: na kabba vittā oham vīra ṭhānasaḥ paṭibhanti mama  tena hi dāni vaṅgīsa ṭhānaso mama
translated: “I am not a braggart, hero,” I said, “they will come back to me as I recite them.”🔽“Well then, Vangasattha, recite them to me.”

original: “Tadāhaṃ santhaviṃ vīraṃ, gāthāhi isisattamaṃ;
analyzed: tadā aham santhavim vīram gāthāhi isi sattamam
translated: Then I recited to the hero, the best of seers, the verses.

original: Ṭhānaso me tadā tuṭṭho, jino agge ṭhapesi maṃ.
analyzed: ṭhānasaḥ me tadā tuṭṭhaḥ jinaḥ agge ṭhapesi mam
translated: Then, being satisfied with me, the Conqueror placed me in the foremost position.

original: “Paṭibhānena cittena, aññesamatimaññahaṃ;
analyzed: paṭibhānena cittena
translated: “With a mind of conceit, I thought myself superior to others;

original: Pesale tena saṃviggo, arahattamapāpuṇiṃ.
analyzed: pesale tena saṃviggaḥ arahattama pāpuṇim
translated: But being anxious because of the good man, I attained Liberation.

original: “Paṭibhānavataṃ aggo, añño koci na vijjati;
analyzed: paṭibhānavatam aggaḥ aññaḥ koci na vijjati
translated: “There is no one else who can be called foremost in wisdom,

original: Yathāyaṃ bhikkhu vaṅgīso, evaṃ dhāretha bhikkhavo.
analyzed: yathā ayam bhikkhu vaṅgīsaḥ evam dhāretha bhikkhavaḥ
translated: Except for this monk Vaṅgīsa, so remember it, monks.

original: “Satasahasse kataṃ kammaṃ, phalaṃ dassesi me idha;
analyzed: sata sahasse katam kammam phalam dassesi me idha
translated: “The deed I did in a hundred thousand years, the fruit of that was shown to me here;

original: Sumutto saravegova, kilese jhāpayiṃ mama.
analyzed: su muttaḥ sara vegā uva kilese mama
translated: Like one released from a prison, I burned up my defilements.

original: “Kilesā jhāpitā mayhaṃ, bhavā sabbe samūhatā;
analyzed: kilesāḥ jhāpitāḥ mayham sabbe
translated: “My defilements are burned up, all my existences are destroyed;

original: Nāgova bandhanaṃ chetvā, viharāmi anāsavo.
analyzed: nāgaḥ iva bandhanam chetvā viharāmi anāsavaḥ
translated: Like an elephant breaking his bonds, I live without defilements.

original: “Svāgataṃ vata me āsi, buddhaseṭṭhassa santike;
analyzed: svāgatam vata me āsi buddha seṭṭhassa santike
translated: “Welcome indeed was it for me to come into the presence of the Buddha, the best of beings;

original: Tisso vijjā anuppattā, kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ.
analyzed: tissaḥ vijjāḥ anuppattā katam buddhassa sāsanam
translated: The three knowledges have been attained, and the word of the Buddha has been fulfilled.

original: “Paṭisambhidā catasso, vimokkhāpi ca aṭṭhime;
analyzed: paṭisambhidā catasso vimokkhā api ca aṭṭhime
translated: “The four analytical knowledges, and the eight liberations as well,

original: Chaḷabhiññā sacchikatā, kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”nti.
analyzed: chaṭṭhā abhiññā sacchikatā katam buddhassa sāsanam ti
translated: The six super-knowledges have been realized, and the word of the Buddha has been fulfilled.”

original: Arahā pana hutvā thero satthu santikaṃ gacchanto cakkhupathato paṭṭhāya candena,
analyzed: arahā pana hutvā thero satthu santikam gacchanto cakkhupathato paṭṭhāya candena
translated: But after becoming an Arahant, when the Elder was going to the Teacher, from the time he saw the moon,

original: sūriyena, ākāsena, mahāsamuddena, sinerunā pabbatarājena, sīhena migaraññā, hatthināgenāti
analyzed: sūriyena ākāsena mahā samuddena sinerunā pabbata rājena sīhena migaraññā hatthi nāgena ati
translated: with the sun, with the sky, with the great ocean, with the Sineru king of mountains, with the lion king of beasts, with the elephant king of the tusked ones.

original: tena tena saddhiṃ upamento anekehi padasatehi satthāraṃ vaṇṇentova upagacchati. Tena
analyzed: tena tena saddhim upamentaḥ anekehi pada satehi satthāram vaṇṇentaḥ iva upagacchati tena
translated: praising the Teacher with many hundreds of verses, he approached. The Teacher

original: taṃ satthā saṅghamajjhe nisinno paṭibhānavantānaṃ aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi. Atha therena
analyzed: tam satthā saṅgha majjhe nisinnaḥ paṭibhānavantānam aggaṭṭhāne ṭhapesi atha therena
translated: seated in the midst of the Saṅgha, placed him in the foremost position among those who are eloquent. Then

original: arahattappattito pubbe ca pacchā ca taṃ taṃ cittaṃ āgamma bhāsitā. Theraṃ uddissa
analyzed: arahatta ppattito pubbe ca pacchā ca tam tam cittam āgamma bhāsitā theram uddissa
translated: the Elder, before and after his attainment of arahatship, spoke in accordance with his various thoughts. The Elder,

original: ānandattherādīhi bhāsitā ca –🔽“Nikkhantaṃ vata maṃ santaṃ, agārasmānagāriyaṃ;
analyzed: ānandatthera ādīhi bhāsitā ca  nikkhantam vata mam santam agārasmā anagāriyam
translated: and those spoken by Ānanda and others, with reference to the Elder,🔽“Having gone forth, I am peaceful, from home to the homeless life;

original: Vitakkā upadhāvanti, pagabbhā kaṇhato ime.
analyzed: vitakkāḥ upadhāvanti pagabbhāḥ kaṇhataḥ ime
translated: Thoughts run towards me, these foolish ones, from the darkness.

original: “Uggaputtā mahissāsā, sikkhitā daḷhadhammino;
analyzed: ugga puttāḥ mahissāsāḥ sikkhitāḥ daḷha dhamminaḥ
translated: “The sons of Uggā, the great lords, trained, of great strength;

original: Samantā parikireyyuṃ, sahassaṃ apalāyinaṃ.
analyzed: samantā parikireyyum sahassam apalāyinam
translated: They would surround me on all sides, a thousand, not fleeing.

original: “Sacepi ettakā bhiyyo, āgamissanti itthiyo;
analyzed: sacepi ettakā bhiyyas āgamissanti itthiyaḥ
translated: “Even if more than this, so many women should come;

original: Neva maṃ byādhayissanti, dhamme samhi patiṭṭhito.
analyzed: na iva mama byādhayissanti dhamme samhi patiṭṭhitaḥ
translated: They will not afflict me, for I am established in the Dhamma.

original: “Sakkhī hi me sutaṃ etaṃ, buddhassādiccabandhuno;
analyzed: sakkhī hi me sutam etam buddhassa adicca bandhunaḥ
translated: “I am a witness to this, heard from the Buddha, the kinsman of the sun;

original: Nibbānagamanaṃ maggaṃ, tattha me nirato mano.
analyzed: nibbāna gamanam maggam tattha me nirataḥ mano
translated: The path that leads to Nibbāna, there my mind finds delight.

original: “Evañce maṃ viharantaṃ, pāpima upagacchasi;
analyzed: evañce mama viharantam pāpimaḥ upagacchasi
translated: If, Evil One, you come to me while I am living thus,

original: Tathā maccu karissāmi, na me maggampi dakkhasi.
analyzed: tathā maccu karissāmi na me maggam pi dakkhasi
translated: I will make an end of you, you will not see my path.

original: “Aratiñca ratiñca pahāya, sabbaso gehasitañca vitakkaṃ;
analyzed: aratiñca ratiñca pahāya sabbasas geha sitañca vitakkam
translated: “Having abandoned disliking and liking, and all thoughts of the household life,

original: Vanathaṃ na kareyya kuhiñci, nibbanatho avanatho sa bhikkhu.
analyzed: vanatham na kareyya kuhiñci nibbanathaḥ avanathaḥ sa bhikkhu
translated: He would not make a thicket anywhere: unencumbered, unfettered, he is a bhikkhu.

original: “Yamidha pathaviñca vehāsaṃ, rūpagataṃ jagatogadhaṃ kiñci;
analyzed: yam idha pathaviñca vehāsam rūpa gatam jagatā ugadham kiñci
translated: “Whatever there is here on earth and in the firmament, in the universe with its gods,

original: Parijīyati sabbamaniccaṃ, evaṃ samecca caranti mutattā.
analyzed: parijīyati sabbam aniccam evam caranti muta ttā
translated: All that is subject to destruction. Having seen thus, the wise one wanders free.

original: “Upadhīsu janā gadhitāse, diṭṭhasute paṭighe ca mute ca;
analyzed: upadhīsu janāḥ diṭṭha sute paṭighe ca mute ca
translated: “People are bound by attachment to what is seen, heard, and sensed,🔽and by what is felt and thought. Here, the wise one should remove desire,

original: Ettha vinodaya chandamanejo, yo hettha na limpati muni tamāhu.
analyzed: ettha vinodaya chandam anejaḥ yaḥ ha itthā na limpati muni tam āhu
translated: he who is not attached here, him they call a sage.

original: “Atha saṭṭhisitā savitakkā, puthujjanatāya adhammā niviṭṭhā;
analyzed: atha saṭṭhi sitā sa vitakkā puthujjana tāya adhammā niviṭṭhā
translated: “Then the sixty-sixes with their sixty-sixes, fixed in the Dhamma, are not of the multitude.

original: Na ca vaggagatassa kuhiñci, no pana duṭṭhullagāhī sa bhikkhu.
analyzed: na ca vagga gatassa kuhiñci no pana duṭṭhulla gāhī sa bhikkhu
translated: He does not go in a group anywhere, nor does he grasp at anything: he is a bhikkhu.

original: “Dabbo cirarattasamāhito, akuhako nipako apihālu;
analyzed: dabbaḥ cira ratta samāhitaḥ a kuhakaḥ nipakaḥ a pihālu
translated: “The bold one, long concentrated, guileless, watchful, free from craving,

original: Santaṃ padaṃ ajjhagamā muni, paṭicca parinibbuto kaṅkhati kālaṃ.
analyzed: santam padam ajjhagamā muni paṭicca parinibbutaḥ kaṅkhati kālam
translated: The sage has reached the state of peace, and waits for the time, dependent on the end.

original: “Mānaṃ pajahassu gotama, mānapathañca jahassu asesaṃ;
analyzed: mānam pajahassu gotama māna patham ca jahassu asesam
translated: “Abandon pride, Gotama, and abandon completely the path of pride.

original: Mānapathamhi sa mucchito, vippaṭisārīhuvā cirarattaṃ.
analyzed: māna pathamhi sa mucchitaḥ vippaṭisārī huvā cira rattam
translated: He who is deluded on the path of pride, will for a long time be full of regret.

original: “Makkhena makkhitā pajā, mānahatā nirayaṃ papatanti;
analyzed: makkhena makkhitāḥ pajāḥ māna hatāḥ nirayam papatanti
translated: “The people who are stained by conceit, who are struck down by pride, fall into hell.

original: Socanti janā cirarattaṃ, mānahatā nirayaṃ upapannā.
analyzed: socanti janā cira rattam māna hatā nirayam upapannā
translated: People grieve for a long time, struck down by pride, reborn in hell.

original: “Na hi socati bhikkhu kadāci, maggajino sammā paṭipanno;
analyzed: na hi socati bhikkhu kadāci magga jino sammā paṭipanno
translated: “The monk who has won the path, who has practiced rightly, does not grieve at any time.

original: Kittiñca sukhañcānubhoti, dhammadasoti tamāhu tathattaṃ.
analyzed: kittiñca sukhañca anubhoti dhamma dasaḥ iti tam āhu tathattam
translated: He experiences fame and happiness, he is called a ‘seer of the Dhamma.’

original: “Tasmā akhilo idha padhānavā, nīvaraṇāni pahāya visuddho;
analyzed: tasmai akhilaḥ idha padhānavā nīvaraṇāni pahāya visuddhaḥ
translated: “Therefore, one who is free from anger here, who has abandoned the hindrances, purified,

original: Mānañca pahāya asesaṃ, vijjāyantakaro samitāvī.
analyzed: mānam ca pahāya asesam samitāvī
translated: and has abandoned pride completely, is one who has made an end of (rebirth in) the lower realms, a sage.

original: “Kāmarāgena ḍayhāmi, cittaṃ me pariḍayhati;
analyzed: kāma rāgena ḍayhāmi cittam me pariḍayhati
translated: “I am burning with lust and passion, my mind is burning,

original: Sādhu nibbāpanaṃ brūhi, anukampāya gotama.
analyzed: sādhu nibbāpanam brūhi anukampāya gotama
translated: please tell me the quenching, out of compassion, Gotama.

original: “Saññāya vipariyesā, cittaṃ te pariḍayhati;
analyzed: saññāya vipariyesā cittam te pariḍayhati
translated: “Your mind is burning because of a wrong perception,

original: Nimittaṃ parivajjehi, subhaṃ rāgūpasaṃhitaṃ.
analyzed: nimittam parivajjehi subham rāgūpasaṃhitam
translated: avoid the sign that is beautiful, connected with passion.

original: “Asubhāya cittaṃ bhāvehi, ekaggaṃ susamāhitaṃ;
analyzed: asubhāya cittam bhāvehi ekaggam su samāhitam
translated: “Develop the mind in foulness, unified, well-concentrated;

original: Sati kāyagatā tyatthu, nibbidābahulo bhava.
analyzed: sati kāya gatā nibbidā bahulaḥ bhava
translated: Establish mindfulness directed to the body, and be full of dispassion.

original: “Animittañca bhāvehi, mānānusayamujjaha;
analyzed: animittam ca bhāvehi māna anusayam ujjaha
translated: “Develop the signless, and abandon the underlying tendency to conceit;

original: Tato mānābhisamayā, upasanto carissasi.
analyzed: tatas māna abhisamayāḥ upasantaḥ carissasi
translated: Then, by penetrating conceit, you will live in complete peace.

original: “Tameva vācaṃ bhāseyya, yāyattānaṃ na tāpaye;
analyzed: tam eva vācam bhāseyya yā āyattānam na tāpaye
translated: “One should speak such speech as brings no suffering to oneself🔽and causes no affliction to others;

original: Pare ca na vihiṃseyya, sā ve vācā subhāsitā.
analyzed: pare ca na vihiṃseyya sā ve vācā su bhāsitā
translated: such speech as is dear to the noble ones,🔽and is blameless to oneself.🔽“One should speak such speech as is full of truth,

original: “Piyavācameva bhāseyya, yā vācā paṭinanditā;
analyzed: piya vācam eva yā vācā paṭinanditā
translated: such speech as is full of friendliness;🔽such speech as, when one hears it, one is not ashamed of it,

original: Yaṃ anādāya pāpāni, paresaṃ bhāsate piyaṃ.
analyzed: yam an ādāya pāpāni paresam bhāsate piyam
translated: and which is not despised by the wise.

original: “Saccaṃ ve amatā vācā, esa dhammo sanantano;
analyzed: saccam ve amatā vācā esa dhammo sanantano
translated: “Truth is the deathlessness of speech; this is the eternal law;

original: Sacce atthe ca dhamme ca, āhu santo patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: sacce atthe ca dhamme ca āhu santaḥ patiṭṭhitā
translated: The good say that truth and reality and Dhamma are established.

original: “Yaṃ buddho bhāsati vācaṃ, khemaṃ nibbānapattiyā;
analyzed: yam buddhaḥ bhāsati vācam khemam nibbāna pattiyā
translated: “The speech that the Buddha speaks, which is safe and leads to Nibbana,

original: Dukkhassantakiriyāya, sā ve vācānamuttamā.
analyzed: dukkha ssanta kiriyāya sā ve vācānam uttamā
translated: which brings an end to suffering, is the best of all speech.

original: “Gambhīrapañño medhāvī, maggāmaggassa kovido;
analyzed: gambhīra paññaḥ medhāvī magga amaggassa kovidaḥ
translated: “The wise one, the intelligent one, who is skilled in what is the path and what is not the path,

original: Sāriputto mahāpañño, dhammaṃ deseti bhikkhunaṃ.
analyzed: sāriputto mahā paññaḥ dhammaṃ deseti bhikkhunam
translated: the one of great wisdom, Sariputta, teaches the Dhamma to the bhikkhus.

original: “Saṃkhittenapi deseti, vitthārenapi bhāsati;
analyzed: deseti vitthārena api bhāsati
translated: “He teaches in brief, and he speaks in detail;

original: Sālikāyiva nigghoso, paṭibhānaṃ udiyyati.
analyzed: sālikāya iva nigghosaḥ paṭibhānam udiyyati
translated: The sound of the recitation is like the cry of the sālikā bird,

original: “Tassa taṃ desayantassa, suṇanti madhuraṃ giraṃ;
analyzed: tassa tam desayantassa suṇanti madhuram giram
translated: As he teaches, they listen to his sweet voice,

original: Sarena rajanīyena, savanīyena vaggunā;
analyzed: sarena rajanīyena savanīyena vaggunā
translated: With a captivating tone, pleasant and beautiful,

original: Udaggacittā muditā, sotaṃ odhenti bhikkhavo.
analyzed: udagga cittāḥ muditāḥ sotam odhenti bhikkhavaḥ
translated: The monks listen with uplifted minds and joy.

original: “Ajja pannarase visuddhiyā, bhikkhū pañcasatā samāgatā;
analyzed: ajja pannarase visuddhiyā bhikkhū pañca satā samāgatā
translated: “Today on the fifteenth, the day of the observance, five hundred monks have gathered,

original: Saṃyojanabandhanacchidā, anīghā khīṇapunabbhavā isī.
analyzed: saṃyojana bandhana chidāḥ anīghā khīṇa punabbhavā isī
translated: Those who have cut the bonds and fetters, the burden laid down, free from grief, the cankers destroyed.

original: “Cakkavattī yathā rājā, amaccaparivārito;
analyzed: cakkavattī yathā rājā amacca parivārito
translated: “Just as a universal monarch, surrounded by his ministers,

original: Samantā anupariyeti, sāgarantaṃ mahiṃ imaṃ.
analyzed: samantā anupariyeti sāgarantam mahim imam
translated: Goes around this earth surrounded by the ocean,

original: “Evaṃ vijitasaṅgāmaṃ, satthavāhaṃ anuttaraṃ;
analyzed: evam vijita saṅgāmam satthavāham anuttaram
translated: “So the disciples attend on the one who has won the battle, the unsurpassed caravan leader,

original: Sāvakā payirupāsanti, tevijjā maccuhāyino.
analyzed: sāvakā tevijjāḥ maccu hāyinaḥ
translated: The knowers of the three knowledges, the conquerors of death.

original: “Sabbe bhagavato puttā, palāpettha na vijjati;
analyzed: sabbe bhagavataḥ puttāḥ palāpā ittha na vijjati
translated: “All of them are the Blessed One’s sons, there is no one here to be despised,

original: Taṇhāsallassa hantāraṃ, vande ādiccabandhunaṃ.
analyzed: taṇhā sallassa hantāram vande ādiccabandhunam
translated: I pay homage to the one who has destroyed the dart of craving, the kinsman of the sun.

original: “Parosahassaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ, sugataṃ payirupāsati;
analyzed: parosahassam bhikkhūnam sugatam payirupāsati
translated: “More than a thousand monks attend on the Accomplished One,

original: Desentaṃ virajaṃ dhammaṃ, nibbānaṃ akutobhayaṃ.
analyzed: desentam virajam dhammam nibbānam akutobhayam
translated: As he teaches the stainless Dhamma, Nibbāna, free from fear.

original: “Suṇanti dhammaṃ vimalaṃ, sammāsambuddhadesitaṃ;
analyzed: suṇanti dhammam vimalam sammāsambuddha desitam
translated: “They listen to the stainless Dhamma taught by the Perfect Sambuddha,

original: Sobhati vata sambuddho, bhikkhusaṅghapurakkhato.
analyzed: sobhati vata sambuddhaḥ bhikkhu saṅgha purakkhataḥ
translated: The Sambuddha shines in glory, with the Bhikkhu-Saṅgha in his train.

original: “Nāganāmosi bhagavā, isīnaṃ isisattamo;
analyzed: nāga nāmā asi bhagavā isīnam isi sattamaḥ
translated: “Thou art called a Nāga, O Blessed One, the seventh Seer of Seers;

original: Mahāmeghova hutvāna, sāvake abhivassasi.
analyzed: mahā meghaḥ uva hutvāna sāvake abhivassasi
translated: Like a great rain-cloud thou dost rain down on thy disciples.

original: “Divā vihārā nikkhamma, satthudassanakamyatā;
analyzed: divā vihārāḥ nikkhamma satthu dassana kamya tā
translated: “Having left the day-quarters, desirous of seeing the Teacher,

original: Sāvako te mahāvīra, pāde vandati vaṅgiso.
analyzed: sāvakaḥ te mahāvīra pāde vandati vaṅgiso
translated: Thy disciple, O mighty hero, the one of variegated hue, worships thy feet.

original: “Ummaggapathaṃ mārassa, abhibhuyya carati pabhijja khīlāni;
analyzed: ummagga patham mārassa abhibhuyya carati pabhijja khīlāni
translated: “Having overcome the path of Māra, he goes about, having broken the stakes;

original: Taṃ passatha bandhapamuñca karaṃ, asitaṃva bhāgaso pavibhajja.
analyzed: tam passatha bandha pamuñca karam asitam iva bhāgasaḥ pavibhajja
translated: See him, the giver of freedom from bondage, like a piece of meat cut off and divided.

original: “Oghassa hi nitaraṇatthaṃ, anekavihitaṃ maggaṃ akkhāsi;
analyzed: oghassa hi nitaraṇa attham aneka vihitam maggam akkhāsi
translated: “For the purpose of crossing the flood, he has declared the path in various ways;

original: Tasmiñca amate akkhāte, dhammadasā ṭhitā asaṃhīrā.
analyzed: tasmin ca amate akkhāte dhamma dasā ṭhitā asaṃhīrā
translated: And when that immortal state has been declared, the disciples of the Dhamma stand firm, unmoved.

original: “Pajjotakaro ativijjha, sabbaṭhitīnaṃ atikkamamaddasa;
analyzed: pajjota karaḥ ativijjha sabba ṭhitīnam atikkama maddasa
translated: “The one who has made the light has seen, by penetrating (the truth), the transcending of all stations;

original: Ñatvā ca sacchikatvā ca, aggaṃ so desayi dasaddhānaṃ.
analyzed: ñatvā ca sacchikatvā ca aggam saḥ desayi dasat hānam
translated: And having known and realized (the truth), he has taught the highest (state) to his ten disciples.

original: “Evaṃ sudesite dhamme, ko pamādo vijānataṃ dhammaṃ;
analyzed: evam su desite dhamme kaḥ pamādaḥ vijānatam dhammaṃ
translated: “When the Dhamma has been so well taught, what heedlessness can there be for those who know the Dhamma?

original: Tasmā hi tassa bhagavato sāsane, appamatto sadā namassamanusikkhe.
analyzed: tasmā hi tassa bhagavato sāsane appamattaḥ sadā namaḥ samanusikkhe
translated: Therefore, in the Dispensation of that Blessed One, one should always train with heedfulness, paying homage.

original: “Buddhānubuddho yo thero, koṇḍañño tibbanikkamo;
analyzed: buddhānubuddhaḥ yaḥ thero koṇḍañño tibba nikkamaḥ
translated: “The Elder Koṇḍañña, who was awakened after the Awakened One,

original: Lābhī sukhavihārānaṃ, vivekānaṃ abhiṇhaso.
analyzed: lābhī sukha vihārānam vivekānam
translated: who was diligent, who often attained the blissful🔽“Whatever is to be attained by a disciple

original: “Yaṃ sāvakena pattabbaṃ, satthu sāsanakārinā;
analyzed: yam sāvakena pattabbam satthu sāsana kārinā
translated: who is a doer of what the Teacher says,🔽all that has been attained by me,

original: Sabbassa taṃ anuppattaṃ, appamattassa sikkhato.
analyzed: sabbassa tat an uppattam appamattassa sikkhato
translated: while training with diligence.

original: “Mahānubhāvo tevijjo, cetopariyakovido;
analyzed: mahā anubhāvaḥ tevijjaḥ cetaḥ pariya kovidaḥ
translated: “He is of great power, a Triple-Knowledge Master,🔽who has knowledge of the highest mind,🔽Koṇḍañña, the Buddha’s heir,

original: Koṇḍañño buddhadāyādo, pāde vandati satthuno.
analyzed: koṇḍaññaḥ buddha dāyādaḥ pāde vandati satthuno
translated: pays homage at the Teacher’s feet.🔽“Seated at the foot of a tree,

original: “Nagassa passe āsīnaṃ, muniṃ dukkhassa pāraguṃ;
analyzed: nagassa passe āsīnam munim dukkhassa pāragum
translated: the sage who has gone beyond suffering,🔽is attended by disciples,

original: Sāvakā payirupāsanti, tevijjā maccuhāyino.
analyzed: sāvakā tevijjāḥ maccu hāyinaḥ
translated: Triple-Knowledge Masters who have conquered Death.🔽“Moggallāna, who has great power,

original: “Cetasā anupariyeti, moggallāno mahiddhiko;
analyzed: cetasā anupariyeti moggallānaḥ mahiddhikaḥ
translated: with his mind goes to them,🔽and finds their minds free,

original: Cittaṃ nesaṃ samanvesaṃ, vippamuttaṃ nirūpadhiṃ.
analyzed: cittam samanvesam vippamuttam nirūpadhim
translated: unbound by clinging.🔽“Thus the sage, who has gone beyond suffering,

original: “Evaṃ sabbaṅgasampannaṃ, muniṃ dukkhassa pāraguṃ;
analyzed: evam sabbaṅga sampannam munim dukkhassa pāragum
translated: who is endowed with all good qualities,🔽is attended by disciples,

original: Anekākārasampannaṃ, payirupāsanti gotamaṃ.
analyzed: aneka ākāra sampannam payiḥ upāsanti gotamam
translated: who are endowed with many forms.🔽“Just as the moon shines in a cloudless sky,

original: “Cando yathā vigatavalāhake nabhe, virocati vītamalova bhāṇumā;
analyzed: candaḥ yathā vigata valāhake nabhe virocati vīta malā uva bhāṇumā
translated: bright and spotless,🔽so you, Aṅgīrasa, great sage,

original: Evampi aṅgīrasa tvaṃ mahāmuni, atirocasi yasasā sabbalokaṃ.
analyzed: evam pi aṅgīrasa tvam mahā muni atirocasi yasasā sabba lokam
translated: shine with glory over the whole world.

original: “Kāveyyamattā vicarimha pubbe, gāmā gāmaṃ purā puraṃ;
analyzed: kāveyya mattāḥ vicarimha pubbe gāmā gāmam purā puram
translated: “We roamed about like fools, from village to village, from town to town,

original: Athaddasāma sambuddhaṃ, sabbadhammāna pāraguṃ.
analyzed: athaddasāma sambuddham sabba dhammāna pāragum
translated: but then we saw the Buddha, the One Awakened, who had gone beyond all states of existence.

original: “So me dhammamadesesi, muni dukkhassa pāragū;
analyzed: saḥ me dhammam adesesi muni dukkhassa pāragū
translated: “He taught me the Dhamma, the sage who had gone beyond suffering,

original: Dhammaṃ sutvā pasīdimha, saddhā no udapajjatha.
analyzed: dhammam sutvā pasīdimha saddhāḥ naḥ udapajjatha
translated: and having heard the Dhamma, we were inspired, and faith arose in us.

original: “Tassāhaṃ vacanaṃ sutvā, khandhe āyatanāni ca;
analyzed: tassa aham vacanam sutvā khandhe āyatanāni ca
translated: “Having heard his words, about the aggregates, the sense-spheres,

original: Dhātuyo ca viditvāna, pabbajiṃ anagāriyaṃ.
analyzed: dhātuyaḥ ca viditvāna pabbajim anagāriyam
translated: and having understood the elements, I went forth from the household life.

original: “Bahūnaṃ vata atthāya, uppajjanti tathāgatā;
analyzed: bahūnam vata atthāya uppajjanti tathāgatā
translated: “The Buddhas appear for the benefit of the many,

original: Itthīnaṃ purisānañca, ye te sāsanakārakā.
analyzed: itthīnam purisānam ca ye te sāsana kārakā
translated: for the happiness of the many, out of compassion for the world, for the good, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: “Tesaṃ kho vata atthāya, bodhimajjhagamā muni;🔽Bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīnañca, ye niyāmagataddasā.🔽“Sudesitā cakkhumatā, buddhenādiccabandhunā;
analyzed: tesam kho vata atthāya bodhim ajjhagamā muni  bhikkhūnam bhikkhunīnam ca ye  su desitā cakkhumatā buddhena adicca bandhunā
translated: “The sage who has gone to the middle of the Bodhi Tree🔽for the benefit of the many, for the happiness of the many, out of compassion for the world, for the good, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans,🔽“The four noble truths🔽have been well-taught by the Visionary, by the Kinsman of the Sun,

original: Cattāri ariyasaccāni, anukampāya pāṇinaṃ.
analyzed: cattāri ariya saccāni anukampāya
translated: out of compassion for the world, for the good, benefit, and happiness of gods and humans.

original: “Dukkhaṃ dukkhasamuppādaṃ, dukkhassa ca atikkamaṃ;
analyzed: dukkham dukkha samuppādam dukkhassa ca atikkamam
translated: “Suffering, the origin of suffering, the transcending of suffering,

original: Ariyaṃ caṭṭhaṅgikaṃ maggaṃ, dukkhūpasamagāminaṃ.
analyzed: ariyam caṭṭhaṅgikam maggam dukkha upasama gāminam
translated: and the noble eightfold path that leads to the stilling of suffering—

original: “Evamete tathā vuttā, diṭṭhā me te yathā tathā;
analyzed: evam ete tathā vuttāḥ diṭṭhāḥ me te yathā tathā
translated: “Thus have I been told, and thus I see;

original: Sadattho me anuppatto, kataṃ buddhassa sāsanaṃ.
analyzed: sadatthaḥ me anuppatto katam buddhassa sāsanam
translated: My true goal is reached, the Buddha’s word fulfilled.

original: “Svāgataṃ vata me āsi, mama buddhassa santike;
analyzed: svāgatam vata me āsi mama buddhassa santike
translated: “Welcome to me was the Buddha’s presence,

original: Suvibhattesu dhammesu, yaṃ seṭṭhaṃ tadupāgamiṃ.
analyzed: su vibhattesu dhammesu yam seṭṭham tad upāgamim
translated: In the well-analyzed teachings I have found the best.

original: “Abhiññāpāramippatto, sotadhātu visodhitā;
analyzed: abhiññāpārami patto sota dhātu visodhitā
translated: “I have attained the perfection of direct knowledge, my ear-element is purified;

original: Tevijjo iddhipattomhi, cetopariyakovido.
analyzed: tevijjaḥ iddhipatto mhi cetopariya kovidaḥ
translated: I am a triple-knowledge holder, a possessor of supernormal power, skilled in reading the minds of others.

original: “Pucchāmi satthāramanomapaññaṃ, diṭṭheva dhamme yo vicikicchānaṃ chettā;
analyzed: pucchāmi satthāram anomapaññam diṭṭhe iva dhamme yaḥ vicikicchānam chettā
translated: “I ask the Teacher, whose wisdom is sublime, who cuts off doubt right here and now,

original: Aggāḷave kālamakāsi bhikkhu, ñāto yasassī abhinibbutatto.
analyzed: aggāḷave kālam akāsi bhikkhu ñātaḥ yasassī abhinibbuta ttaḥ
translated: The monk Nigrodhakappa has died: is he renowned, glorious, and fully extinguished?

original: “Nigrodhakappo iti tassa nāmaṃ, tayā kataṃ bhagavā brāhmaṇassa;
analyzed: nigrodhakappaḥ iti tassa nāmam tayā katam bhagavā brāhmaṇassa
translated: “Nigrodhakappa was his name, and you gave him that name, Blessed One,

original: So taṃ namassaṃ acari mutyapekho, āraddhavīriyo daḷhadhammadassī.
analyzed: saḥ tam namassam acari mutya pekhaḥ āraddha vīriyaḥ daḷha dhamma dassī
translated: He paid homage to you, and then went away, his faculties controlled, his energy aroused, and his vision of the Dhamma clear.

original: “Taṃ sāvakaṃ sakka mayampi sabbe, aññātumicchāma samantacakkhu;
analyzed: tam sāvakam sakka mayam pi sabbe aññātum icchāma samanta cakkhu
translated: “We too, O Sakyan, wish to know that disciple of yours, O all-seeing one.

original: Samavaṭṭhitā no savanāya sotā, tuvaṃ no satthā tvamanuttarosi.
analyzed: samavaṭṭhitā naḥ savanāya sotā tuvam naḥ satthā tvam anuttarā asi
translated: We have assembled to hear, for you are our Teacher, unsurpassed.

original: “Chinda no vicikicchaṃ brūhi metaṃ, parinibbutaṃ vedaya bhūripañña;
analyzed: chinda naḥ vicikiccham brūhi mā etam parinibbutam vedaya bhūri pañña
translated: “Cut off our doubt and tell us this, O you of great wisdom, tell us how the one who has attained Nibbāna is.

original: Majjheva no bhāsa samantacakkhu, sakkova devāna sahassanetto.
analyzed: majjhā iva naḥ bhāsa samanta cakkhu sakkaḥ uva devāna sahassa netto
translated: Speak to us, O All-Seeing One, just as Sakka, the thousand-eyed one, spoke to the gods.

original: “Ye keci ganthā idha mohamaggā, aññāṇapakkhā vicikicchaṭhānā;
analyzed: ye keci ganthāḥ idha moha maggāḥ aññāṇa pakkhāḥ vicikiccha ṭhānā
translated: “Whatever knots there are here, the paths to delusion, the wings of ignorance, the abodes of doubt,

original: Tathāgataṃ patvā na te bhavanti, cakkhuñhi etaṃ paramaṃ narānaṃ.
analyzed: tathāgatam patvā na te bhavanti cakkhum hi etam paramam
translated: when one has gone to the Tathāgata, they are no more. For he is the supreme eye of men.

original: “No ce hi jātu puriso kilese, vāto yathā abbhaghanaṃ vihāne;
analyzed: no ce hi jātu purisaḥ kilese vātaḥ yathā abbha ghanam vihāne
translated: “If a man does not at any time abandon the defilements, like the wind a frail boat,

original: Tamovassa nivuto sabbaloko, jotimantopi na pabhāseyyuṃ.
analyzed: tamovassa nivutaḥ sabba lokaḥ jotimanto api na
translated: then the whole world would be enveloped in darkness; even the radiant one would not shine.

original: “Dhīrā ca pajjotakarā bhavanti, taṃ taṃ ahaṃ vīra tatheva maññe;
analyzed: dhīrā ca pajjota karāḥ bhavanti tam tam aham vīra tathā iva maññe
translated: “But the wise ones are the illuminators; I think it is just so, O Hero.

original: Vipassinaṃ jānamupāgamimha, parisāsu no āvikarohi kappaṃ.
analyzed: vipassinam jānam upāgamimha parisāsu naḥ āvikarohi kappam
translated: We have come to Vipassī, the Knower; reveal to us the truth in the assemblies.

original: “Khippaṃ giraṃ eraya vaggu vagguṃ, haṃsova paggayha saṇikaṃ nikūja;
analyzed: khippam giram eraya vaggu vaggum haṃsa uva paggayha saṇikam nikūja
translated: “Quickly utter the sweet, sweet speech, like a swan stretching out and cooing softly,

original: Bindussarena suvikappitena, sabbeva te ujjugatā suṇoma.
analyzed: bindussarena su vikappitena sabbe iva te ujjugatā suṇoma
translated: with a voice well-modulated, we all listen attentively.

original: “Pahīnajātimaraṇaṃ asesaṃ, niggayha dhonaṃ vadessāmi dhammaṃ;
analyzed: pahīna jāti maraṇam asesam niggayha dhonam vadessāmi dhammaṃ
translated: “Having abandoned birth and death without remainder, having attained the state of purity, I will teach the Dhamma;

original: Na kāmakāro hi puthujjanānaṃ, saṅkheyyakāro ca tathāgatānaṃ.
analyzed: na kāma kāraḥ hi puthujjanānam saṅkheyya kāraḥ ca tathāgatānam
translated: For the ordinary man acts according to his desires, but the Tathagatas act according to the Dhamma.”🔽“Your reply is complete,

original: “Sampannaveyyākaraṇaṃ tavedaṃ, samujjupaññassa samuggahītaṃ;
analyzed: sampanna veyyākaraṇam tava idam samujju paññassa samuggahītam
translated: and your answer is well-received.

original: Ayamañjali pacchimo suppaṇāmito, mā mohayī jānamanomapañña.
analyzed: ayam añjali pacchimaḥ mā mohayī
translated: This last question has been well-devised; do not deceive me, O wise one.”🔽“Having understood the noble Dhamma,

original: “Paroparaṃ ariyadhammaṃ viditvā, mā mohayī jānamanomavīriya;
analyzed: para uparam ariya dhammam viditvā mā
translated: do not deceive me, O wise one.🔽Like a cloud pouring rain on a lake,

original: Vāriṃ yathā ghammani ghammatatto, vācābhikaṅkhāmi sutaṃ pavassa.
analyzed: vārim yathā ghammani ghamma tattaḥ vācā abhikaṅkhāmi sutam pavassa
translated: I wish to hear your reply.”🔽“For what purpose did you live the holy life?

original: “Yadatthikaṃ brahmacariyaṃ acarī, kappāyano kaccissataṃ amoghaṃ;
analyzed: yadatthikam brahmacariyam acarī kappāyanaḥ kaccissatam amogham
translated: Was it in vain, O Kappa?🔽Did he attain Nibbāna with or without residue?

original: Nibbāyi so ādu saupādiseso, yathā vimutto ahu taṃ suṇoma.
analyzed: nibbāyi saḥ sa aupādisesaḥ yathā vimuttaḥ ahu tam suṇoma
translated: We wish to hear how he was liberated.”

original: “Acchecchi taṇhaṃ idha nāmarūpe, (iti bhagavā,)
analyzed: nāma rūpe iti bhagavā
translated: “He severed craving for name-and-form right here,

original: Kaṇhassa sotaṃ dīgharattānusayitaṃ;
analyzed: kaṇhassa sotam dīgha ratta anusayitam
translated: The black flood that had flowed for a long time.🔽He crossed over birth and death completely;

original: Atāri jātiṃ maraṇaṃ asesaṃ, iccabravi bhagavā pañcaseṭṭho.
analyzed: atāri jātim maraṇam asesam bhagavā pañcaseṭṭhaḥ
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One, the best of the five.”

original: “Esa sutvā pasīdāmi, vaco te isisattama;
analyzed: esa sutvā pasīdāmi vacaḥ te isi sattama
translated: “Having heard this, I am confident,🔽in your words, O best of sages.🔽It seems my question was not in vain;

original: Amoghaṃ kira me puṭṭhaṃ, na maṃ vañcesi brāhmaṇo.
analyzed: amogham kira me puṭṭham na mama vañcesi brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: the brahmin does not deceive me.”

original: “Yathā vādī tathā kārī, ahu buddhassa sāvako;
analyzed: yathā vādī tathā kārī ahu buddhassa sāvako
translated: “As he spoke, so he acted, a disciple of the Buddha was he.

original: Acchecchi maccuno jālaṃ, tataṃ māyāvino daḷhaṃ.
analyzed: acchecchi maccunaḥ jālam tatam māyāvinaḥ daḷham
translated: He cut the net of Death, the strong, the wily one’s net.

original: “Addasa bhagavā ādiṃ, upādānassa kappiyo;
analyzed: addasa bhagavā ādim upādānassa kappiyaḥ
translated: “The Blessed One saw the beginning of the taking of what is not given,🔽The one who is free from taking what is not given has gone beyond,

original: Accagā vata kappāno, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.
analyzed: accagāḥ vata kappānaḥ maccudheyyam su duttaram
translated: The hard-to-cross realm of Death.

original: “Taṃ devadevaṃ vandāmi, puttaṃ te dvipaduttama;
analyzed: tam devadevam vandāmi puttam te dvipad uttama
translated: “I pay homage to that God of gods, your son, supreme of men,

original: Anujātaṃ mahāvīraṃ, nāgaṃ nāgassa orasa”nti. –🔽Imā gāthā saṅgītikāle ekajjhaṃ katvā saṅgahaṃ āropitā. Tattha “nikkhantaṃ vata maṃ
analyzed: anujātam mahāvīram nāgam nāgassa orasanti  imāḥ gāthāḥ saṅgīti kāle ekajjham katvā saṅgaham āropitā tattha nikkhantam vata mama
translated: The one born after, the great hero, the elephant, the elephant’s son.”🔽These verses were recited at the time of the recitation and were included in the collection. There, the five verses beginning with “Gone forth, indeed, am I”

original: santa”ntiādayo pañca gāthā āyasmā vaṅgīso navo acirapabbajito hutvā vihāraṃ upagatā
analyzed: pañca gāthāḥ āyasmā vaṅgīsaḥ navaḥ acira pabbajitaḥ hutvā vihāram upagatā
translated: were spoken by the Venerable Vangīsa when he was new, not long after going forth, having gone to the monastery

original: alaṅkatapaṭiyattā sambahulā itthiyo disvā uppannarāgo taṃ vinodento abhāsi.
analyzed: alaṅkata paṭiyattā sambahulāḥ itthiyaḥ disvā uppanna rāgaḥ tam vinodentaḥ abhāsi
translated: and seeing many women adorned and prepared, his lust arisen, he spoke to dispel it.

original: Tattha nikkhantaṃ vata maṃ santaṃ, agārasmānagāriyanti agārato nikkhantaṃ anagāriyaṃ
analyzed: tattha nikkhantam vata mam santam agārasmā anagāriyanti agārataḥ nikkhantam anagāriyam
translated: There, “Gone forth, indeed, am I, peaceful, from the house to the houseless life” means having gone forth from the house to the houseless life,

original: pabbajitaṃ maṃ samānaṃ. Vitakkāti kāmavitakkādayo pāpavitakkā. Upadhāvantīti mama
analyzed: pabbajitam mama samānam vitakka ati kāma vitakka ādayaḥ pāpa vitakkāḥ upadhāvanti iti mama
translated: having become one who has gone forth. Thoughts means evil thoughts such as sensual thoughts. They run towards me means they run towards me.

original: cittaṃ upagacchanti. Pagabbhāti pāgabbhiyayuttā vasino. “Ayaṃ gehato nikkhamitvā
analyzed: cittam upagacchanti pagabbhāti pāgabbhiya yuttāḥ vasinaḥ ayam gehataḥ nikkhamitvā
translated: they approach the mind. In the open air: living in the open air. “Having gone forth from the home life

original: pabbajito, nayimaṃ anuddhaṃsituṃ yutta”nti evaṃ aparihārato nillajjā. Kaṇhatoti kāḷato,🔽lāmakabhāvatoti attho. Imeti tesaṃ attano paccakkhatā vuttā.🔽Asuddhajīvino parivārayuttā manussā uggakiccatāya “uggā”ti vuccanti, tesaṃ puttā
analyzed: pabbajitaḥ na yimam an uddhaṃsitum yuttam ti evam aparihārataḥ nillajjā kaṇhataḥ ti kāḷataḥ  lāmaka bhāvataḥ ti attho ime iti tesam attanaḥ paccakkhatā vuttā  asuddha jīvino parivāra yuttāḥ manussāḥ ugga kicca tāya uggā ti vuccanti tesam puttāḥ
translated: They approach the mind. They are called ‘unashamed’ because they are shameless about not avoiding what should not be done. ‘Dark’ means black; the meaning is, ‘dull’. ‘These’ refers to themselves.

original: uggaputtā. Mahissāsāti mahāissāsā. Sikkhitāti dvādasa vassāni ācariyakule uggahitasippā.
analyzed: ugga puttā mahissāsā ati mahā aissāsā sikkhitā ati dvādasa vassāni ācariya kule uggahita sippā
translated: People who are impure-lived and who are surrounded by a retinue are called ‘leaders’ because they are prominent. The sons of those leaders are ‘leaders’ sons. ‘Great archers’ are those who are skilled. ‘Skilled’ means those who have learned the craft for twelve years in the teacher’s house.

original: Daḷhadhamminoti, daḷhadhanuno. Daḷhadhanu nāma dvisahassathāmaṃ vuccati. Dvisahassathāmanti,🔽ca yassa āropitassa jiyāya bandho lohasīsādīnaṃ bhāro daṇḍe gahetvā yāva kaṇḍapamāṇā
analyzed: daḷhadhammino ti daḷhadhanunaḥ daḷhadhanu nāma dvi sahassa thāmam vuccati dvi sahassa thāmanti  ca yassa āropitassa bandho loha sīsa ādīnam bhāraḥ daṇḍe gahetvā
translated: ‘Great bowmen’ are those who have a strong bow. A strong bow is said to be one that has a pull of two thousand pounds. A pull of two thousand pounds is

original: nabhaṃ ukkhittassa pathavito muccati. Samantā parikireyyunti samantato kaṇḍe khipeyyuṃ.
analyzed: nabham ukkhittassa pathavitaḥ muccati samantā parikireyyunti samantataḥ kaṇḍe khipeyyuṃ
translated: the weight that can be lifted by a man holding a stick and that can be released from the ground up to the height of a knee. ‘They would scatter all around’ means they would scatter all around the knee.

original: Kittakāti ce āha “sahassaṃ apalāyina”nti. Yuddhe aparaṃ mukhānaṃ sahassamattānaṃ.
analyzed: kittakā ati ce āha sahassam apalāyinan ti yuddhe aparam mukhānam sahassa mattānam
translated: How many? A thousand archers, never turning back in battle.

original: Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – sikkhitā katahatthā uggā daḷhadhanuno mahissāsā uggaputtā sahassamattā🔽kadācipi yuddhe parājayaṃ apattā appamattā samantato ṭhatvā thambhaṃ upanissāya sacepi🔽vasseyyuṃ. Tādisehipi issāsasahassehi samantā sare parikirīyante susikkhito puriso
analyzed: idam vuttam hoti sikkhitā katahatthā uggāḥ daḷha dhanunaḥ mahissāsā ugga puttā sahassa mattā  kadācipi yuddhe parājayam a pattā appamattā samantataḥ ṭhatvā thambham upanissāya sace pi  vasseyyum tādisehi pi issāsa sahassehi samantā sare su sikkhitaḥ puriso
translated: This is the meaning: a thousand archers, well trained, skilled, strong, with good bows and arrows, with good sons,🔽even if they were to stand all around and for a whole year were to shoot arrows at the post,

original: daṇḍaṃ gahetvā sabbe sare attano sarīre apatamāne katvā pādamūle pāteyya. Tattha
analyzed: daṇḍam gahetvā sabbe sare attano sarīre a patamāne katvā pāda mūle pāteyya tattha
translated: nevertheless a well-trained man, taking a stick, could make all the arrows fall at his feet without letting any touch his body.

original: ekopi issāso dve sare ekato khipanto nāma natthi. Itthiyo pana rūpārammaṇādivasena
analyzed: ekaḥ api issāsaḥ dve sare ekatas khipantaḥ nāma natthi itthiyaḥ pana rūpa ārammaṇa ādi vasena
translated: There is not one of those archers who could shoot two arrows together. But women,

original: pañca pañca sare ekato khipanti, evaṃ khipantiyo. Ettakā bhiyyoti imāhi itthīhi bhiyyopi
analyzed: pañca pañca sare ekatas khipanti evam khipantiyaḥ ettakāḥ bhiyyas ti imāhi itthīhi
translated: through their objects of attachment such as beauty, shoot five arrows at a time.

original: bahū itthiyo attano itthikuttahāsabhāvādito vidhaṃsenti.
analyzed: bahū itthiyaḥ attanaḥ itthikutta hāsa bhāva āditaḥ vidhaṃsenti
translated: They shoot so much that they can surpass even those women.

original: Sakkhī hi me sutaṃ etanti sammukhā mayā etaṃ sutaṃ. Nibbānagamanaṃ magganti liṅgavipallāsena
analyzed: sakkhī hi me sutam etat ti sammukhāḥ mayā etam sutam nibbāna gamanam magganti liṅga vipallāsena
translated: Nibbānagamanaṃ maggaṃ = ‘The path leading to Nibbāna.’

original: vuttaṃ, nibbānagāmimaggoti attho, vipassanaṃ sandhāyāha. Tattha me nirato manoti
analyzed: vuttam nibbāna gāmi maggaḥ ti atthaḥ vipassanam sandhāya āha tattha me nirataḥ mano ti
translated: Vipassanā is meant.

original: tasmiṃ vipassanāmagge mayhaṃ cittaṃ nirataṃ.
analyzed: tasmin vipassanā magge mayham cittam niratam
translated: Tattha me nirato mano = ‘My mind is intent on that.’🔽On that path of insight.🔽Evañce maṃ viharantanti = ‘If I live thus.’

original: Evañce maṃ viharantanti evaṃ aniccaasubhajjhānabhāvanāya ca vipassanābhāvanāya ca🔽viharantaṃ maṃ. Pāpimāti kilesamāraṃ ālapati. Tathā maccu karissāmi, na me maggampi
analyzed: evam ce mam evam anicca asubha jjhāna bhāvanāya ca vipassanā bhāvanāya ca  viharantam mam pāpimā ati kilesa māram ālapati tathā karissāmi na me maggam pi
translated: By developing the meditation on the foul and impermanence and by developing insight.🔽Pāpimāti = ‘O Evil One.’ The defilement-Mara is addressed.🔽Tathā maccu karissāmi = ‘I will make Death an end.’

original: dakkhasīti mayā kataṃ maggampi yathā na passasi, tathā maccu antaṃ karissāmīti yojanā.🔽Aratiñcātiādikā pañca gāthā attano santāne uppanne aratiādike vinodentena vuttā.
analyzed: dakkhasi iti mayā katam maggam pi yathā na passasi tathā maccu antam karissāmi iti yojanā  pañca gāthā attano santāne uppanne arati ādike vinodentena vuttā
translated: Na me maggampi dakkhasī = ‘You will not see even the path I have made.’ The construction is: ‘I will make Death an end in such a way that you will not see even the path I have made.’

original: Tattha aratinti adhikusalesu dhammesu pantasenāsanesu ca ukkaṇṭhanaṃ. Ratinti pañcakāmaguṇaratiṃ.
analyzed: tattha aratim ti adhi kusalesu dhammesu panta senāsanesu ca ukkaṇṭhanam ratim ti pañca kāmaguṇa ratim
translated: Aratiñcātiādikā pañca gāthā = ‘The five verses beginning with “Aversion” ’. They were spoken by the Blessed One when he was removing aversion, etc., that had arisen in his own mental continuity.

original: Pahāyāti pajahitvā. Sabbaso gehasitañca vitakkanti, gehanissitaṃ puttadārādipaṭisaṃyuttaṃ🔽ñātivitakkādiñca micchāvitakkaṃ anavasesato pahāya. Vanathaṃ na kareyya kuhiñcīti
analyzed: pahāya ati pajahitvā sabbaso geha sitam ca vitakkam ti geha nissitam putta dāra ādi paṭisaṃyuttam  ñāti vitakka ādim ca micchā vitakkam anavasesataḥ pahāya vanatham na kareyya kuhiñci iti
translated: Pahāya = having abandoned. Sabbaso gehasitañca vitakkam = all thoughts connected with the household life, such as those connected with sons, wife, etc.,

original: ajjhattikabāhirappabhede sabbasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ taṇhaṃ na kareyyaṃ. Nibbanatho avanatho🔽sa bhikkhūti yo hi sabbena sabbaṃ nittaṇho, tato eva katthacipi nandiyā abhāvato
analyzed: ajjhattika bāhira ppabhede sabbasmim vatthusmim taṇham na kareyyam nibbanatho avanatho  sa bhikkhu iti yaḥ hi sabbena sabbam nittaṇhaḥ tatas eva katthacipi nandiyāḥ abhāvato
translated: and all wrong thoughts such as thoughts about relatives, etc. Vanathaṃ na kareyya kuhiñci = I would not have craving for anything, either internal or external. Nibbanatho avanatho = free from craving, free from passion.

original: avanatho, so bhikkhu nāma saṃsāre bhayassa sammadeva ikkhaṇatāya bhinnakilesatāya cāti attho.🔽Yamidha pathaviñca vehāsaṃ, rūpagataṃ jagatogadhaṃ kiñcīti yaṃkiñci idha pathavīgataṃ🔽bhūminissitaṃ vehāsaṃ vehāsaṭṭhaṃ devalokanissitaṃ rūpagataṃ rūpajātaṃ ruppanasabhāvaṃ
analyzed: avanathaḥ so bhikkhu nāma saṃsāre bhayassa sammadeva ikkhaṇa tāya bhinna kilesa tāya ca ati attho  yam idha pathaviñca vehāsam rūpa gatam jagatogadham kiñci iti yam kiñci idha pathavī gatam  bhūmi nissitam vehāsam vehāsaṭṭham deva loka nissitam rūpa gatam rūpa jātam ruppana sabhāvam
translated: Sa bhikkhūti = he is called a bhikkhu because he is completely free from craving, and because he is free from passion for anything anywhere.

original: jagatogadhaṃ lokikaṃ bhavattayapariyāpannaṃ saṅkhataṃ. Parijīyati sabbamaniccanti
analyzed: jagatogadham lokikam bhava ttaya pariyāpannam saṅkhatam parijīyati sabbam aniccanti
translated: Yamidha pathaviñca vehāsaṃ = whatever in this world, on earth and in the sky, is included in the realm of form. Rūpagataṃ jagatogadhaṃ kiñcīti = whatever in the realm of form, in the world, is included in the three planes of becoming, is conditioned. Parijīyati sabbamaniccanti = all that is impermanent.

original: sabbaṃ taṃ jarābhibhūtaṃ, tato eva aniccaṃ tato eva dukkhaṃ anattāti evaṃ tilakkhaṇāropanaṃ
analyzed: sabbam tam jarā abhibhūtam tatas eva aniccam tatas eva dukkham anattā ati evam ti lakkhaṇa āropanam
translated: “All that is overcome by ageing, and therefore it is impermanent, painful, not-self.”🔽This is called the Elder’s Great Insight.

original: āha. Ayaṃ therassa mahāvipassanāti vadanti. Evaṃ samecca caranti mutattāti evaṃ samecca
analyzed: āha ayam therassa mahā vipassanā iti vadanti evam samet ca caranti muta ttā iti evam samet ca
translated: “Thus having understood, they go free”: having thus understood,

original: abhisamecca vipassanāpaññāsahitāya maggapaññāya paṭivijjhitvā mutattā pariññātattabhāvā
analyzed: vipassanā paññā sahitāya magga paññāya paṭivijjhitvā muta ttā pariññāta tta bhāvā
translated: having penetrated with the understanding of the path accompanied by insight-understanding, having fully understood,

original: paṇḍitā caranti viharanti.
analyzed: paṇḍitā caranti viharanti
translated: the wise go, they live.

original: Upadhīsūti khandhūpadhiādīsu. Janāti andhaputhujjanā. Gadhitāseti paṭibaddhacittā.
analyzed: upadhīsu iti khandhūpadhi ādīsu janāti andha puthujjanā paṭibaddha cittā
translated: “The fetter”: in the aggregates, etc., as fetters. “The people”: the blind worldlings. “Clinging”: with their minds bound.

original: Ettha hi visesato kāmaguṇūpadhīsu chando apanetabboti dassento āha diṭṭhasute paṭighe🔽ca mute cāti. Diṭṭhasuteti diṭṭhe ceva sute ca, rūpasaddesūti attho. Paṭigheti ghaṭṭanīye
analyzed: ettha hi visesataḥ kāma guṇa upadhīsu chandaḥ apanetabbaḥ iti dassentaḥ āha diṭṭha sute paṭighe  ca mute ca ati diṭṭha suta iti diṭṭhe ca iva sute ca rūpa saddesu ti attho paṭigha iti ghaṭṭanīye
translated: For here, showing that desire should be abandoned in the case of the fetters of the sense-qualities, he said: “In the seen, the heard, and the sensed,

original: phoṭṭhabbe. Muteti vuttāvasese mute, gandharasesūti vuttaṃ hoti. Sāratthapakāsaniyaṃ
analyzed: phoṭṭhabbe mutā iti vutta avasese mute gandha rasesu iti vuttam hoti sārattha pakāsaniyam
translated: and in the cognized.” “In the seen, the heard”: in the seen and in the heard, in visible forms and sounds, is the meaning. “In the sensed”: in the tangible. “In the cognized”: in the remaining cognized, in smells and tastes, is what is meant.

original: “paṭighapadena gandharasā gahitā, mutapadena phoṭṭhabbārammaṇa”nti vuttaṃ. Ettha
analyzed: paṭigha padena gandha rasāḥ gahitāḥ muta padena phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇan ti vuttam ettha
translated: “By the word ‘resistance’ the object of smell and taste are included, and by the word ‘contact’ the object of touch.”

original: vinodaya chandamanejoti etasmiṃ diṭṭhādibhede pañcakāmaguṇe kāmacchandaṃ vinodehi,🔽tathā sati sabbattha anejo avikappo bhavasi. Yo hettha na limpati muni tamāhūti yo
analyzed: vinodaya chandam anejaḥ iti etasmin diṭṭha ādi bhede pañca kāmaguṇe kāma chandam vinodehi  tathā sati sabbattha anejaḥ avikappaḥ bhavasi yaḥ ha ittha na limpati yaḥ
translated: Herein, remove desire, be not excited: remove desire for the five strands of sensual desire classed as visible forms, etc.,

original: hi ettha kāmaguṇe taṇhālepena na limpati, taṃ moneyyadhammaṭṭhato “munī”ti paṇḍitā
analyzed: hi ettha kāma guṇe taṇhā lepena na limpati tam muni iti paṇḍitā
translated: and then you will be not excited, not agitated, in any of the six strands of sense desire. The sage who is not smeared here: the wise call him a “sage” because of his being steadied in the state of what is proper, since he is not smeared here by the stain of craving for the strands of sensual desire.

original: vadanti. “Atha saṭṭhisitā”ti pāḷīti adhippāyena keci “saṭṭhidhammārammaṇanissitā”ti
analyzed: vadanti atha saṭṭhi sitā ati pāḷī iti adhippāyena keci saṭṭhi dhamma ārammaṇa nissitā ati
translated: Some say that the meaning is “depending on the sixty-two views” according to the reading “saṭṭhisitā.”

original: atthaṃ vadanti. “Aṭṭhasaṭṭhisitā savitakkā”ti pana pāḷi, appakañhi ūnaṃ adhikaṃ vā🔽na gaṇanūpagaṃ hotīti. Aṭṭhasaṭṭhisitāti dvāsaṭṭhidiṭṭhigatasannissitā micchāvitakkāti
analyzed: attham vadanti aṭṭha saṭṭhi sitā sa vitakkā ati pana appakam hi ūnam adhikam vā  na gaṇana upagam hoti iti aṭṭha saṭṭhi sitā ati dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhi gata sannissitā micchā vitakkā ati
translated: But the reading is “aṭṭhasaṭṭhisitā,” and a small number less or more is not counted.

original: atthoti keci vadanti. Diṭṭhigatikā ca sattāvāsābhāvaladdhiṃ ajjhūpagatāti adhiccasamuppannavādaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ ti keci vadanti diṭṭhigatikā ca sattāvāsa abhāva laddhim ajjhūpagatā ti adhicca samuppanna vādam
translated: Some say that the meaning is “the sixty-two wrong thoughts depending on the sixty-two views” .🔽And the realms of being that are the bases for the views are the realms of being that are the bases for the false belief in a real self .

original: ṭhapetvā itaresaṃ vasena “atha saṭṭhisitā savitakkā”ti vuttaṃ. Yathā hi taṇhālepābhāvena
analyzed: ṭhapetvā itaresam vasena atha saṭṭhi sitā sa vitakkā iti vuttam yathā hi taṇhā lepa abhāvena
translated: But the rest are excluded, and so it is said, “Then sixty with applied thought. ”

original: bhikkhūti vuccati, evaṃ diṭṭhilepābhāvenapīti dassetuṃ “atha saṭṭhisitā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: bhikkhū ti vuccati evam diṭṭhi lepa abhāvena api iti dassetum atha saṭṭhi sita itiādi vuttam
translated: For just as a bhikkhu is so called because he has smeared himself with craving, so too he is so called because he has smeared himself with false view. This is shown by the words, “Then sixty with applied thought. ”

original: Puthujjanatāya adhammā niviṭṭhāti te pana micchāvitakkā niccādigāhavasena adhammā
analyzed: puthujjana tāya adhammā te pana micchā vitakkāḥ nicca ādi gāha vasena adhammā
translated: They are false views because of the fool’s adherence to them: these wrong thoughts are false because of the grasping of permanence, etc.,🔽and they are adhered to, fastened on to, by the fool because of his adherence to the individual.

original: dhammato apetā puthujjanatāyaṃ andhabāle niviṭṭhā abhiniviṭṭhā. Na ca vaggagatassa🔽kuhiñcīti yattha katthaci vatthusmiṃ sassatavādādimicchādiṭṭhivaggagato, taṃladdhiko🔽na ca assa bhaveyya. Aṭṭhakathāyaṃ pana “atha saṭṭhisitā savitakkā, puthū janatāya🔽adhammā niviṭṭhā”ti padaṃ uddharitvā atha cha ārammaṇanissitā puthū adhammavitakkā
analyzed: dhammataḥ apetā puthujjana tā ayam andha bāle niviṭṭhā abhiniviṭṭhā na ca vagga gatassa  kuhiñci iti yattha katthaci vatthusmim  na ca assa bhaveyya aṭṭhakathā ayam pana atha saṭṭhisitā sa vitakkā puthū janatāya  adhammā niviṭṭhā ati padam uddharitvā atha cha ārammaṇa nissitā puthū adhamma vitakkā
translated: And he would not have any: he would not have any of the views of eternalism, etc., which are called “false views” because of the grasping of permanence, etc., and which are “adherence to rules and vows” because of the adherence to the individual.🔽But in the Commentary the words, “Then sixty with applied thought, False views to which the fool adheres” are taken as a single clause, and then the words, “And he would not have any” are taken as a single clause. And so it is said: “Then the six false thoughts that are dependent on the six bases and that are called ‘false views’ are adhered to by the fool. ”

original: janatāya niviṭṭhāti vuttaṃ. Tathā na ca vaggagatassa kuhiñcīti tesaṃ vasena na katthaci
analyzed: janatāya niviṭṭhā iti vuttam tathā na ca vagga gatassa kuhiñci iti tesam vasena na katthaci
translated: And he would not have any: he would not have any of the views of eternalism, etc., which are called “false views” because of the grasping of permanence, etc., and which are “adherence to rules and vows” because of the adherence to the individual.

original: kilesavaggagato bhaveyyāti ca vuttaṃ. No pana duṭṭhullagāhī sa bhikkhūti yo kilesehi
analyzed: kilesa vagga gataḥ bhaveyya iti ca vuttam no pana duṭṭhulla gāhī sa bhikkhu iti yo kilesehi
translated: But he is not a monk who is a holder of what is extremely loose: he is not one who is defiled by defilements,

analyzed: dūsita ttā ativiya duṭṭhulla tā ca duṭṭhullānam micchā vādānam gaṇhana sīlo ca no assa  no bhaveyya so bhikkhu nāma hoti iti  dabbaḥ ti dabba jātiko paṇḍito cira ratta samāhito ti cira kālataḥ paṭṭhāya samāhitaḥ a kuhakaḥ iti
translated: who is extremely loose, who is of a nature to hold what is extremely loose, who is of a habit to hold what is extremely loose, who is of a tendency to hold what is extremely loose, who is of a disposition to hold what is extremely loose, who is of a character to hold what is extremely loose, who is of a nature to hold wrong views that are extremely loose.

original: kohaññarahito asaṭho amāyāvī. Nipakoti nipuṇo cheko. Apihālūti nittaṇho. Santaṃ padaṃ🔽ajjhagamāti, nibbānaṃ adhigato. Moneyyadhammasamannāgatato muni. Parinibbutoti ārammaṇakaraṇavasena
analyzed: kohañña rahitaḥ asaṭhaḥ a māyāvī nipako ti nipuṇaḥ chekaḥ apihālu uti nittaṇhaḥ santam padam  ajjhagamā ti nibbānam adhigataḥ moneyya dhamma samannāgatataḥ muni parinibbuto ti ārammaṇa karaṇa vasena
translated: He is a wise man, one of a wise nature. He is one who has been concentrated for a long time: he has been concentrated from a long time ago. He is not a deceiver: he is free from deceit. He is not a cheat: he is free from cheating. He is discerning: he is skilled, clever. He is not greedy: he is free from greed.🔽He has attained the state of peace: he has reached Nibbāna. He is a sage because he possesses the nature of one who is disciplined. He is fully quenched: he is fully quenched in the Nibbāna element with a residue of clinging left by making Nibbāna his object.

original: nibbānaṃ paṭicca saupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto. Kaṅkhati kālanti idāni
analyzed: nibbānam paṭicca sa aupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbutaḥ kaṅkhati kālanti idāni

analyzed: an upādisesa nibbāna tthāya kālam āgameti na tassa kiñci karaṇīyam atthi yathā ediso

translated: just as he is now. This is the meaning.

analyzed: mānam pajahassu iti ādayo catasso gāthā paṭibhāna sampattim nissāya attano pavattamānam  mānam vinodentena vuttā tattha mānam seyyamāna ādi navavidham mānam pariccaja  gotama ati gotama gottassa bhagavataḥ sāvaka ttā attānam gotama gottam katvā ālapati māna patham ti

At the end of the Buddha-interval he was reborn in the Brahmā-world.🔽When the present Buddha-dispensation appeared, he was reborn in the family of a brāhmaṇa of the Bharadvājā Gotra in the village of Nāḷandā in the Magadha country.🔽He was called Revata because he was born in a grove of reeds .

analyzed: sabbam eva māna pathamhi sa mucchitaḥ ti māna vatthu nimittam  muccham āpannaḥ vippaṭisārī huvā imasmin māna patha anuyoga kkhaṇe vītivatte

analyzed: pubbā iva arahattam pāpuṇissa naṭṭhaḥ ham asmi iti vippaṭisārī ahuvā ahosi

translated: He is “struck down by conceit” because his good qualities are struck down by conceit. “They fall into hell” means they are reborn in hell.

original: Maggajinoti maggena vijitakileso. Kittiñca sukhañcāti viññūhi pasaṃsitañca kāyikacetasikasukhañca🔽anubhotīti paṭilabhati. Dhammadasoti tamāhu tathattanti taṃ tathabhāvaṃ sammāpaṭipannaṃ

translated: “The one without blemish” is the one without the five mental blemishes. “The one with energy” is the one endowed with right effort and energy. “The one who is pure” is the one whose mind is pure by the removal of the obscurations called hindrances. “The one without remainder” is the one who has abandoned the nine kinds of conceit by means of the supreme path.

original: pajahitvā. Vijjāyantakaro samitāvīti sabbaso samitakileso tividhāya vijjāya pariyosānappatto
analyzed: pajahitvā vijjāyanta karo samitāvī iti sabbaso samita kileso tividhāya vijjāya pariyosāna ppatto

translated: The verse beginning with “If perception is distorted” was spoken by the venerable Ānanda, who was thus requested. “Distorted” means

analyzed: citta vikkhepa abhāvena ekaggam ārammaṇesu su samāhitam appitam katvā bhāvehi tava asubha anupassanam

analyzed: animittam ca bhāvehi iti nicca nimitta ādīnam ugghāṭanena visesataḥ anicca anupassanā animittā
translated: “And cultivate the signless”: the contemplation of impermanence, which is called “signless” because it abolishes the sign of permanence, etc.,

analyzed: nāma tatas māna anusayam ujjahāti tam bhāventaḥ magga paṭipāṭiyā agga magga adhigamena māna anusayam

analyzed: therena bhagavantam sammukhāḥ vuttāḥ na tāpaya iti vācāya
translated: By which speech one does not torment oneself: by which speech🔽one does not torment oneself with remorse, does not afflict oneself.

original: hetubhūtāya attānaṃ vippaṭisārena na tāpeyya na viheṭheyya. Pare ca na vihiṃseyyāti
analyzed: hetu bhūtāya attānam vippaṭisārena na tāpeyya na viheṭheyya pare ca na vihiṃseyya ati

analyzed: pare ca parehi bhindantaḥ na bādheyya sā ve vācā su bhāsitā ati sā vācā eka aṃsena su bhāsitā
translated: one does not afflict others by dividing them from others. That is truly well-spoken speech: that speech is truly well-spoken,
