analyzed: nāma tasmai tam eva vācam bhāseyya ati yojanā imāya gāthāya apisuṇa vācā avasena bhagavantam thoma iti
translated: therefore one should speak only that speech. This is the construction. By this verse he praises the Blessed One by way of non-malicious speech.

original: Paṭinanditāti paṭimukhabhāvena nanditā piyāyitā sampati āyatiñca suṇantehi sampaṭicchitā.
analyzed: paṭinanditā ati paṭimukha bhāvena nanditā piyāyitā āyatim ca suṇantehi sampaṭicchitā
translated: Is pleasing: is pleasing, is endearing, is accepted by those who listen now and in the future.

original: Yaṃ anādāyāti yaṃ vācaṃ bhāsanto pāpāni paresaṃ appiyāni aniṭṭhāni pharusavacanāni
analyzed: yam an ādāya ati yam vācam bhāsantaḥ pāpāni paresam appiyāni aniṭṭhāni pharusa vacanāni
translated: Which does not bring harm: which speech, when spoken, does not bring harm, does not bring unpleasant, undesirable, harsh words

original: anādāya aggahetvā atthabyañjanamadhuraṃ piyameva dīpeti. Tameva piyavācaṃ bhāseyyāti
analyzed: an ādāya agga hetvā attha byañjana madhuram piyam eva dīpeti tam eva piya vācam bhāseyya ati
translated: to others, not taking them up, not grasping them, but only revealing what is dear, sweet in meaning and phrasing. One should speak only that dear speech:

original: piyavācāvasena abhitthavi.
analyzed: piya vācā vasena abhitthavi
translated: he commends by way of dear speech.

original: Amatāti sādhubhāvena amatasadisā. Vuttañhetaṃ – “saccaṃ have sādhutaraṃ rasāna”nti.
analyzed: amatā ati sādhu bhāvena amata sadisā vuttam ha etam saccam have sādhutaram rasānan ti
translated: “Deathless” : good in the sense of being like the deathless . For this is said: “Truth is indeed the best of all flavors” .

original: Nibbānāmatapaccayattā vā amatā. Esa dhammo sanantanoti yā ayaṃ saccavācā nāma, esa
analyzed: nibbāna amata paccaya ttā vā amatā esa dhammo sanantano ti yā ayam saccavācā nāma esa
translated: Or alternatively, it is deathless because it is a condition for the deathless Nibbāna.

original: porāṇo dhammo cariyā paveṇi. Idameva hi porāṇānaṃ āciṇṇaṃ yaṃ te na alikaṃ bhāsiṃsu.
analyzed: porāṇaḥ dhammaḥ cariyā paveṇi idam eva hi porāṇānam āciṇṇam yam te na alikam bhāsiṃsu
translated: “This is the ancient way”: this speech of truth is an ancient way, a practice of old, for this is what was done by the ancients, namely, that they did not speak falsely.

original: Tenāha – “sacce atthe ca dhamme ca, āhu santo patiṭṭhitā”ti. Tattha sacce patiṭṭhitattā
analyzed: tena āha sacce atthe ca dhamme ca āhu santaḥ patiṭṭhitā ati tattha sacce patiṭṭhita ttā
translated: Therefore it is said: “The good declare that truth is the best of all flavors, and that truth is the best of all things.”

original: eva attano ca paresañca atthe patiṭṭhitā, atthe patiṭṭhitattā eva dhamme patiṭṭhitā
analyzed: eva attano ca paresañca atthe patiṭṭhitā atthe patiṭṭhita ttā eva dhamme patiṭṭhitā
translated: Herein, because they are established in truth, they are established in the good of themselves and others; and because they are established in the good, they are established in the Dhamma.🔽This should be understood as follows: because they are established in truth, they are established in the good of themselves and others; because they are established in the good, they are established in the Dhamma.

original: hontīti veditabbā. Saccavisesanameva vā etaṃ. Idañhi vuttaṃ hoti – sacce patiṭṭhitā.
analyzed: honti iti veditabbā sacca visesanam eva vā etam idam hi vuttam hoti sacce patiṭṭhitā
translated: Or this is a distinction of truth: it is said that they are established in truth.

original: Kīdise? Atthe ca dhamme ca, yaṃ paresaṃ atthato anapetattā atthaṃ anuparodhakaraṃ,
analyzed: kīdise atthe ca dhamme ca yam paresam atthataḥ an apeta ttā attham an uparodha karam
translated: What are they established in? In the good and in the Dhamma. Because they do not deprive others of their good, they do not violate the good;🔽because they do not deprive others of their Dhamma, they accomplish the good that is in accordance with the Dhamma.

original: dhammato anapetattā dhammaṃ dhammikameva atthaṃ sādhetīti. Imāya gāthāya saccavācāvasena
analyzed: dhammataḥ an apeta ttā dhammam dhammikam eva attham sādheti iti imāya gāthāya sacca vācā vasena
translated: By this stanza the Blessed One shows the speech of truth as a means of accomplishing the good.

original: abhitthavi. Khemanti abhayaṃ nirupaddavaṃ. Kena kāraṇenāti ce? Nibbānapattiyā dukkhassantakiriyāya,
analyzed: abhitthavi khemanti abhayam nirupaddavam kena kāraṇena ati ce nibbāna pattiyā dukkha ssanta kiriyāya
translated: He extols. Safe: free from fear, free from trouble. And why? Because it leads to the attainment of Nibbāna, to the end of suffering,

original: yasmā kilesanibbānaṃ pāpeti, vaṭṭadukkhassa ca antakiriyāya saṃvaṭṭati, tasmā khemanti
analyzed: yasmā kilesa nibbānam pāpeti vaṭṭa dukkhassa ca anta kiriyāya saṃvaṭṭati tasmā khemanti
translated: since it leads to the extinction of defilements and to the end of the suffering of the round. Therefore the meaning is “safe.”

original: attho. Atha vā yaṃ buddho nibbānapattiyā vā dukkhassantakiriyāya vāti dvinnaṃ nibbānadhātūnaṃ
analyzed: atthaḥ atha vā yam buddhaḥ nibbāna pattiyā vā dukkha ssanta kiriyāya vā ati dvinnam nibbāna dhātūnam
translated: Or else, since the Buddha speaks the word that leads to the attainment of Nibbāna, to the end of suffering, for the sake of the two Nibbāna-elements,

original: atthāya khemamaggappakāsanato khemaṃ vācaṃ bhāsati. Sā ve vācānamuttamāti sā vācā
analyzed: atthāya khema magga ppakāsanataḥ khemam vācam bhāsati sā ve vācānam uttamā ati sā vācā
translated: that word is safe because it reveals the safe path. That is the best of words,

original: sabbavācānaṃ seṭṭhāti evamettha attho daṭṭhabbo. Imāya gāthāya mantāvacanavasena
analyzed: sabba vācānam seṭṭhā ti evam ettha atthaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ imāya gāthāya mantā vacana vasena
translated: the meaning should be regarded thus. By this stanza,

original: bhagavantaṃ abhitthavanto arahattanikūṭena thomanaṃ pariyosāpeti.
analyzed: bhagavantam abhitthavantaḥ arahatta nikūṭena thomanam pariyosāpeti
translated: extolling the Blessed One by way of the recitation of the mantras, he concludes the eulogy with the peak of arahantship.

original: Gambhīrapaññoti tisso gāthā āyasmato sāriputtattherassa pasaṃsanavasena vuttā. Tattha
analyzed: gambhīra pañño ti tissaḥ gāthāḥ āyasmataḥ sāriputta therassa pasaṃsana vasena vuttā tattha
translated: The three stanzas beginning with “Deep in wisdom” are spoken in praise of the Elder Sāriputta. Herein,

original: gambhīrapaññoti gambhīresu khandhāyatanādīsu pavattāya nipuṇāya paññāya samannāgatattā
analyzed: gambhīra pañño ti gambhīresu khandha āyatana ādīsu pavattāya nipuṇāya paññāya samannāgata ttā
translated: “Deep in wisdom” means that he is endowed with the subtle wisdom that occurs in the deep aggregates, sense bases, etc.

original: gambhīrapañño. Medhāsaṅkhātāya dhammojapaññāya samannāgatattā medhāvī. “Ayaṃ duggatiyā
analyzed: gambhīra paññaḥ medhā saṅkhātāya dhammoja paññāya samannāgata ttā medhāvī ayam duggatiyā
translated: He is of profound understanding, because he possesses the understanding of the Dhamma called “intelligence.”

original: maggo, ayaṃ sugatiyā maggo, ayaṃ nibbānassa maggo”ti evaṃ magge ca amagge ca kovidatāya
analyzed: maggo ayam sugatiyā maggo ayam nibbānassa maggo ti evam magge ca amagge ca kovida tāya
translated: He is wise in the path and the not-path, because he is skilled in the path and the not-path in the sense that he knows: “This is the path to an unhappy destiny, this is the path to a happy destiny, this is the path to Nibbāna.”

original: maggāmaggassa kovido. Mahatiyā sāvakapāramīñāṇassa matthakaṃ pattāya paññāya vasena
analyzed: maggāmaggassa kovidaḥ mahatiyā sāvaka pāramī ñāṇassa matthakam pattāya paññāya vasena
translated: He is of great understanding, because he has reached the pinnacle of the great understanding that is the knowledge of the perfection of discipleship.

original: mahāpañño. Dhammaṃ deseti bhikkhunanti sammadeva pavattiṃ nivattiṃ vibhāvento bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: mahā paññaḥ dhammaṃ deseti bhikkhunan ti sammad eva pavattim nivattim vibhāventaḥ bhikkhūnam
translated: He teaches the Dhamma to the bhikkhus, showing them the right way and the wrong way.

original: dhammaṃ deseti. Tassā pana desanāya pavattiākāraṃ dassetuṃ “saṃkhittenapī”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: dhammam deseti tassā pana desanāya pavatti ākāram dassetum saṃkhittena api itiādi vuttaṃ
translated: In order to illustrate the way in which he teaches the Dhamma, the Exalted One says, “In brief as well as in detail.”

original: Tattha saṃkhittenapīti “cattārimāni, āvuso, ariyasaccāni. Katamāni cattāri? Dukkhaṃ🔽ariyasaccaṃ…pe… imāni kho, āvuso, cattāri ariyasaccāni, tasmā tihāvuso, idaṃ dukkhanti
analyzed: tattha saṃkhittena api iti cattārimāni āvuso ariya saccāni katamāni cattāri dukkham  imāni kho āvuso cattāri ariya saccāni tasmā tihā āvuso idam dukkhanti
translated: Herein, he teaches in brief as follows: “Friends, there are these four noble truths. What four? The noble truth of suffering,🔽the noble truth of the origin of suffering, the noble truth of the cessation of suffering, the noble truth of the way leading to the cessation of suffering.🔽These, friends, are the four noble truths. Therefore, friends, one should rightly exhort, instruct, and admonish: ‘One should know suffering thus; one should abandon the origin of suffering thus; one should realize the cessation of suffering thus; one should cultivate the way leading to the cessation of suffering thus.’

original: yogo karaṇīyo”ti evaṃ saṃkhittenapi deseti. “Katamañcāvuso, dukkhaṃ ariyasaccaṃ?
analyzed: yogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ iti evam saṃkhittena api deseti katamat ca āvuso dukkham ariya saccaṃ
translated: “And what, friends, is the noble truth of suffering?

original: Jātipi dukkhā”tiādinā nayena tāneva vibhajanto vitthārenapi bhāsati. Khandhādidesanāsupi🔽eseva nayo. Sālikāyiva nigghosoti yathā madhuraṃ ambapakkaṃ sāyitvā pakkhehi vātaṃ
analyzed: dukkha ati ādinā nayena tān eva vibhajantaḥ vitthārena api bhāsati khandha ādi desanāsu pi  esa iva nayaḥ yathā madhuram amba pakkam sāyitvā pakkhehi vātam
translated: He expounds them in detail by analyzing them in the way beginning, “Birth is suffering” .🔽The same method applies to the exposition of the aggregates, etc.

original: datvā madhuraravaṃ nicchārentiyā sālikāya nigghoso, evaṃ therassa dhammaṃ kathentassa
analyzed: da tvā madhura ravam nicchārentiyā sālikāya nigghosaḥ evam therassa dhammam kathentassa
translated: His voice is like the cry of the curlew: just as the cry of the curlew, after savoring a ripe mango and then letting out a cry with its wings,🔽is sweet, so too is the Elder’s voice sweet when he expounds the Dhamma.

original: madhuro nigghoso hoti. Dhammasenāpatissa hi pittādīnaṃ vasena apalibuddhavacanaṃ
analyzed: madhuraḥ nigghosaḥ hoti dhammasenāpatissa hi pitta ādīnam vasena apalibuddha vacanam
translated: For the voice of the general of the Dhamma is unimpeded by phlegm, etc.,

original: hoti, ayadaṇḍena pahaṭakaṃsathālako viya saddo niccharati. Paṭibhānaṃ udiyyatīti
analyzed: hoti aya daṇḍena pahaṭa kaṃsa thālakaḥ viya saddaḥ niccharati paṭibhānam udiyyati iti
translated: and his voice issues forth like the sound from a bronze gong struck with a mallet. Inspiration comes to him:

original: kathetukamyatāya sati samuddato vīciyo viya uparūpari anantaṃ paṭibhānaṃ uṭṭhahati.
analyzed: kathetu kamyatāya sati samuddataḥ upari upari anantam paṭibhānam uṭṭhahati
translated: when he is desirous of expounding the Dhamma, inspiration wells up in him endlessly, like the waves of the ocean.🔽To him: to the general of the Dhamma.

original: Tassāti dhammasenāpatissa. Tanti dhammaṃ desentassa. Suṇantīti yaṃ no thero katheti,
analyzed: tassa ati dhamma senāpatissa tat ti dhammam desentassa suṇanti iti yam no theraḥ katheti
translated: To him: to the one expounding the Dhamma.🔽They listen: they listen with attention, thinking, “What the Elder says, we will hear.”🔽Sweet: agreeable.

original: taṃ no sossāmāti ādarajātā suṇanti. Madhuranti iṭṭhaṃ. Rajanīyenāti kantena. Savanīyenāti
analyzed: tam naḥ sossāma ati ādara jātā suṇanti madhuranti iṭṭham rajanīyena ati kantena savanīyena ati
translated: Pleasant: charming.

original: kaṇṇasukhena. Vaggunāti maṭṭhena manoharena. Udaggacittāti odagyapītiyā vasena udaggacittā
analyzed: kaṇṇa sukhena vaggunā ati maṭṭhena manoharena udagga cittā ati odagya pītiyā vasena udagga cittā
translated: Glad: gladdened, endowed with gladness.

original: alīnacittā. Muditāti āmoditā pāmojjena samannāgatā. Odhentīti avadahanti aññāya cittaṃ
analyzed: alīna cittā muditā ati āmoditā pāmojjena samannāgatā odhenti iti avadahanti aññāya cittam
translated: They make resound: they make resound, they cause to be heard, they make known to others their own minds.

original: upaṭṭhapentā sotaṃ upanenti.🔽Ajja pannarasetiādikā catasso gāthā pavāraṇāsuttantadesanāya satthāraṃ mahābhikkhusaṅghaparivutaṃ
analyzed: upaṭṭhapentā sotam upanenti  ajja pannarasā iti ādikā catasso gāthā pavāraṇā suttanta desanāya satthāram mahā bhikkhu saṅgha parivutam
translated: They direct their ears: they direct their ears to the teaching.🔽The four verses beginning with “Today on the fifteenth” were spoken by Thullanandā when she saw the Teacher sitting surrounded by a great Saṅgha of bhikkhus

original: nisinnaṃ disvā thomentena vuttā. Tattha pannaraseti yasmiñhi samaye bhagavā pubbārāme
analyzed: nisinnam disvā thomentena vuttā tattha pannarasā iti yasmin hi samaye bhagavā pubbārāme
translated: and teaching the discourse on the Invitation. Therein, on the fifteenth: on the day on which the Blessed One,🔽sitting in the Pubbārāma,

original: nisīdanto sāyanhasamaye sampattaparisāya kālayuttaṃ samayayuttaṃ dhammaṃ desetvā,
analyzed: nisīdantaḥ sāyanha samaye sampatta parisāya kāla yuttam samaya yuttam dhammam desetvā
translated: having taught the Dhamma to the assembly that had gathered at the time suitable to the occasion,

original: udakakoṭṭhake gattāni parisiñcitvā, vatthanivasano ekaṃsaṃ sugatamahācīvaraṃ katvā,
analyzed: udaka koṭṭhake gattāni parisiñcitvā vattha nivasanaḥ eka aṃsam sugata mahā cīvaram katvā
translated: having sprinkled his limbs with water at the water-drinking hall, having put on his robe and sarong, having made a lining of his great robe of the Sugata,

original: migāramātupāsāde majjhimathambhaṃ nissāya paññattavarabuddhāsane nisīditvā, samantato
analyzed: migāra mātu pāsāde majjhima thambham nissāya paññatta vara buddha āsane nisīditvā samantataḥ
translated: having sat down in the excellent Buddha seat prepared for him leaning against the middle pillar of Migāramātā’s mansion,🔽and looking over the assembly of bhikkhus,

original: nisinnaṃ bhikkhusaṅghaṃ anuviloketvā tadahuposathe pavāraṇādivase nisinno hoti, imasmiṃ
analyzed: nisinnam bhikkhu saṅgham anuviloketvā tadahu posathe pavāraṇā divase nisinnaḥ hoti imasmin
translated: and he sits down when the Community of monks, having looked over the sitting places, is sitting down on the Uposatha day of the Invitation ceremony.

original: pannarasīuposatheti attho. Visuddhiyāti visuddhatthāya visuddhipavāraṇāya. Bhikkhū🔽pañcasatā samāgatāti, pañcasatamattā bhikkhū satthāraṃ parivāretvā nisajjavasena🔽ceva ajjhāsayavasena ca samāgatā. Te ca saṃyojanabandhanacchidāti saṃyojanasaṅkhāte
analyzed: pannarasī uposatha iti attho visuddhiyā ati visuddha atthāya visuddhi pavāraṇāya bhikkhū  pañcasatā samāgatā ati pañca sata mattāḥ bhikkhū satthāram parivāretvā nisajja vasena  ca iva ca samāgatā te ca saṃyojana bandhana chidā ati saṃyojana saṅkhāte
translated: and he was seated, surveying the assembly of monks who were seated, on that day of the Uposatha, on the Invitation day, he was seated. The meaning is: on this fifteenth day of the Observance. For the sake of purification: for the sake of purification, for the Invitation of Purification. The monks

original: santānassa bandhanabhūte kilese chinditvā ṭhitā. Tato eva anīghā khīṇapunabbhavā
analyzed: santānassa bandhana bhūte kilese chinditvā ṭhitā tatas eva anīghā khīṇa punabbhavā
translated: had assembled, five hundred in number: five hundred monks had assembled, surrounding the Teacher, by way of sitting down and by way of intention. And they had cut the bonds of the fetters: having cut the defilements which are the bonds of the continuum called the fetters, they were standing. Because of that, they were free from anxiety, their rebirth was destroyed,

original: isīti kilesadukkhābhāvena nidukkhā khīṇapunabbhavā, asekkhānaṃ sīlakkhandhādīnaṃ esitabhāvena isīti.🔽Vijitasaṅgāmanti vijitakilesasaṅgāmattā vijitamārabalattā vijitasaṅgāmaṃ. Satthavāhanti
analyzed: isī iti kilesa dukkha abhāvena nidukkhā khīṇa punabbhavā asekkhānam sīla kkhandha ādīnam esita bhāvena isī iti  vijita saṅgāmanti vijita kilesa saṅgāmattāḥ vijita māra balattāḥ vijita saṅgāmam satthavāhanti
translated: they were seers. Because of the absence of the suffering of defilements, because of the destruction of rebirth, because of the state of being seers of the aggregates of virtue, concentration, wisdom, freedom, and the knowledge and vision of freedom of those beyond training, they were seers.

original: aṭṭhaṅgike ariyamaggarathe āropetvā veneyyasatte vāheti saṃsārakantārato uttāretīti
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgike ariya magga rathe āropetvā veneyya satte vāheti saṃsāra kantārataḥ uttāreti iti
translated: They had won the battle: because of the victory over the battle of defilements, because of the victory over the power of Māra, they had won the battle. The leader of the caravan: having mounted the eightfold noble path-chariot, he leads the beings to be trained, he delivers them from the desert of saṃsāra.

original: bhagavā satthavāho. Tenāha brahmā sahampati “uṭṭhehi, vīra, vijitasaṅgāma, satthavāhā”ti,🔽taṃ satthavāhaṃ anuttaraṃ satthāraṃ sāvakā payirupāsanti. Tevijjā maccuhāyinoti evarūpehi🔽sāvakehi parivārito cakkavatti viya rājā amaccaparivārito janapadacārikavasena samantā
analyzed: bhagavā satthavāhaḥ tena āha brahmā sahampati uṭṭhehi vīra vijita saṅgāma satthavāha ati  tam satthavāham anuttaram satthāram sāvakāḥ payirupāsanti tevijjāḥ maccuhāyinaḥ ti evarūpehi  sāvakehi parivāritaḥ cakkavatti viya rājā amacca parivāritaḥ janapada cārika vasena samantā
translated: The Blessed One is the Leader. Therefore Brahma Sahampati said: “Rise up, O Hero, Conqueror in Battle, O Leader.”🔽The disciples attend upon that Leader, the Supreme One. “With the Three knowledges, the Death-conquerors” : surrounded by such disciples, he is like a universal monarch surrounded by his ministers,

original: anupariyetīti yojanā.
analyzed: anupariyeti iti yojanā
translated: and he goes about everywhere, as it were, on a tour of inspection.

original: Palāpoti tuccho antosārarahito, sīlarahitoti attho. Vande ādiccabandhunanti ādiccabandhuṃ satthāraṃ dasabalaṃ vandāmīti vadati.🔽Parosahassantiādikā catasso gāthā nibbānapaṭisaṃyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya bhikkhūnaṃ
analyzed: palāpo ti tucchaḥ antosāra rahito sīla rahito ti attho vande ādiccabandhunā anti ādiccabandhum satthāram dasabalam vandāmi iti vadati  catasso gāthāḥ nibbāna paṭisaṃyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya bhikkhūnam
translated: “Empty” means hollow, without inner core, without virtue, is the meaning. “I praise the Kinsman of the Sun” : I praise the Teacher, the Kinsman of the Sun, the One of Ten Powers.

original: dhammaṃ desentaṃ bhagavantaṃ thomentena vuttā. Tattha parosahassanti atirekasahassaṃ,
analyzed: dhammam desentam bhagavantam thomentena vuttā tattha atireka sahassam
translated: The four verses beginning with “More than a thousand” were spoken by the Elder Maha Kassapa in praise of the Blessed One, who was teaching the Dhamma to the bhikkhus with a Dhamma talk connected with Nibbana.

original: aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhusahassāni sandhāya vuttaṃ. Akutobhayanti nibbāne kutocipi bhayaṃ
analyzed: aḍḍhateḷasāni bhikkhu sahassāni sandhāya vuttam akutobhayam ti nibbāne kutocipi bhayam
translated: “More than a thousand” : more than a thousand bhikkhus. “Fearless” : in Nibbana there is no fear from anywhere.

original: natthi. Nibbānaṃ pattassa ca kutocipi bhayaṃ natthīti nibbānaṃ akutobhayaṃ nāma.
analyzed: natthi nibbānam pattassa ca kutocipi bhayam natthi iti nibbānam akutobhayam nāma
translated: and there is none for one who has attained Nibbāna.

original: “Āguṃ na karotī”tiādinā vuttakāraṇehi bhagavā nāgoti vuccatīti nāganāmosi bhagavāti.
analyzed: āgum na karoti itiādinā vutta kāraṇehi bhagavā nāgaḥ iti vuccati iti nāga nāmā asi bhagavā ati
translated: The Blessed One is called “Nāga” for the reasons stated thus: “He does not create, he does not contrive” , etc.

original: Isīnaṃ isisattamoti sāvakapaccekabuddhaisīnaṃ uttamo isi, vipassīsammāsambuddhato
analyzed: isīnam isi sattamaḥ ti sāvaka paccekabuddha esīnam uttamaḥ vipassī sammāsambuddhato
translated: “You are the seventh sage among the sages,” i.e., the best of the sages, both disciples and paccekabuddhas.🔽Or, you are the seventh sage among the sages beginning with Vipassī.

original: paṭṭhāya isīnaṃ vā sattamako isi. Mahāmeghovāti cātuddīpikamahāmegho viya hutvā.
analyzed: paṭṭhāya isīnam vā sattamakaḥ isi mahā meghaḥ uvāti cātuddīpika mahā meghaḥ viya hutvā
translated: “Like the great cloud that covers the earth,” i.e., like the great cloud that covers the four continents.🔽“Your disciple, O Great Hero, Vangiisa, pays homage at your feet” .

original: Divā vihārāti paṭisallānaṭṭhānato. Sāvako te, mahāvīra, pāde vandati vaṅgīsoti idaṃ thero arahattaṃ patvā attano visesādhigamaṃ pakāsento vadati.

translated: while the Fortunate One was dwelling at Kāḷasilā, by the venerable Mahā Moggallāna, who was investigating the minds of those monks,🔽and after seeing their minds, he spoke these verses.

original: Dukkhassa pāragunti iminā pahānasampadaṃ. Tadubhayena ca satthu ānubhāvasampadādayo🔽dassitā honti. Tevijjā maccuhāyinoti iminā sāvakānaṃ ñāṇasampattidīpanena ca nibbānadhātuyā

original: adhigamadīpanena ca padadvayena satthusāvakasampatti dassitā hoti. Tathā hi yathāvuttamatthaṃ
analyzed: adhigama dīpanena ca pada dvayena satthu sāvaka sampatti dassitā hoti tathā hi yathāvuttamattham
translated: For the purpose of making the meaning stated in the above verses clearer, the following verse is given:

original: pākaṭataraṃ kātuṃ “muniṃ dukkhassa pāraguṃ. Anekākārasampannaṃ, payirupāsanti gotama”nti
analyzed: pākaṭataram kātum munim dukkhassa pāragum aneka ākāra sampannam payirupāsanti gotamanti
translated: “The Sage who has gone beyond all suffering, endowed with many kinds of excellence, the Gotama is worshipped by the multitude.”

original: vuttaṃ. Tattha anekākārasampannanti anekehi ākārehi sampannaṃ, anekākāraguṇasamannāgatanti attho.
analyzed: vuttam tattha aneka ākāra sampannam ti anekehi ākārehi sampannam aneka ākāra guṇa samannāgatam ti attho
translated: Herein, endowed with many kinds of excellence means endowed with many kinds of excellence, endowed with many kinds of noble qualities, is the meaning.

original: Cando yathāti gāthā bhagavantaṃ campānagare gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena
analyzed: candaḥ yathā iti gāthāḥ bhagavantam campā nagare gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhu saṅghena
translated: The verse beginning with the words “just as the moon” was spoken by the Elder Culla Sumana after seeing the Blessed One on the bank of the Gaggarā lotus pond in the city of Campā surrounded by a great assembly of monks

analyzed: anekehi ca deva nāga sahassehi parivutam attanaḥ vaṇṇena ca yasasā ca virocamānam disvā

analyzed: somanassa jātena abhitthavantena vuttā tattha candaḥ yathā vigata valāhake nabheti  yathā sarada samaye apagata valāhake valāhaka sadisena aññena ca mahika ādinā upakkilesena
translated: Just as the moon shines in a cloudless sky,

analyzed: vimutte ākāse puṇṇa candaḥ virocati vīta malaḥ uva tena iva valāhaka ādi upakkilesa vigamena  vigata malaḥ sūriyaḥ yathā virocati evam pi aṅgīrasa evam aṅgehi
translated: just as the moon shines in the sky free from the obscurations of clouds and other impurities such as haze, etc.,🔽just as the sun shines in a cloudless sky, free from the obscurations of clouds, etc.,

analyzed: tvam pi mahā muni bhagavā atirocasi attanaḥ yasasā sa devakam lokam atikkamitvā virocasi iti  kāveyyamatta ati ādikāḥ dasa gāthāḥ arahattam patvā attanaḥ paṭipattim paccavekkhitvā satthu  attano ca guṇe vibhāventena vuttā tattha kāveyya mattā ati kāveyyena kabba karaṇena
translated: so do you shine, Aṅgīrasa, with your own radiance, O Great Sage, O Blessed One, you shine surpassing the world with its gods, with your own glory.🔽The ten verses beginning with “Drunk with the pride of poetry” were spoken by the Elder when he was reviewing his own progress after attaining arahatship,🔽and when he was revealing his own and the Teacher’s virtues.

translated: Drunk with the pride of poetry: drunk with the pride of poetry, i.e., drunk with the pride of composition.🔽Honored, respected, esteemed, and exalted, we saw.

original: Addhā no udapajjathāti ratanattayaṃ addhā amhākaṃ upakāratthāya uppajji.
analyzed: addhā naḥ udapajjatha ati ratanattayam addhā amhākam upakāra tthāya uppajji
translated: “Surely for our sake” : the Three Gems surely arose for our benefit.

original: Vacananti saccapaṭisaṃyuttaṃ dhammakathaṃ. Khandhe āyatanāni ca dhātuyo cāti pañcakkhandhe
analyzed: vacananti sacca paṭisaṃyuttam dhamma katham khandhe āyatanāni ca dhātuyaḥ ca ati pañca kkhandhe
translated: “Words” : a talk on the Dhamma connected with the Truths. “The aggregates, bases, and elements” : the five aggregates,

original: dvādasāyatanāni, aṭṭhārasa dhātuyo ca. Imasmiṃ ṭhāne khandhādikathā vattabbā. Sā🔽visuddhimagge vitthāritā evāti tattha vuttanayeneva veditabbā. Viditvānāti rūpādivibhāgādito
analyzed: dvādasa āyatanāni aṭṭhārasa dhātuyaḥ ca imasmin ṭhāne khandha ādi kathā vattabbā sā  visuddhi magge vitthāritāḥ evā ti tattha vutta nayena iva veditabbāḥ rūpa ādi vibhāga āditaḥ
translated: the twelve bases, and the eighteen elements. Here the exposition of the aggregates, etc., should be given. But since it has been given in detail in the Visuddhimagga,🔽it should be understood by the method given there. “Having known” : having known by the knowledge of the prior stage the analysis of form, etc.,

original: aniccatādito ca pubbabhāgañāṇena jānitvā.
analyzed: anicca tā āditaḥ ca pubbabhāga ñāṇena jānitvā
translated: and the impermanence, etc., of form, etc.

original: Ye te sāsanakārakāti ye te sattā tathāgatānaṃ sāsanakārakā, tesaṃ bahūnaṃ atthāya vata uppajjanti tathāgatā.
analyzed: ye te sāsana kārakā ati ye te sattā tathāgatānam sāsana kārakā tesam bahūnam atthāya vata uppajjanti tathāgatā
translated: “Those who are the Buddha’s disciples” : for the benefit of the many disciples of the Tathagatas, the Tathagatas arise.

original: Ye niyāmagataddasāti niyāmo eva niyāmagataṃ, ye bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ca sammattaniyāmaṃ
analyzed: ye niyāma gataddasāti niyāmaḥ u eva niyāma gatam ye bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo ca sammatta niyāmaṃ
translated: “Those who see the state of peace” : the state of peace is the fixed course itself. Those bhikkhus and bhikkhunis who have seen, who have attained, the fixed course of rightness,

original: addasaṃsu adhigacchiṃsu. Tesaṃ atthāya vata bodhiṃ sammāsambodhiṃ ajjhagamā, muni bhagavāti yojanā.
analyzed: addasaṃsu adhigacchiṃsu tesam atthāya vata bodhim sammāsambodhim ajjhagamā muni bhagavā ati yojanā
translated: for their benefit I have attained the supreme enlightenment, the supreme awakening, the Muni, the Blessed One.

original: Sudesitāti veneyyajjhāsayānurūpaṃ saṅkhepato vitthārato ca suṭṭhu desitā. Cakkhumatāti
analyzed: su desitā ti veneyya ajjhāsayā anurūpam saṅkhepataḥ vitthārato ca suṭṭhu desitā cakkhumatā ati
translated: Well taught: well taught in brief and in detail in conformity with the inclinations of those who need training.🔽The eye-doctor:

original: pañcahi cakkhūhi cakkhumatā. Attahitakāmehi araṇīyāni karaṇīyāni ariyabhāvakarāni,
analyzed: pañcahi cakkhūhi cakkhumatā atta hita kāmehi araṇīyāni karaṇīyāni ariya bhāva karāni
translated: the eye-doctor with the five eyes.🔽The truths of noble ones: the truths of the noble ones, which are to be done by those who are not quarrelsome, who are intent on their own welfare, who are to be cultivated, and which lead to noble states.

original: ariyassa vā bhagavato saccānīti ariyasaccāni. Dukkhantiādi tesaṃ ariyasaccānaṃ sarūpadassanaṃ.
analyzed: ariyassa vā bhagavato saccāni iti ariya saccāni dukkha nti ādi tesam ariya saccānam sarūpa dassanaṃ
translated: The truth of suffering, etc.: the seeing of the individual essences of those truths of noble ones.

original: Imasmiṃ ṭhāne ariyasaccakathā vattabbā, sā sabbākārato visuddhimagge vitthāritāti
analyzed: imasmim ṭhāne ariya sacca kathā vattabbā sā sabba ākārataḥ visuddhi magge vitthāritā ati
translated: Here the teaching on the noble truths should be given. It is given in detail in the Path of Purity.🔽So it should be understood in the way given there.

original: tattha vuttanayeneva veditabbā. Evamete tathāti ete dukkhādayo ariyasaccadhammā evaṃ🔽dukkhādippakārena tathā avitathā anaññathā. Vuttā diṭṭhā me te yathā tathāti yathā
analyzed: tattha vutta nayena iva veditabbāḥ evam ete tathā ati ete dukkha ādayaḥ ariya sacca dhammā evam  dukkha ādi ppakārena tathā avitathāḥ anaññathā vuttāḥ diṭṭhāḥ me te yathā tathā ati yathā
translated: Thus these things: thus these things, the states of the truths of suffering, etc.,🔽are so, not otherwise, not otherwise than so.🔽Seen by me: seen by me thus,

original: satthārā vuttā, tathā mayā diṭṭhā, ariyamaggañāṇena paṭividdhattā evaṃ tesaṃ. Sadattho
analyzed: satthārā vuttā tathā mayā diṭṭhā ariya magga ñāṇena evam tesam sadattho
translated: realized by me through the knowledge of the noble path.🔽The good has been reached: arahatship has been realized by me.

original: me anuppatto arahattaṃ mayā sacchikataṃ. Tato ca kataṃ buddhassa bhagavato sāsanaṃ
analyzed: me an uppattaḥ arahattam mayā sacchikatam tatas ca katam buddhassa bhagavataḥ sāsanam
translated: And the word of the Buddha, the Blessed One, has been done by me.

original: ovādānusiṭṭhiyaṃ anupatiṭṭho.
analyzed: ovāda anusiṭṭhiyam anupatiṭṭhaḥ
translated: and in the practice of the advice and instruction.

original: Svāgataṃ vata me āsīti suāgamanaṃ vata me ahosi. Mama buddhassa santiketi mama sambuddhassa bhagavato santike samīpe.
analyzed: svāgatam vata me āsi iti su āgamanam vata me ahosi mama buddhassa santike iti mama sambuddhassa bhagavato santike samīpe
translated: It was a good coming for me: it was a good arrival for me. In the presence of my Buddha: in the presence of my Enlightened One, the Blessed One.

original: Abhiññāpāramippattoti channampi abhiññānaṃ pāramiṃ, ukkaṃsaṃ adhigato. Iminā hi padena vuttamevatthaṃ vivarituṃ “sotadhātu visodhitā”tiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: abhiññāpārami patto ti channam pi abhiññānam pāramim ukkaṃsam adhigataḥ iminā hi padena vuttam eva attham vivaritum sota dhātu visodhitā itiādi vuttam
translated: He has reached the perfection of the kinds of direct-knowledge: he has attained the summit, the perfection, of the six kinds of direct-knowledge. For the meaning stated by this clause is expanded in the passage beginning, “The ear element is purified” .

original: Pucchāmi satthārantiādikā dvādasa gāthā attano upajjhāyassa parinibbutabhāvaṃ pucchantena
analyzed: pucchāmi satthāram ti ādikāḥ dvādasa gāthāḥ attanaḥ upajjhāyassa parinibbuta bhāvam pucchantena
translated: The twelve verses beginning with the words, “I ask the Teacher” , were spoken by the Elder Vaṅgīsa when he was questioning the Elder Anuruddha about the state of final Nibbāna.

original: vuttā. Āyasmato nigrodhakappattherassa hi parinibbānakāle āyasmā vaṅgīso asammukhā🔽ahosi. Diṭṭhapubbañca tena tassa hatthakukkuccādi, pubbavāsanāvasena hi tādisañca
analyzed: vuttā āyasmataḥ nigrodhakappa therassa hi parinibbāna kāle āyasmā vaṅgīsaḥ asammukhā  ahosi diṭṭha pubbam ca tena tassa hattha kukkucca ādi pubba vāsanā vasena hi tādisam ca
translated: For the Elder Vaṅgīsa was not present at the time of the Elder Nigrodhakappa’s final Nibbāna.

original: āyasmato pilindavacchassa vasalavādena samudācāro viya khīṇāsavānampi hotiyeva. Tena
analyzed: āyasmataḥ pilindavacchassa vasala vādena samudācāraḥ khīṇa āsavānam pi tena
translated: And the Elder Vaṅgīsa had seen the Elder Nigrodhakappa before, and he had scruples about touching his hand, etc., because of his former habit-energy. For such things happen even to those whose cankers are destroyed, just as the Elder Pilindavaccha’s use of the word “slave” did.

original: “parinibbuto nu kho me upajjhāyo, udāhu no”ti uppannaparivitakko satthāraṃ pucchi.
analyzed: parinibbutaḥ nu kho me upajjhāyaḥ udāhu no ti uppanna parivitakkaḥ satthāram pucchi
translated: “Has my preceptor attained final Nibbāna or not?”

original: Tena vuttaṃ – “upajjhāyassa parinibbutabhāvaṃ pucchantena vuttā”ti. Tattha satthāranti
analyzed: tena vuttam upajjhāyassa parinibbuta bhāvam pucchantena vuttā ati tattha satthāram ti
translated: Therefore it is said: “Asked by him who asked whether his preceptor had attained final Nibbāna.” Herein, the Teacher is

original: diṭṭhadhammikādīhi veneyyānaṃ anusāsakaṃ. Anomapaññanti omaṃ vuccati parittaṃ lāmakaṃ.
analyzed: diṭṭhadhammika ādīhi veneyyānam anusāsakam omam vuccati parittam lāmakam
translated: the one who instructs disciples in the visible here and now, etc. He is of incomparable understanding. The word oma is used to mean small, limited.

original: Na omapaññaṃ anomapaññaṃ, mahāpaññanti attho. Diṭṭheva dhammeti paccakkhameva, imasmiṃyeva
analyzed: na oma paññam an oma paññam mahā paññam ti attho diṭṭhe iva dhamme iti paccakkham eva imasmiṃ yeva
translated: He is not of limited understanding, he is of incomparable understanding; the meaning is, he is of great understanding. In the visible here and now: in the very visible here and now, in this very person, is the meaning.

original: attabhāveti attho. Vicikicchānanti saṃsayānaṃ evarūpānaṃ vā parivitakkānaṃ chettā.
analyzed: atta bhāveti atthaḥ vicikicchānam ti saṃsayānam evarūpānam vā parivitakkānam chettā
translated: He is the cutter-off of doubts: of those who are doubtful, or of such doubts as these.

original: Aggāḷaveti aggāḷavacetiyasaṅkhāte vihāre. Ñātoti pākaṭo. Yasassīti lābhasakkārasampanno.
analyzed: aggāḷava iti aggāḷava cetiya saṅkhāte vihāre ñāto ti pākaṭaḥ yasassī iti lābha sakkāra sampanno
translated: In the Aggalava shrine: in the dwelling called the Aggalava Shrine. Renowned: well known. And famous: endowed with gain and fame.

original: Abhinibbutattoti upasantasabhāvo apariḍayhamānacitto.
analyzed: abhinibbuta ttaḥ ti upasanta sabhāvaḥ a pariḍayhamāna cittaḥ
translated: He has attained final Nibbāna: he is of a nature that is completely at peace, his mind is free from fever.

original: Tayā katanti tādise chāyāsampanne nigrodharukkhamūle nisinnattā “nigrodhakappo”ti
analyzed: tayā tādise chāyā sampanne nigrodha rukkha mūle nisinnattā nigrodha kappoti
translated: “The one you did”: because he sat down at the foot of the Nigrodha tree, which was endowed with a shade like that, he is called “the Nigrodha-planter.”

original: tayā kataṃ nāmaṃ. Iti so yathā attanā upalakkhitaṃ tathā vadati. Bhagavā pana na
analyzed: tayā katam nāmam iti saḥ yathā attanā upalakkhitam tathā vadati bhagavā pana na
translated: “You have given me a name,” and so he speaks as he has understood it. But the Blessed One does not speak thus of himself because he is sitting down,

original: nisinnattā eva taṃ tathā ālapati, api ca kho tattha arahattaṃ pattattāpi. Brāhmaṇassāti
analyzed: nisinnattā eva tam tathā ālapati api ca kho tattha arahattam pattattā api brāhmaṇassa ati
translated: but rather because he has attained arahatship there. The brahmin:

original: jātiṃ sandhāya vadati. So kira brāhmaṇamahāsālakulā pabbajito. Namassaṃ acarinti
analyzed: jātim sandhāya vadati saḥ kira brāhmaṇa mahāsāla kulā pabbajitaḥ namassam acarinti
translated: he speaks with reference to his birth. It seems that he had gone forth from a great brahmin family. I served:🔽I lived in attendance on him. I was intent on freedom:

original: namassamāno vihāsiṃ. Mutyapekhoti nibbāne patiṭṭhito.
analyzed: namassamānaḥ vihāsim muti apekho ti nibbāne patiṭṭhitaḥ
translated: I was established in Nibbāna.

original: Daḷhadhammadassīti bhagavantaṃ ālapati. Daḷhadhammañhi nibbānaṃ abhijjanaṭṭhena, tañca bhagavā passi dassesi ca.🔽Sakkātipi bhagavantameva kulanāmena ālapati. Mayampi sabbeti, niravasesaparisaṃ saṅgaṇhitvā
analyzed: daḷha dhamma dassī iti bhagavantam ālapati daḷha dhammam hi nibbānam abhijjana ṭṭhena tat ca bhagavā passi dassesi ca  sakkātipi bhagavantam eva kula nāmena ālapati mayam pi sabbe iti niravasesa parisam saṅgaṇhitvā
translated: The one who sees the Dhamma well: he addresses the Blessed One. For Nibbāna is the Dhamma in the sense of being what ought to be realized , and the Blessed One has seen it and has caused it to be seen.🔽Sakka: he addresses the Blessed One by his clan name. We too:

original: attānaṃ dassento vadati. Samantacakkhūtipi bhagavantameva sabbaññutaññāṇena ālapati.
analyzed: attānam dassentaḥ vadati bhagavantam eva sabbaññuta ññāṇena ālapati
translated: he shows himself to be included in the entire assembly. The all-seeing one: he addresses the Blessed One with reference to his knowledge of omniscience.

original: Samavaṭṭhitāti sammā avaṭṭhitā, ābhogaṃ katvā ṭhitā. Noti amhākaṃ. Savanāyāti imassa
analyzed: samavaṭṭhitā ati sammā avaṭṭhitā ābhogam katvā ṭhitā no ti amhākam savanāya ati imassa
translated: Well established: well established, established with attention. No: we. To hear:

original: pañhassa veyyākaraṇaṃ savanatthāya. Sotāti sotadhātuyā. Tuvaṃ no satthā tvamanuttarosīti
analyzed: pañhassa veyyākaraṇam savana tthāya sotā ati sota dhātuyā tuvam no satthā tvam anuttarā asi iti
translated: for the purpose of hearing the answer to the question. ‘Ear’ is the ear-element. ‘You are our Teacher, you are unsurpassed’

original: thutivacanavasena vadati.
analyzed: thuti vacana vasena vadati
translated: he says by way of words of praise.

original: Chinda no vicikicchanti vicikicchāpaṭirūpakaṃ taṃ parivitakkaṃ sandhāyāha. Akusalavicikicchāya🔽pana thero nibbicikicchova. Brūhi metanti brūhi me etaṃ. Yaṃ mayā yācitosi “taṃ sāvakaṃ,
analyzed: chinda naḥ vicikicchanti vicikicchā paṭirūpakam tam parivitakkam sandhāya āha akusala vicikicchāya  pana theraḥ nibbicikicchaḥ uva brūhi mā itanti brūhi me etam yam mayā yācitaḥ usi tam sāvakam
translated: ‘Cut off our doubt, we are doubtful’ – he says this referring to the doubt that is a semblance of doubt. But the Elder was without doubt

original: sakka, mayampi sabbe aññātumicchāmā”ti yācitova, taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ parinibbutaṃ vedaya
analyzed: sakka mayam pi sabbe aññātum icchāma ati yācitaḥ uva tam brāhmaṇam parinibbutam vedaya
translated: with regard to unwholesome doubt. ‘Speak this to us’ – speak this to me. ‘That disciple of yours, Sakka, we all wish to know’ – he was asked by me, ‘That brahmin who has attained Nibbāna,

original: bhūripañña. Majjheva no bhāsā”ti parinibbutaṃ jānitvā mahāpañña bhagavā majjheva
analyzed: bhūri pañña majjhā iva naḥ bhāsāti parinibbutam jānitvā mahā pañña bhagavā majjhā iva
translated: O you of great wisdom, speak to us in the middle’ – knowing that he had attained Nibbāna, the Blessed One, who had great wisdom, spoke to us in the middle,

original: amhākaṃ sabbesaṃ bhāsa, yathā sabbe mayaṃ jāneyyāma. Sakkova devāna sahassanettoti,
analyzed: amhākam sabbesam bhāsa yathā sabbe mayam jāneyyāma sakkaḥ uva devāna sahassa netto ti
translated: so that we all might know. ‘Sakka, the thousand-eyed god of the gods’ –

original: idaṃ pana thutivacanameva. Apicettha ayamadhippāyo – yathā sakko sahassanetto devānaṃ
analyzed: idam pana thuti vacanam eva api ca ittha ayam adhippāyaḥ yathā sakko sahassanettaḥ devānam
translated: but this is just a word of praise. And here this is the meaning: just as Sakka, the thousand-eyed god of the gods,

original: majjhe tehi sakkaccaṃ sampaṭicchitavacanaṃ bhāsati, evaṃ amhākaṃ majjhe amhehi sampaṭicchitavacanaṃ bhāsāti.
analyzed: majjhe tehi sakkaccam sampaṭicchita vacanam bhāsati evam amhākam majjhe amhehi sampaṭicchita vacanam bhāsāti
translated: and in the middle he speaks words that are accepted by them, saying, ‘In this way, in our midst, words that are accepted by us are spoken.’

original: Ye kecīti imampi gāthaṃ bhagavantaṃ thunanto vattukāmataṃ janetuṃ bhaṇati. Tassattho
analyzed: ye keci iti imam pi gātham bhagavantam thunantaḥ vattu kāma tam janetum bhaṇati tassa atthaḥ
translated: He also says this verse, ‘Whatever knots there are,’ in order to generate the desire to speak by taking up the Blessed One. Its meaning is

original: – ye keci abhijjhādayo ganthā, tesaṃ appahāne sati mohavicikicchānaṃ pahānābhāvato
analyzed: ye keci abhijjhā ādayaḥ ganthā tesam appahāne sati moha vicikicchānam pahāna abhāvato
translated: – whatever knots there are, such as covetousness, if they are not abandoned, because of the absence of the abandonment of delusion and doubt,

original: mohamaggāti ca, aññāṇapakkhāti ca, vicikicchaṭhānāti ca vuccanti. Sabbe te tathāgataṃ
analyzed: moha maggā ti ca aññāṇa pakkhā ati ca vicikiccha ṭhānā ti ca vuccanti sabbe te tathāgatam
translated: they are called ‘the path of delusion,’ ‘the side of ignorance,’ and ‘the place of doubt.’ All of them,

original: patvā tathāgatassa desanābalena viddhaṃsitā bhavanti, nassanti. Kiṃkāraṇanti? Cakkhuñhi
analyzed: patvā tathāgatassa desanā balena viddhaṃsitāḥ bhavanti nassanti kiṃkāraṇanti cakkhuṃ hi
translated: having reached the Realised One, are destroyed by the power of the Realised One’s teaching, they are lost. Why is that? Because the eye

original: etaṃ paramaṃ narānaṃ, yasmā tathāgato sabbaganthavidhamanena paññācakkhujananato
analyzed: etam paramam yasmai tathāgataḥ sabba gantha vidhamanena paññā cakkhu jananato
translated: is the supreme of men, since the Realised One, by the destruction of all knots, is the one who opens the eye of wisdom,

original: narānaṃ paramaṃ cakkhunti vuttaṃ hoti.
analyzed: narānam paramam cakkhunti vuttam hoti
translated: it is said, ‘the supreme eye of men.’

original: No ce hi jātūti imampi gāthaṃ thunanto eva vattukāmataṃ janento bhaṇati. Tattha jātūti
analyzed: no ce hi jātu iti imam pi gātham thunantaḥ eva vattu kāma tam janentaḥ bhaṇati tattha jātu iti
translated: He also says this verse, ‘For never,’ in order to generate the desire to speak by taking up the Blessed One. Here ‘for never’ means

original: ekaṃsavacanaṃ. Purisoti bhagavantaṃ sandhāyāha. Jotimantoti paññājotisampannā sāriputtādayo.🔽Idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti – yadi bhagavā puratthimādibhedo vāto viya abbhaghanaṃ desanāvegena🔽kilese vihaneyya, tato yathā abbhaghananivuto loko tamova hoti ekandhakāro, evaṃ
analyzed: ekaṃsa vacanam puriso ti bhagavantam sandhāya āha jotimanto ti paññā joti sampannā sāriputta ādayo  idam vuttam hoti yadi bhagavā puratthima ādi bhedaḥ vātaḥ viya abbhaghanam desanā vegena  kilese vihaneyya tatas yathā abbha ghana nivutaḥ lokaḥ tamaḥ uva hoti eka andhakāraḥ evam
translated: “One man” : the Exalted One. “The luminous ones” : Sāriputta and others who are endowed with the light of wisdom.

original: sabbopi loko aññāṇanivuto tamova siyā. Ye cāpi ime idāni jotimanto khāyanti sāriputtādayo,
analyzed: sabbaḥ api lokaḥ aññāṇa nivutaḥ tamaḥ uva siyā ye ca api ime idāni jotimantaḥ khāyanti sāriputta ādayo
translated: This is the meaning: if the Exalted One were to dispel the defilements of the world by the force of his teaching, as the wind disperses a cloud, then just as the world is enveloped in darkness when the cloud has disappeared, so too the whole world would be enveloped in darkness when ignorance has been dispelled.

original: tepi na bhāseyyuṃ, na dīpeyyunti.
analyzed: te api na bhāseyyum na dīpeyyunti
translated: And even those who now appear luminous, such as Sāriputta and others, would not shine.

original: Dhīrā cāti imampi gāthaṃ purimanayenevāha. Tassattho – dhīrā ca paṇḍitapurisā, pajjotakarā
analyzed: dhīrā ca ati imam pi gātham purima nayena iva āha tassa atthaḥ dhīrā ca paṇḍita purisā pajjota karā
translated: “The wise” : this verse is explained according to the method given above. Its meaning is this: the wise, the learned, the men of wisdom,

original: bhavanti paññāpajjotaṃ uppādenti. Taṃ tasmā ahaṃ taṃ vīra padhānavīriyasamannāgata
analyzed: bhavanti paññāpajjotam uppādenti tam tasmai aham tam vīra padhāna vīriya samannāgata
translated: are the illuminators, the producers of the light of wisdom. Therefore, O hero, O Exalted One, who are endowed with the energy of striving,

original: bhagavā, tatheva maññe dhīro pajjotakarotveva maññāmi. Mayampi vipassinaṃ sabbadhamme
analyzed: bhagavā tathā iva maññe dhīro maññāmi mayam pi vipassinam sabba dhamme
translated: I think that the wise man, the Exalted One, is just such an illuminator. We too, O Vipassī, in all things,

original: yathābhūtaṃ passantaṃ bhagavantaṃ jānantā eva upāgamimhā. Tasmā “parisāsu no āvikarohi
analyzed: yathābhūtam passantam bhagavantam jānantāḥ eva upāgamimha tasmai parisāsu naḥ āvikarohi
translated: Knowing that the Blessed One sees in accordance with reality, we have come. Therefore, ‘in the assemblies, reveal to us

original: kappaṃ parinibbutova yathā nigrodhakappaṃ āvikarohi pakāsehī”ti.
analyzed: kappam parinibbutaḥ uva yathā nigrodha kappam āvikarohi pakāsehi iti
translated: how Nigrodhakappa attained final Nibbana after a long time. Reveal, make known.’

original: Khippanti imampi gāthaṃ purimanayeneva āha. Tassattho – bhagavā khippaṃ giraṃ eraya
analyzed: khippam imam pi gātham purima nayena iva āha tassa atthaḥ bhagavā khippam giram eraya
translated: ‘Swiftly’—this verse too he spoke in the same way as before. Its meaning is this. The Blessed One should quickly

original: vaggu vagguṃ acirāyamāno vācaṃ bhāsa vaggu manoharaṃ. Haṃsova yathā suvaṇṇahaṃso
analyzed: vaggu vaggum acirāyamānaḥ vācam bhāsa vaggu manoharam haṃsaḥ uva yathā suvaṇṇa haṃsaḥ
translated: speak a speech that is beautiful, beautiful, not delayed, a speech that is beautiful, delightful. Just as a swan, a golden swan,

original: gocaraṃ pariggaṇhanto jātassaravanasaṇḍaṃ disvā gīvaṃ paggayha pakkhe uddhunitvā
analyzed: gocaram pariggaṇhantaḥ jātassara vana saṇḍam disvā gīvam paggayha pakkhe uddhunitvā
translated: when it is taking a range of pasture, sees a clump of reeds that have grown up, raises its neck, flaps its wings,

original: haṭṭhatuṭṭho saṇikaṃ ataramāno vagguṃ nikūjati giraṃ nicchāreti, evamevaṃ tvaṃ saṇikaṃ
analyzed: haṭṭha tuṭṭhaḥ saṇikam a taramānaḥ vaggum nikūjati giram evam evam tvam saṇikam
translated: and, delighted and satisfied, slowly, slowly, beautifully, sweetly, utters a cry, lets out a cry, in the same way you should slowly, slowly,

original: nikūja iminā mahāpurisalakkhaṇaññatarena bindussarena suṭṭhu vikappitena abhisaṅkhatena,
analyzed: nikūja iminā mahāpurisa lakkhaṇa aññatarena bindussarena suṭṭhu vikappitena abhisaṅkhatena
translated: utter a cry with this other mark of a Great Man, with this drop of honey, well-defined, well-conceived.🔽We all are upright, with undistracted minds, and we will listen to your cry.

original: ete mayaṃ sabbe ujugatā avikkhittamānasā hutvā tava nikūjaṃ suṇomāti.
analyzed: ete mayam sabbe uju gatāḥ a vikkhitta mānasāḥ hutvā tava nikūjam suṇoma ati
translated: We are all listening to your words with undivided attention.

original: Pahīnajātimaraṇanti, idampi purimanayeneva āha. Tattha na sissatīti aseso, taṃ asesaṃ,
analyzed: pahīna jāti maraṇam ti idam pi purima nayena iva āha tattha na sissati iti asesaḥ tam asesam
translated: “He has abandoned birth and death”: this is said because he has abandoned birth and death without remainder, as explained above.

original: sotāpannādayo viya kiñci asesetvā pahīnajātimaraṇanti vuttaṃ hoti. Niggayhāti nibandhitvā,
analyzed: sotāpanna ādayaḥ viya kiñci a sesetvā pahīna jāti maraṇanti vuttam hoti niggayha ati nibandhitvā
translated: “He will not be left over”: he will not be left over without remainder.🔽“He will be free from bonds”: he will be free from the bonds of defilements.

original: dhonanti dhutasabbapāpaṃ. Vadessāmīti kathāpessāmi dhammaṃ. Na kāmakāro hohi puthujjanānanti🔽puthujjanasekkhādīnaṃ tividhānaṃ janānaṃ kāmakāro natthi, te yaṃ icchanti ñātuṃ vā
analyzed: dhonanti dhuta sabba pāpam vadessāmi iti kathāpessāmi dhammam na kāmakāraḥ hohi puthujjanānam ti  puthujjana sekkha ādīnam tividhānam janānam kāmakāraḥ na atthi te yam icchanti ñātum vā
translated: “I will speak”: I will teach the Dhamma.🔽“Do not be a slave to the ordinary men”: the ordinary men, the trainees, etc., are not masters of their own wishes.🔽Whatever they wish to know or to speak, they are unable to do.

original: vattuṃ vā, taṃ na sakkonti. Saṅkheyyakāro ca tathāgatānanti tathāgatānaṃ pana vīmaṃsakāro
analyzed: vattum vā tam na sakkonti saṅkheyyakāro ca tathāgatānam ti tathāgatānam pana vīmaṃsakāro
translated: But the Tathāgatas are masters of their own wishes.

original: paññāpubbaṅgamakiriyā, te yaṃ icchanti ñātuṃ vā vattuṃ vā, taṃ sakkontiyevāti adhippāyo.
analyzed: paññā pubbaṅgama kiriyā te yam icchanti ñātum vā vattum vā tam sakkontiyā iva āti adhippāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that they are able to know and speak whatever they wish.

original: Idāni taṃ saṅkheyyakāraṃ pakāsento “sampannaveyyākaraṇa”nti gāthamāha. Tassattho
analyzed: idāni tam saṅkheyyakāram pakāsentaḥ sampanna veyyākaraṇan ti gātham āha tassa atthaḥ
translated: Now, in order to show that mastery, he spoke the verse, “The one with perfect knowledge and conduct.” The meaning of this is as follows:

original: – tathā hi tava bhagavā idaṃ samujjupaññassa sabbattha appaṭihatabhāvena ujugatapaññassa
analyzed: tathā hi tava bhagavā idam samujju paññassa sabbattha appaṭihata bhāvena uju gata paññassa
translated: For the Blessed One has said this to you, who are of clear understanding, whose understanding is straight, who have understanding that has gone everywhere,

original: sammadeva vuttaṃ pavattitaṃ sampannaveyyākaraṇaṃ “santatimahāmatto sattatālamattaṃ
analyzed: sammat eva vuttam pavattitam sampanna veyyākaraṇam santati mahā mattaḥ satta tāla mattam
translated: who have understanding that is complete, who have understanding that is well developed: “The minister of the interior will attain Nibbāna after rising up from the seven-leaf tree;

original: abbhuggantvā parinibbāyissati, suppabuddho sakko sattame divase pathaviṃ pavisissatī”ti
analyzed: abbhut gantvā parinibbāyissati suppabuddhaḥ sakkaḥ sattame divase pathavim pavisissati iti
translated: the Sakyan Suppabuddha will enter the earth on the seventh day.”

original: evamādiṃ samuggahitaṃ sammadeva uggahitaṃ aviparītaṃ diṭṭhaṃ, puna suṭṭhutaraṃ añjaliṃ
analyzed: evamādim samuggahitam sammat eva uggahitam aviparītam diṭṭham puna suṭṭhutaram añjalim
translated: Thus what was taken up by you was taken up rightly, seen rightly, not wrongly. Again, having paid homage with hands raised in reverential salutation,

original: paṇāmetvā āha. Ayamañjali pacchimo suppaṇāmitoti ayaṃ aparopi añjali suṭṭhutaraṃ
analyzed: paṇāmetvā āha ayam añjali pacchimaḥ su paṇāmitaḥ iti ayam aparaḥ api añjali suṭṭhutaram
translated: he said: “This is the last reverential salutation” . This other reverential salutation was paid more perfectly,

original: paṇāmito. Mā mohayī jānanti mā no avacanena mohayi, jānanto tassa gatiṃ. Anomapaññāti
analyzed: paṇāmitaḥ mā mohayi jānanti mā no avacanena mohayi jānantaḥ tassa gatim anomapaññāti
translated: more purely. “Do not deceive us, knowing” : do not deceive us by not speaking, knowing the way. “O you of incomparable understanding” :

original: bhagavantaṃ ālapati.
analyzed: bhagavantam ālapati
translated: he addresses the Blessed One.

original: Paroparanti imaṃ pana gāthaṃ aparenapi pariyāyena amohanameva yācanto āha. Tattha
analyzed: imam pana gātham aparena api pariyāyena amohanam eva yācantaḥ āha tattha
translated: “The far and the near”: but seeking non-deception in another way, he said this stanza. Herein,

original: paroparanti lokuttaralokiyavasena sundarāsundaraṃ dūre santike vā. Ariyadhammanti
analyzed: paroparanti lokuttara lokiya vasena sundara asundaram dūre santike vā
translated: “The far and the near”: the beautiful and the ugly, or the distant and the near, in the sense of supramundane and mundane. “The noble truth”:

original: catusaccadhammaṃ. Viditvāti paṭivijjhitvā. Jānanti sabbaṃ ñeyyadhammaṃ jānanto. Vācābhikaṅkhāmīti
analyzed: catu sacca dhammam viditvā ati paṭivijjhitvā jānanti sabbam ñeyya dhammam jānantaḥ vācā abhikaṅkhāmi iti
translated: The Four Noble Truths. Having known: having penetrated. They know: they know all knowable things. I long for speech:

original: yathā ghammani ghammakāle uṇhābhitatto puriso kilanto tasito vāriṃ, evaṃ te vācaṃ
analyzed: yathā ghammani ghamma kāle uṇha abhitattaḥ purisaḥ kilantaḥ tasitaḥ vārim evam te vācam
translated: just as a man exhausted and afflicted by heat longs for water at the time of drinking water, so I long for speech

original: abhikaṅkhāmi. Sutaṃ pavassāti sutasaṅkhātaṃ saddāyatanaṃ pavassa pagghara muñca pavatta.
analyzed: abhikaṅkhāmi sutam pavassa iti suta saṅkhātam sadda āyatanam pavassa pagghara muñca pavatta
translated: from them. Let the rain of the heard descend: let the rain of the sense-base of sound called the heard descend, let it fall, let it be released, let it flow.

original: “Sutassa vassā”tipi pāḷi. Vuttapakārassa saddāyatanassa vuṭṭhiṃ vassāti attho.
analyzed: sutassa vutta pakārassa sadda āyatanassa vuṭṭhim vassa ati atthaḥ
translated: “Let the rain of the heard descend” is also a reading. The meaning is: let the rain of the sense-base of sound of the kind already mentioned descend.

original: Idāni yādisaṃ vācaṃ abhikaṅkhati, taṃ pakāsento “yadatthika”nti gāthamāha. Tattha🔽kappāyanoti kappameva pūjāvasena vadati. Yathā vimuttoti “kiṃ anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā
analyzed: idāni yādisam vācam abhikaṅkhati tam pakāsentaḥ yadatthikam ti gātham āha tattha  kappāyano ti kappam eva pūjā vasena vadati yathā vimuttaḥ iti kim anupādisesāya nibbāna dhātuyā
translated: Now, showing what kind of speech he longs for, he said the verse: “I long for speech,” etc. Herein

original: yathā asekkho, udāhu saupādisesāya yathā sekkho”ti vā pucchati. Sesamettha pākaṭameva.
analyzed: yathā asekkhaḥ udāhu saupādisesāya yathā sekkho ti vā pucchati sesam ettha pākaṭam eva
translated: Kappiyaṇa: he speaks of the mere opportunity for worship. As to how liberated: he asks whether it is as a non-returner who is liberated from the five lower fetters, or as a once-returner who is liberated from three fetters, or as a stream-enterer who is liberated from one fetter. The rest is clear.

original: Evaṃ dvādasahi gāthāhi yācito bhagavā taṃ viyākaronto “acchecchī”tiādimāha. Tattha
analyzed: evam dvādasahi gāthāhi yācitaḥ bhagavā tam viyākarontaḥ acchecchi iti ādim āha tattha
translated: Thus requested with twelve verses, the Blessed One replied with the verse beginning “I will tell you,”

original: acchecchi taṇhaṃ idha nāmarūpe (iti bhagavā) kaṇhassa sotaṃ dīgharattānusayitanti
analyzed: acchecchi taṇham nāma rūpe iti bhagavā kaṇhassa sotam
translated: Which had been Mara’s snare for long.

original: imasmiṃ nāmarūpe kāmataṇhādibhedā taṇhā dīgharattaṃ appahīnaṭṭhena anusayitā kaṇhanāmakassa
analyzed: imasmin nāma rūpe kāma taṇhā ādi bhedā taṇhā dīgharattam appahīna ṭṭhena kaṇha nāmakassa
translated: Craving, classed as sensual desire, etc., which had been lying latent for a long time in this mentality-materiality by not being fully abandoned,

original: mārassa sotantipi vuccati. Taṃ kaṇhassa sotamutaṃ dīgharattānusayitaṃ idha nāmarūpe
analyzed: vuccati tam kaṇhassa nāma rūpe
translated: is called “Mara’s snare.” He cut off that snare of Mara, which had been lying latent for long,🔽here for mentality-materiality. Thus the Blessed One,

original: taṇhaṃ kappāyano chindi. Iti bhagavāti idaṃ pana saṅgītikārānaṃ vacanaṃ. Atāri jātiṃ
analyzed: taṇham kappāyano chindi iti bhagavā ati idam pana saṅgītika ārānam vacanam atāri jātim
translated: he crossed over birth and death without remainder.

original: maraṇaṃ asesanti so taṃ taṇhaṃ chetvā asesaṃ jātimaraṇaṃ atari anupādisesāya parinibbāyīti🔽dasseti, iccabravi bhagavā pañcaseṭṭhoti āyasmatā vaṅgīsena puṭṭho bhagavā evaṃ avoca
analyzed: maraṇam so tam taṇham chetvā asesam jāti maraṇam atari anupādisesāya parinibbāyi iti  dassa iti icca bravi bhagavā pañcaseṭṭhaḥ iti āyasmatā vaṅgīsena puṭṭhaḥ bhagavā evam avoca
translated: Having cut off that craving without remainder, he crossed over birth and death without remainder, he attained final Nibbana without remainder of the aggregates.🔽Thus spoke the Blessed One, the best of the five,

original: pañcahi saddhādīhi indriyehi anaññasādhāraṇehi cakkhūhi vā seṭṭho. Atha vā pañcaseṭṭhoti
analyzed: pañcahi saddhā ādīhi indriyehi anañña sādhāraṇehi cakkhūhi vā seṭṭhaḥ atha vā pañca seṭṭhaḥ ti
translated: The Blessed One spoke thus when asked by the venerable Vangisa. The best of the five: either he is the best of the five eyes, which are not common to others, or else he is the best of the five,

original: pañcahi sīlādīhi dhammakkhandhehi, pañcahi vā hetusampadādīhi seṭṭho uttamo pavaroti
analyzed: pañcahi sīla ādīhi dhammakkhandhehi pañcahi vā hetu sampad ādīhi seṭṭhaḥ uttamaḥ
translated: or he is the best of the five aggregates of Dhamma beginning with virtue, or else he is the best of the five kinds of excellence beginning with the excellence of the cause.

original: saṅgītikārānamevidampi vacanaṃ.
analyzed: vacanam
translated: This is the statement of the compilers of the canon.

original: Evaṃ vutte bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinandamānaso āyasmā vaṅgīso “esa sutvā”tiādikā gāthāyo🔽āha. Tattha paṭhamagāthāyaṃ na maṃ vañcesīti yasmā parinibbuto, tasmā tassa parinibbutabhāvaṃ
analyzed: evam vutte bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandamānasaḥ āyasmā vaṅgīsaḥ esa sutvā iti ādikāḥ gāthāyaḥ  āha tattha paṭhama gāthāyam na mama vañcesi iti yasmā parinibbuto tasmā tassa parinibbuta bhāvam
translated: When this was said, the venerable Vangīsa, delighting in the Blessed One’s words, uttered the stanzas beginning with “Having heard this” .

original: icchantaṃ maṃ na vañcesi, na visaṃvādesīti attho. Sesaṃ pākaṭameva.
analyzed: icchantam mam na vañcesi na visaṃvādesi iti sesam pākaṭam eva
translated: Herein, in the first stanza, since he has attained extinction, therefore he does not deceive me who desire his state of extinction; the meaning is that he does not mislead me. The rest is clear.

original: Dutiyagāthāyaṃ yasmā mutyapekho vihāsi, tasmā taṃ sandhāyāha “yathā vādī tathā kārī,🔽ahu buddhassa sāvako”ti. Maccuno jālaṃ tata”nti tebhūmakavaṭṭe vitthataṃ mārassa🔽taṇhājālaṃ. Māyāvinoti bahumāyassa. “Tathā māyāvino”tipi keci paṭhanti, tesaṃ yo
analyzed: dutiya gāthā ayam tasmai tam sandhāya āha yathā vādī tathā kārī  ahu buddhassa sāvakaḥ iti maccunaḥ jālam tatanti tebhūmaka vaṭṭe vitthatam mārassa  taṇhā jālam māyāvino ti bahu māyassa tathā māyāvino ti pi keci paṭhanti tesam yaḥ
translated: In the second stanza, since he lived looking for deliverance, therefore he said “As he spoke so he acted,

original: anekāhi māyāhi anekakkhattuṃ bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkami. Tassa tathā māyāvinoti adhippāyo.
analyzed: anekāhi māyāhi anekakkhattum bhagavantam upasaṅkami tassa tathā māyāvinaḥ iti adhippāyaḥ
translated: he was the Enlightened One’s disciple” . “The snare of Death” is the snare of craving spread out in the round of rebirths in the three planes . “The wily one” is the one with many wiles. Some read “The wily one thus” . Their intention is this: “He came to the Blessed One many times with many wiles” .

original: Tatiyagāthāya ādinti mūlakāraṇaṃ. Upādānassāti vaṭṭassa. Vaṭṭaṃ daḷhehi kammakilesehi
analyzed: tatiya gāthāya ādim ti mūla kāraṇam upādānassa ati vaṭṭassa vaṭṭam daḷhehi kamma kilesehi
translated: The beginning of the round of rebirths is the cause of the round of rebirths. The round of rebirths is called “clinging” because it is to be clung to by kamma-formations and defilements that are strong.

original: upādātabbaṭṭhena “upādāna”nti vuttaṃ. Tassa upādānassa ādiṃ avijjātaṇhādibhedaṃ kāraṇaṃ🔽ñāṇacakkhunā addasa. Kappo kappiyoti evaṃ vattuṃ vaṭṭati bhagavāti adhippāyena vadati.
analyzed: upādātabba ṭṭhena upādānanti vuttam tassa upādānassa ādim avijjā taṇhā ādi bhedam kāraṇam  ñāṇa cakkhunā addasa kappo kappiyo ti evam vattum vaṭṭati bhagavā iti adhippāyena vadati
translated: The beginning of that clinging is the cause, which is divided into ignorance, craving, and so on.🔽He saw with the eye of knowledge. He is called “the one who has gone beyond the world’s end” with the intention that it is proper for the Blessed One to say this.

original: Accagā vatāti atikkanto vata. Maccudheyyanti maccu ettha dhiyyatīti maccudheyyaṃ,
analyzed: accagāḥ vata ati atikkantaḥ vata maccudheyyam ti maccu ettha dhiyyati iti maccudheyyam
translated: He has gone beyond the world’s end,

original: tebhūmakavaṭṭaṃ suduttaraṃ accagā vatāti vedajāto vadati.🔽Idāni satthari attano upajjhāye ca pasannamānaso pasannākāraṃ vibhāvento “taṃ devadeva”nti
analyzed: tebhūmaka vaṭṭam su duttaram accagāḥ vata ati veda jātaḥ vadati  idāni satthari attano upajjhāye ca pasanna mānasaḥ pasanna ākāram vibhāvento tam devadevanti
translated: the round of the three planes of existence, which is difficult to cross.🔽Now, with his mind full of confidence in the Teacher and his preceptor, he uttered the following verse of praise, showing his confidence:🔽“I praise that God of gods.”

original: osānagāthamāha. Tattha taṃ devadevaṃ vandāmīti sammutidevo, upapattidevo, visuddhidevoti
analyzed: osāna gātham āha tattha tam devadevam vandāmi iti sammuti devaḥ upapatti devaḥ visuddhi devaḥ iti
translated: Herein, the god of gods is the supreme god of all gods, whether gods by convention, gods by rebirth, or gods by purification.

original: tesaṃ sabbesampi devānaṃ uttamadevatāya devadevaṃ dvipaduttama bhagavā taṃ vandāmi.
analyzed: tesam sabbesam pi devānam uttama devatāya devadevam dvipad uttama bhagavā tam vandāmi
translated: I praise that god of gods, the Blessed One, the supreme man.

original: Na kevalaṃ taṃyeva, atha kho tava saccābhisambodhiyā anudhammajātattā anujātaṃ, māravijayena
analyzed: na kevalam atha kho tava sacca abhisambodhiyā anu dhamma jāta ttā anujātam māra vijayena
translated: Not only that, but it is also your own, because it is in conformity with the Dhamma that you have realized. It is a great hero, because of your great heroism in conquering Mara.

original: mahāvīriyatāya mahāvīraṃ, āguakaraṇādiatthena nāgaṃ tava ure vāyāmajanitajātitāya
analyzed: mahāvīriya tāya mahāvīram nāgam tava ure
translated: It is a Naga, because of your ability to do what is hard to do. It is a son, because it was born from your breast through the exertion of your striving.

original: orasaṃ puttaṃ nigrodhakappañca vandāmi.
analyzed: orasam puttam nigrodha kappam ca vandāmi
translated: I also pay homage to the Bodhi Tree.

original: Evamete subhūtiādayo vaṅgīsapariyosānā dvisataṃ catusaṭṭhi ca mahātherā idha pāḷiyaṃ
analyzed: evam ete subhūti ādayaḥ vaṅgīsa pariyosānāḥ dvisatam catusaṭṭhi ca mahā therāḥ idha
translated: Thus these great elders, beginning with Subhuti and ending with Vangisa, numbering two hundred and sixty-four, are mentioned in the text.

original: ārūḷhā, te sabbe yathā sammāsambuddhassa sāvakabhāvena ekavidhā. Tathā asekkhabhāvena,🔽ukkhittapalighatāya saṃkiṇṇaparikkhatāya, abbuḷhesikatāya, niraggaḷatāya, pannaddhajatāya,🔽pannabhāratāya, visaṃyuttatāya, dasasu ariyavāsesu vuṭṭhavāsatāya ca. Tathā hi te
analyzed: ārūḍhā te sabbe yathā sammāsambuddhassa sāvaka bhāvena ekavidhā tathā asekkha bhāvena  ukkhitta paligha tāya saṃkiṇṇa parikkhatāya abbuḷhesikatāya niraggaḷa tāya pannaddha ja tāya  panna bhāratāya visaṃyutta tāya dasasu ariya vāsesu vuṭṭha vāsa tāya ca tathā hi te
translated: All of them are of one kind as disciples of the Fully Enlightened One. Likewise, they are of one kind as those who have reached the state of no-more-training.

original: pañcaṅgavippahīnā, chaḷaṅgasamannāgatā, ekārakkhā, caturāpassenā, panuṇṇapaccekasaccā,
analyzed: pañcaṅga vippahīnā chaḍaṅga samannāgatā eka ārakkhā catur āpassenā panuṇṇa paccekasaccā

analyzed: antevāsika bhūtāḥ ajita ādayo soḷasa sahassa parimāṇā ti evam vuttataḥ aññe na ehi bhikkhu bhāvena

translated: They are also of two kinds as face-to-face and not face-to-face. Those who were born in the Noble Birth while the Master was still living,

analyzed: adhigata visesā te sati pi satthu dhamma sarīrassa paccakkhabhāve satthu sarīrassa

analyzed: a paccakkha bhāvataḥ parammukha sāvakāḥ nāma
translated: and so they are called not face-to-face disciples.
