original: “Vimokkhāpi ca aṭṭhime, chaḷabhiññā sacchikatā”ti.🔽Tathā sāpadānānapadānabhedato, yesañhi purimesu sammāsambuddhesu paccekabuddhabuddhasāvakesupi
analyzed: vimokkhā api ca aṭṭhime chaḍabhiññā sacchikatā ati  tathā sa apadāna anapadāna bhedataḥ yesan hi purimesu sammāsambuddhesu paccekabuddha buddha sāvakesu pi
translated: “And the eight liberations too, And the six kinds of direct knowledge realized” .🔽Also as those with an apadāna and those without an apadāna. Those who have an apadāna called “perfection of discipleship” that was performed in the past in the time of former Buddhas and Paccekabuddhas and Buddhas’ disciples,

original: puññakiriyāvasena pavattitaṃ sāvakapāramitāsaṅkhātaṃ atthi apadānaṃ, te sāpadānā,
analyzed: puñña kiriyā vasena pavattitam sāvaka pāramitā saṅkhātam atthi apadānam te sa apadānā
translated: are those “with an apadāna” .

original: seyyathāpi apadānapāḷiyaṃ āgatā therā. Yesaṃ pana taṃ natthi, te anapadānā.
analyzed: seyyathā api apadāna pāḷiyam āgatāḥ therāḥ yesam pana tam natthi te anapadānā
translated: like the elders mentioned in the Apadāna. But those who do not have that are “without apadāna.”

original: Kiṃ pana sabbena sabbaṃ pubbahetusampattiyā vinā saccābhisambodho sambhavatīti? Na
analyzed: kim pana sabbena sabbam pubba hetu sampattiyā vinā sacca abhisambodhaḥ sambhavati iti na
translated: But is it possible to realize the truths without the complete fulfillment of the conditions that existed in the past?

original: sambhavati. Na hi upanissayasampattirahitassa ariyamaggādhigamo atthi, tassa sudukkaradurabhisambhavasabhāvato.
analyzed: sambhavati na hi upanissaya sampatti rahitassa ariya magga adhigamaḥ atthi tassa su dukkara durabhisambhava sabhāvato
translated: It is not possible. For there is no attainment of the noble path without the fulfillment of the conditions, because that is of a nature difficult to realize.🔽As it is said: “What do you think, bhikkhus? Which is more difficult to do, more difficult to master,

original: Yathāha “taṃ kiṃ maññatha, bhikkhave, katamaṃ nu kho dukkarataraṃ vā durabhisambhavataraṃ
analyzed: yathā āha tam kim maññatha bhikkhave katamam nu kho dukkarataram vā durabhisambhavataram
translated: to lead a warrior band in a battle🔽or to go forth into homelessness and realize the four noble truths?”

original: vā”tiādi. Yadi evaṃ kasmā vuttaṃ – “yesaṃ pana taṃ natthi, te anapadānā”ti? Nayidamevaṃ🔽daṭṭhabbaṃ “ye sabbena sabbaṃ upanissayasampattirahitā, te anapadānā”ti tādisānaṃ
analyzed: vā iti ādi yadi evam kasmā vuttam yesam pana tam natthi te na idam evam  daṭṭhabbam ye sabbena sabbam upanissaya sampatti rahitā te
translated: If that is so, why is it said, “But those who do not have that are ‘without apadāna’?”🔽This should not be taken to mean that “those who are completely devoid of the fulfillment of the conditions are ‘without apadāna’,”

original: idha anadhippetattā. Yesaṃ pana atiukkaṃsagataṃ apadānaṃ natthi, te idha “anapadānā”ti
analyzed: idha an adhippeta ttā yesam pana ati ukkaṃsa gatam apadānam natthi te idha anapadānā ti
translated: because such people are not intended here. But those who do not have an apadāna that is outstanding are here called “without apadāna.”

original: vuttā, na sabbena sabbaṃ upanissayarahitāyeva. Tathā hi ime sattā buddhuppādesu acchariyācinteyyaguṇavibhūtivitthataṃ
analyzed: vuttāḥ na sabbena sabbam upanissaya rahitāya iva tathā hi ime sattā buddhuppādesu acchariya acinteyya guṇa vibhūti vitthatam
translated: But it is not entirely devoid of decisive support. For beings who see the power of the Buddhas, which is wonderful and inconceivable, and which is extended with the special qualities that appear in the Buddhas’ eons,

original: buddhānaṃ ānubhāvaṃ passantā catuppamāṇikassa lokassa sabbathāpi pasādāvahattā satthari
analyzed: buddhānam ānubhāvam passantā catuppamāṇikassa lokassa sabbathā api pasāda āvahattā satthari
translated: obtain faith in the Teacher, which is the basis for the fourfold purity of the world.

original: saddhaṃ paṭilabhanti. Tathā saddhammassavanena, sāvakānaṃ sammāpaṭipattidassanena,
analyzed: saddham paṭilabhanti tathā saddhamma ssavanena sāvakānam sammā paṭipatti dassanena
translated: Similarly, they obtain faith in the True Dhamma by listening to the True Dhamma, by seeing the right practice of the disciples,

original: kadāci mahābodhisattānaṃ sammāsambodhiyā cittābhinīhāradassanena, tesaṃ santike ovādānusāsanapaṭilābhena🔽ca saddhamme saddhaṃ paṭilabhanti, te tattha paṭiladdhasaddhā yadipi saṃsāre nibbāne
analyzed: kadāci mahā bodhisattānam sammāsambodhiyā citta abhinīhāra dassanena tesam santike ovāda anusāsana paṭilābhena  ca saddhamme saddham paṭilabhanti te tattha paṭiladdha saddhāḥ yadi api saṃsāre nibbāne
translated: by seeing the aspiration for the supreme enlightenment of the great Bodhisattvas, and by receiving advice and instruction from them.

original: ca ādīnavānisaṃse passanti, mahārajakkhatāya pana yogakkhemaṃ anabhisambhunantā antarantarā
analyzed: ca ādīnava anisaṃse passanti mahārajakkha tāya pana yogakkhemam an abhisambhunantāḥ antarantarā
translated: Even though they see the danger and the advantage in saṃsāra and in Nibbāna, respectively, they do not attain the security of the paths and fruits because of their great royal sovereignty.🔽But they plant the seed of the wholesome in their own continuity by way of the decisive support of the round of rebirths.

original: vivaṭṭūpanissayaṃ kusalabījaṃ attano santāne ropentiyeva sappurisūpanissayassa bahūkārabhāvato. Tenāha –
analyzed: vivaṭṭu upanissayam kusala bījam attano santāne ropentiyā iva sappurisa upanissayassa bahūkāra bhāvato tena āha
translated: This is because the decisive support of a good person is very helpful.

original: “Yadimassa lokanāthassa, virajjhissāma sāsanaṃ;
analyzed: yat imassa loka nāthassa virajjhissāma sāsanam
translated: “As long as we are not free from passion for the Teaching of this Lord of the World,

original: Anāgatamhi addhāne, hessāma sammukhā imaṃ.
analyzed: anāgatamhi addhāne hessāma sammukhāḥ imaṃ
translated: we shall be face to face with him in the future.

original: “Yathā manussā nadiṃ tarantā, paṭititthaṃ virajjhiya;
analyzed: yathā manussā nadim tarantā paṭitittham virajjhiya
translated: “Just as men crossing a river, not letting go of the near bank,

original: Heṭṭhātitthe gahetvāna, uttaranti mahānadiṃ.
analyzed: heṭṭhātitthe gahetvānaḥ uttaranti mahā nadim
translated: grasping the further bank, cross over the great river;

original: “Evameva mayaṃ sabbe, yadi muñcāmimaṃ jinaṃ;
analyzed: evam eva mayam yadi muñcāmi imam jinam
translated: “Even so, all of us, if we let go of this Victor,

original: Anāgatamhi addhāne, hessāma sammukhā ima”nti.🔽Evaṃ vivaṭṭaṃ uddissa uppāditakusalacittaṃ satasahassādhikacatuasaṅkhyeyyakālantare
analyzed: anāgatamhi addhāne hessāma sammukhā imanti  evam vivaṭṭam uddissa uppādita kusala cittam sata sahassa adhika catu asaṅkhyeyya kāla antare
translated: we shall be face to face with him in the future.”

original: vimokkhādhigamassa upanissayo na hotīti na sakkā vattuṃ. Pageva patthanāvasena adhikāraṃ
analyzed: vimokkha adhigamassa upanissayaḥ na hoti iti na sakkā vattum pagā iva patthanā vasena adhikāram
translated: Thus, having generated wholesome thoughts with reference to the turning of the Wheel, it cannot be said that it is not a condition for the attainment of deliverance after a period of four incalculable ages plus a hundred thousand aeons.

original: katvā pavattitaṃ. Evaṃ duvidhāpete.
analyzed: evam duvidha apete
translated: How much more so if it is done by way of aspiration and by way of practice. Thus it is twofold.

original: Aggasāvakā, mahāsāvakā, pakatisāvakāti tividhā. Tesu āyasmā aññāsikoṇḍañño, vappo,
analyzed: agga sāvakā mahāsāvakā pakati sāvakā ati tividhā tesu āyasman vappo
translated: The chief disciples, the great disciples, and the ordinary disciples. Among them, the venerable Koṇḍañña, Vappo,

original: bhaddiyo, mahānāmo, assaji, nālako, yaso, vimalo, subāhu, puṇṇaji, gavampati, uruvelakassapo,
analyzed: bhaddiyaḥ mahānāmaḥ assaji nālakaḥ yasaḥ vimalaḥ subāhu puṇṇaji gavampati uruvelakassapo
translated: Bhaddiya, Mahānāma, Assaji, Nālaka, Yasa, Vimalo, Subāhu, Puṇṇaji, Gavampati, Uruvelakassapa,

original: nadīkassapo, gayākassapo, sāriputto, mahāmoggallāno, mahākassapo, mahākaccāyano,
analyzed: nadīkassapaḥ gayākassapaḥ sāriputtaḥ mahāmoggallānaḥ mahākassapaḥ mahākaccāyanaḥ
translated: Nadī-Kassapa, Gayā-Kassapa, Sāriputta, Mahāmoggallāna, Mahākassapa, Mahācunda,

original: mahākoṭṭhiko, mahākappino, mahācundo, anuruddho, kaṅkhārevato, ānando, nandako, bhagu,
analyzed: mahākoṭṭhikaḥ mahākappinaḥ mahācundaḥ anuruddhaḥ kaṅkhārevataḥ ānandaḥ nandakaḥ bhagu
translated: Mahākoṭṭhita, Mahākappina, Mahācunda, Anuruddha, Revata, Ānanda, Nandaka, Bhagu,

original: nando, kimilo, bhaddiyo, rāhulo, sīvali, upāli, dabbo, upaseno, khadiravaniyarevato,
analyzed: nandaḥ kimilaḥ bhaddiyaḥ rāhulaḥ sīvali upāli dabbaḥ upasenaḥ khadira vaniya revataḥ
translated: Nanda, Kimbila, Bhaddiya, Rāhula, Sāriputta, Upāli, Dabba, Upasena, Khadiravaniya-Revata,

original: puṇṇo mantāṇiputto, puṇṇo sunāparantako, soṇo kuṭikaṇṇo, soṇo koḷivīso, rādho, subhūti,
analyzed: puṇṇaḥ mantāṇiputto puṇṇaḥ sunāparantako soṇaḥ kuṭikaṇṇaḥ soṇaḥ koḷivīsaḥ rādhaḥ subhūti
translated: Puṇṇa Mantāṇiputta, Puṇṇa Sonako, Soṇa Kuṭikaṇṇa, Soṇa Koḷivisa, Rādha, Subhūti,

original: aṅgulimālo, vakkali, kāḷudāyī, mahāudāyī, pilindavaccho, sobhito, kumārakassapo,
analyzed: aṅgulimālaḥ vakkali kāḷudāyī mahāudāyī pilindavacchaḥ sobhito kumārakassapo
translated: Aṅgulimāla, Vakkali, Kāḷudāyī, Mahākoṭṭhita, Pilindavaccha, Sobhita, Kumāra-Kassapa,

original: raṭṭhapālo, vaṅgīso, sabhiyo, selo, upavāno, meghiyo, sāgato, nāgito, lakuṇḍakabhaddiyo,
analyzed: raṭṭhapālaḥ vaṅgīsaḥ sabhiyaḥ selaḥ upavānaḥ meghiyaḥ sāgataḥ nāgitaḥ lakuṇḍakabhaddiyo
translated: Raṭṭhapāla, Vaṅgīsa, Sabhiya, Sela, Upavāna, Meghiya, Sāgata, Nāgita, Bhaddiya the dwarf,

original: piṇḍolabhāradvājo, mahāpanthako, cūḷapanthako, bākulo, kuṇḍadhāno, dārucīriyo, yasojo,
analyzed: piṇḍolabhāradvājaḥ mahāpanthakaḥ cūḷapanthakaḥ bākulaḥ kuṇḍadhānaḥ dārucīriyaḥ yasojaḥ
translated: Piṇḍola-Bhāradvāja, Mahāpanthaka, Cūḷapanthaka, Bākula, Kaṭṭhakannika, Dhaniya, Yasa,

original: ajito, tissametteyyo, puṇṇako, mettagū, dhotako, upasivo, nando, hemako, todeyyo,
analyzed: ajitaḥ tissametteyyaḥ puṇṇakaḥ mettagū dhotakaḥ upasivaḥ nandaḥ hemakaḥ todeyyaḥ
translated: Ajita, Tissa Metteyya, Puṇṇaka, Mettagū, Dhotaka, Upasīva, Nanda, Hemaka, Todeyya,

original: kappo, jatukaṇṇi, bhadrāvudho, udayo, posālo, mogharājā, piṅgiyoti ete asītimahāsāvakā nāma.
analyzed: kappaḥ jatukaṇṇi bhadrāvudhaḥ udayaḥ posālaḥ mogharājā piṅgiyoti ete asīti mahāsāvakāḥ nāma
translated: Kappo, Jatukaṇṇi, Bhadrāvudho, Udayo, Posālo, Mogharājā, Piṅgiyanti these eighty great disciples are called the Great Disciples.

original: Kasmā pana te eva therā “mahāsāvakā”ti vuccantīti? Abhinīhārassa mahantabhāvato.
analyzed: kasmā pana te eva therāḥ mahāsāvakā ati vuccanti iti abhinīhārassa mahanta bhāvato
translated: But why are they called “Great Disciples”? Because of the greatness of their aspiration.

original: Tathā hi dve aggasāvakāpi mahāsāvakesu antogadhā. Te hi sāvakapāramīñāṇassa matthakappattiyā
analyzed: tathā hi dve aggasāvaka api mahāsāvakesu antogadhā te hi sāvaka pāramī ñāṇassa matthaka ppattiyā
translated: For the two chief disciples are included among the great disciples. For they reached the summit of the knowledge of disciples

original: sāvakesu aggadhammādhigamena aggaṭṭhāne ṭhitāpi abhinīhāramahantatāsāmaññena “mahāsāvakā”tipi
analyzed: sāvakesu agga dhamma adhigamena agga ṭṭhāne ṭhitā api abhinīhāra mahanta tā sāmaññena mahāsāvakā atipi
translated: and they are called “great disciples” because of the greatness of their aspiration, though they are established in the foremost place by their attainment of the foremost state among disciples.

original: vuccanti. Itare pana pakatisāvakehi sātisayamahābhinīhārā. Tathā hi te padumuttarassa
analyzed: vuccanti itare pana pakati sāvakehi sa atisaya mahā abhinīhārā tathā hi te padumuttarassa
translated: But the others had aspirations that were greater than those of ordinary disciples. For they made their aspiration

original: bhagavato kāle katapaṇidhānā. Tato eva sātisayaṃ abhiññāsamāpattīsu vasino pabhinnapaṭisambhidā
analyzed: bhagavataḥ kāle kata paṇidhānā tatas eva sa atisayam abhiññā samāpattīsu vasinaḥ pabhinna paṭisambhidā
translated: in the time of the Blessed Padumuttara. And because of that they became masters of the higher wisdom and attained the discriminations.

original: ca. Kāmaṃ sabbepi arahanto sīlavisuddhiādike sampādetvā catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu patiṭṭhitacittā
analyzed: ca kāmam sabbe pi arahantaḥ sīla visuddhi ādike sampādetvā catūsu satipaṭṭhānesu patiṭṭhita cittā
translated: Of course, all arahats, having fulfilled the purification of virtue, etc., and established their minds in the four establishments of mindfulness,

original: satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtaṃ bhāvetvā maggapaṭipāṭiyā anavasesato kilese khepetvā
analyzed: satta bojjhaṅge yathābhūtam bhāvetvā magga paṭipāṭiyā anavasesataḥ kilese khepetvā
translated: having developed the seven factors of Awakening in accordance with reality, having exhausted all the defilements by the order of the path,

original: aggaphale patiṭṭhahanti, tathāpi yathā saddhāvimuttato diṭṭhippattassa, paññāvimuttato
analyzed: agga phale patiṭṭhahanti tathā api yathā saddhā vimuttataḥ diṭṭhi ppattassa paññā vimuttataḥ
translated: and after developing the seven factors of enlightenment in the way beginning, “He develops the enlightenment factor of mindfulness … “, they reach the supreme fruit by exhausting all the defilements without remainder in the order in which they arise.🔽And just as there is a difference in the prior development in the case of one liberated by faith and one attained to vision , and in the case of one liberated by understanding and one doubly liberated ,

original: ca ubhatobhāgavimuttassa pubbabhāgabhāvanāviseso addhā icchito viseso, evaṃ abhinīhāramahantatāpubbayogamahantatāhi
analyzed: ca ubhatobhāga vimuttassa pubbabhāga bhāvanā visesaḥ addhā icchitaḥ visesaḥ evam abhinīhāra mahanta tā pubbayoga mahanta tāhi
translated: so too there is a difference in the prior aspiration and in the prior effort in the case of the great disciples.

original: attasantāne sātisayaguṇavisesassa nipphāditattā sīlādiguṇehi mahantā sāvakāti mahāsāvakā.
analyzed: atta santāne sa atisaya guṇa visesassa nipphādita ttā sīla ādi guṇehi mahantā sāvakā ati mahāsāvakā
translated: And because of the production of the special quality in their own continuity, they are great disciples because of their greatness in virtue, etc.,

original: Tesuyeva pana ye bodhipakkhiyadhammesu pāmokkhabhāvena dhurabhūtānaṃ sammādiṭṭhisammāsamādhīnaṃ
analyzed: tesu yeva pana ye bodhi pakkhiya dhammesu pāmokkha bhāvena dhura bhūtānam sammādiṭṭhi sammāsamādhīnam
translated: And among them, those who are pre-eminent in the states partaking of enlightenment, who are leaders in right view and right concentration,

original: sātisayakiccantarabhāvanipphattiyā kāraṇabhūtāya tajjābhinīhārābhinihatāya sakkaccaṃ🔽nirantaraṃ cirakālaṃ samāhitāya sammāpaṭipattiyā yathākkamaṃ paññāya samādhismiñca
analyzed: sa atisaya kicca antara bhāva nipphattiyā kāraṇa bhūtāya tajja abhinīhāra abhinihatāya sakkaccam 🔽nirantaram cira kālam samāhitāya sammā paṭipattiyā yathākkamam paññāya samādhismin ca
translated: are great disciples because of the production of their special function in the states partaking of enlightenment, which is due to the aspiration that has been made for that special function, and because of their right practice, which is due to their being devoted to the states partaking of enlightenment, to their being devoted to the development of the states partaking of enlightenment, and to their being devoted to the meditation that is the cause of the development of the states partaking of enlightenment.🔽And because of the production of their special function in right view and right concentration, which is due to the aspiration that has been made for that special function, and because of their right practice, which is due to their being devoted to right view and right concentration, to their being devoted to the development of right view and right concentration, and to their being devoted to the meditation that is the cause of the development of right view and right concentration, they are great disciples because of their greatness in right view and right concentration.🔽And because of the production of their special function in right view and right concentration, which is due to the aspiration that has been made for that special function, and because of their right practice, which is due to their being devoted to right view and right concentration, to their being devoted to the development of right view and right concentration, and to their being devoted to the meditation that is the cause of the development of right view and right concentration, they are great disciples because of their greatness in right view and right concentration.

original: ukkaṃsapāramippattiyā savisesaṃ sabbaguṇehi aggabhāve ṭhitā. Te sāriputtamoggallānā
analyzed: ukkaṃsa pārami ppattiyā sa visesam sabba guṇehi agga bhāve ṭhitā te sāriputta moggallānā
translated: These Sāriputta and Moggallāna,

original: satipi mahāsāvakatte sāvakapāramiyā matthake sabbasāvakānaṃ aggabhāve ṭhitattā abhinīhāramahantabhāvato,
analyzed: sati api mahāsāvaka tte sāvaka pāramiyāḥ matthake sabba sāvakānam agga bhāve ṭhita ttā abhinīhāra mahanta bhāvato
translated: though they were great disciples, were called “chief disciples” because they were established in the foremost position among all disciples in the perfection of discipleship, because of the greatness of their aspiration,

original: pubbayogamahantabhāvato ca “aggasāvakā”icceva vuccanti. Ye pana ariyasāvakā aggasāvakā
analyzed: pubba yoga mahanta bhāvato ca vuccanti ye pana ariya sāvakāḥ aggasāvakā
translated: and because of the greatness of their previous application.

original: viya ca mahāsāvakā viya ca na parimitāva, atha kho anekasatā anekasahassā, te pakatisāvakā.
analyzed: viya ca mahāsāvakā viya ca na atha kho aneka satā aneka sahassā te pakatisāvakā
translated: But those noble disciples who are not limited to being like the chief disciples or like the great disciples, but are rather many hundreds, many thousands, they are ordinary disciples.🔽Here in the text they are limited to being mentioned in the verse, because they are included in the verse.

original: Idha pāḷiyaṃ ārūḷhā pana parimitāva gāthāvasena pariggahitattā. Tathāpi mahāsāvakesupi
analyzed: idha pāḷiyam ārūḍhā pana tathā api mahāsāvakesu pi
translated: But even among the great disciples

original: keci idha pāḷiyaṃ nārūḷhā.🔽Evaṃ tividhāpi te animittavimokkhādibhedato tividhā, vimokkhasamadhigamavasenapi
analyzed: keci idha pāḷiyam na ārūḍhā  evam tividhā api te animitta vimokkha ādi bhedataḥ tividhā vimokkha samadhigama vasena api
translated: some are not mentioned in the text here.🔽Thus they are of three kinds. They are also of three kinds as deliverance, concentration, and attainment.

original: tividhā. Tayo hi ime vimokkhā suññato vimokkho, animitto vimokkho, appaṇihito vimokkhoti.
analyzed: tividhā tayaḥ hi ime vimokkhā suññataḥ vimokkhaḥ animittaḥ vimokkhaḥ appaṇihitaḥ vimokkho ti
translated: For there are these three deliverances: deliverance by emptiness, deliverance by the signless, and deliverance by the desireless.

original: Te ca vimokkhā suññatādīhi aniccānupassanādīhi tīhi anupassanāhi adhigantabbā. Ādito
analyzed: te ca vimokkhā suññatā ādīhi anicca anupassanā ādīhi tīhi anupassanāhi adhigantabbā āditaḥ
translated: And these deliverances are to be reached by means of the three contemplations, that is to say, the contemplation of impermanence, etc., beginning with emptiness.

original: hi aniccādīsu yena kenaci ākārena vipassanābhiniveso hoti. Yadā pana vuṭṭhānagāminiyā
analyzed: hi anicca ādīsu yena kenaci ākārena vipassanā abhinivesaḥ hoti yadā pana vuṭṭhāna gāminiyā
translated: For to start with, there is absorption in insight by means of any one of the aspects of impermanence, etc.,

original: vipassanāya aniccākārato saṅkhāre sammasantiyā maggavuṭṭhānaṃ hoti, tadā vipassanā
analyzed: vipassanāya anicca ākārato saṅkhāre sammasantiyā magga vuṭṭhānam hoti tadā vipassanā
translated: and when there is emergence from it, then insight🔽is called “with object” because it has the sign of formations as object.

original: satipi rāganimittādīnaṃ samugghāṭane saṅkhāranimittaṃ pana sā na vissajjetīti nippariyāyena
analyzed: rāga nimitta ādīnam samugghāṭane saṅkhāra nimittam pana sā na vissajjeti iti nippariyāyena
translated: But although it has abolished the sign of greed, etc., it does not relinquish the sign of formations.🔽So it does not get the name of “signless” in the ultimate sense.

original: animittanāmaṃ alabhamānā attano maggassa animittanāmaṃ dātuṃ na sakkotīti. Kiñcāpi
analyzed: animitta nāmam a labhamānā attanaḥ maggassa animitta nāmam dātum na sakkoti iti kiñca api
translated: And it is unable to give its own path the name of “signless.”🔽And although the signless deliverance is not mentioned in the Abhidhamma,

original: abhidhamme animittavimokkho na uddhaṭo, suttante pana rāgādinimittānaṃ samugghāṭena labbhatīti.
analyzed: abhidhamme animitta vimokkhaḥ na uddhaṭaḥ suttante pana rāga ādi nimittānam samugghāṭena labbhati iti
translated: it is mentioned in the Suttas, where it is said that it is obtained by the abolition of the sign of greed, etc.,

original: “Animittañca bhāvehi, mānānusayamujjaha;
analyzed: animittam ca bhāvehi māna anusayam ujjaha
translated: “Develop the signless, abandon the underlying tendency to conceit,

original: Tato mānābhisamayā, upasanto carissasī”ti. –
analyzed: tatas māna abhisamayā upasantaḥ carissasi iti
translated: And when you have realized conceit’s ending, you will wander free” .

original: Ādinā hi vipassanāya animittavimokkhabhāvo anuttarassa animittavimokkhabhāvo ca vutto.
analyzed: ādinā hi vipassanāya animitta vimokkha bhāvaḥ anuttarassa animitta vimokkha bhāvaḥ ca vutto
translated: For this is said of the signless deliverance in the first stage of insight and in the supreme path.

original: Yadā vuṭṭhānagāminiyā vipassanāya dukkhato saṅkhāre sammasantiyā maggavuṭṭhānaṃ hoti,
analyzed: yadā vuṭṭhāna gāminiyā vipassanāya dukkhataḥ saṅkhāre sammasantiyā magga vuṭṭhānam hoti
translated: When, as they discern formations as painful by means of insight leading to emergence, there is emergence in the path,

original: tadā vipassanā rāgapaṇidhiādīnaṃ samugghāṭanena appaṇihitanāmaṃ labhatīti appaṇihitavimokkhaṃ
analyzed: tadā vipassanā rāga paṇidhi ādīnam samugghāṭanena appaṇihita nāmam labhati iti appaṇihita vimokkham
translated: then insight, by uprooting greed, hate, and the rest, acquires the name of “desireless” and so it is called the “desireless deliverance.”🔽And the path that is next to that is called the “desireless deliverance.”

original: nāma hoti. Tadanantaro ca maggo appaṇihitavimokkho. Yadā pana vuṭṭhānagāminiyā vipassanāya
analyzed: nāma hoti tad anantaraḥ ca maggaḥ appaṇihita vimokkho yadā pana vuṭṭhāna gāminiyā vipassanāya
translated: But when, as they discern by means of insight leading to emergence

original: anattākārena sammasantiyā maggavuṭṭhānaṃ hoti, tadā vipassanā attadiṭṭhiyā samugghāṭanena
analyzed: anatta ākārena sammasantiyā magga vuṭṭhānam hoti tadā vipassanā atta diṭṭhiyā samugghāṭanena
translated: with the aspect of not-self, there is emergence in the path, then insight, by uprooting the view of self,

original: suññatanāmaṃ labhatīti suññatavimokkhaṃ nāma hoti. Tadanantaro ca maggo suññatavimokkho
analyzed: suññata nāmam labhati iti suññata vimokkham nāma hoti tad anantaraḥ ca maggo suññata vimokkho
translated: acquires the name of “void” and so it is called the “void deliverance.” And the path that is next to that is called the “void deliverance.”

original: nāma hoti. Imesu aggamaggabhūtesu tīsu vimokkhesu imesaṃ therānaṃ keci animittavimokkhena
analyzed: nāma hoti imesu aggamagga bhūtesu tīsu vimokkhesu imesam therānam keci animitta vimokkhena
translated: Among these three kinds of deliverance, which are the three highest paths, some of these elders were liberated by the signless deliverance,🔽some by the desireless deliverance, and some by the void deliverance. Hence it was said:

original: muttā, keci appaṇihitavimokkhena, keci suññatavimokkhena. Tena vuttaṃ – “animittavimokkhādibhedato
analyzed: muttā keci appaṇihita vimokkhena keci suññata vimokkhena tena vuttam a nimitta vimokkha ādi bhedato
translated: By the division into the signless deliverance, etc.,

original: tividhā, vimokkhasamadhigamenapi tividhā”ti.
analyzed: tividhā
translated: It is threefold; and also by the attainment of the three deliverances it is threefold.

original: Paṭipadāvibhāgena catubbidhā. Catasso hi paṭipadā – dukkhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā,
analyzed: paṭipadā vibhāgena catubbidhā catasso hi paṭipadā dukkha paṭipadā dandha abhiññā
translated: It is of four kinds as analysis of the way,🔽for there are four ways: painful way with slow intuition, painful way with quick intuition,

original: dukkhapaṭipadā khippābhiññā, sukhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā, sukhapaṭipadā khippābhiññāti.
analyzed: dukkha paṭipadā khippa abhiñā sukha paṭipadā dandha abhiññā sukha paṭipadā khippa abhiññā ati
translated: It is of four kinds according to the distinction of the four paths, for there are four paths, that is to say, the difficult path, the slow path, the difficult path, the quick path, the easy path, the slow path, and the easy path, the quick path.

original: Tattha rūpamukhādīsu vipassanābhinivesesu yo rūpamukhena vipassanaṃ abhinivisitvā
analyzed: tattha rūpa mukha ādīsu vipassanā abhinivesesu yaḥ rūpa mukhena vipassanam abhinivisitvā
translated: Herein, when those who insist on insight have begun insight with the material septad, etc.,

original: cattāri mahābhūtāni pariggahetvā upādārūpaṃ pariggaṇhāti arūpaṃ pariggaṇhāti, rūpārūpaṃ🔽pana pariggaṇhanto dukkhena kasirena kilamanto pariggahetuṃ sakkoti, tassa dukkhapaṭipadā
analyzed: cattāri mahābhūtāni pariggahetvā upādā rūpam pariggaṇhāti arūpam pariggaṇhāti rūpa arūpam  pana pariggaṇhantaḥ dukkhena kasirena kilamantaḥ pariggahetum sakkoti tassa dukkha paṭipadā
translated: and have discerned the four great primaries, and have discerned the derived materiality, and have discerned the immaterial,🔽but who can discern materiality and the immaterial🔽with difficulty, slowly, laboriously, that is called the difficult path.

original: nāma hoti, pariggahitarūpārūpassa pana vipassanāparivāse maggapātubhāvadandhatāya
analyzed: nāma hoti pariggahita rūpa arūpassa pana vipassanā parivāse magga pātubhāva dandha tāya
translated: But when the path becomes evident to one who has discerned materiality and the immaterial, and his direct-knowledge is slow in arising owing to his being a person of slow wisdom,

original: dandhābhiññā nāma hoti. Yopi rūpārūpaṃ pariggahetvā nāmarūpaṃ vavatthapento dukkhena
analyzed: dandhābhiññā nāma hoti yaḥ api rūpa arūpam pariggahetvā nāma rūpam vavatthapentaḥ dukkhena
translated: that is called slow direct-knowledge. And when one who has discerned materiality and the immaterial defines mentality-materiality with difficulty,

original: kasirena kilamanto vavatthapeti, vavatthapite ca nāmarūpe vipassanāparivāsaṃ vasanto
analyzed: kasirena kilamantaḥ vavatthapeti vavatthapite ca nāma rūpe vipassanā parivāsam vasanto
translated: slowly, laboriously, and when, after defining it, he dwells seeing its dissolution,

original: cirena maggaṃ uppādetuṃ sakkoti, tassapi dukkhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāma hoti. Aparo
analyzed: cirena maggam uppādetum sakkoti tassa api dukkha paṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāma hoti aparo
translated: He is able to arouse the path only after a long time. His is called the painful way of practice with slow intuition.

original: nāmarūpampi vavatthapetvā paccaye pariggaṇhanto dukkhena kasirena kilamanto pariggaṇhāti.🔽Paccaye ca pariggahetvā vipassanāparivāsaṃ vasanto cirena maggaṃ uppādeti, evampi
analyzed: nāma rūpam pi vavatthapetvā paccaye pariggaṇhantaḥ dukkhena kasirena kilamantaḥ pariggaṇhāti  paccaye ca pariggahetvā vipassanā parivāsam vasantaḥ cirena maggam uppādeti evam pi
translated: Another, after defining mentality-materiality, finds it hard work to discern conditions, and he does so only with difficulty and despair.🔽And after discerning conditions, he finds it hard work to maintain the life of insight, and he does so only after a long time before he is able to arouse the path. His is called the painful way of practice with slow intuition.

original: dukkhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāma hoti. Aparo paccayepi pariggahetvā lakkhaṇāni paṭivijjhanto🔽dukkhena kasirena kilamanto paṭivijjhati, paṭividdhalakkhaṇo ca vipassanāparivāsaṃ
analyzed: dukkha paṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāma hoti aparaḥ paccaye pi pariggahetvā lakkhaṇāni paṭivijjhanto  dukkhena kasirena kilamantaḥ paṭivijjhati paṭividdha lakkhaṇaḥ ca vipassanā parivāsam
translated: Another, after discerning conditions, finds it hard work to penetrate the characteristics, and he does so only with difficulty and despair.

original: vasanto cirena maggaṃ uppādeti, evampi dukkhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāma hoti. Aparo🔽lakkhaṇānipi paṭivijjhitvā vipassanāñāṇe tikkhe sūre pasanne vahante uppannavipassanānikantiṃ
analyzed: vasantaḥ cirena maggam uppādeti evam pi dukkha paṭipadā dandhābhiññā nāma hoti aparaḥ  lakkhaṇāni pi paṭivijjhitvā vipassanā ñāṇe tikkhe sūre pasanne vahante uppanna vipassanā nikantim
translated: And one whose insight has penetrated the characteristics finds it hard work to maintain the life of insight, and he does so only after a long time before he is able to arouse the path. His is called the painful way of practice with slow intuition.

original: pariyādiyamāno dukkhena kasirena kilamanto pariyādiyati, nikantiñca pariyādiyitvā
analyzed: pariyādiyamānaḥ dukkhena kasirena kilamanto pariyādiyati nikantim ca pariyādiyitvā
translated: Another, after penetrating the characteristics, finds it hard work to surmount the perception- sphere of boundless space, and he does so only with difficulty and despair.🔽And after surmounting the perception-sphere of boundless space, he finds it hard work to maintain the life of insight, and he does so only after a long time before he is able to arouse the path. His is called the painful way of practice with slow intuition.

original: vipassanāparivāsaṃ vasanto cirena maggaṃ uppādeti, evampi dukkhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā
analyzed: vipassanā parivāsam vasantaḥ cirena maggam uppādeti evam pi dukkha paṭipadā dandha abhiññā
translated: One who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.🔽But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.🔽But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.

original: nāma hoti. Yathāvuttāsuyeva paṭipadāsu maggapātubhāvassa khippatāya dukkhapaṭipadā🔽khippābhiññā, tāsaṃ pana paṭipadānaṃ akicchasiddhiyaṃ maggapātubhāvassa dandhatāya
analyzed: nāma hoti yathā vuttāsu yeva paṭipadāsu magga pātubhāvassa khippa tāya dukkha paṭipadā  khippā abhiññā tāsam pana paṭipadānam a kiccha siddhiyam magga pātubhāvassa dandha tāya
translated: But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.🔽But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.

original: khippatāya ca yathākkamaṃ sukhapaṭipadā dandhābhiññā, sukhapaṭipadā khippābhiññā🔽ca veditabbā. Imāsaṃ catassannaṃ paṭipadānaṃ vasena aggamaggappattiyā therānaṃ catubbidhatā
analyzed: khippa tāya ca yathākkamam sukha paṭipadā dandha abhiññā sukha paṭipadā khippa abhiññā  ca veditabbā imāsam catassannam paṭipadānam vasena agga magga ppattiyā therānam catubbidha tā
translated: But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.🔽But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.

original: veditabbā. Na hi paṭipadāhi vinā ariyamaggādhigamo atthi. Tathā hi abhidhamme “yasmiṃ🔽samaye lokuttaraṃ jhānaṃ bhāveti niyyānikaṃ apacayagāmiṃ…pe… dukkhapaṭipadaṃ dandhābhiñña”ntiādinā
analyzed: veditabbā na hi paṭipadāhi vinā ariya magga adhigamaḥ atthi tathā hi abhidhamme yasmin  samaye lokuttaram jhānam bhāveti niyyānikam dukkha paṭipadam dandha abhiññanti ādinā
translated: But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.🔽But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is of difficult progress and slow deepening of knowledge.

original: paṭipadāya saddhiṃyeva ariyamaggo vibhatto, tena vuttaṃ “paṭipadāvibhāgena catubbidhā”ti.
analyzed: paṭipadāya saddhiṃyeva ariya maggaḥ vibhatto tena vuttam paṭipadā vibhāgena catubbidhā ti
translated: But one who develops insight quickly and who arouses the path after a short time is of difficult progress and quick deepening of knowledge.🔽And one who develops insight slowly and who only after a long time arouses the path is

original: Indriyādhikavibhāgena pañcavidhā. Satipi nesaṃ saccābhisambodhasāmaññe ekacce therā🔽saddhuttarā, seyyathāpi thero vakkali; ekacce vīriyuttarā, seyyathāpi thero mahāsoṇo,🔽koḷivīso; ekacce satuttarā, seyyathāpi thero sobhito, ekacce samādhuttarā, seyyathāpi🔽thero cūḷapanthako, ekacce paññuttarā, seyyathāpi thero ānando. Tathā hi so gatimantatāya
analyzed: indriya adhika vibhāgena pañcavidhā satipi na īsam sacca abhisambodha sāmaññe ekacce therā  saddhuttarā sā iyyathā api theraḥ vakkali ekacce vīriyuttarā sā iyyathā api theraḥ mahāsoṇo  ekacce satuttarā sā iyathā api thero sobhito ekacce samādhuttarā sā iyathā api  thero cūḷapanthako ekacce paññuttarā sā iyyathā api theraḥ ānando tathā hi saḥ gatimanta tāya
translated: and fivefold by way of the excess of faculties.🔽Although they are the same in the realization of the Truths, some Elders are superior in faith, as the Elder Vakkali,🔽some in energy, as the Elder Mahā Soṇa, Koḷivisa,🔽some in mindfulness, as the Elder Sobhita, some in concentration, as the Elder Cūḷa Panthaka,🔽some in wisdom, as the Elder Ānanda. Thus he is superior in going.

original: atthakosallādivantatāya ca pasaṃsito, ayañca vibhāgo pubbabhāge labbhamānavisesavasena🔽vutto. Aggamaggakkhaṇe pana sesānampi indriyānaṃ ekasabhāvā icchitāti.
analyzed: attha kosalla ādivanta tāya ca pasaṃsitaḥ ayam ca vibhāgaḥ pubba bhāge labbhamāna visesa vasena  vuttaḥ aggamagga kkhaṇe pana sesānam pi indriyānam eka sabhāvā icchitā ti
translated: They are of five kinds as distinguished by predominance of faculties. Although they are equal in their realization of the truths, some elders are distinguished by predominance of faith, as the elder Vakkali; some by predominance of energy, as the elder Mahā Soṇa, Koḷivisa; some by predominance of mindfulness, as the elder Sobhita; some by predominance of concentration, as the elder Cūḷa Panthaka; some by predominance of wisdom, as the elder Ānanda. For he is praised for his possession of the goal and for his skill in the meaning. And this distinction is stated according to the differences that are found in the earlier stages. But at the moment of the path of Arahantship the faculties of the rest are also of the same kind as the one that is predominant.

original: Tathā pāramippattā, paṭisambhidāppattā, chaḷabhiññā, tevijjā, sukkhavipassakāti pañcavidhā.
analyzed: tathā pārami pattā paṭisambhidā pattā chaḍabhiññā tevijjā sukkha vipassakā ati pañcavidhā
translated: They are of five kinds as distinguished by the perfections, the discriminations, the higher knowledges, the three knowledges, and bare insight.

original: Sāvakesu hi ekacce sāvakapāramiyā matthakappattā, yathā taṃ āyasmā sāriputto, āyasmā
analyzed: sāvakesu hi ekacce sāvaka pāramiyā matthaka ppattāḥ yathā tam āyasmā sāriputtaḥ āyasmā
translated: For some disciples have reached the peak of the perfection of a disciple, as the venerable Sāriputta, the venerable Mahā Moggallāna, the venerable Mahā Kassapa, the venerable Anuruddha, the venerable Revata, the venerable Nanda, the venerable Kimbila, the venerable Ānanda, the venerable Rāhula, and others. They are called “perfection-fulfilled disciples.”

original: ca mahāmoggallāno; ekacce atthapaṭisambhidā dhammapaṭisambhidā niruttipaṭisambhidā
analyzed: ca mahāmoggallāno ekacce attha paṭisambhidāḥ dhamma paṭisambhidāḥ nirutti paṭisambhidāḥ
translated: and Mahāmoggallāna; some had the discrimination of meaning, the discrimination of truth, the discrimination of language,🔽

original: paṭibhānapaṭisambhidāti imāsaṃ catunnaṃ paṭisambhidānaṃ vasena paṭisambhidāppattā;🔽ekacce iddhividhañāṇādīnaṃ abhiññānaṃ vasena chaḷabhiññā; ekacce pubbenivāsañāṇādīnaṃ
analyzed: paṭibhāna paṭisambhidā ti imāsam catunnam paṭisambhidānam vasena paṭisambhidā appattā  ekacce iddhividha ñāṇa ādīnam abhiññānaṃ vasena chaḍḍabhiññāḥ ekacce pubbenivāsa ñāṇa ādīnam
translated: and the Elder Maha Moggallana; some had attained the discriminations by means of the four discriminations, namely, the discrimination of meaning, of truth, of the Dhamma, and of inspired speech;

original: tissannaṃ vijjānaṃ vasena tevijjā. Ye pana khaṇikasamādhimatte ṭhatvā vipassanaṃ🔽paṭṭhapetvā adhigataaggamaggā, te ādito antarantarā ca samādhijena jhānaṅgena vipassanābbhantaraṃ
analyzed: tissannam vijjānam vasena tevijjāḥ ye pana khaṇika samādhi matte ṭhatvā vipassanam  paṭṭhapetvā adhigata agga maggā te āditas antar antarā ca samādhi jena jhān aṅgena vipassanā abbhantaram
translated: some had attained the six kinds of direct knowledge, namely, the knowledge of the realization of the supernormal powers, etc.; some had attained the three knowledges, namely, the knowledge of recollecting past lives, etc.;

original: paṭisandhānānaṃ abhāvā sukkhā vipassanā etesanti sukkhavipassakā nāma. Ayañca vibhāgo
analyzed: paṭisandhānānam abhāvā sukkhā vipassanā etesan ti sukkhavipassakāḥ nāma ayam ca vibhāgaḥ
translated: but those who had entered upon insight after standing in momentary concentration and had reached the supramundane path were called “bare-insight workers” because their insight was bare of jhana factors derived from concentration.

original: sāvakānaṃ sādhāraṇabhāvaṃ upaparikkhitvā vutto. Idha pāḷiyaṃ āgatā nattheva sukkhavipassakā. Tenevāha –
analyzed: sāvakānam sādhāraṇa bhāvam upaparikkhitvā vuttaḥ idha pāḷiyam āgatā nattha eva sukkha vipassakā tena iva āha
translated: And this classification is stated after examining the commonness of disciples. But there are no bare-insight workers mentioned in the texts here. Hence it is said:

original: “Paṭisambhidā catasso, vimokkhāpi ca aṭṭhime;
analyzed: paṭisambhidā catasso vimokkhā api ca aṭṭhime
translated: “The four discriminations, and the eight liberations,

original: Chaḷabhiññā sacchikatā, kataṃ buddhassa sāsana”ntiādi. ;
analyzed: chaḍabhiññā sacchikatā katam buddhassa sāsana ntiādi
translated: He has realized the six direct knowledges, And done the Buddha’s bidding.

original: Evaṃ pāramippattādivasena pañcavidhā.
analyzed: evam pāramippatta ādi vasena pañcavidhā
translated: So it is of five kinds as “perfected” and so on.

original: Animittādivasena chabbidhā animittavimuttotiādayo.
translated: It is of six kinds as “liberated by the signless” and so on.

original: Saddhādhuro, paññādhuroti duvidhā. Tathā appaṇihitavimutto paññāvimutto cāti. Evaṃ
analyzed: saddhā dhuro paññā dhuro ti duvidhā tathā appaṇihita vimutto paññā vimutto ca ati evam
translated: It is of two kinds as “one whose vehicle is faith” and “one whose vehicle is understanding.” So too as “liberated only by wisdom” and “liberated in both ways.”

original: animittavimuttādivasena ca pariyāyavimuttabhedena sattavidhā. Catūsu hi arūpasamāpattīsu🔽ekamekaṃ pādakaṃ katvā vipassanaṃ ārabhitvā arahattaṃ pattā cattāro, nirodhato vuṭṭhāya
analyzed: animitta vimutta ādi vasena ca pariyāya vimutta bhedena sattavidhā catūsu hi arūpa samāpattīsu  ekam ekam pādakam katvā vipassanam ārabhitvā arahattam pattā cattāraḥ nirodhataḥ vuṭṭhāya
translated: So it is of seven kinds as “liberated by the signless” and so on and as “one liberated by the path” and “one liberated by the fruition.”🔽For there are five kinds of “one liberated by the path”: one who has reached Arahantship by making the first immaterial state his basis, one who has done so by making the second, the third, or the fourth immaterial state his basis, and one who has done so by emerging from the attainment of cessation.

original: arahattaṃ patto cāti pañca, ubhatobhāgavimuttā, saddhādhurapaññādhuravasena dve paññāvimuttāti
analyzed: arahattam patto ca ati pañca ubhatobhāga vimuttā saddhā dhura paññā dhura vasena dve paññā vimuttā ati
translated: And there are two kinds of “one liberated in both ways”: one whose vehicle is faith and one whose vehicle is understanding.

original: evaṃ vimuttibhedena sattavidhā.
analyzed: evam vimutti bhedena sattavidhā
translated: So it is of seven kinds as “one liberated by the path” and so on and as “one liberated in both ways.”🔽It is of eight kinds as “one who attains Nibbāna early” and so on. For one who attains Nibbāna early is of slow path and quick insight,

original: Dhurapaṭipadāvibhāgena aṭṭhavidhā. Yo hi dukkhapaṭipadāya dandhābhiññāya niyyāti,
analyzed: dhura paṭipadā vibhāgena aṭṭhavidhā yaḥ hi dukkha paṭipadāya dandha abhiññāya niyyāti
translated: one who attains Nibbāna late is of slow path and slow insight,

original: so saddhādhurapaññādhuravasena duvidhā, tathā sesapaṭipadāsupīti evaṃ dhurapaṭipadāvibhāgena aṭṭhavidhā.
analyzed: so saddhādhura paññādhura vasena duvidhā tathā sesa paṭipadāsu pi iti evam dhura paṭipadā vibhāgena aṭṭhavidhā
translated: They are twofold as those whose vehicle is faith and those whose vehicle is understanding. So too the rest of the paths. So they are of eight kinds according to the division of vehicles and paths.

original: Vimuttibhedena navavidhā. Pañca ubhatobhāgavimuttā, dve paññāvimuttā, paññāvimuttiyaṃ cetovimuttiyañca pāramippattā dve aggasāvakā cāti evaṃ navavidhā.🔽Vimuttivaseneva dasavidhā. Catūsu arūpāvacarajjhānesu ca ekamekaṃ pādakaṃ katvā arahattaṃ
analyzed: vimutti bhedena navavidhā pañca ubhatobhāga vimuttā dve paññā vimuttā paññā vimuttiyam cetaḥ vimuttiyañca pārami pattā dve aggasāvakā ca ati evam navavidhā  vimutti vasena iva dasavidhā catūsu arūpāvacara jhānesu ca ekam ekam pādakam katvā arahattam
translated: They are of nine kinds according to the division of deliverance. There are five kinds of both-ways-liberated , two kinds of understanding-liberated , and two chief disciples who have reached perfection in understanding-liberation and in deliverance by heart’s ease . So they are of nine kinds.

original: pattā cattāro, sukkhavipassakoti pañca paññāvimuttā, yathāvuttā ca ubhatobhāgavimuttā
analyzed: pattā cattāro sukkha vipassako ti pañca paññā vimuttā yathā vuttā ca ubhatobhāga vimuttā
translated: They are of ten kinds according to the division of deliverance. There are four who have reached Arahantship by making the fourth immaterial jhāna the basis for it, and there is one who is a bare-insight worker, that is to say, five who are understanding-liberated, and the above-mentioned five kinds of both-ways-liberated.

original: cāti evaṃ vimuttibhedeneva dasavidhā. Te yathāvuttena dhurabhedena bhijjamānā vīsati
analyzed: ca ati evam vimutti bhedena iva dasavidhā te yathā vuttena dhura bhedena bhijjamānāḥ vīsati
translated: So they are of ten kinds according to the division of deliverance. When they are divided according to the aforesaid division of vehicles they are twenty;

original: honti. Paṭipadābhedena bhijjamānā cattālīsaṃ honti. Puna paṭipadābhedena dhurabhedena
analyzed: honti paṭipadā bhedena bhijjamānā cattālīsam honti puna paṭipadā bhedena dhura bhedena
translated: when divided according to the division of paths they are forty; when divided according to the division of paths and the division of vehicles they are eighty;

original: ca bhijjamānā asīti honti. Atha te suññatavimuttādivibhāgena bhijjamānā cattālīsādhikā
analyzed: ca bhijjamānā asi iti honti atha te suññata vimutta ādi vibhāgena bhijjamānā cattālīsa adhikā
translated: when divided according to the division of emptiness-deliverance, etc., they are more than forty.

original: dve satāni honti. Puna indriyādhikabhāvena bhijjamānā dvisatuttaraṃ sahassaṃ hontīti.
analyzed: dve satāni honti punar indriya adhika bhāvena bhijjamānāḥ dvi sata uttaram sahassam honti iti
translated: they come to two hundred. And when they are further divided by the predominance of the faculties, they come to a thousand, and so on.

original: Evaṃ attano guṇavasena anekabhedavibhattesu maggaṭṭhaphalaṭṭhesu ariyasāvakesu ye🔽attano paṭipattipavattiādike ca vibhāventi. Ye “channā me kuṭikā”tiādikā gāthā udānādivasena
analyzed: evam attanaḥ guṇa vasena aneka bheda vibhattesu magga ṭṭha phala ṭṭhesu ariya sāvakesu ye  paṭipatti pavatti ādike ca vibhāventi ye channāḥ me gāthāḥ udāna ādi vasena
translated: So among the noble disciples who are established in the paths and fruits and who are classified in many ways according to their special qualities,🔽those who have proclaimed their own progress in the path, etc., and who have uttered their inspired verses such as the verse beginning, “My hut is thatched and well repaired” ,

original: abhāsiṃsu. Te ca idha gāthāmukhena saṅgahaṃ ārūḷhā. Tenāha – “sīhānaṃva nadantānaṃ…pe…
analyzed: te ca gāthā mukhena saṅgaham ārūḍhā tena āha
translated: have been included here under the heading of verses. Hence it is said: “As lions roar their mighty roar …

original: phusitvā accutaṃ pada”nti. Evamettha pakiṇṇakakathā veditabbā.
analyzed: phusitvā accutam padanti evam ettha pakiṇṇaka kathā veditabbā
translated: And having roared their lion’s roar, they have attained the deathless state.” This is how the supplementary account should be understood here.

original: Vaṅgīsattheragāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
